title: "New Jersey Jobs Protection Act;" requires verification of employment.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
"Transparency in Government Act"; provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Clarifies that licensed dealers may provide firearms for display at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Sunsets "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" five years after date of enactment unless certain conditions are met.
Prohibits placing primary election candidates into political party lines on primary ballot.
"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Requires physicians to provide patients opportunity to undergo obstetrical ultrasound or sonogram within 48 hours of performing abortion.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Requires proof of lawful presence in the United States to obtain certain benefits.
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Repeals certain restrictions on future retail sales of handguns.
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.
Renders federal "Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act" null and void in NJ.
Requires certain public entities to issue requests for proposals for purchase of certain insurance products and services; requires disclosure of commissions paid.
Requires law enforcement agency to issue retired law enforcement officer identification card to certain qualified retirees.
Establishes "New Jersey Commission on Government Efficiency and Cost Control" to recommend measures for efficiency and cost reduction in State government.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Increases filing threshold and the applicable exclusion amount for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.
Eliminates certificated superintendent and administrator exceptions to TPAF retiree reenrollment requirement.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in all counties.
Repeals law establishing offshore wind renewable energy certificate program.
Requires certain contractors to verify work authorization of newly hired employees.
Permits county correctional facilities to seek reimbursement from inmate welfare fund for certain medical services provided in county jails.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for development of Northern New Jersey Veterans Memorial Cemetery.
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act."
Eliminates $375 minimum Corporation Business Tax on New Jersey S corporations with New Jersey gross receipts of less than $100,000.

Authorizes municipalities that petition for or receive substantive certification pursuant to the "Fair Housing Act" to make certain affordable housing units available on a preferential basis to certain eligible persons.
Provides that no more than four of the seven public members appointed to the Highlands Water Protection and Planning Council may be of the same political party.
Allows for exclusion of certain properties from Highlands preservation area.
Repeals sections of law pertaining to transfer of civil service and non-civil service employees of terminated local health agency to superseding agency.
Concerns hazardous waste transporter fee.
Eliminates expansion of preschool education programs in "School Funding Reform Act of 2008."
Exempts contaminated and industrially-zoned sites from affordable housing rules.
Prohibits the imposition of affordable housing need and related fees upon the local transfer or move of a business.
Decreases sales and use tax rate from 7% to 6%.
Increases membership of Fish and Game Council and clarifies it has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Eliminates seniority in Civil Service and other jurisdictions for reductions in force in certain circumstances.
Requires women incarcerated in county correctional facilities to cover full cost of abortion.
Provides for drug testing of adult recipients of Work First New Jersey program benefits.
Provides for automatic waiver of juvenile case to adult court for repeat juvenile offenders.
Expands range of local units eligible to join an insurance fund established by a municipality or county under certain circumstances.
Replaces references to Civil Service Commission with chairperson of commission to clarify duties and responsibilities of chairperson.
Expands scope of review of Pension and Health Benefits Review Commission.
Provides that certain absentee ballots will be counted if received within ten days of election.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee and one percent fee on transfers of certain commercial real estate and tax on sale of controlling interests in certain commercial real property.
Establishes motor vehicle registration for street rods and custom motor vehicles.
Exempts employees and school board members of federal impact aid districts from certain out-of-state travel restrictions.
Clarifies local government unit obligations with regard to DEP loan awards for dam repairs.
Repeals requirement for general hospitals and State psychiatric hospitals to hold annual public meetings.
Restricts use of electronic benefit cards by cash assistance recipients.
Concerns procedures for public comment about matters before municipal planning and zoning boards.
Concerns alternate methods of wage payment.
Requires access to law enforcement guidelines for processing firearms permit applications upon public records request.
Requires Department of Agriculture to post on its website certain information regarding State's farm to school program.

"Direct Tax Relief for New Jersey Families Act"; Establishes the New Jersey Direct Property Tax Relief Program; increases the renter's gross income tax credit for property taxes; and increases the earned income tax credit.

Prohibits payment to public employees at retirement for certain unused sick leave, provides for forfeiture of payment for unused sick leave for certain criminal convictions, and requires documentation for use of sick leave.

Makes various changes to civil service; permits institution of temporary layoffs; permits government entities to opt-out of civil service; requires civil service examinations be offered on continual basis.
Permits layoff plans as substitute for employment reconciliation plans for joint meetings or shared service agreements under certain circumstances.
"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to taxpayers contributing to scholarships for low-income children.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act of 2012"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Creates a civil "rape shield" law.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective offices; provides for transition period between offices.
Clarifies penalties court may impose in sentencing certain adults and juveniles guilty of making false public alarms.

Requires electronic bulletin board on DCA website for local units to advertise shared services opportunities; requires development of computerized survey to match local units together to implement shared services.
Requires suspension of local elected and appointed officers and employees indicted for certain offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office or position.
Concerns criminal background checks for certain school employees.
Prohibits sex offenders from entering school property.
Requires ELEC to provide ethics training for governmental affairs agents.
Requires all elected or appointed local government officers to receive ethics training.
Prohibits member of Legislature from representing any person or party other than the State in connection with any proceeding of municipal, county, or State government entity.
Limits payment to certain public employees for accumulated sick leave upon retirement; requires fine and reprimand or termination for violation of sick leave by public employee.
Creates "Comprehensive Anti-Nepotism Act."
Concerns eligibility for unemployment insurance for certain seasonal workers.
Concerns repayment of unemployment insurance benefits obtained fraudulently.
Amends definition of "racketeering activity" in RICO statute to include unemployment insurance fraud offenses.
Limits compensation provided to presidents of public institutions of higher education.
Establishes the "New Jersey Right to Work Act"; prohibits payroll deduction of union dues from wages or salaries of public employees.
Directs AG to enter into agreement with U.S. Attorney General to empower certain corrections officers to investigate immigration status of inmates.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment benefits for certain seasonal workers.

Prohibits dual government employment and office holding; requires pension forfeiture by convicted elected officials; bans use of campaign funds for criminal defense costs; revises legislative conflict of interest standards.
Removes provision permitting dismissal of de minimis violations for offenses involving corruption of public resources.
Increases civil penalty for first offense violation of campaign finance requirements; makes first offense punishable with forfeiture of candidacy or office.
Requires candidates keep detailed records of how campaign funds are spent for the ordinary and necessary expenses of holding public office.
Establishes system for early resolution of medical injury claims.
Requires managed care plans to disclose allowed amounts for out-of-network health care services under certain circumstances.
Increases maximum penalty under "Local Government Ethics Law."
Prohibits improper release of photographs or videos captured by public entities.
Prohibits governmental collection of biometric identifiers without consent.
Imposes criminal penalties for illegally obtaining or disclosing personally identifiable health information.
Increases penalties for the unlawful disclosure or use of taxpayer information by State tax officials.
Requires judge approval prior to installation of video camera by public entity.
Requires administrative agency to include privacy impact statement when adopting, amending, or repealing rule.
Restricts access to recorded data imbedded in motor vehicle computer systems.
Requires judicial approval prior to installation or use of automated license plate reader by law enforcement agency.
Establishes pilot project to install global positioning system (GPS) devices on certain State vehicles.
Enacts the "Marriage Equality and Religious Exemption Act."
Upgrades assault on victims who are disabled.
Requires court to issue animal protective orders against persons found guilty of abusing animals.
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
Amends RICO to add certain crimes involving public servants.
Establishes "Naturally Occurring Retirement Community" pilot program; appropriates $250,000.
Requires all lamps and lighting devices on motor vehicles be kept in working order.
Shortens waiting periods for expungement of criminal and other records and information; makes various changes to other expungement procedures and requirements.**
Eliminates awarding of attorneys' fees, filing fees and costs of suit for certain technical violations of consumer fraud act.*
Provides public servant is guilty of official misconduct if he knowingly obtains, arranges or provides "no-show" job for himself or another.
Establishes procedures for admitting into evidence blood sample certificates and related lab reports in drunk driving cases.
The " Responsible Pesticide Use Reduction Recognition Act."
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Consolidates all "doughnut municipalities" and "doughnut-hole municipalities" within 10 years.
Establishes "Police Officer, Firefighter, Public School Teacher, Corrections Officer, and Sanitation Worker Home-buyer Assistance Act."; appropriates $5 million.*
Clarifies authority of municipal court to suspend driver's licenses; establishes that the terms revoke and suspend are to have the same meaning under Title 39 of the Revised Statutes.*
The "Seaside Lodging and Rental District Act"; imposes tax on certain lodging properties for tourism promotion therein.
Requires spousal consent to election of certain pension payout options under TPAF, JRS and PERS.
Requires legislators to certify in writing, upon introduction of legislation, that no monetary benefit will be derived from it; requires certification be filed with the Legislative Ethics Commission.
Decriminalizes possession of 15 grams or less of marijuana, imposes civil penalties, and establishes fund for drug education.
Establishes N.J. Historical Commission program for preservation and promotion of graves of significant individuals of the American Revolutionary period; appropriates $200,000.
Consolidates various municipalities into the new municipalities of Seaside Township and Long Beach Island Township, or alternatively requires shared services agreements for all major services.
Revises definition of "necessary care" in the State's animal cruelty law to include more specific requirements.
Establishes that payment plan for motor vehicle surcharges is mandatory upon request; extends payment period.
Authorizes law enforcement agency to inform the president of a public or independent institution of higher education when a student is charged or convicted of certain crimes.
Creates Voluntary Registry for Individuals with a Mental Illness or Developmental Disability.
Requires Adjutant General of DMVA to issue State flag to resident enrolling in federal service academy.
Requires posting of information about availability of services from substance abuse treatment facilities on county and DHS websites.

Requires disclosure of contributions received and expenditures made by committees or organizations not affiliated or coordinated with any candidate, or committee organized to support or oppose public questions.
Permits new cigar lounges to be opened under certain circumstances.*
Expands implied consent statute to include blood and urine testing.
Enacts "Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act."
Provides for private cause of action for bad faith in settlement of certain insurance claims.
Establishes process for consideration of offers from short sale buyers during residential mortgage foreclosures.

Provides that a school business administrator appointed by a school district after a certain date will not be eligible for tenure and may be dismissed pursuant to the terms of the employment contract.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on awareness of eating disorders as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Provides that strangulation of victim resulting in bodily injury during commission of act of domestic violence constitutes aggravated assault.*
Provides for modification of child support and certain alimony payments due to changed circumstances.
Requires health care representative to make health care decisions for incapacitated patient in accordance with patient's religious beliefs.
Requires DEP to establish artificial reef plan for commercial and recreational fishing.
Exempts individuals with certain types of military service from certain professional and occupational fees and continuing education requirements.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation benefits for certain seasonal employees.
Establishes restrictions and requirements for use of fishing gear and conch, fishing, and lobster pots on artificial reefs.
Requires municipal court to obtain and transmit to prosecutor an offender's driver's abstract prior to sentencing for certain offenses.
Grandfathers municipal ordinances that require merchants of used and secondhand jewelry to maintain possession longer than minimum period required by State law.
Requires compounding pharmacies be accredited by Pharmacy Compounding Accreditation Board.
Exempts sales of county property from certain requirements under certain circumstances.
Appropriates $10 million to the DEP for Black Creek and Wreck Pond dredging.
Directs DEP and Monmouth County to form study commission to examine nonpoint source pollution and stormwater management issues in Wreck Pond Watershed.
Directs BPU to adopt best practices and standards for public utility disaster response.
Requires electric public utilities to repair or install street lights within certain time periods after municipal notification.
Permits certain public and private entities to qualify for BPU grants or low interest loans for cost of alternative power generation devices.
Requires electric public utilities to implement flood mitigation plans for certain electric distribution substations; prohibits rate increase pending implementation of flood mitigation plans.
Exempts properties within flood zones from variance requirements to raise structure.
Disqualifies person named on federal Terrorist Watchlist from obtaining firearms identification card or permit to purchase handgun.
Requires wheelchair-only handicapped parking spaces in certain parking lots.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to victims injured in September 11th and 1993 World Trade Center attacks.
Upgrades theft to a crime of the first degree if amount involved is $500,000 or more.
Extends moratorium on imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees, for three years, through June 30, 2016.
Authorizes appointment of part-time county tax administrators.
Establishes Hunterdon-Somerset Flood Advisory Task Force.
Requires medical bills be standardized and accompanied by explanatory disclosure form.
Reduces number of rooms necessary for historic hotel to receive liquor license.
Tax Relief for New Jersey Families Act; provides income tax credits for property tax relief, quadruples the homestead property tax credit and increases the earned income tax credit.
Directs board of trustees of county college to post information on the compensation paid to college president on its website.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to adopt guidelines for the employment contracts of county college presidents.
Prohibits plea bargain if sex offender who committed Megan's Law offense would not be required to register.
Criminalizes operation of school bus with suspended driver's license.
Requires school districts to allow home-schooled students to participate in school-sponsored extracurricular activities in the student's resident district.
Provides for permanent debarment from government contracting of any person who is convicted of certain crimes involving government contracts.
Requires sex offenders to note criminal status on social network accounts.

Requires eligibility checklist and audit for enrollment in PERS of certain public employees who provide professional services; imposes fine on certifying officer or supervisor for ineligible enrollments.
Requires criminal background check for name change and prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from changing their name.
Requires certain health benefits coverage for diagnosing and treating autism and other developmental disabilities.
Requires public utility requesting rate increase to hold public hearings in every county.
Requires public utilities to meet with county emergency management coordinators during major catastrophic event.
Establishes "New Jersey Electromagnetic Infrastructure Advisory Commission."
Establishes pilot program to provide zero-interest loans to certain emergency shelters and food banks for purchase and installation of generator.
Requires certain public contracts for insurance coverage and consulting services to be awarded through competitive contracting process.
Authorizes disclosure by DCF of child abuse and neglect information to religious institutions.

Prohibits elected officials and public employees from enrolling for health benefits with more than one public entity; provides civil action for treble expenses by public entity providing additional coverage.
Allows certain sole proprietors to join a small employer health benefits purchasing alliance.
Requires DEP and owners of reservoirs to implement certain flood control measures, and authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoirs in response to severe weather events.
Establishes a Special Medical Malpractice Part in the Superior Court.
Creates 12 additional Superior Court judgeships; establishes a Special Business Part in the Superior Court; provides for appropriations.
Establishes a Business Part in the Superior Court.
Extends certain federal income tax advantages of individual health savings accounts to individual taxpayers under the New Jersey gross income tax.

Conforms voter identification procedures to requirements of Statewide voter registration system; permits use of provisional ballots for voters who move to different counties; revises certain penalty provisions.
Creates a Business Court.
Establishes grant program for school districts to develop in-district and collaborative special education programs and services to reduce need to place classified students out-of-district.
Provides Student Population Density Aid to certain public school districts.

Applies certain conflicts of interest restrictions on legislators to county, municipal and local authority condemnation proceedings and project contracts funded directly or indirectly by State monies.
Requires Joint Legislative Committee on Ethical Standards to maintain information on Internet; requires certain assistance to be provided to individuals filing complaints with the committee.
Exempts local governmental units from supplemental titling fees on passenger automobiles they purchase or lease.
Clarifies authority of municipalities to utilize zoning authority to regulate billboards or outdoor advertising bearing commercial advertisements.
Prohibits campaign contributions between county party committees; makes such contributions a third degree crime; increases to third degree crimes certain other campaign finance offenses.
Prohibits contributions by certain entities doing business with State; limits amount of contributions by principals and officers of such entities.
Limits contributions by certain public contractors; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.

Limits political contributions by certain government contractors; revises disclosure standards applicable to State officials; expands disclosure for lobbyists; prohibits certain types of dual office holding.
Authorizes counties and municipalities to adopt regulations limiting political contributions by contractors.

Limits contributions to certain candidates and elected officials by certain public contractors; limits contributions by certain political party committees; repeals certain campaign contribution prohibitions.

Provides local governments may limit political contributions by business entities performing or seeking to perform public contracts; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.
Prohibits public entities from engaging certain governmental affairs agents.
Establishes certain ethical standards and financial control requirements for State authorities.
Protects employee rights to ownership and usage of employee inventions developed entirely on employee's own time and without using employer's resources.
Requires schools to maintain supply of epinephrine and permit administration of epinephrine to any student having anaphylactic reaction.
Prohibits use of smokeless tobacco in public schools.
Upgrades penalties for certain crimes committed during a state of emergency.
Allows Hurricane Sandy victims to claim gross income tax deduction for certain personal casualty losses.
Prohibits escrow agent evaluation services from charging escrow agents fees.

Requires health insurers to cover treatment ordered by health care provider for covered person based on generally accepted standards of health care practice, subject to appeal; creates Carrier Appeals Program.
Permits board of education to accept donations for purpose of providing property tax relief.
Requires public schools to weight courses in visual and performing arts equally with other courses worth same number of credits in calculating grade point average.
Provides that limitation on lawsuit option does not apply in accident caused by drunk driver.
Permits municipal police officers to make arrests for any disorderly persons or petty disorderly persons offense outside the territorial limits of their municipality.
Establishes crime of participation in criminal street gang initiation ritual.

Expands duties of State Auditor to include performance audits at request of legislator; establishes Performance Audit Committee, consisting of eight public members, to help conduct performance audits.
Allows person calling certain State or local government entities to have option of speaking or leaving a recorded message with a human telephone operator during normal business hours.
Requires employers to provide time off from work for members of certain volunteer organizations to respond to fires under certain conditions.
Creates new motor vehicle offense of engaging in a pattern of aggressive driving.
Grants immunity from civil liability to persons reporting information concerning crimes related to terrorism.
Requires ballot question on approval of State bond issue to disclose total amount of debt of State or other entity, debt service on which is funded through annual State appropriation.
Makes desecration of a military monument a crime of the third degree.
Creates the "Local Unit Audit Teams" program in the Department of the Treasury.
Authorizes members of the New Jersey State Legislature to solemnize marriages and civil unions.
Provides for public comment period at certain sessions of each house of the Legislature.
Allows physicians to jointly negotiate with carriers over contractual terms and conditions.
Eliminates minimum corporation business tax on New Jersey S corporations.
Allows jurors to designate donation of their jury duty fees to various charitable funds.
Permits certain holders of permits to carry a handgun to carry another licensee's handgun.
Phases out estate tax over five-year period.
Permits boards of education to convey certain school property to nonprofit senior citizen organizations for nominal consideration.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain donated vehicles.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
Makes all persons convicted of sexual assault subject to the No Early Release Act; specifies that any use of force elevates sexual assault to aggravated sexual assault.
Increases maximum penalty for attempted murder and conspiracy to commit murder in certain cases.
Prohibits information from certain medical malpractice claims from being used by employers or medical malpractice insurers.
Reduces gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years.
"Vader's Law"; revises law to enhance penalty for injuring or harming certain dogs.
Establishes threats of violence against prosecutors, law enforcement officers and their family members as a second degree crime, subject to the No Early Release Act sentencing.
Requires notice prior to lapse of life insurance policy due to nonpayment of premium.
Allows military member to qualify for resident tuition rate at county college.
Clarifies procedure for municipalities sharing police patrol responsibilities.
Prohibits soliciting or phishing for personal identifying information.
Creates first degree crime of home invasion, makes crime subject to No Early Release Act, and upgrades burglary of a residence to a second degree crime under certain circumstances.
Prohibits sale of certain products using advertisements alluding to controlled dangerous substances or analogs.
Directs Division of Consumer Affairs to develop informational brochure regarding dental amalgam, and requires dentists to distribute brochure to patients and offer composite alternatives.
Requires public schools to include instruction on caffeine-related health issues as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Authorizes municipalities to impose penalties on creditors that fail to timely remedy code violations of certain properties in foreclosure.*
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Belleville Township.
Broadens criteria for certain municipalities to qualify as having UEZ-impacted business districts.
Directs DOT, in consultation with other State entities, to study and report on certain solar and wind energy installations.
Permits exemption from mandatory immunization for students in writing for any reason.
Prohibits delivery of more than one magazine issue before billing information is obtained.

Authorizes municipality to adopt ordinance permitting tenant to remain in illegal occupancy with no immediate health or safety risk; requires expiration of ordinance upon evidence of economic stabilization.
Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands horse racetrack, subject to voter approval.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands racetrack, upon voter approval; dedicates 1/3 net proceeds to General Fund, 1/3 to State education aid, and 1/3 to horse racing industry.
Requires appointments for safety-related recalls on vehicles to be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis.
Requires State to pay all costs associated with maintaining and operating the office of the executive county superintendent of schools.
Establishes certain specifications for NJ Sports and Exposition Authority sale or lease of Meadowlands Racetrack.
Permits appointment of certain nonpermanent firefighters laid off for reasons of economy to vacant paid positions.
Permits appointment of certain EMTs laid off for reasons of economy to vacant paid positions.
Establishes carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide air quality standards and certification requirements for ice arenas.*
"Caylee's Law;" requires missing child be reported within 12 hours.
Establishes the Office of Dropout Prevention and Reengagement of Out-of-School Youth in DOE, and the Student Dropout Prevention Task Force.
Changes calculation of years of service from date of enrollment in pension system to date of appointment to determine certain retirees' payment obligations for health care coverage.
Requires certain entities to be equipped with generators and allows those entities to qualify for NJEDA loans for cost of generators.
Clarifies application of business personal property tax on local exchange telephone companies that were subject to tax as of April 1, 1997.
Authorizes professional and occupational boards to recognize continuing education approval entities.
Limits political contributions by hedge funds and private equity funds that invest in casinos or in which State funds are invested.
Reduces dollar amount of full outstanding debt issue that exempts casino institutional investor from requirement to maintain qualifications.
Caps at 35 percent share of State public employee pension and annuity funds portfolio that may be invested in combination of hedge funds, private equity, commodities, and real estate.
Eliminates certificated superintendent and administrator exceptions to TPAF retiree reenrollment requirement.
Requires board of education to provide an individual textbook for each student enrolled in a class.
Requires school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to local law enforcement.
"Corporate Disinvestment Property Tax Relief Act"; appropriates $13.5 million.
Requires applicants for liquor licenses and license transfers to notify residents within 200 feet of licensed premises.
Prohibits certain sales of alcoholic beverages within 1,000 feet of schools or religious institutions.
Requires mandatory registration of family day care providers.
Establishes a 500 foot drug free zone around child care centers.
Broadens municipal arson investigators' powers.
Requires parents who intend to home-school their children to inform the school district of that decision; requires school district to maintain record of each home-schooled child in the district.
Broadens eligibility for certain veterans' benefits by eliminating requirement of service during specified dates or in specified locations.
Permits certain special law enforcement officers to carry firearms at all times when in State.
Creates Veterans Haven North Council; renames current Veterans Haven Council to Veterans Haven South Council.
Grants certain leaves of absence for Vietnam Veterans of America conventions.
Establishes Disparity in Treatment of Persons with Disabilities in Underrepresented Communities Commission in DCA.
Requires minimum level of police staffing based on municipal population and violent crime rate.
Makes consent to register with Selective Service part of driver's license application process for males under age 26.
Requires HIV testing for pregnant women and marriage license applicants.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Prohibits public and independent institutions of higher education from admitting any student who is not a United States citizen or who does not hold lawful immigration status.
Requires impact statement for any proposed regulation affecting volunteer ambulance squads and fire companies.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Restores the death penalty for persons who commit certain murders.
Authorizes Sunday bow hunting on federal military installations and William J. Hughes Technical Center.*
Revises certain exemptions to "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Requires court to consider gang affiliation when making bail determinations.
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
Limits right of appeal of disciplinary action taken by employer against certain public employees.
Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes.
Exempts contracting units who use cooperative purchasing agreements or cooperative pricing systems from price adjustments in local public contracts for asphalt cement and fuel.
Individual's status as minor may not disqualify him from bone marrow donation if medical criteria and informed consent requirements are met.
Permits municipalities to provide information on property tax bills concerning amount of local tax dollars saved through shared services.
Requires State agencies, when developing and proposing rules, to utilize approaches that will accomplish objectives of statutory law while minimizing adverse economic impact on municipalities.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program.
Authorizes municipality to deliver property tax bills, construction permits, and receipts for payment via e-mail.
Exempts electric vehicle charging systems from real property taxation.
Provides tax credits to companies contributing to loan and loan redemption program for residents who attend institutions of higher education in the State and work at such a company upon graduation.
Repeals Highlands planning and environmental permitting provisions of "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act," and amends various statutes to reflect repeal thereof.
Establishes DOT roadside memorial program for fallen police officers, sheriff's officers, EMS workers, and firefighters; designated as "Patrolman Joseph Wargo's Law.**
Extends time period for municipalities to commit to expend collected development fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units.
Prohibits residential development fees on reconstruction after natural disasters.
Establishes a grant program for school districts to establish substance abuse prevention programs for eighth grade students.
Increases penalties for injuring school crossing guard or student pedestrian in crosswalk.
Requires DCA to provide accounting of monies remitted to the "New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund" by municipality and allows for municipal affordable housing credit for funds remitted.
Designates "Sweet, Sweet New Jersey" as State song.
Abolishes Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission, transfers bridges to NJ DOT and Penn DOT, removes tolls.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations and partnerships.
Clarifies that crime victim has a right to make a victim impact statement directly to the defendant at sentencing.
Provides that civil service make-up examinations not include the same questions as the original examination.
Expands number of disorders included in newborn screening program.
Establishes guidelines for dissemination of vital records.
Provides for reciprocity of certain out-of-State EMT certification.
Requires employers and birthing facilities to notify insured pregnant women if their health insurance coverage is not subject to 48-hour maternity law.
Requires criminal history record background checks for public employees handling vital records.
Provides voter registration assistance to persons completing parole, probation, and criminal sentences.
Amends Health Enterprise Zone law to allow municipalities more discretion in granting property tax exemptions to medical offices.
Expands DNA database to include samples from disorderly persons who are fingerprinted and permits law enforcement officers to collect certain biological samples.*
Expands eligible municipalities under the "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act" to include Harrison Town in Hudson County.
Provides for school and medical family leave.
Requires clinical laboratory that provides services for accountable care organization to establish clinical laboratory testing advisory board.
Designates New Jersey Commuter Pass Credit Act; provides for temporary gross income tax credit for certain commuting passes.

Clarifies that executive county superintendent's authorities regarding special education services do not allow him to require a child study team to make a specific determination on the special education placement for a student.
Allows adoptees access to nonidentifying family medical history information.
Requires insurers to provide coverage for medications and dose-intensive chemotherapy/bone marrow transplants and umbilical cord blood transplants for treatment of sickle cell anemia.
Provides for the designation of new charter school authorizers.
Provides for notification to law enforcement authorities of discharge of certain persons brought to screening services for evaluation and assessment for mental health services.
Clarifies enforcement responsibility of State Housing Code concerning multiple dwellings from municipalities to the State under the "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."
Permits release of certain student information.
Revises the dates for submission and approval of school district applications for designation as a choice district.
Allows municipalities to designate redevelopment entities and certain non-profits to act as land bank entities.*

Modifies various aspects of charter school program including student enrollment procedures, revocation of charter, monitoring of charter schools, and collaboration between school districts and charter schools.
Prohibits emergency shelters for the homeless from refusing to provide services for minimum time frame unless shelters are at maximum capacity.
Requires emergency shelters for the homeless to admit persons with mental illness unless they pose danger.
Exempts from disclosure as public record personal identifying information provided to government agency for emergency notification purposes.
Clarifies that teachers and professional support staff employed in charter schools and other public schools must meet the same certification requirements.
Establishes task force to study issues related to the establishment of full-day kindergarten.
Authorizes a teacher leader endorsement to the instructional certificate.
Establishes criminal penalties for operating or participating in pyramid promotional schemes.
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.
Permits eviction for good cause of tenants who are creating nuisance; requires court to notify landlord when restraining order has been issued barring tenant from residential rental property.
Restricts bail options for second and subsequent offenses occurring while released.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance to curb gang related loitering and criminal activity.
Permits master deed of condominium to reflect proportional common and limited common elements interests of each owner as fractions.
Establishes professional standards for county sheriffs and their employees.
Clarifies that using animal to cause bodily injury to another constitutes assault with a deadly weapon; grants immunity to police officers who use police dog as deadly weapon.*
Authorizes designation of joint urban enterprise zone by Urban Enterprize Zone Authority.
Requires health care facilities to report certain information about their health care staff to their respective professional boards or DHSS.
Modifies intent, purpose and standard of construction of "Municipal Land Use Law."
Prohibits BPU from exercising authority over utility service extensions in manner which creates cost differentials that distinguish among persons or localities based on location of such extensions.
Requires appointed board of education members and candidates for an elected board to reveal criminal convictions prior to assuming or running for office.
Decreases membership of county boards of taxation to 2004 level.
Amends the "Fair Housing Act" to change details of regional contribution agreements.
Provides for increase in relocation assistance amounts based on increase of CPI.
Concerns urban enterprise zones.

Extends requirement of wastewater management planning agencies to establish or update wastewater management plans, and extends validity of sewer service areas and wastewater service areas until April 7, 2011.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing; abolishes Council on Affordable Housing.
Requires contracting units and boards of education to credit contractors with interest earned on certain funds withheld from payment to contractors.
Concerns membership and management of homeowners associations.
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."*
Permits automatic expungement for certain persons completing a sentence to drug court under the special probation statute.
Extends time municipalities have to commit fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units to six years.
Allows corporation business tax or gross income tax credits to developers for certain capital investments for repurposing qualified health care facilities.
Eliminates duplication and redundancy in registration of certain apartments.
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Establishes compensation limits for licensed public adjusters during certain emergencies.
Permits liens in favor of planned real estate development associations for unpaid assessments in planned real estate developments.
"Property Tax Lien Pilot Program," establishes pilot program to allow certain municipalities greater control over sale of tax liens.
Extends moratorium on the imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until 2018; establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Establishes alternatives to monetary bail for certain criminal offenders.
Permits charter school to limit admission to students with a substance abuse or dependence disorder.
Permits a tax deduction under the New Jersey gross income tax for taxpayers who operate or maintain for their employees a licensed child care center or who have paid the cost of outside child care.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for day care center support benefiting children of employees.
Revises State funding formula for public education.
Revises New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act and other laws relating thereto.
Establishes tuition aid grant pilot program for part-time county college students.
Exempts municipal clerk from penalties for Open Public Records Act violations under certain circumstances.
Prohibits use of certain underwriting guidelines by insurers pertaining to guide dogs, service dogs, or hearing assistance dogs harbored on the insured property.
Provides for forwarding of criminal history record background check information among State agencies under certain circumstances.
Excludes individual building single family home as his primary residence from provisions of "Fair Housing Act."
Exempts security deposits by residential tenants from provisions of "Uniform Unclaimed Property Act."
Provides that an "attorney-in-fact" is a fiduciary for purposes of theft statutes.
Requires certain public utilities to notify an appropriate law enforcement officer of service shutoffs to residential customers under certain circumstances.
Authorizes courts to include animals in domestic violence restraining orders.
Establishes Office of Asset and Revenue Recovery within Office of Attorney General in DLPS.
Requires county board of taxation to transmit written memorandum of judgment to assessor and taxpayer within 15 days of judgment.
Exempts child under age six from hepatitis B vaccine requirement if child's mother tested negative for hepatitis B during her pregnancy.
Prohibits the unauthorized photographing or videotaping of a child.
Exempts certain properties acquired by municipalities from county, school, and fire district taxes immediately upon aquisition.
Requires drug test specimens from drug abuse treatment clinics be analyzed by independent clinical laboratory.
Authorizes innocent spouse relief under the gross income tax.
Requires court to deny defendant's right to copy or reproduce images of child pornography as part of discovery.
Requires builders of new homes to provide owners with building plans.
Clarifies DCA's authority to ensure planned real estate development builders comply with disclosure requirements.
Requires developer under "The Planned Real Estate Full Disclosure Act" to post bond with DCA and provides for more accountability to owners in common interest community.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.
Clarifies current law regarding noisy motor vehicle muffler; establishes penalty for commercial motor vehicle operators.

Clarifies and strengthens disclosure requirements for certain complimentary tickets received by candidates, officeholders, political party officials, political committees and continuing political committees.

Authorizes the Legislative Counsel in the Office of Legislative Services to accept proper and sufficient service of process on behalf of the State Legislature when either or both Houses are named defendants in any legal proceeding.
Changes date for election of fire district commissioners from third Saturday in February to day of general election.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.
Directs State public issuer of obligations to use competitive bidding process when investing proceeds from such obligations.

Prohibits contributions by administrator of Type II school district to candidates for member of district's school board; restricts employment by Type II school district of contributors to election campaign of member of district's school board.
Permits tax credit against gross income tax for certain adoption expenses.
Concerns debarment of contractors for conviction of certain computer-related crimes.
Requires foreign corporations providing electronic communication services or remote computing services to comply with New Jersey subpoenas, court orders and search warrants.
Revises child pornography law.
Excuses students with conflicts of conscience from certain class requirements of public institutions of higher education.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Requires certain conditions affecting application for development or zoning variance to be recorded with municipality and county.
Allows New Jersey S corporations to elect to transfer corporation business tax credits to shareholders to apply against the shareholders' gross income tax liability.
Requires municipal governing bodies and boards of education to provide sufficient time for all requested public comment at open public meetings.
Allows victims and relatives to witness parole hearings.
Requires hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Establishes net operating loss carryback deduction under corporation business tax.
Gives Director subpoena powers in administration of Division of Pensions and Benefits.

Increases statutory mandatory retirement age for Supreme Court Justices, Superior Court Judges, Tax Court Judges, Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and County Prosecutors from 70 to 75.
Exempts from sales and use tax sale of pet medications; designated as "Fritz's Law."
Designates corn as New Jersey State Grain.
Clarifies that first aid, ambulance or rescue squads, as entities, have immunity from civil damages in certain circumstances.
Authorizes special Support Our Veterans license plate with proceeds supporting New Jersey homeless veteran's centers.
Provides employers with various tax incentives for hiring persons with disabilities under insurance premiums tax, corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Prohibits the use of drones by law enforcement entities.
Reestablishes certain historic driving privileges afforded holders of agricultural driver's licenses in operating farm equipment and vehicles.*
Provides for philosophical exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Requires use of highest appraisal value as offer price for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs.
Prohibits DEP from imposing conditions on projects exempt from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Provides for awarding of certain costs to defendants who prevail in DEP enforcement actions.

Requires State compensation of property owners for certain property devalued due to certain environmental laws; and requires State agencies to evaluate proposed administrative rules for potential to constitute taking of real property.
Requires boards of education to provide more detailed information on compensation of school district employees not covered by collective bargaining agreements.
Authorizes certain non-emergency mutual agreements between municipalities for law enforcement purposes.
Permits sale of raw milk under certain conditions and establishes raw milk permit program.
Exempts certain municipalities from payment for certain State Police services.
Designates "I'm From New Jersey" as the State song.
Clarifies that BB guns are not firearms under New Jersey law.
Limits the transportation costs of school districts sending students to county vocational school districts located outside the county of residence.
Designates bison as agricultural livestock.
Authorizes reimbursement for EMT training from EMT Training Fund for certain volunteer firefighters.
Establishes program authorizing lease of historic buildings and structures in State parks, forests, and wildlife management areas.
Repeals law permitting project labor agreements.
Allows commercial farmer to recover reasonable costs and attorney fees of defending against unreasonable complaints under "Right to Farm Act."
Prohibits public utilities from recovering certain charges from customers.
Requires accountability of NJSPCA and county societies for prevention of cruelty to animals to Attorney General and county prosecutors, respectively.
Changes membership of, and election process for, NJSPCA board of trustees.
Provides tort claims immunity to certain State volunteer workers.
Requires third-party disbursement service organization that contracts with local government unit or board of education to post bond against failure to meet obligations.
Revises law concerning disposition of assets of a county society for the prevention of cruelty to animals that has dissolved or has had its charter revoked, canceled, or suspended.
Establishes special motorcycle license plates for veterans.
Provides one-third of motor vehicle fine moneys generated through State Police issued tickets go to municipality where violation occurred.
Concerns collective negotiations for school employees; repeals law prohibiting school boards from imposing terms and conditions of employment.

Authorizes an institution of higher education to initiate a new program without the approval of the Commission on Higher Education that might otherwise be required if the program is not supported by State funds.
Excludes gains on sales of certain real estate purchases from taxation under corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Prohibits a public institution of higher education from using State funds to pay a commencement speaker.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
The "Retail Establishment Check Cashers Act"; establishes license for retail establishments to cash checks for fees.
Exempts disabled veterans from certain fees at State parks and forests.
Provides for medical exemption from influenza vaccination based on allergy to any vaccine ingredient.

Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to provide information on life insurance plans to borrowers of student loans and requires authority to contract with life insurance company to offer policies to borrowers.
Clarifies "knockout game" assault as third-degree aggravated assault; permits juvenile offender 14 years of age or older committing such assault to be tried as adult offender.
Requires Secretary of State to establish secure Internet website for online voter registration; authorizes use of digitized signatures from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission's database.
Directs the Division on Women to conduct an audit of the coordination of community responses to domestic violence.
Requires telephone companies regulated by BPU to mail certain service discontinuance notices via certified, return receipt requested.
Requires State Comptroller to report findings of audit compliance reviews.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Requires State department, agency, authority, or instrumentality thereof to provide link on its website for members of public to submit complaints.
Provides for excused absences for public school students involved in election activities on day of general election under certain circumstances.
Designates May of each year "Military Appreciation Month" in New Jersey.
"Garden State Manufacturing Jobs Act."
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of certain compressed natural gas vehicles.
Requires each school district to annually submit interscholastic athletic opportunity report to the Commissioner of Education.

Revises "Overseas Residents Absentee Voting Law" to mirror federal law; permits overseas voters to vote in any election; permits use of federal write-in absentee ballot to vote, register or request ballot for all elections.
Requires pawnbrokers to file transaction reports online.
Prohibits awarding alimony to domestic violence offenders; permits termination of alimony based on conviction for crime or offense involving domestic violence.
Provides that routine foot care services covered under certain insurance policies include coverage of services provided by podiatric physicians.
Eliminates salary for part-time members of certain boards, commissions, and independent authorities.
Provides for priority consideration, by State, of permit applications by counties and municipalities with 10 or more shared services.
Requires interpretive statements of State general obligation bond act public questions to include certain fiscal information.
Immunizes employers from civil liability for certain disclosures regarding employees and former employees.

Prohibits legislative aide who works, or worked, directly for legislator in district office from making political contribution greater than $30 per election to that legislator; prohibits receipt of such contribution.
"The New Jersey Healthcare Choice Act"; permits health insurers licensed in other states to provide coverage in New Jersey under certain circumstances.
Allows residents of certain Highlands municipalities to designate on gross income tax returns that a portion of gross income tax paid be returned to municipality of residence.
Caps noneconomic damages in medical malpractice actions at $250,000.
Excludes overtime pay of certain employees from gross income tax.
"Prenatally and Postnatally Diagnosed Conditions Awareness Act in New Jersey."
Prohibits wrongful life/birth suits.
Establishes procedure for notification to, and review by, municipalities of certain grant and loan applications for acquisition or development of lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Re-establishes 6.37 percent as top marginal gross income tax rate.
Places restrictions on unsolicited school budget communications sent by a board of education to school district residents 90 days prior to annual school election.
Authorizes the establishment of probationary periods for nontenured faculty members at State colleges.
"Medical Philanthropy Act"; provides physicians who provide uncompensated care with $250,000 cap on noneconomic damages in actions alleging medical malpractice.
"Education Investment Act"; establishes an equity financing for education program at certain public institutions of higher education.
Amends State college law to allow boards of trustees to conduct collective bargaining.
Amends State college law to remove certain employees from civil service system.
Allows Governor to remove an executive county superintendent of schools at will.
Provides civil immunity to licensed health care professionals who provide care at health care facilities for no compensation.
Provides for the designation of new charter school authorizers and additional modifications of the charter school program.
Eliminates public school district budget reduction appeals to the Commissioner of Education.

"Home-Based Jobs Creation Act"; classifies certain home businesses as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing, or retailing activities.
Prohibits dual elective office holding and holding of elective office and public office or position.
Specifies failure to restrain a cat, dog, or other domestic companion animal while the animal is riding in a motor vehicle is not cruel or inhumane transport.
"School Children First Act"; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires principal consent for teacher placement; eliminates certain seniority rights.
The "Digital Impersonation Prevention Act."
Consolidates all categories of gross income for cross-claiming of net losses and allows 20 year loss carryforward under the New Jersey gross income tax; repeals alternate business income calculation.
Increases interest rate paid on certain overdue refunds of tax overpayments.
Requires independent State authority member to disclose contractual relationship between authority and authority member's relatives.
Prohibits sending unsolicited advertising by text messaging, and requires companies offering text messaging services to allow customers to block all incoming and outgoing text messages.
Establishes annual sales tax holiday for certain sales of personal computers and certain sales of school supplies and equipment during first full weekend of August.
Makes certain changes to public access of government records.
Directs Attorney General to develop guidelines for positive identification of suspects before release.
Requires the adoption of nepotism policies by school districts and charter schools.
Prohibits sale of certain products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.*
Requires breath or blood sample to be obtained from certain drivers involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death or serious bodily injury.
Requires school districts to provide for the safe operation of electrically operated partitions in classrooms or other school facilities.
Prohibits certain unsolicited checks.
Prohibits the sale of certain children's products containing lead, mercury, or cadmium.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Praying Mantis."
Requires printers to display average cost per 1,000 printed pages and ink cartridges to display yield.
Concerns compensation and benefits of officers, employees, and members of State and local authorities.
Permits counties and municipalities to withdraw from civil service system by ordinance.
Authorizes hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Repeals restriction on weights and measures officers' and employees' duties.
Establishes pilot project to permit voters in military service on active duty overseas, and their eligible family members, to vote in certain elections using the Internet; makes appropriation.*
Requires destruction of records stored on digital copy machines under certain circumstances.
Authorizes county and municipal consumer affairs directors to conduct administrative hearings, assess civil and other penalties, and issue cease and desist orders.
Requires DOH to establish uniform standards for retail food establishment health and sanitary evaluation placards.

"Government Reality Check Act"; prohibits public employers from providing certain benefits to public employees; restricts gifts to public employees; restricts travel by public employees; imposes post-employment restriction on public contracting employees.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River Port Authority commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River and Bay Authority commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Port Authority of New York and New Jersey commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Requires State Auditor review of certain Department of Corrections privatization contracts.
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Requires State Treasurer to organize and publish certain contract and grant data and information on State expenditure Internet website.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in hedge funds and derivative contracts.
Prohibits employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.
Establishes minimum registered professional nurse staffing standards for hospitals and ambulatory surgery facilities and certain DHS facilities.
Permits EMT, paramedic, or investigator for county medical examiner's office to make determination and pronouncement of death under certain circumstances.
Establishes bio-recovery specialist license and requires first responders to provide certain support to victims.
Provides alternative pathway for architects licensed in another state to be licensed as architects in New Jersey.
Concerns credit card interchange fees and consumer protection.
Requires reporting of public high school, district and Statewide drop-out and graduation rates.

"New Jersey College Student and Parent Consumer Information Act"; requires each four-year public institution of higher education to provide on its website certain information regarding its costs, faculty, and graduation rates.
Increases sheriffs' fees for executing arrest warrants in Special Civil Part.
Permits the issuance of restraining orders against persons charged with certain prostitution related offenses.

Establishes lawn watering restrictions; authorizes DEP to adopt water conservation regulations and to reduce water supply application backlog; and requires installation of automatic rain sensor devices under certain circumstances.

Establishes uniform lower contribution limits and requires greater disclosure of all campaign contributions received by candidates; repeals laws regulating campaign contributions by entities performing certain public contracts.
Requires four-year institutions of higher education to achieve a minimum 50% five-year graduation rate for full time students within five years.
Requires incarcerated individual be counted for redistricting purposes at previous address if State resident and not counted if incarcerated and not State resident.
Concerns reviews of State's economic development incentives.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $100,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $50,000 or less of taxable income.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $150,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $75,000 or less of taxable income.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $250,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $125,000 or less of taxable income.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $200,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $100,000 or less of taxable income.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish performance-based funding plan for public institutions of higher education.
"Christopher's Law;" provides court with option of ordering juveniles adjudicated delinquent to receive interactive instruction in preventing gang involvement and gang and youth violence.
Establishes the Higher Education Reorganization Oversight Board to facilitate coordination of any reorganization of Rutgers University, UMDNJ, and Rowan University.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide to prospective students certain cost, loan, and debt information in financial aid shopping sheet.
Provides three years of partial funding to urban enterprise zone assistance fund for Hurricane Sandy relief.
"Vegetation Management Response Act"; concerns vegetation management related to electric public utility infrastructure.
Reduces lawful maximum capacity of certain ammunition magazines in New Jersey.
Establishes a ballistics identifier program for certain firearms.
Requires firearms to be unloaded and securely locked or stored within home.
Requires firearms seizure when mental health professional determines patient poses threat of harm to self or others.
Strengthens State's assault weapons ban.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish performance-based funding plans for public institutions of higher education.
Disqualifies persons with three drunk driving or refusal convictions in five years from purchasing firearm.
Limits public college immunity from municipal land use restrictions on large-scale development projects.
Encourages the establishment of "breakfast after the bell" programs in school districts, public school, and nonpublic schools participating in the federal school breakfast program.*
Establishes public awareness campaign concerning safety of certain pedestrians.
Establishes $800,000,000 program of tax credits for qualified residential projects; restricts $200,000,000 for 100 percent-dedicated affordable housing.
Provides that the New Jersey Supreme Court shall have the authority to administer juror challenges through its rulemaking process.

Requires mail-in ballot applications be available at polling places on election day for voting in future elections; requires establishment of Intrnet webpages to provide instructions for completing mail-in ballot applications.*
Prohibits use of facial recognition systems except in certain circumstances.

Requires driver's license examination to include questions on distracted driving; makes it a violation for motorists to talk or text on hand-held wireless devices while vehicle is temporarily stopped.
Establishes "knockout game" assault as second-degree aggravated assault.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers in certain fields to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in certain failing schools.
Modifies certain fees charged by, and requirements imposed on, check casher licensees.
Prohibits sale of products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.
Bars sex offenders from jobs which primarily consist of contact with children.
Regulates assignment and use of State vehicles.
Expands number of safe havens for leaving newborn infants.
Clarifies criteria for issuing Amber Alert when child abducted by family member.
Bars sales of aerosol dusters to persons under the age of 18.

Permits certain applicants to submit personal statement of veteran status, in lieu of determination of veteran status, prior to issuance of civil service eligible list; requires submission of determination of status prior to employment.
Provides for satellite-based monitoring of homeless registered sex offenders.
Upgrades harassment under certain circumstances; restricts cyberbullying offenders' access to the Internet.
Prohibits sale of alcoholic energy drinks.
Makes harassment by electronic means a crime of the fourth degree.
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under 21 years of age.
Establishes per se standard for driving under the influence of drugs.
Regulates massage therapy advertising.
Prohibits cultivation or production of marijuana on preserved farmland and eligibility for farmland assessment of any land used for such purposes.
Provides that committing a sex act with a minor under certain circumstances constitutes aggravated sexual assault or sexual assault.
Revises ignition interlock device requirements for first drunk driving offenses.
Concerns access to information maintained by Prescription Monitoring Program.
Permits minors to engage in certain construction work for nonprofit organizations.
Requires hospitals to post notice in emergency departments concerning prescription drug diversion.
Requires pharmacies and prescribers to notify patients about how to ensure proper and safe disposal of unused prescription drugs.
Requires website operators to delete posts at request of minor.
Requires proof of identification for dispensation of certain prescription medications.
Provides that registration will be revoked for second and subsequent drunk driving and refusal offenses.
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.
Establishes municipal authority to supervise, discipline and terminate employment of construction code officials.
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Requires notaries public to be U.S. citizens.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Supplemental appropriation of $250,000 to DLPS to assist local police departments in paying for new NICS terminals.
Eliminates the New Jersey inheritance tax and repeals chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Permits conversion of fines for violation of certain municipal ordinances into tax liens.
Revises criteria for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Provides immunity from civil liability for persons performing animal rescue and authorizes formation of emergency animal rescue response units.
Establishes "Seniors Helping Seniors Who are Blind or Visually Impaired Demonstration Program" in DHS; appropriates $360,000.
Allows gross income tax filers to designate contributions to VetGroup, Inc. for services for veterans.
Authorizes special license plate for distinguished service medal recipients.
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Requires State to reimburse counties and municipalities for salary and fringe benefit costs of employee on official leave of absence for military service in war on terror; makes an appropriation.
Extends veterans' property tax exemption to tenant shareholders in cooperatives and mutual housing corporations.
Allows PERS ordinary disability retiree to earn up to $3,000 in PERS-covered employment annually before cancellation of disability benefit and reenrollment in PERS.
Extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Makes annual compensation paid to surviving spouses of certain blind or disabled veterans payable from date of veteran's death.
Establishes task force to study issues facing returning members of the United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard and make recommendations on how State should address issues.
Increases penalties for identity theft when victim is a senior citizen or veteran.
Dedicates up to $400,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach and Liberty State Parks to special funds to be used to support certain park programs, and makes appropriations from the funds.
Creates new offense of theft by financial exploitation of a vulnerable person.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to fully disabled veterans.
Converts loan awarded to Barnegat Bay Decoy and Baymen's Museum from loan to grant.
Clarifies that non-credit courses are eligible courses under the volunteer tuition credit program.
Establishes NJ Business and the Arts Commission to promote art Statewide.
Creates New Jersey Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act.
Exempts veterans' organizations from motor vehicle registration fee.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Requires prosecutor to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Requires DEP to assume responsibility for dredging of waterways providing boat access to lagoon communities; appropriates $6,000,000.
Establishes special dredging account; directs $5,000,000 of sales tax collected annually be deposited therein; directs DEP to administer account and dredging program with certain requirements.
Appropriates $26,140,000 for dredging projects and dredged material disposal projects related to navigational waterways.
Establishes a New Jersey Coordinating Council on the Decommissioning of Nuclear Power Generating Facilities.
Revises law concerning sexually oriented businesses.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Increases personal needs allowance to $55 for low income persons residing in certain facilities.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Increases prison time for certain persons convicted of a motor vehicle offense when license suspended for DUI.
Extends penalties for driving under the influence to include any substance that impairs driving ability; deems driver's consent to non-invasive drug tests.
Criminalizes fifth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Ends the transitional energy facilities assessment, caps the State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures the balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Clarifies that harassment made anonymously or otherwise through electronic communication devices constitutes a petty disorderly offense.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Requires certain offenders to register under Megan's Law; upgrades the crimes of invasion of privacy and peering into a window of a dwelling for a second or subsequent offense.
Prohibits seller of real estate to transfer realty transfer fee liability to buyer.
Requires certification that persons directly or indirectly receiving State monies or privileges are not unauthorized aliens.
Provides for mandatory terms of imprisonment for certain sexual assaults upon a minor; amends murder statute.
Provides that trespassing in nuclear power plant is third degree crime.
Provides for immediate driver's license suspension under certain circumstances.
Requires State to purchase certain vehicle tires and motor oils to minimize fuel usage.
Directs DOT to study and report on implementation of truck stop electrification systems to reduce truck idling and fuel usage.
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.

Exempts transfer of ownership of real property between individual and business entity controlled by that individual from realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on transfer of ownership of certain real property.
Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.
