Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Ends transitional energy facilities assessment (TEFA), caps State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Requires any individual seeking elective public office to disclose when filing petition of nomination whether he or she has been convicted of a criminal offense.
Allows CRDA to finance certain highway projects outside of Atlantic City Tourism District.
Allows certain drug dealing offenses to be graded by "units," rather than weight, of controlled dangerous substances.
Revises grades and sentencing determinations for certain controlled dangerous substances.**
Provides for payment to small municipalities, in certain cases, of certain penalty moneys assessed for violations of fish and game laws.

Creates an integrated State medical examiner system by increasing the authority of the State Medical Examiner regarding forensic investigations, establishing regional medical examiner offices, and eliminating the county medical examiner system.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Revises "Local Bond Law" provisions to exempt certain energy projects from appropriation requirement for five percent down payment.
Regulates teen nights by requiring security provided by police officers, prohibiting persons under age 15 from attending, and disqualifying registered sex offenders from employment.
Establishes gross income tax credit for cost of certain postage for sending goods to members of United States Armed Forces and National Guard who are serving their country away from home.
Makes technical corrections to individual health coverage and small employer health benefits programs and to NJ FamilyCare.
Defines "mobile home park" as "multiple dwelling" for inspection purposes.
Authorizes proportional property tax exemption for honorably discharged veterans having a service-connected permanent disability.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million for grants to certain nursing schools to address shortage of nursing faculty.
Authorizes creation of economic recovery districts; authorizes certain economic recovery district management corporations to issue bonds secured by incentive grants.
Requires SHBP and joint insurance funds to provide certain information to participating public employers.
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Authorizes immediate euthanasia of impounded stray animals that are injured or ill beyond hope of recovery.
Authorizes municipality to provide for imposition and collection of special assessment to secure developer's recovery of cost of certain improvements in connection with redevelopment project.
Requires health insurers and SHBP to provide certain mental health benefits for eating disorders under same terms and conditions as for other illnesses and diseases.
Directs New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to study and report on potential revenue generating services of rest areas and service plazas.*
Clarifies that criminal impersonation committed by any means, including electronic communications or Internet website, shall be subject to criminal penalties.
Changes priorities for financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
Allows certain State agencies to sell Internet advertisements on agencies' websites as pilot program.*
Authorizes development and operation of computer system which would allow electronic access to outstanding arrest warrant information.
Permits health care providers to report certain patient health problems to MVC.
Requires managed care plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide for reasonable accommodation in accessing providers for persons with physical disabilities.
Permits municipal court to order certain offenders to perform community service in lieu of payment of penalty.
Revises individual cause of action under consumer fraud act; restricts consumer fraud act to New Jersey residents.
Exempts veterans' organizations from nonprofit corporation annual report filing fee.
Authorizes award of attorney's fees and expenses in landlord-tenant actions under certain circumstances.
Permits municipalities to hold certain inactive liquor licenses reserved for smart growth developments for an additional five years.
Requires local governments and school boards in SHBP/SEHBP to certify savings based on three bids from non-SHBP/SEHBP plans before continuing SHBP/SEHBP in new collective negotiations agreements.
"Naturopathic Doctors Licensing Act."
Requires municipalities which license peddlers and solicitors to accept certain background check results from other municipalities.**

Provides corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization, and expansion, or hiring and training of new employees for manufacturing purposes.
Permits boards of education to establish donated leave programs for their employees as an alternative to the sick leave banks which are currently permitted by law.
Establishes the "Superstorm Sandy Victims' Bill of Rights."
Provides tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain costs incurred in purchase of equipment used by private facilities to conduct motor vehicle safety inspections.
Changes priorities for financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
Requires notification of municipalities by public utilities under certain circumstances.

Repeals Kyleigh's Law decal requirement; requires MVC to provide parents of graduated driver license applicants detailed information about program's conditions and restrictions; imposes penalties on parents when licensees fail to comply.
Establishes "MarcAnthony's Law;" criminalizes use of defaced or stolen firearm to injure a police officer; enhances penalties for defacing a firearm.
Requires DHSS to authorize Jersey City to issue certified copies of birth certificates by December 31, 2010.
Increases penalties for drunk driving with a minor as a passenger.
Prohibits smoking in automobiles when children are present.
Provides for termination of child support obligation upon certain conditions.
Extends period for requested medical exam for disability benefits under PFRS to every two years until 55 years of age.
Establishes "Study Commission on E-Licensing."
Prohibits public and private employers from discriminating against ex-convicts.
Establishes linked deposit program allowing State Treasurer to deposit State funds at below market interest rates with certain banks.
Concerns prompt payment of construction contracts.
Amends special probation statute to give judges additional discretion to admit certain offenders to "drug court" program.
Prohibits public and private employers from automatically disqualifying ex-offenders from employment.
Codifies AG recommendations for issuing Amber Alert when family member abducts child.
Provides that student truancy cases would be heard in municipal court and requires truants to attend an appropriate intervention program.
Requires retired law enforcement officers to qualify in use of firearm once a year.
Provides that certain personal identifying information may be redacted from certain public records in certain circumstances.
Requires DOC to conduct quarterly site visits at residential community release programs.
Prohibits certain persons charged with first, second, or third degree crimes from being in halfway houses prior to adjudication.*
Provides that certain personal identifying information may be redacted from certain public records in certain circumstances.
Permits cities of the first class to operate weigh stations and to inspect vehicles and railroad cars transporting hazardous materials within their jurisdiction.
Requires mental health evaluation and list of household members with mental illness to purchase firearm.
Requires security guards who carry weapons to wear certain uniform, including identification card.
Establishes durational limits and enumerates certain factors concerning modification and termination of alimony; establishes "open durational" alimony.*
Criminalizes posting on Internet videotape of aggravated assault.
Increases insurance requirements on operators of autobuses; requires driver of autobus to possess commercial driver license.
Requires State Board of Education to include training in mental health as part of professional development requirement for public school teachers.
Prohibits installation of gunfire locators on utility poles.
Establishes compensation program for certain injured probation officers.
Requires firearms endorsement on driver's license or non-driver identification card.
Establishes criminal penalties for killing, injuring or interfering with a service animal or guide dog; designated as "Dusty's Law."
Revises exemption from "unemployment compensation law" for operators of certain motor vehicles.
Excludes from income for gross income tax and PAAD eligibility purposes victims' remuneration for involuntary internment received under judgments or settlement agreements.

Authorizes creation of urban enterprise zones in Garfield, Harrison, Keansburg, and two joint urban enterprise zones, one in Cliffside Park and Fairview, and one in Buena Vista Township and Buena Borough.
Prohibits authorized bearer from mailing or transporting voted ballots to county board on behalf of more than 10 qualified voters in an election.
Increases minimum wage for tipped workers.
Requires assessments prior to laboratory and diagnostic testing of persons undergoing mental health screening.
Allows direct deposit of adoption subsidy payments.
Codifies additional options for the court to enforce court-ordered child support in certain cases.
Requires school district hiring preference for veterans for school security positions.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to recruit, select, and train veterans for school security positions in school districts.
Expands role of temporary guardian to include arranging placement of alleged incapacitated person in appropriate, less restrictive environment.
Requires newly-constructed multiple dwellings with 25 or more residential units to install standby generators to provide electricity in case of emergency.
Provides for electronic scanning of certain certificates for initiating court proceedings for involuntary commitment.
Concerns eligibility for certain leave and benefit programs.
Creates the Office on Women's Research and Policy and appropriates $150,000.
Requires State Comptroller to perform compliance audit to verify municipal implementation of corrective action plan following performance audit.
Requires Division on Civil Rights and DCA to post information regarding disability accommodation rights for owners and occupants of condominiums, cooperatives, and other common interest communities.
Makes supplemental appropriation of up to $6.3 million to the Department of Health for certain grants to counties for women's health services.
Requires DHS to give priority to temporary rental assistance over use of hotels or motels in emergency assistance to Work First New Jersey recipients.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Removes license suspension penalty for persons with only one outstanding parking fine; permits Motor Vehicle Commission to refuse registration to persons with outstanding parking fine.
Provides for mandatory forfeiture of retirement benefits of elected official convicted of crime involving office held.

Imposes mandatory minimum terms of imprisonment and forfeiture of pension and retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of crimes involving or touching their office or employment.
Clarifies that permitting sexual abusers to reside with a child constitutes endangering welfare of a child.
Exempts from sales tax certain sales by or to any senior citizens club organized for pleasure, recreation, or other nonprofitable purposes.
Expands eligibility under the Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act by broadening certain municipal qualifier provisions.
Upgrades the disorderly persons offense of desecration of a venerated object to a crime of the third degree if the object desecrated is a military monument.
Provides that public employee pension benefits are calculated on base salary exclusive of various forms of extra compensation.
Allows judgment for restitution of stolen public funds to be levied against convicted employee's retirement allowance or pension contributions.
Concerns stalking and related restraining order protections for adoptive children and their adoptive parents victimized by persons whose parental rights to the adoptive children have been terminated.
Requires sex offender's tier designation to be completed and reviewed by the court prior to release from incarceration.
Permits eligible claimant who is proportionate owner paying entire property tax bill to collect entire homestead property tax reimbursement amount.
"One Strike, You're Ours;" adds use of Internet as aggravating factor in child sex crimes and requires lifetime electronic monitoring of offender.
Requires breath or blood test in motor vehicle accidents involving pedestrians.
Requires hospitals to maintain passive audio or visual mechanism for alerting emergency department staff to presence of non-ambulance vehicles containing patients.
Grants discretion to Parole Board in determining whether inmate should be released on parole.
Appropriates $5 million to Cranford Township for flood control projects.
Permits advanced practice nurses to certify person as handicapped for purposes of handicapped parking.
Restricts access to motor vehicle accident reports under certain circumstances.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act;" imposes mandatory term of imprisonment; provides for negotiated reduction of mandatory term under certain circumstances.
Requires DOT to construct noise barriers on Interstate 78.
Provides exemption from 3-day cancellation provision of home improvement contract in case of bona fide emergency.
Requires that sexual abuse against a child be reported to law enforcement officials.
Increases penalty for harboring or concealing certain sex offenders.
Creates housing purchase matching grant program for members of United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations.
Imposes surcharge on motor vehicle offenses to fund upgraded electronic systems for police vehicles.
Requires all prison commissary profits be turned over to Victims of Crime Compensation Office.
Changes restrictions on certain county or municipal stream cleaning activities.
Establishes "Matthew's Law Limiting the Use of Restraints."
Exempts homestead from attachment in medical malpractice judgment.
Prohibits insurers from raising medical malpractice liability insurance premiums under certain circumstances.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act;" imposes mandatory term of 25 years to life for aggravated sexual assault against a child under 13 and increases penalties for harboring certain sex offenders.
Establishes process for county colleges to offer baccalaureate degree nursing programs.
"Consumer Access to Health Care Act"; eliminates requirement of joint protocol with physician for advanced practice nurses to prescribe medication.
Requires assisted living residences and certain facilities under DCA, DCF, and DHS to be equipped with standby emergency power generators.
Requires suspension of member of Legislature indicted for certain crimes or offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office.
Adds two nurse educators to the New Jersey Board of Nursing.
Creates commission to study effectiveness of county government; appropriates $95,000.
Prevents county park facility from having primary purpose of hosting private events.
Increases the types of matters eligible to be voted upon by a sending district representative on a receiving district board of education.
Limits State appointment or employment of members of Legislature for two years after completion of legislative service.
Prohibits nonrenewal of homeowners insurance policies based on proximity to water or risk of windstorm related claims.

Provides that certain districts are not penalized in the calculation of State debt service aid for school facilities projects in which bonds were authorized but not issued prior to effective date of P.L.2008, c.39.
Decreases the threshold percentages of student enrollment necessary for a sending school district to obtain representation on a receiving school district board of education.
Authorizes counties to participate in property tax appeals for real property having a value of $10 million or more.
Makes all members of Legislature ineligible to participate in SHBP.
Requires persons convicted of possessing child pornography to register as sex offenders.
Requires SJTA to provide a cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Provides temporary exemption from sales and use tax for rental of certain hotel rooms.
Permits municipality to sell certain vehicles in connection with motor vehicle offenses.
Reduces number of voters for whom person can serve as messenger; limits to three number of voted mail-in ballots transmittable by bearer; modifies conviction standard under vote by mail law.
Makes various changes to registration and community notification requirements under Megan's Law.
Requires certain services be prearranged before homeless person is relocated.
Provides public access to certain information received or possessed by legislators.
Permits installation of GPS navigation devices which do not obstruct a motor vehicle operator's vision.
Authorizes Commissioner of Education to approve waiver of salary cap for school district superintendent under certain circumstances.
Establishes certain exceptions for emergency personnel operating personal watercraft while providing rescue services.
Provides certain employees access to certain personnel records.
Requires disclosure of water damage prior to household appliance sales.
Requires Adjutant General to consider need for inpatient hospice care for admission to veterans' facilities; permits waiver of State residency requirement.
Provides supplemental enrollment growth aid to districts that experienced significant enrollment growth; appropriates $21,881,000 to DOE.

Requires appropriation of revenues collected in excess of amount anticipated for fiscal year for State hotel and motel occupancy fee for additional allocation among certain cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.
Eliminates statute of limitations for theft of fine art and amends theft statute concerning such art.
Revises sales and use tax to specify certain persons deemed to be sellers and to clarify tax collection responsibilities of certain other persons and agents.
Permits municipality to hire private company to provide construction officials, subcode officials, and technical assistants.
Enhances the reporting and disclosure requirements concerning State tax expenditures and limits the duration of new State tax expenditure enactments.
Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) programs.*
Eliminates certain components of realty transfer fee.

"Assistance to Firefighters' Families Act"; doubles State survivor pension amounts for beneficiaries of certain deceased volunteer emergency service providers; requires municipal life insurance and burial expenses for volunteer firefighters; permits fire code inspection surcharge.
Permits small businesses to qualify for loans from NJEDA for costs of energy audit and making energy efficiency or conservation improvements.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for qualified wages of certain veterans.
Establishes New Jersey Council on Responsible Fatherhood and Responsible Fatherhood Fund.
Modifies timeframe during which charter school applications are submitted to and approved by DOE.
Requires release of bid list prior to bid date under "Local Public Contracts Law."
Requires a board of education to consult with appropriate nonpublic school representatives prior to any change in the provision of nursing services.
"New Jersey Venture Investment and Employment Program Act;" establishes program under NJ EDA to provide for qualified investments of capital in qualified businesses.
Creates corporate business tax and gross income tax credits to fund education enrichment demonstration program.

Increases distribution to municipalities from Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund over five years to restore municipal aid reductions; requires additional aid to be subtracted from municipal property tax levy.
"Health Care Consumer Cost Transparency Act" *
Establishes microenterprise training program and assistance for micro entrepreneurs.
Requires reporting for State tax purposes of certain nonwage payments made to construction service providers.
Establishes the "Mortgage Assistance Pilot Program."
Establishes State pension fund preference for certain in-State infrastructure investment.

Expands membership of Credit Union Advisory Council; requires at least two members to be members of federally chartered credit unions and at least four members to be members of State chartered credit unions.
Increases penalties for motor vehicle violations resulting in serious bodily injury or death to certain persons in highway.
Requires percentage of motor vehicle fines be used to support safe routes to school initiatives.
Increases fine for violation of certain laws concerning pedestrian safety and traffic control; dedicates funds to certain roadways.
Requires an annual State debt affordability analysis be included in the State Debt Report.
Permits religious institutions to request DCF conduct child abuse record checks of certain prospective and current employees and volunteers.*
Requires State to reimburse municipalities for portion of foregone property tax revenue resulting from veterans' property tax exemption.
Requires certain bidders for prevailing wage public work to provide proof that the prevailing wage will be paid.
Requires Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to review construction work on public utilities.*
Establishes a cybersecurity investment incentive tax credit program.
Makes a $3 million supplemental appropriation for increased Per Capita Library Aid.
Establishes a loan redemption program for public school teachers who meet certain academic requirements and teach Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics subjects or special education.

Requires State Board of Education to adopt standards and benchmarks of performance for the improvement of teacher preparation programs and teacher certification candidates who complete the programs, and develop a program rating system.
Establishes Flexible Pathways Initiative in the Department of Education.
Eliminates permanent alimony and revises certain standards for alimony awards.
Establishes green infrastructure financing program.
Allows school districts to enter into school construction public-private partnership agreements with private entities.
Authorizes creation of special Phi Beta Sigma license plates.
Directs State Comptroller to identify and recommend certain programmatic budget reductions for certain State agencies, authorities, and instrumentalities.
Creates State contract set-aside program for businesses owned and operated by disabled veterans.
Authorizes veterans property tax exemption for totally disabled veterans who did not serve in theater of war.

Excludes from gross income under the gross income tax certain United States military compensation paid to members of units of the NJ National Guard and reserve components of the United States Armed Forces.
Excludes veteran disability compensation from income qualification limits under homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.
Authorizes special Distinguished Flying Cross license plates.
Permits a joint meeting by the Senate and Assembly Budget Committees to review and veto utility rate increases approved by BPU.
Makes "Skinner's and Michelle's Law" violators subject to No Early Release Act sentencing guidelines.
Enhances penalty for tampering with evidence after fleeing the scene of an accident resulting in death.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to Cold War veterans.
Establishes telemarketing fraud investigation unit.
Authorizes school district hiring preference for veterans.
Designates New Jersey Route 47 from Wildwood City to Maurice River Township as "Veterans Memorial Highway at Delsea Drive."
Clarifies definition of reasonably necessary deviation when legally transporting firearm or weapon in motor vehicle.

Establishes Common Core State Standards Evaluation Task Force; delays use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers until task force submits final report.
Establishes mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for harming or threatening to harm animal owned or used by a law enforcement agency or a search and rescue dog.
Shortens term of municipal court judges from three years to one year.
Directs DOT Commissioner to allocate Transportation Trust Fund monies for concept development and design of Route 55 extension.
Reduces State hotel and motel occupancy fee from five to two percent starting FY2011; preserves dedication.
Revises qualifications for handgun permit, establishes crimes for certain handgun use; establishes annual fee of $100.
Requires issuance of construction permits for installation of wheelchair ramps on residential real property within 5 business days of application.

Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in urban enterprise zone program; allow zone funds to pay for storm related recovery costs for five years.
Excludes .22 caliber tubular magazines from large capacity ammunition magazine definition.
Creates State Dredging Task Force.
Provides gross income tax credits to support development of New Jersey-based small business start-ups.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of certain electric or plug-in hybrid electric vehicles.

Requires governmental affairs agents retained by government entities to file certain reports with ELEC; requires certain government entities retaining governmental affairs agents to file annual reports with ELEC.
Prohibits automatic renewal of service contracts.
Provides tax credit against gross income tax for cost of certain property that conserves energy or promotes energy efficiency and for other energy efficiency measures.
Creates the "Mold Safe Housing Act."
Requires Department of Health to publish informational guidelines on the inspection, identification, evaluation, and abatement of mold.*
Provides totally disabled persons with discount on hunting license fees.

Lowers age of eligibility for surviving spouse under homestead property tax reimbursement program; extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.

Prohibits public colleges from charging tuition to students who are parents, spouses or children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Creates "New Jersey Life Sciences Internship Challenge" program.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid in State Fiscal Year 2012.
Requires high school driver education course, certain new driver brochures, and driver's license written exam to include aggressive driving information.
Requires certain electric public utilities to file emergency response plan with Board of Public Utilities.
Permits a student to participate in certain voluntary surveys if the district sends prior written notification to the student's parents; limits use of information obtained from survey.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act," requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Allows for a gross income tax deduction for any honorably discharged member of the US Armed Forces, reserve unit or national guard.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain amino acid-based elemental formulas.

Transportation for Hazardous Walking Routes Act; requires school districts to provide busing for students required to walk to school along hazardous routes and prohibits school bus stops within 250 feet of residence of sex offender.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under gross income tax, eliminates income cap on exclusion.
Requires certain energy tax receipts to be paid directly to municipalities.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions, earnings, and qualified distributions associated with special needs trusts.
Authorizes placement of involved animal with animal welfare agency or similar entity pending adjudication of alleged animal cruelty violation when not adjudicated in seven days.
Requires suspension of pay of local elected officials during period between indictment and conviction for certain offenses involving moral turpitude.
Requires appropriate community notification when sex offender is placed in halfway house; prohibits certain county inmates in halfway house.
Alters the amount school district may charge parents when it elects to offer empty seats on a school bus to students who live less than remote from school along established bus routes.
Prohibits certain energy suppliers from making false and misleading claims to potential customers; prohibits suppliers' calls to customers where no business relationship exists.
Provides for licensure of pediatric respite care facilities.
Requires training program for school bus drivers and school bus aides on interacting with students with special needs, and requires development and use of student information cards.*
Extends gross income tax medical expense deduction to certain cord blood banking services.
Requires certain disclosures in advertisements by health care professionals.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Concerns special needs trusts for persons with developmental disabilities.
Establishes "Local Governmental Process Activities Disclosure Act."
Prohibits health insurance carriers from requiring optometrists to become providers with vision care plans as condition of becoming providers in carriers' panel of providers.
Allows gross income tax deductions for certain contributions to NJBEST college tuition savings program.

Codifies current State Board of Education regulations which limit who may serve as case managers for students with disabilities to members of child study teams and certain speech-language specialists.
Allows consumers to return vehicles for full repayment under the lemon law.
Sets forth certain standards to be followed by law enforcement agencies and fire departments when utilizing drones.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees from 11 to 13 members.
Exempts Holocaust reparations payments from legal process, and from estate recovery under Medicaid program.
Requires DOH to establish "New Jersey Autism Website."
Requires certain arbitrators to file financial disclosure statements.
Limits amount of contribution to legal defense fund of holder of elective public office and requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Requires practitioners to disclose business relationship with out-of-State facilities when making patient referrals to those facilities.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and cyber-harassment under certain circumstances.*
Provides for appointment to board of directors of New Jersey Automobile Insurance Risk Exchange by Commissioner of Banking and Insurance.
Increases and clarifies permissible categories of fees chargeable by residential mortgage lenders and brokers.
Prohibits stranger-originated life insurance contracts.
The "Health Care Provider Network Transparency Act"; establishes requirements for granting access to certain health care provider discounts.
"Life Settlements Act"; regulates life settlement contracts and prohibits stranger-originated life insurance contracts; repeals "Viatical Settlements Act."
Makes supplemental appropriation of $7,000,000 to DOE to reinstate nonpublic technology initiative aid.
Requires contribution for health care benefits provided for certain local elected and appointed officials.
Establishes that only non-violent offenders should have their cases reviewed by the parole board every three years.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to $50 million.

Increases personal needs allowance to $50 for recipients of Medicaid and Supplemental Security Income who are veterans or spouses of veterans and provides for annual cost-of-living increase in allowance.
Establishes waiver, rebate or payment of insured's deductible, copayment, or coinsurance by health care practitioner as a form of insurance fraud subject to criminal and civil penalties.
Transfers Bureau of Securities to Department of Banking and Insurance.
Makes permanent certain temporary authorizations that expanded permitted investment by Director of Division of Investment of State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund and State pension funds.
Extends deadline for filing nominating petitions each year new legislative districts are established by Apportionment Commission.
Requires State to provide recipients of State tax refunds, unemployment insurance benefits and State employee compensation certain payment options.
Requires child's religion not be changed due to foster care or adoption.
Eliminates 15% fee charged by cemetery company on transfer of graves, crypts and niches.
Regulates individuals engaged in the facilitation of like-kind exchanges of property pursuant to Section 1031 of the United States Tax Code.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for bond ordinances approved by counties and municipalities.
Requires adoption agency, court, or DYFS to maintain child's religious upbringing when placing child in adoptive or resource family home.
Increases reimbursement rate for providers of adult medical day care services.
Appropriates $3.963 million from General Fund to DOE for nonpublic nursing services aid.
"Healthcare Disclosure and Transparency Act."
Allows certain fuel dealers and distributors refunds of petroleum products gross receipts tax and credits against motor fuel tax for certain bad debts from sale of fuel.
Requires electric public utilities to provide priority power restoration to certain medical facilities, assisted living facilities, and nursing homes.*
"Certificates of Insurance Act."
Establishes procedures for determining enforceability of standard form contracts; invalidates certain indemnification clauses.
"Protection for Individuals with Developmental Disabilities in Institutional and Community Settings Act."
Permits conversion of life insurance policies to pay for Medicaid long-term care.
Modifies certain requirements imposed on check casher licensees.
Requires that definition of occurrence in certain property damage liability insurance policies include coverage for faulty workmanship.
Commences payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt real property owned by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
The "Smart Container Act."
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.
Requires nursing homes to provide training to staff in behavioral health issues.
Allows credit against corporation business tax equal to 50 percent of fair market value of new computer equipment donated to public or nonpublic school.
"PANYNJ Transparency and Accountability Act."
Imposes time constraints on submission and analysis of rape kits.
Designates four State songs.
"State Authorities Reform Act."
Provides that toll revenue generated from PANYNJ bridges shall not exceed cost of maintenance, operation, and debt service of those bridges.
Expands the means to obtain a protective order for a minor.
Establishes the "Sexual Assault Victim's Bill of Rights."
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Requires DOT to issue guidance on certain aspects of red light camera pilot program.
Requires hepatitis B to be considered a priority under "Eliminating Health Disparities Initiative."
Requires funds collected through societal benefits charge not allocated be credited to electric and gas public utility customers.
Prohibits right on red turns at intersections with red light cameras; requires certain additional signage if red light camera is in safe corridor.
Subjects Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to New York's Freedom of Information Law and New Jersey's Open Public Records Act.
Requires DHS to conduct follow-up study of former residents of North Princeton Developmental Center.
Establishes Developmental Disability Awareness license plates; dedicates fees to Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Requires DHS and DMVA to conduct or contract for follow-up studies of former residents transitioning to community from their facilities.*
Requires at least one State developmental center in each region of State; requires certain factors to be considered for transfer of residents between developmental centers.
Permits change in case manager for persons with developmental disabilities under certain circumstances.
"Let Them Be Little Act"; provides for screening newborn infants for MPS I and MPS II.*
Provides for licensure of dementia care homes by DOH.
Establishes Office of the Special Education Ombudsman in DOE.
Limits easement, acquired by the State or local government unit, for use of beachfront property to dune construction or beach replenishment except under certain circumstances.
Authorizes court to include in domestic violence restraining orders a provision making the order applicable to a pregnant victim's child upon birth of the child.
Prohibits distribution of images and information produced by red light cameras.
Requires public institutions of higher education to submit proposed tuition and fees for upcoming academic year to Secretary of Higher Education for review.
Allows refundable gross income tax credit for certain unreimbursed hearing aid expenses.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; designated as "Stephen Komninos' Law."
Imposes moratorium on DHS transitions and transfers of certain individuals with developmental disabilities to new residential placements until certain conditions are met. *
"Reproductive Donation Safety Act."
Requires filing of financial and conflict disclosure statements as condition of development approval.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective and appointive positions.
Provides for mandatory imprisonment and forfeiture of retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes.
Allows pension calculation to be based on compensation increase in excess of actuarially assumed experience only if employer pays unfunded liability.
Clarifies that retention of unearned wages by a public servant is theft under certain circumstances.
Provides increased representation on receiving district boards of education for certain sending districts.

Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each housing unit occupied by a veteran; permits municipalities to satisfy fair share affordable housing obligation through 35 percent set aside for veterans.
Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each unit of transitional housing occupied by a veteran.
Makes members of county boards of taxation ineligible for membership in State-administered retirement system or for health care benefits coverage under plan for public employees.
Prohibits for ten years after compliance with penalty or sentence imposed by court elected or appointed officials convicted of certain crimes from serving as governmental affairs agents.
Repeals law requiring prevailing wage be paid to workers employed in construction undertaken with Board of Public Utilities financial assistance.
Establishes a 2.0 percent cap on annual appropriations increases for certain State government spending.
Amends law concerning conversion of age-restricted communities to define substantial detriment and makes other clarifications.
Requires that police obtain warrant to seize cell phone data.
Requires that police obtain warrant to attach GPS device to suspect's motor vehicle.
Replaces TPAF, PERS, PFRS and SPRS accidental disability benefits with reduced work-related disability benefit; modifies JRS disability benefit.
Increases certain time frames governing arbitration in police and fire contract disputes.

Extends "Right to Farm" protections to cultivation or production of marijuana for medical use; permits such activity on preserved farmland; prohibits county or municipal interference with such activity.
Requires local authorities and independent State authorities to grant officers and employees only those holidays granted to State employees.
Prohibits certain public officers and employees from receiving dual health care benefit coverage.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program; prohibits future use of red light cameras in State.
Requires certain elected officials and appointed officers eligible for dual health benefits coverage to choose coverage by one public entity.
Excludes certain institutions of higher education from prevailing wage requirements.
Revises certain motor vehicle fines imposed on motor vehicle drivers or operators for failing to have required documentation.
Establishes moratorium on hydraulic fracturing for purpose of natural gas exploration or production until certain conditions are met.
Expands definitions of "abused child" or "abused or neglected child" to include prenatal exposure of child to controlled substances.
Requires municipality which has authorized installation and use of red light cameras to designate one person in prosecutor's office to respond to certain summons issued in error.
Directs all fines imposed by municipalities for violations of red light cameras to Highway Safety Fund.
Grants law enforcement agencies authority to order road closures; increases penalty for violations.
Prohibits double-trailer truck combinations on certain portions of U.S. Route 206 in Mercer and Somerset counties.
Permits board of chosen freeholders to establish "Sharing Resources" grant and loan program to encourage shared services and municipal consolidation.
Concerns unemployment insurance benefits and certain severance payments.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment insurance benefits for crossing guards.
Prohibits possession and sale of shark fins.

Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities and counties to implement municipal consolidation, the sharing of services, and the creation of a joint meeting under certain circumstances.
Allows certain emergency squad volunteers holding municipal elective office to vote on emergency squad concerns.

Specifies conditions under which State, county, municipality, independent authority, school district, or higher education institution can grant unpaid or paid leave of absence to public employee to perform work for labor organization.
Establishes offense of advertising commercial sexual abuse of minor.
Allows exclusion of certain alternative energy and energy conservation patent income under gross income tax and corporation business tax.
Directs removal or enhancement of electric public utility infrastructure located in flood hazard area.
Affords immunity to private colleges and their police officers in certain cases.
Clarifies that electronic funds transfers are included within the scope of the statute concerning issuing or passing bad checks.
Permits municipalities to enter into shared service agreement for tax assessment.

Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for a public servant, during a state of emergency, to use or make disposition of a public resource in an unauthorized manner with purpose to obtain a benefit for himself or another.
Revises procedure for transfer of terminated employees of closed local health agency to superseding local health agency.
Requires reauthorization of payroll deduction for contributions to political committees.
Requires employers provide itemized statement of certain payroll deductions for political contributions.
Concerns certain severance payments and unemployment insurance benefits.
Requires explanatory statement of employee contributions to political committees.
Directs public utilities and pipeline operators to reimburse municipalities for certain emergency services.
Clarifies that electronic funds transfers are included within the scope of the civil statute concerning issuing bad checks.

Provides for disclosure of person's medical records related to AIDS or HIV infection for investigations or prosecutions of crime of diseased person committing act of sexual penetration; makes crime ineligible for expungment.
Establishes certain warrant requirements for law enforcement agencies that utilize drones.
Creates new $100 assessment for convictions of certain sexual offenses to fund counseling for victims and their families; establishes Sexual Offender Victim Counseling Fund.
Provides New Jersey certification as a school administrator or principal to any applicant with similar certification in another State.
Allocates at least $100 million from Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund for coastal and inland Blue Acres land acquisition projects in flood-prone areas.
Denies custody and visitation rights to minor child by family members of individuals convicted of certain crimes.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program beginning in tax year 2002.
"Homestead School Property Tax Reimbursement Act"; provides State reimbursement for 50% of school property taxes paid by seniors, 65 years and older.
Allows adopted person access to his original birth certificate and other related information; appropriates $90,000.
Concerns telemarketing political calls.
Prohibits members of the Legislature from acting on certain bills in which they have personal interest; redefines personal interest.
Eliminates remarriage prohibition for PFRS death benefits; provides retirement allowance to certain survivors of PFRS members.
Increases annual income limits for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Authorizes criminal history record background checks of employees and volunteers of nonprofit domestic violence victim serving organizations.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Provides that PFRS definitions of widow, widower and spouse will include domestic partners of all PFRS members.
Requires members of NJ Legislature to file statement of financial affairs.
Supplemental appropriation of $5 million to DHS to develop community residences for Division of Developmental Disabilities clients on the waiting list.
Provides NJ STARS II Program eligibility to certain students who attained an associate's degree through a joint program offered by a school district and a county college.
Increases penalties for violations committed by provisional driver's license holder.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to the families of NJ troops overseas.
Changes political party affiliation deadline from 50th to 21st day before primary; changes date after which absentee ballots must be available from 40th to 21st day before any election.
Enhances penalty for leaving the scene of a boating accident.
Requires certain veterinarians at for-profit veterinary facilities to provide written notification concerning absence of supervision after normal business hours; designated as "Betsy's Law." *
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."
Includes screening for toxoplasmosis in newborn screening program.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Expands scope of serological testing of certain defendants to include blood-borne diseases.
Changes law regulating size limits of lobsters.
Upgrades penalty for certain aggravated assaults when victim suffers serious bodily injury.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on the dangers of texting while driving as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Transfers responsibility for establishment and enforcement of ethical standards for local officials and school officials to the State Ethics Commission.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to include sales of properties in age-restricted developments by third parties in table of equalized valuations.
Modifies school funding law to incorporate recommendations of DOE's Education Funding Report.
Requires newly-constructed grocery stores to have generators.
Requires electric distribution lines be located underground in areas affected by severe weather or natural disasters.
Requires local governing body and DCA to suspend collection of certificate of occupancy and related inspection fees for homes being rented by persons identified by FEMA as displaced individuals.
Provides certain immunities from spectator-based lawsuits arising from youth sports events.
Prohibits sale, distribution, and use of urea as an ice melt.
Requires labeling of ingredients and restricts phosphorus in household cleansing products.
Requires driver's license to display license holder's blood type.
Increases penalties for committing serious offenses while released on bail.
Requires police notification when driver license is suspended.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.
Recodifies offenses against animals under State criminal code; increases degree of crime for certain offenses.
Establishes offense of soliciting image of minor with unlawful purpose.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Permits use of overseas absentee ballots for all elections.
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on lawn fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Extends eligibility for certain veterans' benefits to members of reserve components of US Armed Forces and NJ organized militia who serve at least 180 continuous days.
Exempts senior citizens and blind or disabled persons from certain realty transfer fees.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from working in ice cream trucks and amusement parks.
Prohibits sale of any dog by kennel, pet shop or other retail establishment without name, address and phone number of person providing dog thereto; establishes $500 fine for each violation.
Directs DHSS to adopt regulations prohibiting overcrowding of animals in kennels, pet shops and other retail establishments; establishes penalties.
Authorizes special parking insignias for passenger automobiles used to transport the developmentally disabled.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for marinas and boatyards that follow certain environmentally sound management practices.
Establishes NJ Animal Abuser Registry.
The "Healthy Puppies and Kittens Assurance Act."

Establishes bribery in official and political matters applies to person soliciting, accepting, or agreeing to accept benefit as consideration to act even though not yet in office or otherwise qualified to act.
Permits consolidation of all fire districts in a municipality; sets forth procedure for consolidation.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain tolls paid via E-ZPass.
Designates portion of State Highway Route 37 as "Denis Miranda Memorial Highway."
Establishes mandatory penalties for committing burglary and theft during a state of emergency.
Directs BPU to study whether State's electric distribution system meets certain standards.
Prohibits public utility from filing rate increase petition under certain circumstances.
Increases criminal penalties if leaving loaded firearm within easy access of minor results in injury or death.
Requires mortgage lenders to maintain vacant, age-restricted dwelling units during foreclosure.
Requires prescribers and pharmacists to check prescription monitoring program prior to prescribing and dispensing Schedule II drugs.
Establishes Nursing Student Support Program.
Requires health benefits coverage for orthotic and prosthetic appliances and provides reimbursement therefor.
Requires youth baseball league coaches to comply with pitch count standards to minimize injury to youth baseball pitchers.
Creates Construction Trades Licensing Board for licensing and regulation of several construction professions; creates new division for homeowner protection in Department of Law and Public Safety.
Imposes a four percent gross revenues tax on providers of direct-to-home satellite services.
Requires registration of certain additional securities investment advisers.
Prohibits retail sales establishment from storing certain magnetic-stripe data; requires reimbursement for costs incurred by financial institution due to breach of security.
Requires ATM facilities to be equipped with access to emergency telephone service.
Permits landscape irrigation contractors to install backflow prevention devices under certain circumstances.
Revises law concerning alarm business licensees.
"Appraisal Management Company Registration Act."
Permits sale of home-baked goods under certain circumstances.
Increases income eligibility limits for PAAD program and Senior Gold Prescription Discount Program.
Requires Medicaid program to increase reimbursement for ambulance services provided to Medicaid recipients who are also Medicare eligible to Medicare rate.
Requires health benefits coverage for mammograms for women under 40 who lack access to family medical history due to their or their parent's adoption.
Requires costs of contract for construction be revealed to municipal construction office for construction permit.
Authorizes certain municipalities to establish safety requirements for certain bars and taverns.
Provides certified municipal fire inspectors and fire officials having more than four consecutive years service with tenure in office.
The "Owners' Rights and Obligations in Shared Ownership Communities Act."
Requires ATM operators to disclose balance inquiry fees.
Revises law concerning ticket sales.
Requires certain civil actions against certain licensed persons to be brought within two years.
Requires employers to pay their employees when serving on a jury.
Creates the "Meadowlands Responsible Development Program."
Creates cause of action for failure to maintain certain vacant properties; requires out-of-state creditors to designate in-State representative.
Permits adoptees and certain others access to adoptee's original birth certificate and other related information.
Permits adoptees and certain others to obtain adoptee's original birth certificate and other related information.
Eliminates the board of trustees of Rutgers University and provides that its powers will be exercised by the board of governors of the university.
Permits certain officials to possess pepper spray in quantity carried by law enforcement officers.
Regulates the operation of certain autobuses.
Requires that all emergency departments have necessary pediatric equipment available.
Requires public schools which have automated external defibrillators to adopt policies concerning usage.
Authorizes board of education to pay stipend to superintendent for performance of additional duties.
Revises property assessment calendar.
Imposes civil penalty for income falsification for Federal Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program and state and federal housing assistance program benefits.
Provides preference in certain State contracting to businesses that do not employ individuals with H-1B visas.
Eliminates dual governmental pay to members of Legislature for legislative duties.
Alexandra's Law; prohibits operation of motor vehicle with detectable amount of CDS in blood.
Prohibits the employment of unauthorized aliens and requires employers to use E-Verify program.

Extends "Right to Farm" protection to certain agricultural tourism acttivities and events; requires adoption of agricultural management practices therefor; permits special occasion events that promote agricultural tourism conducted at wineries under certain circumstances.*
Authorizes account wagering licensee to accept wagers from residents of eligible United States jurisdictions through account wagering system via electronic means such as internet.
Prohibits use of volunteer driving activities in underwriting for private passenger automobile insurance; revises charitable immunity statute as applied to volunteer drivers.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.

Provides State transportation aid incentive to support shared services agreements between municipalities and districts with efficient transportation systems for the provision of public school hazardous busing.

Allows permitholder that leases Meadowlands Racetrack from New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority to conduct wagering on simulcast horse races at sports, retail, and entertainment development at Meadowlands Complex, subject to agreement and approvals.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement, in consultation with New Jersey Racing Commission, to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks.
Increases from 3.2% to 5% percentage of certain dedicated purse moneys used for horsemen aid programs and the association from Standardbred racing at private racetracks.
Allows State residents who are outside of New Jersey to place wagers on horse races using account wagering system.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amounts under New Jersey estate tax in accordance with provisions of federal tax law.

Allows monies statutorily dedicated to standardbred or thoroughbred horse racing purses to be used for benefit of horse racing industry, subject to agreement between permitholder and representative horsemen's organization.
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Permits municipalities to dedicate revenues from storage of motor vehicles for maintenance, surveillance, construction expenses, and salaries related to municipal impound lots.
Permits counties and municipalities to use snow removal reserve funds for clearance of debris following declaration of emergency by President or Governor.
Authorizes the establishment of federal impact aid reserve account.
Limits payment to any public officer or employee terminated prior to expiration of individual contract of employment.
Authorizes New Jersey Racing Commission to grant special horse racing permit for steeplechase races; allows wagering on such races.
Provides for Medicaid coverage and reimbursement for mental health services provided through telepsychiatry.
Permits persons at racetracks, off-track wagering facilities, and casino simulcasting facilities to place instant racing wagers.
Establishes trunk fighting as animal cruelty offense and crime of the third degree.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to provide assistive technology to elementary and middle school students with dyslexia.
Provides for shops offering a combination of skin care specialty services and manicuring services.
Extends Right to Farm Act protections to commercial beekeepers, with some restrictions.
Establishes exclusive State regulatory authority over apiary activities and allows for delegation of monitoring and enforcement authority to municipalities.
Establishes penalty for destruction of man-made native bee hive.
Requires any State entity administering State or federal public benefit programs to verify recipient's personal information against death records to prevent payment to deceased individual.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks; dedicates revenues derived therefrom as State aid for education.
Upgrades penalties for crimes committed with aid of firearms locator application.
Clarifies manner of public disclosure of findings or information about child abuse or neglect cases resulting in child fatalities or near fatalities.
Clarifies sales tax collection responsibilities of horse boarding businesses in New Jersey.
Allows school district to teach about traditional winter celebrations, display holiday symbols on school property, and include musical selections with religious themes.
Requiring municipal auditors to test whether tax exempt properties remain eligible for exemption.
Clarifies "knockout game" assault as third-degree aggravated assault; provides mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for such assault.
Establishes certain requirements for a State entity planting vegetation in certain circumstances; provides for NJ businesses providing such vegetation.**
Authorizes New Jersey Racing Commission to grant special permit for steeplechase racing; allows wagering on such races; allows local governing body to object to issuance of special permit.
Prohibits telecommunications, utility or cable television companies from charging certain customers prior to actual billing due date.
Increases rate of tax imposed on little cigars under tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax to equal tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax.
Requires State toll road authorities to give preference in awarding service station contracts to bidders offering to dispense certain alternative fuels on State's toll roads.
Requires counseling for certain domestic violence offenders.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in port district of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.
Creates the option to make a voluntary contribution for the support of local libraries on gross income tax returns.
Allows person with allergy to drugs or medications to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.*
Establishes a loan redemption program for teachers employed in chronically failing schools.
Concerns wage protection and certain penalties for violating laws regarding wages, compensation or benefits.
Increases benefit amounts and income eligibility limits for the Work First New Jersey program.
Permits attending advanced practice nurse to determine cause of death and execute death certification of patient if nurse is patient's primary caregiver.
Establishes mutual aid assistance request protocols for 9-1-1 ambulance dispatchers.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.
Provides certain reemployment rights to teachers dismissed due to a reduction in force.
Prohibits Governor from using State helicopter for personal and political events; requires quarterly reports to the Legislature.
Provides gross income tax credit for interest paid on certain student loans.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain security-related goods and services.
Directs MVC to establish driver's license endorsement for autonomous vehicles.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support United Way of New Jersey.
Requires Internet service providers to retain data for law enforcement purposes.
Revises penalties imposed on businesses for failure to report security breach of computer system.
Establishes Cyber Security Bureau within the Office of Homeland Security and Preparedness.
Provides for SHBP New Jersey State Employee Wellness Program with financial incentives for participation in program.
Extends statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands the categories of potentially liable defendants; and revives certain actions.
The "New Jersey Consumer Catastrophe Preparedness and Protection Act"; creates "New Jersey Catastrophe Fund."
Creates offense of impairing communications, which would constitute domestic violence in certain circumstances.
Creates crime of cyber-harassment.
Creates Task Force on Distracted Driving.
Permits Office of Emergency Management to order reduction in reservoir levels prior to weather emergency; requires DEP to adopt regulations concerning reservoir levels.
Establishes pilot program within Office of Emergency Management to provide zero-interest loans to certain gas stations that install appropriate wiring for generators.
Establishes special license plates supporting American Red Cross.
Requires removal of equipment and markings on certain used emergency vehicles; requires that Attorney General issue guidelines or directives.
Requires that certain health care facilities be generator ready; allows health care facilities to qualify for NJEDA loans for cost of generators.

Excludes certain out-of-State businesses and employees from certain taxes, fees, and business registration requirements when temporarily performing in-State work or services during declared disaster or emergency.
Requires prevailing wage be paid to certain workers.
Concerns transfer of PANYNJ contracts related to marine terminals.
Requires retail store operators to establish in-store recycling programs that provide opportunities for customers to return clean plastic carryout bags.
Requires retailers to provide consumers with information on origin of raw produce.
"Thomas P. Canzanella Twenty First Century First Responders Protection Act"; concerns workers' compensation for public safety workers.
Requires boil water notices to be provided by certain public water systems via telephone, email or text message.
Revises penalties for a school bus driver who leaves a pupil on a school bus at the end of his route.
Establishes pilot program to utilize value-based benefit design in SHBP to increase health benefits coverage for certain employees concerning chronic health conditions.
Limits fees charged in connection with certain prepaid debit accounts; requires access to certain account information.
Provides PFRS member in federal or State military service who is injured or killed with disability or death benefits.
Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
Revises penalties for drunk driving offenses and creates restricted use driver's license.
Requires DOH to provide information about crib safety on its Internet website.*
Creates permissive inference of credit card theft in certain cases and requires restitution in certain cases.
Prohibits certain violations of terms of service for Internet ticket sales.
Regulates certain practices of pharmacy benefits management companies.
Requires labeling of foods containing genetically engineered material.*
Allows New Jersey gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions for Hurricane Sandy relief in New Jersey.
Requires State pay postage for voted ballots returned by mail; makes an appropriation.
Provides homestead owners gross income tax deduction for certain water supply and sewerage charges.
Permits two or more candidates for school board member to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot for same term.
"Consumer Protection Act of 2012."
Prohibits service and sale in schools of food and beverage items labeled as not intended or recommended for children.
Concerns disclosure and reimbursement procedures of board of education and municipal employee health care benefit contracts.
"Carryout Bag Reduction and Recycling Act."

Revises penalty provisions for certain drunk driving violations, including use of and applicable time periods covering driver's license suspensions and installations of ignition interlock devices on motor vehicles.*
Provides red light camera fines are shared with county only when violation occurs on county road.
Prohibits mortgage loan discrimination based on familial status.
Prohibits public boardwalk construction using uncertified rainforest wood.
Prohibits PANYNJ from imposing cargo facility charge in certain instances.
Prohibits use or sale of neonicotinoid pesticides.

Permits qualifying patients to possess and use medical marijuana legally obtained from another jurisdiction; extends State medical marijuana laws to qualifying out-of-State patients; expands ability of parents to serve as primary caregiver to minor children.
Exempts traffic summons records from public access under State's open public records law.
Assigns financial responsibility of educating homeless student to district of attendance.
Establishes special parking for hybrid, electric, and alternative fuel vehicles.
Concerns exclusion of individuals with certain employment history in advertisements for job vacancies.
Establishes "Victim-Witness Scholarship Fund;" establishes "Witness Protection Fund;" and concerns State forfeiture funds.
Creates advisory council to oversee revision of core curriculum content standards.
Establishes a Gun Court Pilot Program in Passaic County.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Designated the Equitable Disclosure Act of 2010, modifies provisions of MLUL concerning objectors to applications for development.
Grants credit against business taxes to developer of rental housing reserved for occupancy by veterans.
Creates crime of victimization of persons with disabilities and senior citizens.
Allows a gross income tax deduction for certain higher education tuition and fee expenses.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.
Concerns repayment of unemployment compensation overpayments.
Concerns outreach and training for minorities and women in the construction industry.
Makes certain veterans eligible for certificates of registration under Security Officer Registration Act.
Requires notice of cancellation or nonrenewal of automobile and homeowners insurance policies to be sent by certified mail, return receipt requested.
Requires local recreation departments, youth serving organizations, and camps to have defibrillators for youth athletic events.*
"State Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights."
Permits exterior-based property reassessments within eight years of last municipal-wide revaluation.
Clarifies procedures for restoration of driver's license after suspension; authorizes the court to waive imprisonment under certain circumstances.
Enacts the "Reader Privacy Act."
Authorizes creation of special Omega Psi Phi license plate.
Permits payment of only one co-payment or deductible for follow-up care or treatment after surgery or illness under certain health benefits plans.
Changes types of development requiring CAFRA permit from DEP.
Addresses various concerns affecting post-release employment.
Limits the amount of aid-in-lieu-of transportation provided to certain families of nonpublic students.
Provides that child study team members may be employees of the school district or of a DOE approved agency or clinic.
Requires blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death; designated as "Michelle Sous' Law."

Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research institutions; allows certain technology businesses located in certain innovation zones to receive certain tax credits under Grow New Jersey Assistance Program.*
Provides for submission to voters in each county a binding referendum on the establishment of a county administrative school district to govern and operate all public schools in the county.
Establishes governance structure for county administrative school districts.

Requires electric, gas, and water public utilities to provide bill credits to volunteer fire companies, first aid, rescue, and emergency squads, and nonprofit homeless and domestic violence assistance organizations.
Expands State's energy efficiency and renewable energy requirements.
Establishes alternative distributed energy generating requirement; provides financial incentives for certain alternative distributed energy generating facilities.
Establishes temperature control guidelines and standards for school facilities.
Requires BPU to establish uniform Statewide reliability standards for electric and gas public utilities.*

"Save New Jersey Electric and Gas Public Utility Customer Service and Call Center Jobs Act"; requires notification by electric and gas utilities when relocating customer and call centers out of State.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for capital gains from sale of certain employer securities.
Amends Offshore Wind Economic Development Act concerning offshore wind energy facilities and wind energy zones.
Classifies energy derived from hydrothermal decomposition as Class I renewable energy.
"Government Energy Reliability and Savings Public-Private Partnership Act."
Allows use of master meter system in residential dwellings under certain conditions.
Requires MVC to publish driver's manual on website in certain languages.
Allows law enforcement agencies to utilize electronic signatures on police reports; requires Attorney General to adopt uniform guidelines.
Enhances retail competition in electric power and gas supply industries.
Creates Office of Clean Energy.
Prohibits notaries public from falsely representing themselves as attorneys in advertisments.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from using social networking websites and requires certain identifying information.
"Higher Education Citizenship Equality Act;" defines domicile for dependent students for the purpose of eligibility for State student loans, grants, or scholarships and resident tuition rate.
Prohibits notaries public from falsely representing themselves as attorneys in advertisements.
Extends validity of certain retired law enforcement officers handgun carry permits from one to two years.
Expands NJ Meadowlands Commission responsibilities to include flood control activities.
Requires school districts to adopt policies concerning electronic communications between employees and students.
Establishes Meadowlands Flood Advisory Task Force.
Requires State Board of Education regulations regarding school nurse certification to include certain minimum eligibility requirements.
Requires school bus transporting students using wheelchairs to be equipped with four-point securement system; requires school bus operator to secure students using wheelchairs.
Prohibits sale of prepaid and wireless telephone service and equipment unless certain buyer information is recorded.
Allows processing of wild striped bass caught out of State for sale out of State.
Allows sale of wild striped bass caught outside of NJ.
Authorizes Attorney General to coordinate Statewide law enforcement efforts against opioid drug abuse.*
Increases age for helmet requirement for bicycling, roller skating, and skateboarding to 17 and younger; extends helmet requirement to ice skaters and operators of non-motorized scooters.*
Requires insurance coverage for magnetic resonance imaging for women at high risk for breast cancer.
Increases from $15,000 to $25,000 annual compensation PERS retiree may earn in PERS-covered employment without reenrollment.
Adds two employees to the boards of trustees of the State colleges and the county colleges.
Adds two student representatives to board of governors of Rutgers University.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Requires physicians and other prescribers to obtain informed consent from parents or guardians of minors for certain medications with "black box warnings."
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for certain infant formulas.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.
Requires State Treasurer to follow usual procurement process prior to entering into cooperative purchasing agreements.
Requires health insurance carriers to use standard explanation of benefits form.
Provides for compensation of teachers on appropriate salary guide and schedule after withholding of an increment.
Requires binding arbitration for certain matters relating to dismissals or reductions in salary of tenured persons employed in a teaching capacity at a county college.
Provides for the removal of a State Board of Education member for failure to attend three consecutive board meetings without good cause.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services.
Excludes from PAAD income eligibility withdrawals from an IRA.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation for public adjusters.
Permits municipality to pay tax refund in equal installments over period of three years.
Abigail's Law; requires that newly-manufactured school buses be equipped with sensors.
Requires taxpayer to provide certificate of merit setting forth estimated true value of certain property which is subject to county tax appeal.
Authorizes mechanism for independent determination of legal sufficiency of initiated ordinances and referendum petitions.
Establishes certain consumer protections related to arbitration organizations.
Establishes the number of students to be supported under the veterinary medicine education program and a service requirement for students who participate in the program.

Provides that settlement agents are not responsible for transmitting estimated gross income tax payment and forms for certain nonresident real estate transactions unless so responsible pursuant to contract.
Reduces maximum rate of interest to be charged for delinquent taxes from 18% to 12%.
Requires coin redemption machine operators to disclose fees.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax.

Permits school districts to provide transportation to nonpublic school pupils and charge parents when the per pupil amount of the route exceeds the maximum nonpublic school transportation costs per pupil.
