Eliminates requirement that notice of elections list polling place locations; requires notice include Division of Elections Internet site providing polling place locations.
Allows for waiver of school bus requirements for mobility assistance vehicle technicians who transport students with medical needs to and from school.
Permits a board of education to adopt a salary policy in excess of three years and requires the payment of increments pursuant to an expired policy in certain circumstances.
Requires DOE to review Core Curriculum Content Standards to ensure they incorporate standards regarding engineering where appropriate.*
Imposes certain restrictions on sale of products containing dextromethorphan.
Requires certain community residential facilities have standby emergency power generators.
Permits alternate members of county planning boards to vote in place of any absent public member.
Authorizes use of emergency reserve fund or proceeds from bonds issued by EDA to finance school security improvements.
Requires annual physical examination of child 19 years of age or younger include certain questions related to cardiac health.*
Prohibits use of anti-concurrent causation clauses in homeowners insurance policies.
Provides that President of Municipal Clerks' Association of New Jersey and one additional public member serve as members of Government Records Council.
Provides that nonpublic school nursing services may include nursing services for a preschool pupil in the event of an emergency.
Establishes the "New Jersey Family Collaborative Law Act." *
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses paying a salary differential to National Guard members or reservists on active duty.
Removes decal requirement from graduated driver's license law; establishes new system for law enforcement to identify novice drivers.
Provides grants to eligible businesses equal to 5% of annual base salary of new employees hired under employment grant component of Invest in New Jersey Business Grant Program.
Provides tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain costs incurred in purchase and installation of certain environmentally responsible business equipment.
Allows corporation business tax credits as incentives for redevelopment of distressed shopping centers.
Eliminates DOT approval of municipal traffic calming measures in business districts.
Requires municipal agency under MLUL to notify prospective applicant of potential need for additional governmental approvals.
Establishes special license plates for honorably discharged veterans.
Establishes reward program in DOE for districts with high academic performance and low per pupil expenditures.
Permits municipalities to use up to 15% of affordable housing trust fund monies to provide financial assistance grants to owners of real property that sustained certain weather-related damage.
Requires State Building Authority to make certain payments in lieu of taxes for public safety facilities to municipalities; makes appropriation.
Provides general election, primary, and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
Provides that probationary license holder may transport siblings in addition to dependents and one additional passenger.
Increases State appropriations to Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund by $387 million to restore municipal aid reductions from Fiscal Years 2009, 2010, and 2011.
Establishes procedures for nomination and election of members of New Jersey Hall of Fame; directs principal location of hall to be in or adjacent to New Jersey State Museum.
Eliminates exception to public advertising and bidding requirements for certain public contracts involving insurance coverage and consulting services.
Changes signature requirement for recall petition.
Changes date when a recall election may be initiated from 50th to 90th day preceding completion of first year of term of office.
Subjects certain municipal and school property to property taxation.
Limits contributions to legal defense fund of candidate for or holder of elective public office; requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Modifies tax levy apportionment methodology in certain school districts; restricts authority for certain municipalities to enter long-term tax exemption agreements.
Requires school business administrator to annually report to board of education on district contracts.*
Eliminates State aid growth limit for school districts in which individuals age 65 and over comprise at least 33.3 percent of the population.
Requires retirement subdivision and retirement community to install electrical generator to provide electricity to common use area to be used as shelter in case of emergency.
Provides sales and use tax rebate for certain purchases made by, or on behalf of, individuals and small businesses affected by natural disasters.
Clarifies that members of volunteer first aid squads that bill third parties do not lose right to use emergency warning lights.
Revises definition of volunteer first aid, rescue, and ambulance squad under New Jersey Highway Traffic Safety Act of 1987.
Excludes certain increases in school security expenditures from tax levy and appropriation cap, as applicable, for municipalities and counties.
Excludes certain increases in school security expenditures from the tax levy cap applicable to school districts.
Permits State employment on temporary basis of workers with certain skills to perform routine maintenance in State facilities.
Regulates toll collection transponders in rental vehicles.
Establishes liability for harm caused by defective trees.
Requires hiring preference for veterans seeking position with State Police.
Requires cell phone warranties to last throughout initial service contract.
Revises sales and use tax treatment of garbage removal services.
Directs the Division of Taxation to produce instructional materials on the appropriate gross income tax treatment of certain deferred compensation plans.
Concerns installation and maintenance of solar panels in common interest communities.
Exempts military personnel receiving combat zone pay from the gross income tax.
Eliminates statute of limitations in civil cases involving certain sexual offenses.
Requires AG to defend challenges to certain municipal ordinances that establish residency requirements for convicted sex offenders.
Establishes penalties for manufacture, purchase or possession of certain keys.
Upgrades lewdness to fourth degree crime if committed in public rest room.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Establishes training wage.
Requires criminal history record background checks on certain volunteer sports personnel.
Clarifies powers of public safety directors.
Exempts certain volunteer emergency service organizations from charitable contribution filing fees.
Provides that person who impersonates law enforcement officer and commits crime is guilty of third degree crime.
Requires all new State buildings to have solar or geothermal energy systems, where feasible.
Prohibits public school fund-raising activities which include unsupervised door-to-door sales by students.
Requires disclosure of all campaign contributions received and expenditures made by school board candidates.
Allows planning and zoning board members to satisfy training requirements on Internet.
Permits municipalities to charge a fee to cover ancillary costs of traffic control; limits fee.
Designates portion of New Jersey Route No. 34 in Wall Township as the "Duncan Thecker Memorial Highway."
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Criminalizes participation in criminal street gang.
Provides for conscientious exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Provides that videotaping of aggravated assault is a third degree crime.
Establishes a "Blue Alert System."
Reduces amount of fire duty required in order to receive exempt fireman certificate.
Concerns interest rate chargeable by licensed pawnbrokers on certain transactions.

Permits municipality to use proceeds of beach access fees for areas near beach facilities that are significantly affected by beach tourism; requires municipality to provide explanation of expenditures on website.
Requires electric public utilities to file with BPU and implement distribution infrastructure protection plans; prohibits rate increase pending implementation of plans.
Requires DOBI to provide notification of suspension or revocation of license or registration of third party administrators.
Increases threshold value of surplus State-owned real property and easements above which legislative review and approval is required before sale.
Requires health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for diagnosis, evaluation and treatment of lymphedema.
Protects home addresses of law enforcement officers from being released by governmental entities.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $2,200,000 to Maritime Industry Fund in Office of Maritime Resources in DOT.
Revises "Contractors' Registration Act" to include water remediation services.
Establishes fourth degree crime of possessing firearms locator application; enhances penalty if such application is used in the theft of firearm.
Makes revisions to the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Increases threshold amount at which MLUL escrow deposits must be deposited in interest bearing accounts.
Requires genetic testing to determine paternity in non-dissolution cases.
Requires in public schools instruction on the contributions of United States veterans and the observance of patriotic exercises on certain holidays.
Directs State acquisition of Troy Meadows Natural Area, Morris County, for recreation and conservation purposes and designates it as natural area and wildlife sanctuary.
Establishes New Jersey Transportation Heritage Center and authorizes establishment of Foundation for the New Jersey Transportation Heritage Center.
Requires State Office of Emergency Management to study and recommend evacuation routes in Trenton for inclement weather conditions or other emergency situations.
Requires electric utility bills to separately list the amount of State sales tax, societal benefits charge and transitional energy facility unit rate assessment surcharge.
Provides that certain permits and approvals for critical infrastructure projects must be acted upon within 45 days.

Permits board of chosen freeholders to change title to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner"; requires county that changes terms to update website.
Authorizes development of public-private transportation demonstration projects.
Adds child molestation and endangerment to crimes that subject public school employee offender to pension and retirement benefit forfeiture.

Provides school district tax levy cap adjustment for certain special education costs; limits sending district per pupil tuition increase to 2%; and provides increased representation on receiving board of education for certain sending districts.
"New Jersey Residents' Power Protection Act"; requires use of emergency power generators by various facilities and businesses; provides related tax incentives.
Provides gross income tax deduction for costs of purchasing and installing battery backups for certain home solar electrical generators.
Requires screening of certain high-risk pregnancies and reporting of fetal deaths.
"Transparency in Government Legal Billing Act;" requires that bill for legal services rendered for public entity contain certain information as condition of payment.
Requires certain energy drinks to be labeled with warning for young consumers.
Requires each school district to offer a summer payment plan for school district employees.
Makes it unlawful for a private citizen to record a communication unless all parties to the communication have previously consented.
Prohibits employees of revaluation firms from employment by companies that may appeal assessed value of real property following municipal-wide revaluation.
Establishes Park Prescription Program authorizing medical practitioners to prescribe free State park access passes to patients with obesity-related conditions.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for pediatric cancer research.
Prohibits possession of ammunition capable of penetrating body armor.
Establishes Distressed Cemetery Maintenance and Preservation Fund.
Increases minimum wage.
Provides enhanced penalties for certain crimes when victim is 65 years of age or older, or disabled.
Requires ATM independent sales organizations to provide certain withdrawal options.
Requires criminal history record check of school district volunteers.
Requires motorists operating vehicles to maintain reasonable and safe distance when overtaking pedestrians and certain bicycles.*
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Creates self-defense justification for victims of domestic violence.
Amends law concerning application, sale, and use of fertilizer to exempt organic fertilizer from certain requirements.
Concerns regulation of solid waste, hazardous waste, and recycling industries.
Concerns combined sewer overflows; establishes Combined Sewer Overflow Solutions Fund; exempts improvements thereto from 2% property tax cap; and appropriates $5 million.*
Authorizes creation of stormwater utilities for certain local government entities.
The "Green Building and Infrastructure Tax Credit Act"; provides tax credits for certain green buildings and wood utility poles.

Requires owner or operator of industrial establishment applying for de minimis exemption from "Industrial Site Recovery Act" to certify as to no actual knowledge of contamination exceeding remediation standards.
"Comprehensive Regulated Grease Recycling Act." *
Provides certain exemptions from sales and use tax for hybrid electric vehicles, compressed natural gas vehicles, and equipment used for refueling or recharging certain vehicles.
Requires DEP to update Shore Protection Master Plan.

Clarifies that certain types of sewage and sewage sludge expelled from a public sewer system or public sewage treatment plant are not hazardous substances for purposes of "Spill Compensation and Control Act."
Requires use of constitutionally dedicated moneys to fund conversion of certain diesel vehicles to compressed natural gas, liquefied petroleum gas, or electric vehicles.
Increases penalties for careless driving when violation results in injury or death to pedestrian.
The "Preserve New Jersey Act of 2013"; implements constitutional dedication of sales tax revenue for open space, including flood prone areas, farmland, and historic preservation purposes.
Imposes water consumption and diversion user fees to fund open space and farmland preservation projects.
Concerns environmental permits in burdened communities.
Requires consideration of increased property value due to dune construction in determining compensation provided for condemned beachfront property.

Permits fifth and sixth class counties to assume control and responsibility for operation and maintenance of beaches bordering Atlantic Ocean unless control and responsibility are reserved by a municipality.
Repeals law providing CAFRA permit exemption for certain grading or excavation of a dune.

Provides exemption for commercial and institutional solid waste generators from source separation requirements of municipal recycling ordinances if recyclable materials are otherwise recycled pursuant to certain conditions and requirements.
The "Emergency Disaster Relief Act of 2013"; appropriates $100 million.
Requires drivers to move over or slow down when approaching a bicyclist or pedestrian.
Establishes "Environmental Justice Advisory Council."
Requires PANYNJ to conduct noise and land use compatibility survey.
Requires paint producers to implement or participate in paint stewardship program.*
The "Green Acres, Water Supply and Floodplain Protection, and Farmland and Historic Preservation Bond Act of 2014," authorizes bonds for $200 million; appropriates $5,000.
Requires use of direct deposit and Internet for State, local government, and school district employee compensation and certain retirement payments and information.
Permits counties to charge a fee to fund infrastructure through voter approval.
Requires disclosure of original purchase price for land to be sold to a county, county agriculture development board, or municipality for farmland preservation purposes.
Establishes the "Corrupt Gains Restitution Act."
Reduces number of paid holidays from 13 to 10 for all State and local government employees.
Requires investigating law enforcement officer to contact next of kin of unconscious motor vehicle accident victim who has been transported to hospital emergency room.
Prohibits public employers from reimbursing tuition or awarding promotions or compensation based on degrees or certifications obtained from unaccredited institutions.
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
Amends the "Public Corruption Profiteering Penalty Act."
Concerns unemployment benefits and work stoppages.
Excludes certain contributions to deferred compensation plans and provides deduction for certain individual retirement savings under the gross income tax.
Prohibits payment of temporary disability benefits to incarcerated individuals.

Requires certain political subdivisions to grant employees only those holidays granted to State employees and standardizes amount of paid vacation and sick leave granted to employees of certain political subdivisions.
Prohibits certain political subdivisions from awarding longevity-based benefits to their employees.
Prohibits annual bonuses for perfect attendance and the non-use of sick leave.
Prohibits terminal leave compensation for local government employees.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies with ties to terrorists.
Prohibits member of Legislature from seeking certain grants or loans through annual appropriations act or legislatively-controlled program.
Requires COAH to subtract affordable units from municipality's fair share affordable housing obligation to reflect job loss upon closure of federal military installation.
Requires posting on State and local government websites information concerning assignment and use of vehicles.
Repeals statutory requirement of annual or biennial dog census.
Imposes mandatory forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
Creates pilot program to allow wagering on horse races by means of certain patron-operated terminals.
Eliminates transfer inheritance taxes on brothers and sisters of a decedent.
Caps attorney fee awards in actions against public entities.
Upgrades penalties for certain criminal offenses committed against elderly and disabled persons.
Allows gross income tax deduction for expenses associated with enrollment in nonpublic schools.
Provides for regulation of modeling and talent marketing companies.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain moving expenses for taxpayer moving to New Jersey to commence work in State.
Permits certain municipalities to issue additional plenary retail consumption licenses.

Requires tenure charges be filed against any public school employee found to have bullied a student and requires the employment of any nontenured public school employee be terminated for such activity.
Requires bars, restaurants, and liquor stores to post penalties for DWI.
Requires explanatory statement on ballot question for school district capital projects to include certain information.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain employer-provided child care expenditures.
Enacts the "NJ Family First Employer Act"; establishes award for certain employers.
Requires BPU to conduct biennial rate cases for public utilities; increases penalties for public utilities failing to comply with BPU orders.
Creates exemption from certain MVC fees for prisoners of war.
Prohibits sex offenders from holding any job, position, or type of employment that primarily consists of contact with children.
"Permit Transparency Act"; requires State entity to post on official website number of permits applied for and issued, revenue derived, number of employees involved, and salary of such employees.
Includes e-mail addresses in list of confidential items to be redacted from public records under OPRA
Requires restaurants to post notice about food allergy and anaphylaxis and provide food allergy information to customers.
Establishes special license plates to bring awareness to breast cancer.
Revises statutes regarding practice of physical therapy.
Clarifies certain factors concerning modification and termination of alimony; eliminates the term "permanent alimony" from the statutes.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situtations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply; repeals section 2 of P.L.1999, c.47.
Requires board of education to unseal and announce contents of bids for certain subcontracting only at regularly scheduled, public meetings of the board.
Requires the Passaic Valley Sewerage Commissioners maintain minutes of meetings; provides Governor veto over minutes.
Requires SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for prostate cancer.
Increases contribution limit by counties and municipalities to volunteer first aid, ambulance, and rescue squads.
Prohibits false or secret compartments in motor vehicles under certain circumstances.
Requires criminal history background check for certain persons working at schools.
Establishes a permanent Gang Land Security Task Force.
Establishes the "Office of the Gang Member Relocation Coordinator."
Criminalizes purchase or possession of firearms ammunition by persons convicted of certain crimes.
Increases juror compensation.
Directs Department of Corrections to provide employment assistance to inmates prior to release.
Authorizes the court to order the deletion, sealing, labeling, or correction of certain personal information in government records involving certain victims of identity theft.*
Permits immediate expungement of court records where the person is acquitted or discharged or where the charges have been dismissed.
Requires DOC employees who recruit, interview, and hire corrections officers to have gang awareness training.
Prohibits job discrimination on basis of credit history or financial status.
Requires preservation of certain biological evidence.
Permits child whose parent or guardian is ordered into active military service to remain enrolled in school district where child's parent or guardian resided prior to active military service.

Designated Kevin Apuzzio's Law; allows municipalities to provide increased survivor pensions for certain volunteer emergency workers and requires municipalities to provide health and life insurance coverage to volunteer firefighters.

Redirects vehicle surcharge revenues for Autism Medical Research and Treatment Fund to support children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other developmental delays and disabilities enrolled in the Early Childhood Intervention Program.
Provides DYFS caseworkers with personnel and law enforcement assistance when conducting DYFS investigations.
Limits rent increases for certain senior citizens.
Requires youth sports team organizations or cheerleading programs to implement written head injury policies.*
Requires halfway house employees to complete police training course.
Requires halfway houses to permit attorneys and certain representatives of attorneys to visit incarcerated clients.
Transfers probation employees from Judiciary to State Parole Board.
Provides that crime victims do not have to pay fees to obtain records relating to the crime and that requests for such records are not public information.*
Establishes supervised community reintegration program for certain victims of domestic abuse.
Authorizes court to order submission of DNA evidence to national database to determine whether evidence matches a known individual or DNA profile from an unsolved crime.*
Requires written security plan when school is polling place and open to students; provides that schools may be used as polling places only under certain circumstances; makes an appropriation.

Requires school districts to take all steps to ensure adequate security for students when school is open as a polling place and provides that school district costs shall be deducted from the itemized list of expenses submitted by the county board of elections.
Exempts senior homeowners from municipal building permit fees.
Establishes time periods for adverse possession of certain property.*
Requires causes of driver inattention to be noted in traffic accidents.
Exempts experienced firefighters from certification requirement.
Concerns eligible municipalities under the urban transit hub credit.
Permits municipalities to recover certain costs and fees from alcoholic beverage licensees charged with violations.
Limits liability for insurers conducting boiler insurance inspections.
Allows homestead property tax reimbursement program participants who lose income eligibility due to an IRA withdraw for certain purposes to maintain base year upon requalification.
Permits municipality, fire district or authority to approve transfer of certain firefighters from PERS to PFRS.
Establishes certain procedures for awarding design-build contracts.
Requires health insurers to disclose broker commissions to purchasers.
Concerns fair business practices at intermodal marine terminals.
Revises requirement that library tax be assessed against equalized value of property.
Provides for appointment of certain municipal court judges at the local or county level.
Permits retail dealer of motor fuel to sell motor fuel at price below retail dealer's net cost to meet competition.
Allows State agency to pay subcontractor directly for work performed in certain situations.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in certain portfield sites.
Requires fire suppression systems in new single and two family homes.
Expands education requirements for special learner's and examination permits.
Requires information concerning certain public employees be made public.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities and pay costs thereof when necessary for infrastructure projects.
Permits voter registration at polling place on days of municipal, primary, and general elections.
Requires party bidding on, or performing, a State contract to provide employee health care benefits.
The "Family and Private Burial Grounds Preservation Act."
Appropriates $3,279,459 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund to NJ Historic Trust for grant to Proprietary House Association for historic preservation purposes.
Requires owner of autocab to provide proof of financial responsibility.
Requires Legislative approval of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey minutes.
Requires DOT Commissioner to develop public awareness programs and use variable message signs to inform motorists about State's "move over" law.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities when necessary for transportation infrastructure projects at direction of DOT.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell as surplus certain land and improvements now part of East Jersey Prison to Woodbridge Township in Middlesex County for a restricted use.
Authorizes special Ancient Order of Hibernians license plate.
"New Jersey Disaster Victims' Bill of Rights"; authorizes $500 million emergency State bonds and appropriates money for municipal property tax relief program.
Requires Commissioner of Banking and Insurance to develop standard prior authorization form for prescription drug benefits for use by network providers.
Allows gross income taxpayers to use their gross income tax returns to make voluntary contributions to the Rutgers Oral History Archives.
Designates salt water taffy as New Jersey State Candy.
Establishes "Rutgers, The State University Study Commission."
Concerns methods of paying wages.
Encourages development of electric vehicle charging stations in transportation projects.
Provides primary and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
"Blue Acres Floodplain Protection and Home Elevation Bond Act of 2013," authorizes bonds for $100 million, and appropriates $5,000.
Permits toll-free passage on State toll roads for certain buses traveling to casinos.
Establishes energy efficiency standards for battery chargers.
Limits rent increases for certain senior citizens.
Establishes permanent sterile syringe access program; appropriates $95,000.
Amends "Flood Hazard Area Control Act" to require DEP to take certain actions concerning delineations of flood hazard areas and floodplains.*
Permits temporary casino gaming at Meadowlands Complex for 2014 Hambletonian Race.
Directs installation of electric vehicle charging stations at service areas on State's toll roads.*
Requires mandatory imprisonment for child luring and requires certain information about Megan's Law to be provided to sex offenders annually.
Dedicates sales and use tax collections from sales of medical marijuana to the "Medical Marijuana for a Cure Fund" for medical research grants on certain debilitating medical conditions.
Requires employer notification when relocating call center services outside the United States.
Concerns importation and delivery of motor fuel during certain emergencies.
Concerns sale of certain motor fuel during certain emergencies.
Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities to implement a municipal consolidation.
Requires hazard mitigation plan element in municipal master plan; appropriates $95,000.
Establishes the "New Jersey Sunshine in Litigation Act"; requires disclosure of judgements, records, and settlements concerning public hazards.
Requires BPU to provide grants for cost of purchase and installation of certain electric metering equipment for solar electric power generation systems.
Establishes Capture, Control, and Conserve Reward Rebate Program in DEP to encourage property owners to implement certain techniques to conserve water or control stormwater runoff.
Increases flexibility, clarity, and available tools of optional municipal consolidation process.
Extends alternate route police training certification for military personnel for time deployed.
Establishes a limited license for threading within the practice of cosmetology and hairstyling.
Establishes "Collaborative Mental Health Care Pilot Program" in DOH; appropriates $750,000.
Increases penalties for improper prescribing of drugs.

Requires forms for homestead property tax reimbursement, veterans' property tax exemption, veterans' property tax deduction, and senior and disabled property tax deduction to be available in certain languages.
Disqualifies individuals for unemployment benefits due to receipt of certain severance payments.
Allows voter who has received mail-in ballot to vote in person on election day by delivering that ballot to polling place.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain contributions to New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) program.*
Allows New Jersey gross income taxpayers to elect to deduct certain losses from certain investment arrangements discovered to be criminally fraudulent.
Permits developer to qualify for low-interest loan from NJEDA when building a high performance green building.
Permits water supply service and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings to promote water conservation.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
"Plastic Container Recycling Enhancement Act."
"Water Supply Open Space, Farmland and Historic Preservation Trust Fund Act."

Requires installation of operational automatic rain sensor on lawn sprinklers as condition of sale and on lawn sprinklers on commercial, retail or industrial property and in common interest communities within specified timeframes.
The "Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Bars certain officials from elective office and political activity for certain time periods.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $2,700,000 to DCA for Neighborhood Preservation Program.
The "Renewable Energy District Financing Act."
Prohibits good faith allegations of child abuse from being used against the accuser in a child custody proceeding; makes it a disorderly persons offense to file a false allegation of child abuse.
"Ocean County Stormwater Management System Demonstration Act."
Provides $3,000 gross income tax deduction for certain taxpayers providing home care for an elderly relative.
Modifies requirements for local unit to dissolve certain authorities.
Clarifies intent of P.L.2007, c.340 regarding NJ's required participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.

Increase gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 for taxable years 2011 and 2012 and expands gross income tax exclusion for pensions, annuities and other retirement income for certain taxpayers beginning in 2011.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to, or purchases of credits from, federally qualified tuition program.

Requires Governor to make temporary appointment when vacancy occurs in U.S. Senate; requires appointee be member of same political party as person vacating office since beginning of that term; eliminates special election option.
Reestablishes and revises public contract set-aside program.
Requires State to pay expenses associated with nonpartisan municipal elections.
Requires use of uniform silver flags to mark certain pesticide applications.
Increases renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements under "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Creates Highlands Conservation Trust to preserve land in Highlands Region, and authorizes Highlands conservation license plate to raise revenue therefor.
"New Jersey Transit Villages Act."
Clarifies procedures for closing active child protective services cases.
The "Retrofitted Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Establishes forest stewardship program for State-owned lands.
Concerning the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Requires assisted living residences to have standby emergency power generators.
Requires health insurers and State Health Benefits Commission to provide coverage for posttraumatic stress disorder under same conditions as other sickness.
Clarifies that certain types of sewage and sewage sludge do not constitute hazardous substances under "Spill Compensation and Control Act."
Directs BPU to study feasibility of adopting certain requirements for installation of new and replacement electric distribution utility poles and transmission towers.
"Nikhil's Law"; requires MVC to inform and test drivers on dangers of failing to comply with traffic safety laws and "STOP for Nikhil Safety Pledge."
Establishes criteria and requirements for shore protection project priority list and funding from Shore Protection Fund.
"Art Therapist Licensing Act."
Exempts certain persons from licensing requirements of the "New Jersey Residential Mortgage Lending Act."
The "New Jersey Parental Rights and Property Tax Reduction Act."
Designates four State songs.
Allows public contractors paying benefits under collective bargaining agreements to count benefit costs toward compliance with local "living wage" ordinances.
Requires certain State public employees and officers and members of Legislature to file financial disclosure statement with State Ethics Commission or Joint Legislative Committee on Ethics.
Directs NJTA to dedicate toll increase revenue no longer required for payment of Access to the Region's Core Tunnel project to Transportation Trust Fund Account.

Imposes requirements concerning Passaic Valley Sewerage Commissioners budgets and capital plan; requires commissioners' meetings and public hearings be made available to public; requires commissioners make certain information available on website.
Makes changes to manner in which State-administered retirement systems operate and to public employee pension benefits.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations.

Increases PFRS employee contribution rate; requires new members to be age 50 for special retirement; creates cap on PFRS retiree COLA; restructures PFRS board of trustees and gives it control over fund investments.
Limits when bidders can be required to submit a financial statement in order to bid on a local public contract or county college contract.
Develops evaluation procedure for classroom teachers and requires establishment of lead teacher endorsement.
Prohibits school district from denying student school breakfast or school lunch because payment is in arrears without prior notice to parent.
Prohibits imposition of parking fees in Meadowlands Sports Complex.
Requires reimbursement to State for costs related to provision of New Jersey State Police at certain Meadowlands Sports Complex events.
Removes certain requirements for professional engineers to take examination to operate water supply and wastewater treatment systems.
Requires background check for private gun sales.
Provides for life imprisonment without parole for killing an emergency responder.
Prohibits use of wearable computer with head mounted display while driving.
Permits municipalities to establish weapons free zones around schools and public facilities.
Authorizes payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt institution of higher education property if 25 percent of property of municipality is tax exempt and 12.5 percent is institution's property.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to18 years old; increases fine on parent of truant student; and requires truant student to complete community service requirement.
Establishes a pilot program in DOE to increase the length of the school day and school year and provides tax credits for corporate contributions to fund the program.
Allows private passenger automobile usage information as rating factor in insurance underwriting.
Requires corporations qualifying for certain State development subsidy grants to repay entire grant amount if corporation fails to uphold grant terms.*
Requires each charter school to annually employ teachers who hold special education endorsements.
Establishes New Jersey Food Access Initiative; funds initiative with certain sales tax revenue from urban enterprise zones for five years.

Provides for homestead property tax relief for senior homestead owners with certain gross income based on higher of homestead credit or local school property taxes on first $60,000 of homestead value.
Extends protections of the new vehicle "lemon law" to new farm tractors purchased or leased in New Jersey.*

Amends and supplements the "New Jersey Parentage Act" to provide relief from judgment and modification of child support orders under certain circumstances; requires paternity testing of all infants at birth.
Establishes animal cruelty offense of cruel confinement of a gestating pig.
Creates "Expungement Study Commission."*
Requires Division of Purchase and Property to award contracts to halfway houses; sets forth certain contract requirements.
Establishes that police vehicles have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.*
Revises criteria to establish base year for homestead property tax reimbursement after relocation resulting from eminent domain.
Clarifies that compensation may be paid for expenses related to service animals required due to injuries resulting from crime against victim.
Prohibits local government agency from employing person on paid leave from local government agency of another county or municipality.
Prohibits sale of food and beverage packaging and containers made with bisphenol A.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain small business employers that provide health care benefits to employees.
Provides a gross income tax credit for textbook purchases made for undergraduate education.
Requires suicide prevention continuing education courses for physicians and podiatrists.
Directs certain recoveries of federal funds for services to persons with developmental disabilities be used for grants to support community infrastructure purposes.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for construction of buildings in accordance with certain energy and environmental performance standards.
Requires Commission on Higher Education to develop accountability and transparency standards for public research institutions and State colleges.
Requires BPU to establish Energy Efficiency Leadership awards program.

Establishes loan redemption program for certain teachers under which they are permitted to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public schools.
Requires school districts to annually disseminate information to students and parents or guardians on the dangers of distributing sexually explicit images through electronic means.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to address school climate issues related to harassment, intimidation, and bullying in public schools.
Requires New Jersey Transit to offer discount passes to all New Jersey higher education students.
Revises criteria for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement for claimants affected by eminent domain.
Revises the period of time required for a State college faculty member to receive tenure.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance regulating where sex offenders may reside; restricts locations of certain child care centers and school bus stops.
Creates grant program for newly established small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Creates matching grant program for small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Encourages local unit sharing of services; makes appropriations.
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave; limits employment for certain public employees.
Requires each public institution of higher education to post its budget on the institution's website.
Directs New Jersey Economic Development Authority and Secretary of Higher Education to promote the establishment of higher education and business partnerships.

Limits payments for unused sick leave earned after effective date by public officers or employees represented by union; for all public employees, limits vacation leave carry-forward and requires suspension and forfeiture of certain supplemental compensation.

Authorizes DOT, NJ Turnpike Authority, and South Jersey Transportation Authority to permit BPU-certified persons to install and maintain solar photovoltaic panels on noise barriers erected on roads and highways.
Requires DHS to establish training, educational assessment, and remedial instruction programs, and minimum educational standards for staff at State psychiatric hospitals.

Prohibits payment for unused sick leave earned after effective date by public officers and employees not represented by union; for all public employees, limits vacation leave carry-forward and requires suspension and forfeiture of certain supplemental compensation.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of natural gas, and charges for transportation or transmission of natural gas, to certain colleges and universities.

Limits leave and supplemental compensation benefits for school district superintendents, assistant superintendents, and school business administrators; provides procedures and penalties for enforcement of TPAF provisions.

Requires public institution of higher education to notify the parents of certain dependent students, without prior consent of the student, when student receives mental health treatment at the institution.
Prohibits State Board of Education from limiting number of certain two-year college credits that may be applied towards meeting teacher certification requirements.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Requires members of governing boards of public institutions of higher education to complete a training program developed by the Commission on Higher Education.
Prohibits home-schooling of children under DYFS care, custody, or supervision without DYFS approval.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to recruit disadvantaged or minority men to teach in certain failing schools under alternate route program.
Establishes grant program for constructing kitchen facilities in licensed child care centers; appropriates $1,000,000.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain expenses paid or incurred for care and support of qualifying senior family member; designated as Caregiver's Assistance Act.
Requires carbon monoxide detectors in school buildings.
Establishes public awareness campaign advising pregnant women, new parents, and women who are breast feeding about dangers of casual milk sharing.
Provides for licensure of human milk banks.
Authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoir levels prior to certain severe weather events.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
The "New Jersey Right to Home Defense Law."
Prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from serving on political party committees.
Simplifies the certification process for out-of-State teachers.

Removes requirement that holder of a special learner's permit, examination permit, and probationary driver's license display decal; requires certain novice drivers submit motor vehicle information to chief administrator.
Expands authority of emergency management departments in requesting assistance outside normal territorial jurisdictions.
Upgrades the crime of invasion of privacy if it results in death or serious bodily injury to a crime of the second degree.
Requires counties to fix curbs and surrounding areas when damaged during county road projects.
Upgrades burglary of a residence to a crime of the second degree; requires mandatory period of parole ineligibility if residence was occupied at time of offense.
Expands list of crimes with bail restriction to include gun related crimes with mandatory minimum terms of imprisonment under "Graves Act."
Allows courts to issue restraining orders prohibiting persons charged with firearms and gang related offenses from entering premises, locations, or areas where the offense occurred.
Establishes Office of River Maintenance in DEP; repeals P.L.1993, c.376 concerning stream cleaning activities.
Regulates advertising of manufacturer
The "Real Estate Installment Contract Act."
Makes various technical and procedural amendments to the "Municipal Land Use Law."
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Regulates mailed manufacturer's rebates.
Permits tenant to be removed from leased housing due to criminal activity under certain circumstances.

Modifies process for contested case hearings by OAL with regard to telephone and video conferences, delegation of final decision authority, oral decisions, checklist decisions, electronic filings, and settlements.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning conflicts between rules of different State agencies.
Permits licensed dealers to display and auction firearms at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
Authorizes deer hunting with firearm on Sundays on private property.
Revises exemption from license requirement for raffles for door prizes of donated or purchased merchandise; increases total retail value from $50 to $200 or higher if permitted.
Increases membership of Drinking Water Quality Institute and responsibilities of DEP related to institute.
Increases annual income limitation for senior and disabled citizens' eligibility for $250 property tax deduction and bases future annual income limitations on annual CPI changes.

Applies provisions of "New Jersey College Student and Parent Consumer Information Act" to proprietary schools and limits eligibility for State student assistance programs to students enrolled in certain proprietary schools.
Requires toll road authorities to award contracts for motor fuel services on toll roads to retail dealers who dispense motor fuel provided by suppliers with refineries located in this State.
Requires certain purchasers of precious metals and jewelry to maintain certain records; grandfathers certain municipal ordinances regarding sales of used and secondhand jewelry.
Requires certain user fees for the provision of traditional municipal services to be included within the 2% municipal and county property tax levy cap.
Restricts bail for persons charged with violent crimes; establishes bail alternatives for non-violent offenders.

Changes certain eligibility criteria for TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS and SPRS disability benefits; requires Attorney General to establish fraud unit; creates temporary committee to recommend accidental disability standard for systems.
"Safe Motor Vehicle Rental Act"; prohibits rental companies from renting, leasing, or selling unrepaired motor vehicles which are subject to safety recall.*
Prohibits State departments and agencies from charging a fee to an applicant solely to correct clerical errors on any application form.
Directs State agencies to take certain action to expedite permitting through use of general permits.
Requires MVC to offer driver's license knowledge test in Italian.
Expands notification when an offender is released from custody or transferred within the criminal justice system.

Prohibits enforcement, for a period of 12 months, of homeowners' association bylaws prohibiting domesticated animals if owner is FEMA designated displaced individual following emergency declaration by President or Governor.
Requires OLS to provide certain notices and reports to legislators and legislative staff by electronic means only.
Creates New Jersey Cold War medal.

Requires wholesalers, terminal facilities, motor fuel retail dealers, grocery stores, nursing homes, assisted living facilities, and residential rehabilitation facilities to install appropriate wiring for use of generator during power outage.
Makes certain technical corrections to the "Revised Uniform Limited Liabiltiy Company Act."
Requires patient to receive notification of abnormality in chest x-ray; designated as Claudia's Law.
Permits Internet gaming equipment to be located at certain secure facilities in Atlantic City.
Concerns rights of Delaware River and Bay Authority employees.
Prohibits boards of education from charging students a fee to participate in extracurricular activities.
Exempts veterans and members of military from boat license and registration fees under certain circumstances.
Reinstates moratorium on imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until January 2015.
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits.
Provides that certain funds in Casino Simulcasting Special Fund will be paid to Atlantic City Racetrack and prescribes use thereof with certain amounts remaining paid to other racetracks.

Implements constitutional amendment providing for pretrial detention of certain criminal defendants; establishes non-monetary bail alternatives for release; authorizes Judiciary to revise fees for certain legal programs and services.*
Authorizes licensing of operators to provide restricted foreign Internet wagering under certain circumstances.
Allows gross income tax deduction for first $200,000 earned by certain new physicians in their first seven taxable years of practice in New Jersey.
Concerns access to certain job training courses for employees affected by plant closings, mass layoffs or transfer of operations.
Allows persons affected by certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program."

Prohibits permanent change of child custody during period of active military service; provides that absence due to active military duty, by itself, is insufficient justification to modify a child custody or visitation order.
Concerns liability, standards of care, and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Provides for expedited injunction for violations of law requiring prenotification of certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs.
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.
Revises standards for expert witnesses in medical malpractice actions.
Requires audits of managed care plan provider networks.
Prohibits school districts from accessing a school-issued electronic communication device to monitor student conduct outside of school property.
Extends Medical Malpractice Liability Insurance Premium Assistance Fund and collection of annual surcharges for 5 years.
Requires certain health benefits plans to include coverage for treatment at ambulatory surgical centers and surgical practices and prohibits riders to the contrary.
Enhances pay-to-play provisions applicable to county bridge commission contractors.
Establishes death by auto as first degree crime in certain circumstances; designated as Dirk's law.
Requires DEP to conduct vibration analysis along routes for disposal of dredged material from Delaware River.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Requires Commissioner of DHSS to assess how to increase number of teaching hospitals and medical residency programs throughout State.
Clarifies statutory exemptions from mandatory immunizations for students.
Requires insurance coverage in the individual and small employer markets and SHBP and SEHBP for "off-label" uses of certain drugs.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.

Provides for designation of surrogates to make health care decisions for certain patients and decision making process for patients without surrogates; establishes demonstration program for transition of isolated patients from inpatient care to post-acute care.
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHSS as ambulatory care facilities.
Requires certain health care facilities to offer, and health care workers to receive, annual influenza vaccination.
Requires insurers, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to reimburse for childhood immunizations at levels specified by regulation.
Permits person covered by certain managed care plans to receive covered services from network provider without obtaining written referral from primary care provider.
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics and federally qualified health centers.
Establishes prescription drug donation repository program.
Requires physicians to complete survey as condition for biennial registration with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.
Deletes prior authorization requirements by certain insurers for accessing certain health care services.
Provides post-traumatic stress disorder from military service during combat may be mitigating factor during sentencing.
Increases tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax rates to be on par with tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax; dedicates revenue for smoking and tobacco use cessation programs.
Concerns cigarette manufacturers and production of certain tobacco products using roll-your-own tobacco machines at retail establishments within this State.
"Compounding Pharmacy Quality Assurance Act"; requires accreditation of compounding pharmacies.

Requires county elections board give notice by Internet posting or mail when polling place location changes unexpectedly before election; requires board develop plan for polling place change notification.**
Permits flexible scheduling of private duty nursing services for eligible Medicaid recipients.
Prohibits insurers from increasing premiums or making other adverse underwriting decisions with respect to medical malpractice liability insurance under certain circumstances.
Revises requirements for licensure and creates physician-delegated scope of practice for physician assistants.
Establishes Medicaid Smart Card Pilot Program.
Provides procedure for municipality acquiring school property from non-operating school district following merger to extinguish restrictive deed covenant.
Requires law enforcement officers to search domestic violence restraining order registry upon conducting an arrest.
Requires correspondence or notice by public entity contain citations of any appropriate statutes, ordinances, or resolutions.
Revises penalty for destruction of, or damage to, trees, saplings, shrubs or other plants; repeals current law thereon.
Requires health care professionals to notify patients of end of health benefits coverage during course of treatment in certain circumstances.
Allows fees to be suspended or vacated for certain persons sentenced to labor assistance programs as alternative to incarceration.
Concerns permits, letters of exemption, and enforcement with regard to agricultural activities under "Freshwater Wetlands Protection Act".
Establishes farm brewery and winery-brewery beverage license and permits farm wineries to produce hard cider.
Creates cooperative farm winery licenses.
Requires carriers to clarify whether medically necessary procedures are covered benefits and remit certain payments to hospitals for services rendered.
Requires DHS to dispose of newborn screening specimens within 60 days after testing.
Expands the domestic violence statutes to encompass minors aged 16 and older.
Permits wineries to sell wine at certain farm markets.
Permits a farm income averaging credit under the New Jersey gross income tax.
Provides municipalities with discretion to restrict hours for sale of package goods.
Requires certificate of need for hospital-based basic obstetric and pediatric services.
Creates "Inmate Community Service Program" in DOC.
Establishes offense of criminal mischief committed on historical sites.
Equalizes standing of private and public colleges before land use agencies.
Requires telecommunications companies to provide prorated refunds for service outages of longer than 24 hours.
Enhances penalties for false incrimination and making fictitious reports.*
Provides that Probation Division would file child support judgment as a lien only when amount of judgment equals or exceeds amount of child support due for a one-month period.
Requires public and independent institutions of higher education to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.
Establishes new crime of domestic violence committed in the presence of a child.
Requires president of public institution of higher education to regularly report on-campus criminal and fire events to the institution's governing board.
Includes payday lending as a violation of the consumer fraud act.
Prohibits use of tobacco products on the grounds of any public or private institution of higher education.
Requires wireless telecommunications carriers to locate personal wireless service facilities on State or municipal property, when permissible.
Establishes farmland preservation inheritance tax deduction program within Department of Agriculture.
Requires school districts to pay advanced placement examination fees for certain students and the State to reimburse school districts for the cost.
Requires MVC to provide Gold Star Family decals to certain family members of armed services members who died while on active duty.
Provides immunity from civil liability for person who sends text message to motor vehicle operator.
Establishes "New Jersey Works Dual Enrollment Option Program."
Stipulates that retail motor fuel dealers shall not be responsible for certain fees associated with credit, debit and rewards cards.
Provides for background checks and other requirements for certain agencies providing temporary home for child or pregnant woman during crisis.
Requires mailing of sample ballot for fire district elections.
Requires payment to municipality for use of municipal services by for-profit lessee of property owned by county or county improvement authority.
Establishes Trenton Capital City Aid program.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses employing qualified ex-offenders.
Authorizes eight hours of leave for parents and guardians from work for school-related events of children.
Authorizes special Alpha Kappa Alpha license plate.
Creates Foreclosure Prevention and Neighborhood Stabilization Revolving Trust Fund; places temporary surcharge on mortgage foreclosure complaints.
Requires lowest possible price for inmate telephone calls.
Establishes a magnet school pilot program in DOE.
Establishes loan redemption program and bonus program for teachers employed in schools in need of improvement.
Requires full-day kindergarten in all school districts and establishes uniform age requirement for enrollment in kindergarten.
"The Opportunity to Compete Act;" establishes certain employment rights for persons with criminal record.*
Reduces the alcoholic beverage excise tax rate on liquor, wine, vermouth, sparkling wine, and hard cider and eliminates the dedication of that tax to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Removes plenary retail distribution license limit for certain stores.
Establishes limited retail religious distribution license.
Provides credit against ambulatory care facility assessment liability for value of unreimbursed care provided to hospital charity care patients.
Removes limousine services from sales and use tax imposition.
Reduces maximum capacity of ammunition magazines to 10 rounds; exempts firearms with .22 caliber tubular magazines from 10 round limitation. *
Clarifies responsibility of Unsatisfied Claim and Judgment Fund for pedestrian personal injury protection claims.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.
Establishes procedures for awarding of design-build contracts.
Excludes certain services rendered in connection with installation of carpeting and other flooring from sales and use tax.
Decreases the premium receipts tax for surplus lines insurance coverage.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $2 per day.
Authorizes State constitutional convention to reform system of property taxation; makes appropriation.
Terminates transitional energy facility assessment (TEFA) unit rate surcharges effective January 1, 2013.
Provides that the State Board of Examiners may not charge a fee for the issuance of credentials required to serve as a substitute school nurse.
Requires public institutions of higher education to waive or reimburse application fees and transcript fees for veterans and members of the military.
Eliminates the 1% fee, and the 1% tax, on purchasers of Class 4A commercial property transferred for consideration in excess of $1 million.
Reduces cigarette tax rate by 30 cents per pack and reduces revenue dedicated to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Renames Mountainview Youth Correctional Facility as "William H. Fauver Youth Correctional Facility."
Revises definition of "responsible charge" as it pertains to licensed professional engineers and licensed architects.*

Appropriates $20,000,000 from General Fund to the Department of State for travel and tourism advertising and promotion to communicate that New Jersey's tourism destinations are operational despite damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.
Grants immunity from liability for certain professional services rendered during emergencies under certain circumstances.
Realigning the transfer inheritance tax payment due date to coincide with the payment due dates for State and federal estate taxes.

Requires certain public contract bid advertisements to contain certified cost estimate ranges, specifies grounds for rejection of all bids, and requires 50% guaranty on bids; designated as the Fairness in Bidding Act.
Revises statutes concerning firearms purchaser identification cards and handgun purchase permits; makes handgun purchase permit valid for four years.
Replaces NJ Wine Industry Advisory Council with NJ Wine Board and establishes new duties and authorizes revenue-producing activities.
Expands applicability of "The Truth-in-Renting Act."
Recognizes same-sex marriages entered into outside the State.
Establishes teacher recruitment grant program in DOE; appropriates $6 million to DOE.
Provides loan redemption for certain physicians who work in State 10 years.
Provides extended validity to wastewater service area designations and sewer service area designations, and revises certain aspects of wastewater management planning process.
Revises law concerning the rights and responsibilities of motor vehicle franchisees and franchisors.**
Establishes a gross income tax credit for attendance at New Jersey county colleges.
Requires persons to report incidents of domestic violence to law enforcement and makes it a disorderly persons offense to fail to report.
Establishes the "Domestic Violence Tuition Waiver Program."
Permits voter registration of certain persons at age 17 for voting at next election occurring on or after 18th birthday.
Requires Commissioner of Education to annually evaluate the effectiveness of teacher preparation programs at institutions of higher education in the State.
"Internet Service Provider Customer Bill of Rights."
Provides tax credit against corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain small businesses receiving qualifying loans.
Establishes bill of rights for authorized family members of persons with developmental disabilities.
Requires period of mandatory incarceration for second or subsequent conviction for prostitution.

Provides that NJBEST Program is available to persons with taxpayer identification number; establishes DREAM Commission to provide scholarships for children of immigrants; and requires teaching staff professional development include information on serving such children.
Increases domestic violence civil penalty and surcharge; imposes new civil penalties under certain circumstances; provides funds to Legal Services.
Establishes Statewide database of beds in shelters for the homeless.
Requires that public address, and phone number or email address, of local elected officials be available on local unit website.
Excludes from disclosure as public record e-mail addresses provided to government entities to receive emergency notices.
Exempts certain health information contained in 9-1-1 calls from definition of government record.

"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to entities contributing to scholarships for low-income children; appropriates $1,500,000 to Treasury.
Places certain limitations on attorney solicitation letters.

Authorizes sale of certain property interests in public roads by local governments to connect certain electric generating facilities with customers; provides for net metering, virtual net metering and connections by public utility.
The "New Jersey Responsible Banking Act."
Establishes the "Neighborhood Scholar Revitalization Pilot Program."
Requires certain buyers of precious metals and jewelry to pay by check and maintain certain records.

"Drug Dealer Accountability Act;" increases penalties for distribution of phencyclidine; establishes criminal liability for drug dealers under certain circumstances; imposes civil and criminal penalties for combinations of controlled dangerous substances.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on responsible use of social media for middle school students as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Technology.
Requires developers constructing certain renewable energy generation systems to ensure that such systems would be functionally integrated to the electric grid prior to commencement of construction.
Criminalizes mental or emotional hazing.

Provides that institutions of higher education require candidates for membership in or members of fraternities, sororities, sports teams, and other student organizations to sign anti-hazing agreement.
Criminalizes purchasing or owning weapon if person has previous conviction of unlawful possession of weapon.
Anti-Hazing Reporting and Immunity Pilot Program Act.
Exempts mugshots of arrestees who have not been convicted of the underlying offense from State's open public records law.
Imposes mandatory fine and education requirement for prostitution offenses committed on school, registered day care or licensed child care facility property; creates fund.
Requires State Police to produce brochure summarizing law governing transport and possession of firearms; requires MVC to make brochure available to new State residents registering vehicles.
Requires cost-saving reforms to administration of correctional health care.
Increases statute of limitations for prosecution of theft of firearm.
Concerns employment of certain minors as runway or print models.
Requires completion of a computer science class as part of the high school graduation requirements.
"New Jersey Open Data Initiative;" requires certain information be made available on Internet by State departments and agencies.
Requires public school students in grades 9 through 12 to receive instruction in cardiopulmonary resuscitation and use of an automated external defibrillator prior to graduation.*
Exempts certain offers and sales of securities from registration.*
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.
Prohibits the construction of school facilities on a contaminated or remediated site.
Prohibits sale of emergency warning lights to unauthorized motorists.
Increases penalties for unauthorized display or use of emergency warning lights.
Requires person eligible for health care benefits from more than one public entity to choose coverage from only one.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Prohibits implementation of formula-based rates for sewerage authorities and electric, gas and water public utilities.
Revises procedure for removal of municipal administrator by municipal council; provides for payment of balance of salary to municipal administrator upon removal.
Increases penalties for luring a child and kidnapping.
Establishes crime for adult to misrepresent age in order to join youth serving organization.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on municipalities and counties.
Exempts sheltered workshops from disclosure and fingerprinting requirements for certain solid waste operations.
Establishes crime of using blue lights or other insignia on vehicle to impersonate law enforcement authority.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 2% over the prior academic year.
Defines and removes limits on municipal market to affordable programs.
Establishes fine for committing motor vehicle offense that results in collision with bicyclist.
Eliminates the office of the executive county superintendent of schools and transfers all the duties of that office to the Commissioner of Education.
Requires condominium and homeowners' associations to provide information to federal home loan insurance providers at no cost to potential buyers.
Exempts, for five years, certain new business activities in pinelands area from compliance with Pinelands Commission development approval process.
Requires public utilities to mail customers detailed explanation of rate settlement agreements prior to final BPU vote.
Requires public utilities to provide customers notice of request for increase in rates; revises requirements related to hearings on proposed rate increases.
Gives priority status for connection of solar photovoltaic systems for customer-generators who are public entities.
Prohibits smoking on property acquired or developed for recreation and conservation purposes by local government units or nonprofit organizations using State funds.
Prohibits smoking at State parks, forests, beaches, and wildlife management areas.
Allows New Jersey Board of Massage and Bodywork Therapy to accept alternative proof of education for licensure of current practitioners.
Provides for use of alternative dispute resolution to settle disagreements between State agencies concerning public works projects.
Requires use of pervious concrete by State agencies under certain circumstances.
Restricts occupancy of dwelling unit in age-restricted community to older adults following resale.
Establishes crime of initiating a false "Amber Alert."
Requires BPU to issue written decision concerning utility rate increase approvals to public via its website.
Revises requirements related to public hearings on proposed public utility rate increases.
Codifies DEP's New Jersey Recycling Awards Program to annually recognize outstanding recycling achievements.
Clarifies that the domestic pigeon (Rock Pigeon) is not protected by law.

Prohibits treatment, discharge, disposal, application to roadway, or storage of wastewater, wastewater solids, sludge, drill cuttings or other byproducts from natural gas exploration or production using hydraulic fracturing.*
Provides that a charter school may only be established in certain school districts and prohibits further payments to a charter school in the event of closure.
Creates nine-member New Jersey Legislative Elections Public Financing Study Commission.
Prohibits voters from voting in primary or general election by electronic communications; permits voting by provisional ballot if state of emergency declared.
Requires in-network hospitals to notify patients of out-of-network health care professionals who provide services in hospital.
Prohibits use of State funds to lease or purchase certain motor vehicles.
Requires electronic recording of purchases of over-the-counter drugs used to manufacture methamphetamine.
Provides State, county, municipal, and school district contracts for professional services will be awarded pursuant to competitive contracting process.
Increases fine for student truancy and requires truant student to attend court-ordered truancy counseling program or other appropriate program.
Creates New Jersey Coastal Commission; reallocates certain funds from DEP to commission; and appropriates $20 million.
Authorizes Attorney General to impose a fine against institution of higher education that fails to appropriately respond to a student's allegation of sexual assault by another student.*
Requires DEP to establish regulations for approval to install and operate certain solar facilities.
Provides for sales tax exemption for advanced technology partial zero emission vehicles, imposes surcharge on certain automobiles, and deletes surcharge on certain automobiles.

Requires State to pay full contribution to State-administered pension systems plus $300 million annually until systems are fully funded; provides members of systems with contractual right to financially sound funding of systems.

Prohibits feeding of black bears and requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, or food boxes in certain areas located in bear habitat and under certain circumstances, including garbage collection.
Requires DOE to adopt green cleaning policy for schools and child care centers with 50 or more students.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for 50% of purchase cost of diesel engine conversion devices.
Requires the incorporation of solar panels in design and construction of new public school facilities.
Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2010.
Requires filing of report comparing investment returns earned by private money managers and by State employees for public employee retirement funds and State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund.
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years.

Limits tuition increase in school district sending-receiving relationships to percentage increase in State aid and tax levy of sending school district and prohibits severance of such relationships currently in effect.
Permits levy cap exclusion for certain monies expended by local units for shared services.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid.
Requires design of new public schools to incorporate green building practices.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Establishes civil penalty for certain unlawful conduct.
Establishes driving privilege cards for New Jersey residents who cannot prove lawful presence in United States.
Prohibits employment-based discriminatory actions against persons engaged in unpaid internships.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to develop online historic tour identifying locations of war battles and places of significance to war efforts in NJ.
Revises current law permitting paid leave of absence for municipal police officers.
Provides for discounted resident trapping license fees for senior citizens.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $5,000 income tax deduction.
Permits municipalities impacted by Hurricane Sandy to borrow for current expenses through December 31, 2014, and repay special emergency notes over a 10-year period.
Establishes civil action for damages against organizations that support terrorism.
The "Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at child care centers and certain schools, playgrounds, and recreational fields.
Amends racketeering law to add solicitation and recruitment to join criminal street gangs, gang criminality and promoting organized street crime.
Upgrades certain penalties for gang criminality committed in a public place.
Creates crime of intentional discharge of firearm from vehicle.
Sets forth certain restriction regarding use of drones by law enforcement entities, forest fire departments, and entertainment venues.
Establishes time limit for retention of automated license plate reader data by law enforcement agency.
Increases length of time in which to file certain lien claim forms under "Construction Lien Law."
Restricts sale and use of remaining State-owned portion of Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital property in Morris County.
Prohibits drilling technique of hydraulic fracturing.
Increases penalties for violations of certain pet shop laws and regulations.
Imposes civil penalty for the exhibition or use in performance of a living bear, elephant, lion or tiger.
