Permits a witness who is under the age of 16 or a victim of any age to testify by closed circuit television in prosecutions for crimes or offenses involving domestic violence.
Establishes pilot program in DCF providing animal-assisted therapy to victims of childhood violence, trauma, or children with behavioral health care needs; appropriates $100,000.
Requires reporting of the graduation and transfer rates of State tuition aid grant recipients.
Requires casino licensee to install and maintain system of security cameras in every stairwell throughout casino hotel facility.
Establishes and enhances certain insurance fraud prevention measures.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.
Increases State hotel and motel occupancy fee revenues required to be annually appropriated to fund certain arts and cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.
Concerns availability of services and administrative requirements of federally qualified health centers.
Exempts nursing mothers from jury duty.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Domestic Violence and Abuse.
Increases the penalty for hindering the apprehension or prosecution of offender.
Authorizes special plate for holders of "Combat Action Ribbon."
Establishes time limit for execution of arrest warrant for non-moving motor vehicle violations.
Increases penalties for underage drivers who have consumed alcohol.
Establishes time limit for issuance of warrant for certain motor vehicle violations.
Authorizes issuance of duplicate firearms purchaser identification cards for change of address with certain proof.
Authorizes courts to assess costs of prosecution against certain drug defendants.
Requires sharing of incarceration information between government agencies; prohibits certain benefits program payments to incarcerated individuals.
Clarifies that handgun ammunition may be sold to retired law enforcement officers with certain identification.
Requires additional notices to governmental agencies upon termination of utility services to residential customers.
Permits extension of deadline for notification of depreciation of value of real property to tax assessor and allows Division of Taxation to extend certain statutory dates.
Permits reassessment of real property when municipal assessor has not received notice of material depreciation from property owner and allows Division of Taxation to extend certain statutory dates.
Authorizes notaries public to take oath of office before any official generally authorized to take oaths.
Requires public release of photographs of arrestees under State's open public records law.
Provides that certain nonprofit organizations would not be assessed a civil administrative penalty under the "Water Supply Management Act" for exceeding permitted water allocations.
Excludes from gross income tax value of prizes or awards won in athletic competition in Olympic Games.
Designates Common Eastern Bumble Bee as New Jersey State Native Pollinator.
Requires public institution of higher education to provide information on Selective Service registration and inquire on Selective Service registration of prospective students.

Extends "Right to Farm" protection to certain agricultural tourism activities and events; requires adoption of agricultural management practices therefor; and permits special occasion events that promote agricultural tourism to be conducted under certain circumstances.
The New Jersey Battlefield to Boardroom Act; Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for qualified wages of certain veterans.
Requires issuance of one free copy of a veteran's death certificate to certain authorized persons upon request.
Requires establishment of and compliance with infection control risk assessment (ICRA) standards for hospital construction work.
Mandates "breakfast after the bell" program in schools with significant low income population.
"New Jersey Housing Assistance for Veterans Act," establishes pilot program to assist certain veterans with housing modification and rehabilitation; appropriates $5 million.
Provides additional State school aid to certain districts with expenditures below districts' adequacy threshold.

Creates housing purchase matching grant program for reserve component of the U.S. Armed Forces and the New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations; appropriates $2,000,000.
Establishes right of way for funeral processions.
Upgrades crime of soliciting or recruiting for criminal street gang while on school property.
Requires persons under age 17 to wear helmets when operating non-motorized scooters.
Requires recalls on motor vehicles to be repaired prior to sale.
Allows certain law enforcement officers to have access to medical records of inmates under certain circumstances.
Authorizes expenditures from open space trust funds to develop or maintain recreation and conservation land although the land was not acquired by the municipality.
Repeals application of gross income tax to certain New Jersey Lottery prize winnings.
Requires coverage of medication therapy management in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare.
Permits wineries to operate salesrooms in certain municipalities with restrictions on the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Permits historic motor vehicles to be used for pleasure driving one day per week.
Requires the Board of Public Utilities in the Department of the Treasury to administer certain federal energy assistance programs.
Requires municipal court judge to dismiss motor vehicle charges if accident was caused by medical condition of driver.
Permits inclusion of volunteer firefighters and other emergency responders within municipal eligible employee group for purposes of the small employer health benefits plan statutes.
Requires lobbyists that are nonprofit organizations to report annually to Election Law Enforcement Commission estimated number of members, contributors, and supporters.
Permits restaurants without a liquor license to advertise that they are BYOB or a winery salesroom.
Directs Commissioner of Education to establish guidelines limiting amount of time students spend on school bus.
Eliminates licensure of rehabilitation counselors.
Expands definition and licensure requirements for health care service firms.
Clarifies juvenile's right to attorney representation; requires 12 month judicial review hearing when juvenile is placed out-of-home.
Provides for oversight of DHS contracts with providers serving persons with developmental disabilities.
Concerns licensure exemptions for boiler operators.
Stipulates that applicants for pawnbroker license are not required to submit CPA-certified financial statement.
Requires school districts and school bus contractors to ensure that school bus drivers are familiar with assigned route.
The "New Jobs for New Jersey Act."
Requires veterinarians to provide written prescriptions and certain notifications.
Strengthens public entities' immunity for damages against claims of injury occurring on public beaches and boardwalks.
Establishes procedures for the approval of the closure of a public school.
Abolishes Division of Rate Counsel and transfers functions to Office of Attorney General; decreases BPU membership.
Designates New Jersey Big Data Alliance as State's advanced cyberinfrastructure consortium.
Directs Rutgers Discovery Informatics Institute, Office of Information Technology, and New Jersey Big Data Alliance to develop advanced cyberinfrastructure strategic plan.
Requires electric public utilities to conduct vegetation management adjacent to service lines on certain real properties.
Establishes uniform real property taxation for commercial renewable energy systems and limits municipal construction permit fees for non-commercial renewable energy systems.
Requires State to use energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Requires certain local and State government entities to issue certain emergency and warning light permits.
Permits a student to participate in sex-segregated school activities and use facilities consistent with the student's gender identity.
Requires assessment of administrative penalty amount by administrative law judge for environmental violations.
Establishes Bergen Watershed Flood prevention and Protection Task Force.
Prohibits requiring domed roofs on storage tanks if alternative emissions reduction method for volatile organic compound emissions can be established.
Establishes certain requirements for trapping of snapping turtles.
Concerns contracts for asphalt work under the "Local Public Contracts Law."
Requires availability of early voting for certain elections; makes appropriation.
Allows for sale of municipally owned preserved open space under certain circumstances to homeowners displaced as a result of severe repetitive loss events.
Prohibits operator of motor vehicle from engaging in distracted driving.
Requires complaint against juvenile taken into custody be filed within 24 hours.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to prepare and implement annual advertising and promotion plan.
Establishes electronic reporting system for purchasers of precious metals or jewelry.
Establishes "College Affordability Study Commission" to examine issues and develop recommendations to increase the affordability of higher education in New Jersey.
Makes escapees responsible for apprehension costs.
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Revises definition of "landlord" to include rooming and boarding house owners and operators with regard to ordinances holding landlords to certain standards of responsibility.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Heating Oil and Propane Reserves.
Prohibits use of hands-free wireless telephones and electronic communication devices while providing instruction in operation of a motor vehicle.
Caps State use portion of energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Prohibits service repair contractors from charging hourly rates for travel time.
Requires State personal income tax materials to include notice of certain property tax relief programs.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.

Authorizes municipalities, by resolution, to require tax collector to remove parcel of real property from accelerated tax sale list if fourth quarter property taxes not paid but property materially depreciated following severe weather event.
Authorizes penalties for failure to file certain public employment contracts; clarifies requirement for electronic posting of public employment contracts and interest arbitration awards.
Requires DHS to verify level of severity of reports received about incidents involving individuals with developmental disabilities.
Permits municipalities to authorize property tax reward programs; validates actions of municipalities that have created them.
Exempts parking spaces reserved for persons with a disability from meters or fees.
Enhances penalties for drivers without motor vehicle insurance involved in accident with pedestrian; requires public awareness campaign concerning importance of this insurance.
Provides law enforcement officers option to obtain handgun permit or firearms identification card from municipality where they are employed.
Requires DEP to obtain legislative approval and authorization before increasing a fee or imposing a new fee, but retains DEP authority to use ordinary administrative procedure when decreasing a fee.
Requires BPU to consider certain revenue-raising limitations when determining whether to approve increases in public utility rates, fares or charges that may be assessed to municipalities.
Prohibits electric and gas public utilities from collecting payment from residential budget billing plan customers whose service was interrupted as a result of major emergency event.
Prohibits electric and gas public utilities from disqualifying certain residential customers if enrolled in government energy aggregation program.
Prohibits use of certain technology for unauthorized electronic surveillance of cellular telephones.
Requires transfer of certain incarceration records to DOLWD.
Eliminates unemployment tax for certain workers ineligible to receive unemployment benefits.
Requires school districts to employ a certain number of student assistance coordinators based on district enrollment.
Prohibits BPU review and approval of property transactions of certain telecommunications companies.

Eliminates requirement that at least one of two licenses issued under small-scale and staged casino facility pilot program must be staged casino facility license; permits these facilities to be located in renovated buildings.
Makes a FY2014 supplemental appropriation of $3 million for hemophilia treatment centers.
"Pet Groomers Licensing Act;" designated as "Bijou's Law."
Authorizes public institution of higher education to establish in-municipality tuition rate for students who graduate from public high schools located in the same municipality as the institution.
Establishes Behavioral Health Insurance Claims Advocacy Program.
Provides for issuance of a uniform identification card for all law enforcement officers.
Establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank and Energy Bank within New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust.
Provides standards for home elevation contractors.
"Aid in Dying for the terminally Ill Act"; permits qualified terminally ill patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner.**
Waives certain commercial driver license fees for veterans and spouses of veterans.
Eliminates New Jersey Law Revision Commission.
Requires at least 50% of highest Casino Simulcasting Special Fund amount awarded to racetrack be paid to Atlantic City Race Course; prescribes uses thereof.
Requires MVC to issue motor vehicle placard to certain veterans and waives meter fees.*
Establishes pilot program in Edison Township requiring Attorney General to perform police internal affairs functions.

Exempts disabled veterans and Purple Heart recipients from payment of municipal parking meter fees when their vehicles bear a disabled veteran's or Purple Heart license plate or placard issued by New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission.*
Prohibits municipality from imposing special assessment for curb repair in certain circumstances.
Requires Council on Affordable Housing to adjust municipal fair share to reflect job loss in a municipality.
Limits job creation estimation under previous COAH regulations for warehousing activities.
Requires certain police vehicles to be equipped with cameras.
Includes reverse rate evasion as form of insurance fraud and provides for civil and criminal penalties.
Permits construction workers to file a lien against the owner of real property under "Construction Lien Law."
Extends prevailing wage requirements to certain for-sale housing projects.
Establishes recreational fishing license plate; dedicates fees to coastal fishing research.
Authorizes free State park and forest admission and free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for persons with certain types of military service.
Concerns apprenticeship programs and other standards for public works contractors.
Provides exclusive jurisdiction to PERC for certain unfair labor practice claims.
Establishes minimum criminal penalties for animal cruelty offenses.
Allows issuing of stop-work orders for failure to pay prevailing wage.
Requires certain CATV companies to provide free Internet access to public libraries.*
Includes death by auto or vessel and certain assaults as crimes with bail restrictions.
Increases mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain repeat sex offenders.
Requires oversight reporting on Hurricane Sandy recovery funds.
Permits veteran's property tax deduction for tax year when veteran was previously qualified to receive deduction and became owner of real property after October 1 of pretax year.
Requires Division of Addiction Services to grant residential drug treatment program licenses to certain programs operating in State correctional facilities and county jails.
Makes disabled persons receiving disability payments pursuant to federal Railroad Retirement Act eligible to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Authorizes lease of DEP and locally owned historic buildings and structures and public-private partnerships to facilitate their maintenance and use.*
Prohibits employers from obtaining, requiring, or discriminating on the basis of credit reports.

Requires municipalities to exempt 100% disabled veterans from construction permit surcharge fees for improvements to promote living unit accessibility; appropriates $20,000 for municipal reimbursements.
Requires video cameras at certain ATMs.
Designates certain interchanges of Garden State Parkway in honor of Melvin M. Loftus and Christopher Meyer.*
Establishes an animal abuser registration system.
Requires certain State departments, divisions, commissions, and authorities to consider use of green or blue roof in construction of certain new State buildings, facilities, and structures.
Requires construction of certain new buildings, facilities, and structures using State, EDA, or NJ Schools Development Authority funds to include green or blue roofs.*
Requires DEP Commissioner to periodically study and make recommendations concerning blue roofs and green roofs.*
Directs Office of Emergency Management to develop and undertake annual public awareness campaign concerning State's emergency coastal evacuation plan.
Requires NJ Environmental Infrastructure Financing Program to give additional weight in ranking system to projects including green or blue roofs.
Makes certain repeat offenders ineligible for parole.
Authorizes municipalities to contract with appropriately trained municipal firefighters to provide paramedic services.
Prohibits practice of requiring credit check as condition of employment.
Provides corporation business tax credit for certain New Jersey news, weather, and sports content production expenses.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Enables collection of voluntary contributions for New Jersey Nonprofit Veterans Organizations through gross income tax returns.*
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
Provides for establishment and operation of casino at Meadowlands Complex.
Prohibits certain agencies from establishing checkpoints limited to specific vehicle types.
Establishes aid program for certain municipalities with State correctional facilities.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Exempts senior citizens, disabled persons, and veterans from E-ZPass account monthly service charge.
Provides free tuition at public institutions of higher education for surviving spouses and dependent children of military personnel killed in performance of duties.
Requires sellers of used motor vehicles to complete and submit form.
Establishes 24-hour hotline for information concerning the crime of human trafficking; appropriates $75,000.
Concerns sale of cemetery, grave, monument and historical markers.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental Grants-in-Aid appropriation of $10 million to DCA for Lead Hazard Control Assistance Fund.*
Requires 30-day grace period prior to accrual of interest on late water and sewer bill payments.
Requires Secretary of State create e-mail notification system alerting when US and State flags flown at half-staff.
Requires requestor pick up government records within 10 business days of availability.
Requires all campaign contributions to be reported to ELEC.
Prohibits additional jughandles on roads or highways in the State.
Requires water purveyors to notify municipalities they service regarding water supply and water quality issues.
Requires public body to publish notice of public meeting on official Internet website.
Allocates nondedicated portion of State realty transfer fee collections to municipal property tax relief.
Increases and indexes maximum homestead property tax deduction under gross income tax.
Reduces period of time that member of Legislature may be absent, without excuse, before member's seat is deemed vacant.
Establishes standard of review for certain juvenile waiver motions.
Establishes new offenses concerning the unlawful possession and use of credit card scanners.
Establishes pilot program for municipalities and school districts to contract for video monitoring systems to assist in enforcing law against unlawfully passing a school bus.
Directs Commissioner of Education to study curriculum requirements for geography education in high school.
Requires report and public hearing prior to DEP recommendation of site for inclusion on Superfund list.

Authorizes county surrogates to establish or expand programs to provide information to law enforcement officers, firefighters and first aid squad members concerning the preparation of wills, living wills and powers of attorney.
Adds budget language specifying Medicaid reimbursement for various ambulance services provided to certain recipients.
Prohibits cemetery company from charging additional fee for rendering certain services on Sunday.
Revises licensing provisions for orthotists and prosthetists and assistants.
"Wage Transparency Act"; requires reporting of public contractor employment information.
Directs NJEDA to establish pilot program to assist with permit and approval process related to redevelopment of certain properties.
Grants EDA broader discretion to approve applications for corporation business tax certificate transfer program.
Establishes a computers for schools program in DOC.
"Unfair Wage Recovery Act"; provides that unlawful employment practice occurs each time individual is affected.
Establishes the "Municipal Court Prosecutors' Automated System."
Requires MVC to issue driving privilege cards to persons who cannot prove lawful presence in the country.
Establishes penalty for unlawfully using parking placard issued to person with qualifying disability.
Concerns organ and tissue donation.
Concerns earned sick leave.
Requires ignition interlock device to be installed on vehicle owned or leased by drunk driver only after period of driver's license suspension.
Enhances penalties for committing improper behavior in place of public accommodation.
Establishes judicial presumption in favor of 10 percent bail option in lieu of a bail bond issued by licensed surety for repeat criminal offenders.
Requires DEP to designate smoke-free sections of State beaches, parks, and forests.
Permits municipality to establish restricted parking spaces for certain volunteer firefighters.
Concerns contributions to special funds made through the gross income tax return.
Permits municipal board of library commissioners to reduce library tax rate when municipality acquires new ratables.
Requires public utilities to set bill due date to no earlier than 20 days past postmarked date if mailed by regular mail, or 20 days past sent date if sent electronically.
"Highway Accident Property Tax Relief Act;" requires State to reimburse municipalities for costs of providing certain emergency services.
Provides that eligibility for NJ STARS Program be based on class rank at completion of student's junior year or senior year of high school.*
Requires private vocational schools to provide adequate written notification when planning to close facilities.
Requires certain NJ Transit Corporation employees to undergo criminal history background checks and wear photo identification.
Ensures operation of certain motor fuel storage, distribution and dispensing facilities during disasters and emergencies.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Concerns valuation of property condemned for dune construction or beach replenishment.
Excludes certain public works contracts related to Hurricane Sandy recovery from prevailing wage requirements.
Prohibits toll-free passage for SJTA employees, officers, and members except while commuting or carrying out official duties.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for full time enrollment at four year institutions of higher education, county colleges and accredited post-secondary schools in New Jersey.
Omits State Police detectives from Open Public Records Act.
Requires electric public utilities to undertake vegetation management practices near power lines.

Authorizes Commissioner of Education to convene meeting when a constituent municipality in a regional school district is impacted by natural or other disaster; provides for temporary modification of tax levy apportionment methodology.
Concerns collective bargaining by executive county superintendents.
Expands infertility coverage under certain health insurance plans.
Regulates receipt of things of value by members and employees of Legislature and officers and employees of Executive Branch.
Requires school districts to include information on reproductive coercion as part of the dating violence education program.
Establishes Council of Women in Higher Education in Department of State to study and promote women's issues within institutions of higher education.
Requires issue advocacy organization using certain candidate information in advertisements to register with ELEC as political committee or continuing political committee.
Prohibits loans as political contributions by certain persons; prohibits certain inducements for political contributions; reduces permitted amount of outstanding loans in certain cases.
Restricts business entities that make campaign contributions from performing certain local government contracts.
Authorizes municipal governing body to create and maintain list of municipal residents in need of special assistance in case of emergency for public safety purposes.
Authorizes rural electric cooperative and certain municipalities to establish municipal shared services authority.*
Establishes New Jersey port support zone surrounding certain ports and marine terminals.
Abolishes the State Real Estate Appraisers Board and transfers regulation of appraisers to the New Jersey Real Estate Commission.
Concerns registration of contractors and sets criteria for responsible bidders in public work.
Prohibits persons convicted of animal cruelty offenses from owning domestic companion animals and from working or volunteering at animal-related enterprises; designated as "Moose's Law."*
Establishes Extended School Day and School Year Study Commission.
Establishes Innovation Grant Program and authorizes tax credits for contributions to Innovation Fund; appropriates $5 million to DOE.
Establishes "The Patient Safety and Provider Incentive Program;" makes an appropriation.
Requires certain CATV companies to make CATV service available throughout residential areas of municipality within specified number of years after CATV company first provides service to municipality.
Exempts from sales tax for two years certain highly fuel efficient vehicles and energy efficient appliances.
Prohibits political contributions by county and municipal political party committees to other committees; increases certain penalties.
Authorizes issuance of special emergency notes to finance special emergency appropriations for payment of current year property assessment appeal refunds over three years.
Makes homeowners' association in which developer's control of executive board has not been surrendered a public body under "Senator Byron M. Baer Open Public Meetings Act."
Requires DCA to provide information regarding "Lead Hazard Control Assistance Act" to certain dwelling units approved for Weatherization Assistance Program.
Authorizes local units of government subject to "Local Public Contracts Law." and "Public School Contracts Law" to use electronic procurement technologies.*
Prohibits harassment of farmers engaged in farming operations.
Exempts certain qualified applicants for commercial driver's licenses from fingerprinting and criminal history record background check.
Increases minimum civil fine for harassing person taking wildlife and increases criminal penalty for subsequent offenses.
Provides that Good Samaritans are not required to pay for ambulance service if injured while rendering emergency care.
Requires residential community release programs to file certain financial disclosure documents with DOC.
Concerns low emission and gas emission vehicles; establishes Clean Vehicle Task Force.
Requires AG to notify certain legislators of decision not to defend validity of challenged State statute in court.
Requires pawnbrokers to retain purchased property for not less than 20 days and record and report certain information.
Designates State Route 173 between Clinton and Phillipsburg as "173rd Airborne Brigade Highway."
Directs Department of Law and Public Safety to engage in Internet privacy and social media responsibility campaign.
Removes statutory limitation on number of permits that may be issued by Division of Fish and Wildlife for the taking of beaver.
Designated "Snookiville law," authorizes municipalities to license and regulate the filming of reality shows in public locations and in public places of accommodation within their jurisdiction.
Permits municipalities and school districts to agree on payment dates and amounts for transfer of school purposes tax collections.
Imposes residency requirements on newly appointed members of sewerage and utility authorities.
Permits certain oaths, affirmations, and affidavits to be taken before township and village mayors.
Provides for termination of parental rights under certain circumstances; expands definition of "abused child."
Authorizes wiretapping to investigate crimes involving human trafficking or certain prostitution activities.
Directs the collection of recidivism data for adults sentenced to a period of probation.
Requires certain accuracy standards for child support wage garnishments.
Eliminates statute of limitations for prosecution of human trafficking crimes.
Concerns human trafficking of a minor.
Permits human trafficking victims to testify by closed circuit television under certain circumstances.
Specifies bringing minor to animal fight as crime of third degree; establishes civil penalty therefor.
Establishes exemption for solar panel installation in certain wetland areas on farmland.
Expands registration requirements under Megan's Law to include persons committing human trafficking crimes or engaging in prostitution, when crimes involve minors.

Requires State, counties, municipalities, and instrumentalities thereof to post public employee contracts on respective websites; requires posting on Civil Service Commission's website when local unit does not maintain own website.
Directs State Agriculture Development Committee to establish limited transfer of development rights program for permanent retirement of certain residential development rights on preserved farmland.
Authorizes subdivision of certain preserved farms into smaller preserved farms under certain circumstances.
Makes various revisions to scrap metal law.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Requires municipal court judge to disclose to governing body of municipality information concerning certain decisions by the Advisory Committee on Judicial Conduct.
Establishes security standards for judicial hearings at mental health facilities.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.
Prohibits payment of public employee bonuses not directly contingent upon achieving certain performance goals.
Prohibits certain public utilities from sending residential customers redundant written notice of enrollment in government energy aggregation programs.
Directs the collection by the Administrative Office of the Courts of data about crimes committed by persons released on bail.
Extends and expands the scope of the "Local Unit Electronic Technology Pilot Program and Study Act."
Clarifies the effect of abstention by a member of a public body.
Requires certain persons licensed or appointed to inspect homes to pass criminal history background check.

Requires elected public officials and candidates for elective public office to disclose if they ever filed for bankruptcy; requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Requires public bodies to allow public comment at every meeting.
Requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Requires any candidate convicted of crimes or offenses to return campaign contributions to donors; freezes most campaign funds of candidates indicted for crimes or offenses.
Establishes certain apprentice hunting licenses.
Allows person to request voluntary exclusion from gaming activities without acknowledging being problem gambler.
Requires that certain information be redacted from motor vehicle accident reports submitted to the public.
Creates a civil cause of action for stalking.
Adds conviction of unlawfully possessing weapon to list of crimes that statutorily prohibits someone from buying or owning firearm.
Limits forum of consumer contract disputes to New Jersey.
Upgrades crime of manslaughter to aggravated manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Requires Local Finance Board in DCA to exercise oversight of certain local authority employment contracts and approve, when applicable, employee and board member travel expenses in excess of $250.
Establishes certain restrictions on aerial advertising above sports and entertainment facilities.
Increases penalties for contractors who victimize clients during states of emergency.
Provides for no net loss of DEP lands for fishing, hunting, and trapping purposes.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to develop and promote NJ Heritage Weekend.
Dedesignates portions of Route 24.
Exempts certain persons from HVACR licensing requirement; clarifies definition of heating, ventilating, air conditioning, and refrigeration.
Provides for nursing home reimbursement adjustment for cost of energy improvements.
Establishes pilot program to provide educational support for foster children; appropriates $900,000.
Establishes one-year moratorium on replacement of copper-based landline telephone service with wireless telephone service; requires BPU to report to Governor and Legislature. *
Waives certain professional and occupational licensing fees for veterans and spouses of veterans.
Creates offense of financial exploitation of the elderly.
Prohibits bad faith assertion of patent infringement.
Creates New Jersey Innovation Council Program.
Modernizes business filing statutes to include entity conversion and domestication.
Clarifies law authorizing application of reciprocal limitations against businesses from states that give in-state preference in awarding public contracts.
Concerns proof of workers' compensation coverage with certain legally required annual reports of employers.
Establishes "Art in Storefronts" initiative within the Main Street New Jersey program.
Establishes "Tourism Mentor and Matchmaker Program" in Department of State.
Authorizes NJ State Council on the Arts to establish program to promote developing artist projects on website and collect donations for projects on behalf of artist.
Amends "Main Street New Jersey" program to provide assistance to arts and tourism organizations.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to create webpage listing wall murals in NJ.
Requires Treasurer and Divisions of Pensions and Benefits and Investment Directors to report on status of State-administered pension plans to Legislature by May 15 and November 15 each year.
Provides a plan to rebalance State resources to provide community services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities.

"Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act"; enhances film and digital media tax credits, revises and expands tax credit eligibility requirements, and requires EDA to study development of film studio at North Jersey location.*
"Autumn Joy Stillbirth Research and Dignity Act"; requires DOH to establish protocols for stillbirths, establishes stillbirth research data base.
Requires State agencies to post Internet links to programs and services for women as applicable.
Eatablishes requirements for pharmacists to dispense biological products.*
Requires body of water between Korean peninsula and Japan be called "East Sea" for all governmental purposes.
Requires elevators in new buildings be at least a certain size.
Requires certain notifications and free credit reports for customers following breach of security of personal information within business or public entity.
Provides remedies for certain fraudulent financing statements.*
Clarifies that corporation may adopt "force the vote" provision in plan of merger or consolidation; allows directors to amend plan of merger or consolidation prior to effectiveness of plan.
Clarifies scope of corporate by-laws; provides that by-laws may include forum selection clause.
Authorizes special Island Spirit license plate.
Requires voter registration forms be made available when applying for hunting, fishing, or trapping license.
Prohibits candidates and elected public officials charged with crimes from using campaign contributions for their legal defense.
Prohibits member of Legislature from performing certain no-bid contracts.
Establishes new standard and procedure for forfeiture of elective public office for accepting illegal contributions; removes illegal contribution threshold for such forfeiture.
Permits MVC to issue registration plates to certain mechanics who rehabilitate and sell used motor vehicles.
Prohibits campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations that purchase or acquire property involved in eminent domain proceedings.
Requires public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions to reimburse public entities for legal expenses.
Prohibits awarding of municipal professional services contracts to members of Legislature.
Establishes certain minimum standards for State contracts paid on hourly basis.
Prohibits awarding of municipal professional services contracts to certain elected officials.
Extends county-based real property assessment pilot program to Atlantic County.
Authorizes retired law enforcement officers to provide security in public schools.
Requires installation of emergency power supply systems to certain common areas of new planned real estate developments; provides related tax incentives.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.
Limits upfront costs for oral anticancer medications for persons covered under certain health benefits plans.
Directs State Board of Agriculture and Dept. of Agriculture to adopt regulations concerning confinement of pregnant sows during gestation.
The "New Jersey Homeowners' Equity Protection Act."
Expands scope of claims subject to "Health Claims Authorization, Processing and Payment Act," and modifies certain claims procedures.
Appropriates $250,000 to Department of Children and Families for grants to rape care crisis centers.
Excludes appropriations to reserve for uncollected taxes in excess of two percent from calculations of municipal adjusted tax levy.
Regulates sale of olive oil.
Requires, after study, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem, and requires DEP to adopt nutrient standards for NJ marine waters.
Requires, after assessment, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem.
Establishes forest harvest demonstration program in pinelands area.
Authorizes Ocean County Planning Board and municipal planning boards in Ocean County to take certain measures to control stormwater runoff and nonpoint source pollution in Barnegat Bay watershed.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.

Authorizes the State, with prior approval by the State House Commission, to use eminent domain power to acquire lands for recreation and conservation purposes provided lands are protective of drinking water sources.
Expands programs in BPU to include low-interest loans and grants to municipalities for energy efficient programs and innovative energy technologies.
Revises "New Jersey Money Transmitters Act"; provides consumer protections; increases reporting and record keeping requirements.
Allows installation of solar arrays by municipalities on preserved open space in certain circumstances.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits and approvals for development related to drilling for oil and natural gas off NJ coast.
Applies prevailing wage to work on Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital grounds and facilities.
Establishes $2 surcharge upon building permits for payments to Community Health Law Project.
Requires Site Improvement Advisory Board to offer recommendations to encourage sustainable development.
Establishes the Renewable Energy Infrastructure and Advanced Technology Vehicle Task Force.
Requires financial institution to notify account holder when information relative to an electronic fund transfer is shared with third party.
Establishes registry of stroke cases in State.
Increases fees charged for marriage or civil union licenses and dedicates monies to Displaced Homemakers Trust Fund.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DHSS.
Concerns NJ Transit's treatment of people with guide or service dogs; establishes Access Link Customer Service Group.
Raises allowable speed for low-speed vehicles to 35 miles per hour.
Providing for AG representation of employees of county prosecutors' offices in certain civil actions and providing for State indemnification in certain cases.
Provides grants and tax credits for school districts and private contractors for installing cameras on school buses.
Upgrades penalties for eluding police officer if stolen vehicle involved.
Requires criminal history background check for owners and employees of home service enterprises.
Requires local law enforcement officer or firefighter prescribed anabolic steroids or human growth hormone to report to designated physician for evaluation of fitness for duty.
Requires BPU financial incentives for photovoltaic equipment for residences that are Energy Star compliant receive preferred treatment.
Creates Witnesses of Crime Protection Program Fund and assess $25 penalty on persons convicted of crimes.
Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates revenue from tax rate increase for direct real property tax relief for taxpayers.
Establishes requirements for newly installed and replacement electric utility poles and transmission towers.
Establishes financial incentives for certain energy providers to conduct energy audits.
Allows for 75 percent of costs of energy audits undertaken for commercial buildings be paid for by societal benefits charge.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Makes various revisions to operations of local tax collector's and assessor's offices.
Establishes publicly accessible domestic violence Internet registry.
Authorizes permits for certain New Jersey casinos for interstate and foreign Internet wagering; requires Internet gaming payment processors be licensed as casino service industry enterprises.
Modifies interest rates and accrual of interest on certain unpaid water and sewer utility bills and delinquent municipal taxes, assessments, and other municipal liens and charges.
Re-establishes moratorium on the imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until 2016.
Prohibits new employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.
The "Jobs, Trade and Democracy Act."
Consumer Electronics Warranty Lemon Law.
Exempts certain car-sharing programs from motor vehicle rental fees.
Creates new offenses and penalties regarding animal fighting.
Prohibits charging vehicle storage fees for days on which storage facility is closed.
Provides prescriber or health care facility with discretion to number prescription blank forms consecutively.
Authorizes Office of Public Defender to provide legal representation for child in proceedings after parental rights have been terminated.
Provides that a homestead owner who is 65 years of age or older or disabled shall not receive a homestead rebate of less than $1,440.

Provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes to small and medium-sized businesses for certain export and export promotion activity; designated as the Export Promotion Tax Credit Act.
Prohibits insurers offering managed care plans from denying participation in network to health care providers willing to meet terms of contract.
Requires for-profit hospitals to report certain information to DHSS.
Requires hospitals and health care professionals to offer hepatitis C testing to certain individuals.
Requires public schools to include instruction on oral health as part of core curriculum content standards.
Requires health care providers to observe certain practices concerning collection of outstanding balances on patient accounts.
Requires assisted living residences and comprehensive personal care homes to ensure connection of emergency cords in residential units to facility staff.
Exempts certain surviving spouses and surviving civil union partners of certain disabled veterans from components of the realty transfer fee.
Bars certain employees of certain public agencies from participating in PERS; repeals law permitting PERS and TPAF members on leave who work for labor organization to purchase pension credit.
Requires emergency action plans for delivery of oxygen to patient residences during public health emergency.
Provides for screening newborn infants for genetic mutations associated with hereditary hemochromatosis.
"Judy and Nikki's Law"; provides for life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of murder of a child 16 years of age or younger.
Revises requirements for private investigator identification cards.
Modifies powers and allocation of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.*
Establishes "New Jersey Out-of-School Time Advisory Commission" to review before-school, after-school and summer programs; appropriates $60,000.
Requires private passenger automobile insurance buyer's guide to include both range of premium rate credit and actual dollar savings for coverage selections.
Establishes the "Superstorm Sandy Bill of Rights."*
Terminates imposition of general purpose fee under realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on purchases of residential real property selling for more than $1,000,000.
Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
Establishes cross-acceptance of local master plans; intermunicipal review of certain development applications.
Concerns payment of certain TDI and family temporary disability leave benefits.
The "Save the Hudson River Palisades Act."
Establishes de minimus levels for regulation of air contaminants and hazardous air pollutants, and directs DEP to establish de minimus levels for regulation of hazardous substances.
Prohibits unilateral changing of terms and conditions of employment by public employers.
"Parkinson's Disease Public Awareness and Education Act."
Establishes Rail Passenger Bill of Rights and authorizes Division of Consumer Affairs to enforce provisions.
Requires nursing homes to permit use of electronic monitoring devices at request of resident.
Authorizes municipalities to facilitate private financing of water conservation, storm shelter construction, and flood and hurricane resistance projects through use of voluntary special assessments.*
Provides for priority consideration, by DCA, DEP, DOT, and municipalities, of permit applications for green building projects.
Requires OAL to maintain Internet database summarizing all State rule-making actions.
Exempts from real property taxation during construction any building, or portion thereof, to be used for a property tax-exempt purpose.
Requires development of fact sheet about bedbugs to be posted on the Department of Education's website.
Establishes Sex Offender Management Commission; amends Megan's Law in response to federal Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006.
Directs Attorney General to develop plan to disseminate Amber and Silver Alert information through social media.
Establishes "Energy Infrastructure Study Commission."
Requires Division of Rate Counsel to evaluate NJT fare increases and determine whether increases are necessary and fair to NJT customers.
Provides consumer protections under certain telecommunications service provider contracts.
Establishes "Solar Equipment Purchase and Installation Assistance Program" in NJ EDA.
Appropriates $2 million in constitutionally dedicated CBT revenues for hazardous substance discharge remediation to DEP for White Swan Cleaners/Sun Cleaners Superfund site cleanup in Monmouth County.

Lengthens amber light at traffic signal with red light camera; sets penalty for failing to stop before turning right on red when detected by red light camera; implements half-second delay for red light camera violations.
Requires life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of the murder of a minor under the age of 18 in the course of the commission of a sex crime.
Regulates Internet pharmacies and electronic prescriptions.
Requires certain employers to plan and implement traffic reduction programs for employees.

Permits electric public utilities, electric power suppliers, and basic generation service providers to enter into certain agreements with building owners for use of solar energy systems for such buildings.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of fuel cell vehicles.
Provides that beginning with the 2016-2017 grade nine class, Advanced Placement computer science course may satisfy a part of the mathematics credits required for high school graduation.*
Revises certain aspects of the New Jersey Individual Development Account Program.*
Requires registration of certain vacant and abandoned properties with municipalities and permits municipalities to require protective measures be taken for such properties.
Pertains to certain review and approval responsibilities of land surveyors.
Establishes standards regarding the disqualification of claimants for unemployment compensation for misconduct.
Imposes limits on fees charged for discovery in municipal court matters.
Allows corporations to indemnify corporate agents without approval from board of directors.
Concerns homeowners insurance coverage with respect to dogs harbored on insured property.
Establishes sexual assault training requirements for law enforcement officers.
Prohibits school districts from declaring as absent child performers who meet certain criteria.
Permits taxing districts to credit amount of excess taxes paid to first two quarterly payments of local budget year next following date of final judgment, after successful appeal.
Establishes "New Jersey Racetrack Growth and Development Fund" on behalf of eligible lessees of the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority.
Requires Commissioner of Health to examine certain records of nursing home residents' personal funds, and provides that misappropriation of funds is grounds for cause of action.
Clarifies factors currently used by courts to determine when child support orders can be terminated.
Excludes veterans' benefits from calculation of financial obligation for care at psychiatric facility.
Requires court order to transfer person awaiting hearing for involuntary commitment from private hospital to State psychiatric hospital.

Requires certain psychiatric facilities to contact Division of Child Protection and Permanency if minor is to be discharged and parent or guardian is unable or unwilling to remove minor from facility.
Provides for three year retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
Concerns financial responsibility for inmates and certain legally charged patients transferred to psychiatric hospitals.
Eliminates duplicative requirements for notification to counties of admissions for Division of Developmental Disabilities residential services and for maintenance of those records.
Codifies standard for rehospitalization after conditional discharge from psychiatric facitlity.
Requires DOC to transfer certain payments of restitution to Victims of Crime Compensation Office.*
Excludes certain conveyances of graves, crypts and niches from 15% fee charged by cemetery company.
Creates "Real Property Revaluation Review Commission."
Authorizes county government to appoint county assessor for taxes.
"New Jersey Tuition Equality for America's Military (NJTEAM) Act;" provides in-State tuition at New Jersey public institutions of higher education to military veterans.

Revises animal cruelty provisions concerning euthanizing and impoundment of animals, and provisions for court disposition of seized animals; establishes civil penalty for improper euthanizing of animals; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Allows judge to admit evidence of prior sexual offenses in current sexual offense actions.

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.
Excludes veterans' entitlements from income for determination of PAAD eligibility.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members on federal active duty to temporarily defer mortgage loan payments and suspend property tax payments.***
Clarifies that certain former New Jersey National Guard members may be eligible for higher education tuition assistance.
Requires property tax bills to contain eligibility information on State tax relief programs.
Permits, as approved by court, use of assistance dogs by certain victims or witnesses when giving testimony on certain offenses.
Establishes new crimes concerning killing or injuring service dogs, and upgrades crimes involving killing or injuring certain other animals.
Prohibits multiple coverage for public employer health care benefits as employee, dependent, or retiree.
Provides exceptions to garnish exemption against benefits from State-administered pension systems for certain financial claims under State law.
Provides that healthcare benefits plan, fully or partly paid by public employer, cannot cover public employee's spouse who is subject of divorce from bed and board.
Transfers New Jersey State Forestry Services and related entities to Department of Agriculture.

Prohibits DEP from charging fee for mobile sportfishing vehicle permit to any NJ resident who is a veteran, active military member, former or current member of the NJ National Guard or Reserve, or a volunteer emergency worker.
Preserves judicial duty of impartiality by prohibiting certain communications by local government officers or employees with municipal court judges or candidates for municipal court judgeships.
Establishes new crimes concerning commercial exploitation of a child.
Authorizes issuance of restraining orders for situtations in which domestic violence statutes do not apply.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support farm to school and school gardens programs.
Allows contributions to "New Jersey Farm to School Program.*
Establishes "Best in New Jersey 'Farm to School' Awards Program" to annually recognize the best farm to school programs implemented by a school or school district.
Directs the Dept. of Agriculture to establish a clearinghouse website for farmers to offer produce and dairy products for use by school breakfast programs, school lunch programs, and food banks.*
Increases loss ratio reporting and disclosure requirements for carriers offering individual and group health insurance plans; applies loss ratio requirement to large group health insurance plans.
Requires that certain motor vehicle surcharge revenues be dedicated to the Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Establishes maximum payment to virtual charter schools and requires State to pay portion of costs for first five years.
Authorizes certain gestational carrier agreements.*
Directs portion of Unclaimed Child Support Trust Fund be used to balance certain unpaid receivables of State agency responsible for disbursement of child support.
Excludes from State gross income tax certain payments made to the families of victims of school violence.
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson in the Division of Consumer Affairs.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Coordination Among Nonprofit Social Service Organizations.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to provide every person engaged in raising a dog for guide or service the right to access public facilities.
Removes monk parakeet from list of potentially dangerous species.
Establishes Become A Nurse license plates and dedicates fees for nursing scholarships.
Establishes Medicaid demonstration project to cover room and board services for certain terminally ill patients in the home or other non-institutional setting.
Establishes the authority of the court to order electronic monitoring of certain convicted domestic violence offenders.
"Innovative Services for Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act."
Revises procedure for issuance of amended birth certificate for person who has undergone change in sex.
Requires State agencies to review operations and to implement use of Internet to conduct public business when cost savings may be realized, with certain exceptions.
Permits voter registration up to 29 days before an election; reduces polling place hours by one hour in the morning.
Requires Family Part under certain circumstances to dispose of charge of contempt of a domestic violence order on an emergency basis, without setting bail.
Allows TPAF retiree to be employed as certificated superintendent or administrator for limited time frame due to critical need without TPAF reenrollment.
Imposes criminal penalties for discharges of untreated sewage from containment devices installed on watercraft.
Restricts gifts to certified homemaker-home health aides from patients.
Makes various changes to the "Law Against Discrimination"; repeals section 4 of P.L.1985, c.73.
Provides for 30-day period for filing notice of appeal on matters adjudicated in municipal courts.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Provides for decrease and eventual ban on use of non-compostable plastic grocery bags.
Provides purchasing preference to local and environmentally responsible businesses in awarding of State contracts.
Provides for voluntary contributions to the "Homelessness Prevention Program" through real estate sales.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program.
Exempts carsharing rentals from State imposed $5 per day motor vehicle rental fee.
Requires green building standards for affordable housing construction.
Restricts health insurers from limiting access to pain medication.
Authorizes special "We Support the Arts" license plates with proceeds to the New Jersey State Council on the Arts.
Requires retail pharmacies to stock and dispense emergency contraception.
Allows gross income tax deduction for 50% of contributions of $100 or more to domestic violence shelters.
Requires forms and materials for individuals with developmental disabilities to be available in languages other than English.
Provides that children under care, custody or supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Extends health benefits coverage of a newborn infant.
Establishes "Task Force To Review Residential Community Release Programs" to review this State's halfway houses and make recommendations concerning security and inmate services.
Establishes Menhaden Personal Use and Limited Sale License, and permits use of certain gear for taking of menhaden.
Permits court to order involuntary outpatient treatment in any county; concerns patient compliance with taking medication.
Establishes gubernatorial veto power over Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor's meeting minutes; expands gubernatorial oversight powers over commission.
Provides for replacement of incandescent light bulbs in public school buildings with energy-efficient light bulbs.*
Limits rescheduling, cancelation, and no-show fees providers of health care services may charge in certain instances.
Requires State to offer surplus State Police vehicles to certain volunteer fire and emergency service organizations.
Creates grant program for municipalities to establish Light of the Missing; appropriates $100,000.
Invalidates consumer contracts which require a waiver of right to file a consumer complaint.
Requires Department of the Treasury to collect for overpayment of UI benefits.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credits for purchase and installation of certain electric vehicle charging stations.
Designates September 11 each year "September 11 Remembrance Day" in New Jersey.
Prohibits businesses that outsource jobs overseas from receiving State contracts or grants; prohibits investment of State funds in such businesses.
Limits caseload of parole officers who monitor sex offenders to 40.
Prohibits certain elected public office holders from simultaneously holding more than one elective office.
Prohibits person from serving as officer of more than two political campaign committees.

Establishes measures to deter steroid use among students; appropriates $45,000 to DOE for New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association testing of student-athletes for steroids and other performance enhancing substances.*
Requires medical examination and submission of student work portfolios for home-schooled children; provides that children under supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Requires an application fee to be paid to the DOE when applying to establish a charter school.
Increases benefit amounts under New Jersey earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal earned income tax credit amounts beginning in Tax Year 2014.
Permits conduct of lottery games on Internet.
Requires each county to establish and maintain veterans' service office.
Changes title of animal cruelty investigator to "municipal humane law enforcement officer" and defines term in statute.
Immunizes from civil liability first responders who forcibly enter property to provide emergency assistance.
Provides certain small businesses impacted by Hurricane Sandy a corporation business tax or gross income tax credit for certain reinvestment in Shore municipalities.
Eliminates exemption from noise control restrictions for certain bars in Atlantic City Tourism District.*
Establishes "MVP Emergency Alert System" for missing persons with mental, intellectual, or developmental disabilities.*
Permits NJ boat manufacturers to qualify for EDA loans for renewable energy technology, equipment, or systems.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Underground Utility Lines.
Establishes a "Local Authorities Review Commission."
Clarifies that the implementation of a municipal court security plan, shall be at the discretion of the municipal governing body.
Requires continuing education for licensed practicing psychologists.
Establishes "New Jersey Higher Education Funding Formula Commission."
"Economic Opportunity Act of 2014, Part 1."
Requires one-time application for requesting services for individuals with developmental disabilities from DCF and DHS.
Requires boil water notices be provided to mayor and municipal clerk within one hour.
Allows industrial hemp farming; establishes industrial hemp license.*

Requires immediate forfeiture of public office, position or employment, without application by the prosecutor, for public officials and employees convicted under federal law of certain public corruption offenses.
Concerns alterations in child support obligations in response to changes to status of supported child.
Appropriates $3.5 million to Phillip Alampi Beneficial Insect Rearing Laboratory improvements project.
Prohibits administration of standardized assessments not required under State or federal law.
Allows parent, guardian, or adult student to prevent disclosure of student information to certain entities.
Enhances penalty for leaving the scene of boating accident.
Requires hotels to upgrade phone systems to allow guests to dial 9-1-1 without first dialing any other digit.
Directs NJTA to study and report on potential revenue generating services of NJTA rest areas and service plazas.
Extends deadline for developer to submit temporary certificate of occupancy for an Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant Program qualified residential project.
Clarifies that fishing license is not required to fish at a private community lake.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.
Prohibits smoking at State-owned beaches.
Requires that a teacher's evaluation take into consideration the degree of parental involvement and the impact it has on student achievement.
Permits local unit to contract with private entities to lease advertising space on local unit's official Internet website.
Establishes compensation program for State and juvenile corrections officers and parole officers injured while performing official duties.
Authorizes the court to issue restraining orders to defendants charged with a crime as a condition of release on bail.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain employers engaged in farming operations.
Creates the crime of victimization of a senior citizen or a person with a disability.
Clarifies law concerning the advertising and promoting of NJ farm products.

Increases salary of certain government officials; codifies legislative district office allowance and legislative director salary; opens PERS enrollment to certain elected officers; eliminates PERS/TPAF disability insurance.
Eliminates school district budget per pupil administrative cost limits.
Permits municipalities to purchase and issue certain surplus retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
Authorizes local option tax on seller of billboard advertising space.
Permits public records custodian to require deposit for OPRA record requests exceeding $15.
Permits juveniles to be admitted to drug court program under certain circumstances.
Revises application and issuance procedures for employment certificates for minors.
Requires DCA to promulgate certain fire safety regulations concerning upholstered furniture and furnishings purchased for use in residential premises and public buildings.
Exempts various local units of government from State permitting fees and permits the reimbursement of violation fines under certain circumstances.
Provides for State assumption of the costs of the county prosecutors' offices.
Requires DCA to adopt energy inspection code, and requires licensed home inspector to report energy analysis for each home inspected for buyer in contemplation of purchase.
Permits establishment of municipal employee early retirement incentive programs.

Authorizes local governments to license the use of, or sell in fee simple or as an easement interest, public roads within a municipality to connect a non-contiguous solar, wind, combined heat and power, or biomass generation facility with an end-use customer; requires public utility to provide for the connection.
Adds Sons of The American Legion to list of organizations whose representatives receive paid leaves of absence to attend State and national conventions.
Requires use of headlights on motor vehicles when motor vehicle is operated in an area of highway construction or repair.
Grants subpoena power to Office of Inspector General at Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in furtherance of investigations.
Requires funds collected through societal benefits charge not allocated be credited to electric and gas public utility customers.
Establishes right to immediate interlocutory appeal from determinations as to class certification in class action lawsuits.
Requires insurers and SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for ovarian cancer.

Requires issue advocacy organization disclosure; increases disclosure of campaign finance information; raises amount of money contributable to committees; modifies restrictions on contributions by certain business entities performing public contracts.
Allows Attorney General to prevent halfway house placement of murderers.

Authorizes Judiciary to revise or supplement filing and other fees, subject to limitations, to fund Legal Services of New Jersey and e-court information system; requires review and reporting on fees and expenditures of such fees.
Requires electric public utilities to implement flood mitigation plans for electric distribution substations and transfer stations in certain flood zones.
Provides that 20% of fee charged for initial certified copy of birth certificate shall be used to support certain activities of NJ Cord Blood Bank.
Makes certain access changes to open public records act; establishes State public finance website and creates program for development of local websites; makes appropriation.

Establishes Commission on State-owned Historic Sites in Department of State, transfers administration of State-owned historic sites to commission, and transfers historic preservation programs from DEP to Department of State.
Provides that farm, farmstand, or other agricultural operation selling firewood obtained from property other than seller's shall not be considered a lumber yard.
Prohibits use of public funds for embryonic stem cell research.
Requires designation of certain intersections for alternative emergency power generator in event of Statewide emergency.
Directs BPU to undertake public awareness campaign concerning telecommunications carriers, including mobile and Voice over Internet Protocol service providers, and disclosure of customer information.
Requires State Board of Medical Examiners to conduct international criminal history background checks and check employer references for licensees.
Provides for certification for emergency medical technicians to administer opioid antidotes.
"The New Jersey Social Innovation Act"; establishes social innovation loan pilot program and study commission within EDA.

Requires DOT and NJTA to conduct study on options to reduce traffic congestion on Interstate 295 and rectify underutilization of NJ Turnpike by motorists traveling in Burlington, Camden, Gloucester, and Salem Counties.
Allows municipality to petition county for removal of abandoned vessel; provides that vessel after declared state of emergency.**
"Invest in New Jersey First Act;" requires preference in awarding certain contracts for critical infrastructure projects.
Allows "Coastal Protection Trust Fund" monies to be used to separate combined sewer systems.
Establishes "County Tourism Incentive Grant Fund" within Department of Treasury to provide funding for grants to counties to support tourism advertising and promotion.
Defines reasonable deviations in the course of transporting firearms.
Directs DOT and NJT to study and report on transportation infrastructure needs in coastal counties.
Increases maximum municipal contribution to fire districts and volunteer fire companies; indexes amount biennially for inflation.
Prohibits DEP from reducing fishing quotas established by federal or regional entities, unless authorized by law.
Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority to hold regular meetings in various counties in the State.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Transfers administration of certain nutrition programs to Department of Agriculture.
Increases minimum penalty for aggravated manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for fish and wildlife management and conservation.
Authorizes special striped bass license plate.*
Provides for representation of certain regions of State on New Jersey Turnpike Authority.
Makes direct deposit the default distribution method for gross income tax refunds and allows gross income tax refunds via prepaid debit cards.
Repeals all prevailing wage laws.
Provides that labor union representatives cannot be compelled to disclose certain information.
Requires actual transportation occur as a condition of billing for ambulance services.
Requires executive county superintendent of schools to establish a county-wide school calendar.
Includes certain deceptive practices in the advertising of floral or ornamental products or services as a violation of the consumer fraud act.
Revises distribution of Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund.
Provides Medicaid coverage for family planning services to individuals with incomes up to 200 percent of the federal poverty level.

Requires prequalification process for prospective bidders on school district transportation contracts; authorizes debarment of bidders convicted of certain crimes; authorizes disqualification of bidder or termination of transportation contract for certain crimes by an employee.

Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements and to approve school district collective negotiations agreements prior to execution of agreement.

Removes statutory requirement that health officers and registered environmental health specialists employed by municipalities receive maximum salary within their range within five years from date of appointment.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of compressed natural gas vehicles.

Requires high school students to be assessed using college placement cut scores to determine readiness for college-level course work, and Commissioner of Education to develop plan to improve college and career counseling for students.
Provides that no more than 120 credits will be required for baccalaureate degree awarded by a public institution and no more than 60 credits for an associate degree.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish a communication and incentive plan to encourage re-enrollment in college; requires Statewide reverse transfer agreement.

Requires independent colleges report certain consumer information on their websites; requires information on remedial instruction to be provided by certain colleges; directs how remedial education is delivered at four-year public and independent colleges.*
Requires county colleges to develop plan to achieve three-year graduation rate of at least 33 percent for full-time degree-program students by 2019-2020 academic year.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish common course numbering system for public institutions of higher education.*
Establishes the New Jersey School Counts County College Scholarship Program.

Prohibits four-year public and independent institutions of higher education from increasing New Jersey resident undergraduate tuition and fees for nine continuous semesters following student's initial enrollment.*
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to study prevalence, cost, and quality of certain on-line courses compared to traditional classroom courses offered by institutions of higher education.*
Requires institutions of higher education to develop open textbooks available to students at no charge and requires buyback of used textbooks at 50 percent of purchase price.
Allows gross income tax deduction for certain student loan interest.

Prohibits four-year public and independent institutions of higher education from requiring students to purchase meal plans and permits the institutions to only offer meal plans in the form of a spending allowance.
Requires development of longitudinal data system that maintains individuals' data from preschool through entry into workforce.
Requires closure of a four-year public institution of higher education that fails to achieve a six-year graduation rate of at least 50% for full-time undergraduate students.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to revoke proprietary school's license to award academic degrees if school fails to achieve certain minimum graduation rates.
Requires New Jersey Educational Facilities Authority to annually prepare report on debt held by public institutions of higher education.
Requires State Auditor to conduct audit of fees charged by public institutions of higher education.

Requires all school districts and public institutions of higher education to offer dual enrollment programs to provide college-level instruction to high school students and requires these students be charged a reduced tuition rate.
Requires certain undergraduate students to file degree plan and requires public institutions of higher education to develop pathway systems to graduation.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."
Repeals the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote."
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program.
Prohibits posting, publishing on the Internet, or disclosing certain information regarding law enforcement officers.*
Requires notification to Division of Child Protection and Permanency upon arrest of child's primary caregiver.
Reduces thresholds for certain heroin offenses.
Prohibits a person from charging a fee to stop publishing personal identifying information obtained through the criminal justice system.
Concerns occupational safety and health for public employees of certain interstate authorities.
Allows gross income tax deductions totaling $300,000 over five taxable years for certain primary care physicians.
Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to make payment to school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing upon adoption of resolution by municipal governing body.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to reimburse school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing and adjusts recipient districts' tax levy growth limit.
Requires beneficiary photo to be included on State-issued benefit debit cards.
Authorizes State Agricultural Development Committee to permit operation of certain microenterprises on certain preserved farms; designated as "New Jersey Rural Microenterprise Act."
Expands school breakfast program to all schools with 5% or more of students eligible for free or reduced price meals.
Requires DHS to develop timeline for use by individuals with developmental disabilities to gain benefit of State and federal programs; requires posting timeline on DHS, DCF, and DOE websites.
