Legalizes possession of one ounce or less of marijuana, subject to voter approval.
Requires DHS to make list of drugs with "black box" warnings accessible through its website.
Permits chair or booth rentals for the purpose of providing cosmetology and hairstyling services or ancillary services.
Requires registered qualifying patient's authorized use of medical marijuana to be considered equivalent to use of any other prescribed medication.
Increases membership of State Police Retirement System Board of Trustees; requires membership to include two active and two retired members.
Provides that gift certificates and cards shall not expire or contain dormancy fees.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from selling from ice cream trucks.

"Military Dependents Scholarship Fund Act"; provides college scholarships to the spouses and children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, or Operation New Dawn.
Clarifies deadline to request mail-in ballot application.
Eliminates requirement that candidates file with county clerk duplicate copy of report of contributions and expenditures; requires each county provide link to ELEC on county Internet site. *
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption, and clarifies municipal planning or zoning authority, for certain development along commercial corridors in Highlands Region.
Requires DEP to send notice of decision on certain freshwater wetlands permit applications to certain individuals via postcard.
Requires retail motor fuel dealer to use generator during power outage.
Establishes new crime of official interference with transportation.
Establishes a fixed term for Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director of PANYNJ; requires approval from Governors of New Jersey and New York prior to employment of directors.
Requires State Comptroller to receive and provide certain independent authority employee information on State Comptroller's website.
Requires bi-state transportation authorities to make advance notification of certain projects or operations expected to impede traffic.
Codifies "Project Medicine Drop" program; requires Division of Consumer Affairs to maintain secure prescription medicine drop-off receptacles at certain law enforcement agencies.*
Establishes "Truck Operator Independent Contractor Act."
Provides an adjustment to school district tax levy cap for increases in special education costs per pupil in excess of $40,000 that exceed such prior year costs by more than 2%.
Requires court appearance for certain motor vehicle offenses that occur in school zone.
Dedicates up to $150,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach State Park to special fund to be used to support certain park programs, and makes an appropriation from the fund.
"Stormwater Management and Combined Sewer Overflow Abatement Bond Act of 2014," authorizes bonds for $50,000,000, and appropriates $5,000.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.

Provides municipality with affordable housing credit toward its municipal fair share housing obligation for funds transferred to the New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund pursuant to P.L.2008, c.46.
Provides procedures for crediting certain dwellings used by agricultural workers in determination of municipality's fair share housing obligation.
"Property Assessment Appeal Transparency Act"; revises content of required annual notification of real property assessment.
Eliminates prohibition against purchasing more than one handgun in calendar month.
Prohibits release of illegal immigrants from correctional facilities.
Allows certain self-employed business owners to deduct their own pension plan contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Establishes procedures and standards regarding public services privatization contracts.
Provides counties and municipalities with additional discretion when leasing public land for agricultural or horticultural use.
Clarifies law regarding local public contract specifications and leases of public land for agricultural or horticultural use.
Authorizes educational service providers to provide in-district special education instructional programs.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for enrollment at a New Jersey college or university.
Clarifies that certain offenders who drive during periods of license suspension are eligible for certain alternatives to incarceration.

Authorizes court to waive certain fees, offer mediation as sentence; authorizes defendant information in presentence report; reduces certain expungement waiting periods; requires benefits be considered in juvenile plan.
Authorizes waiver of license revocation process for certain child support obligors.
Requires training for constables.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.
Expands statute authorizing temporary restraining orders for certain alleged stalking victims to include victims of any age or mental capacity.
Increases penalty for operating motor vehicle equipped with television located or positioned so screen is visible to the driver.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
Establishes various good governance requirements at certain bi-state authorities.
Establishes various good governance requirements at State and local authorities.

Requires teacher preparation program for instuctional certificate to include certain amount of instruction or clinical experience in special education and for students with disabilities endorsement to include credit hours in autism spectrum disorder.**

Provides 50% State matching funds to support shared services agreements between municipalities and districts with efficient pupil transportation systems for the provision of public school hazardous busing.
Establishes voluntary program to provide caregivers of children diagnosed with autism and other developmental disabilities with GPS tracking devices; designated as "Avonte's Law."
Provides that any superintendent salary caps adopted by the commissioner will apply to charter school administrators.
Grants prescriptive authority to certain psychologists.
Exempts board of education and local government payments to entities under BPU jurisdiction from certain certification requirements.*
Permits municipalities to use portion of State aid under Clean Communities Program for snow and ice removal.
Requires Attorney General to establish Statewide gun buyback program.
Prohibits incarcerated individuals from receiving Medicaid, Work First New Jersey, or Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits.
Permits holders of certain alcoholic beverage licenses to be issued amusement game license.
Excludes certain federal employee Thrift Savings Fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Extends from one to two years after leaving employment period during which Executive Branch department heads cannot act as governmental affairs agent.
Makes various changes to law addressing meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and information about meetings.
Provides that teaching staff member's annual summative evaluation rating for the 2013-2014 and 2014-2015 school years will not include a student growth percentile; delays use of certain assessment.

Requires executive county superintendent to provide financial and educational information regarding formation of all purpose regional school district to districts proposing a withdrawal from or dissolution of a limited purpose regional school district.
Establishes licensing program in Department of Agriculture for farmed deer and other cervids.
Concerns withholdings and deductions from employee wages for certain payments.
"Licensed Wildlife Rehabilitator Act"; establishes licensure requirements for wildlife rehabilitators.
Excludes from gross income compensation paid to members of district boards of election for services rendered in elections.
Excludes certain district boards of election poll workers from employee wage withholding and coverage under UI, TDI, and family disability leave insurance programs.
"Common Interest Community Manager Licensing Act."
Requires any POW-MIA flag purchased with State funds be manufactured in United States.
Prohibits employment discrimination based on applicant employment status.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for capital gains from sale of certain employer securities by qualified business that result in net positive benefit to the State.
Establishes additional county recording fees to support "New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund."
Designates Black Swallowtail butterfly as State Butterfly.

Provides for use of directed trust to administer particular assets separate from other assets placed in trust; clarifies duty to inform between co-fiduciaries concerning administration of trusts and other governing instruments.
"Uniform Trust Code."
Eliminates presumption of non-imprisonment for theft of a firearm.
Provides that preserved farmland may be sold by the State or a local government unit only to established farmers and restricts size of farmer residence which may be built thereon.
Authorizes donation of forfeited bicycles to charities.
Establishes an industrial hemp license.
Establishes up to four-month extension for expiring carrier contracts with acute care hospitals while parties engage in contract renegotiation.
Revises "Accountancy Act of 1997."*
Clarifies use of motor vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic of certain road conditions is permissible.

Establishes crimes of operating school bus with suspended or revoked driving privileges and being involved in accident causing bodily injury; permanently prohibits passenger and school bus CDL endorsements for persons convicted of those crimes.
Modernizes the distribution of gross income tax refunds by making direct deposit the default distribution method.
Allows modernization for the form of disbursement for certain State government and local unit payments to individuals and business entities. *
Gives priority in training programs to long-term unemployed.
Provides for sick leave injury program of 30 days for State corrections officer injured by inmate of State correctional facility.
Allows certain materials to be included in corporation's proxy solicitation materials.
Requires that school districts use a model contract developed by the Commissioner of Education when employing a superintendent of schools.
Prohibits the DOE from regulating the maximum salary amount a school district may pay its superintendent of schools.
Permits certain motor vehicle offenders to apply for restricted use license.
Permits landlords to take actions after death of tenant in certain situations.
Prohibits unsolicited telemarketing sales calls to commercial mobile service devices.
Permits the incorporation of psychologists.
Authorizes property tax deferment for deployed military personnel.
Requires complaint for guardianship of person receiving services from Division of Developmental Disabilities to include one of the documents identified in bill.*
Requires DCA to establish training and certification program and arbitration standards for new home warranty arbitrators and publish a "New Home Buyer's Bill of Rights."
Permits municipalities to contract with animal and humane societies which engage in animal foster care.
Restores State fiscal year 2011 reductions to Garden State Preservation Trust payments in lieu of taxes; appropriates $3,400,000 to DCA.
Directs DOT to establish roadside accident memorial program.
Provides tax relief through three refundable tax credits under the gross income tax, for homestead property taxpayers, renters and working poor.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for maintenance of certain State memorials honoring war veterans.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for active duty members of United States Armed Forces, Reserve components thereof, and National Guard from New Jersey.
Provides family leave insurance for certain first responders.
Establishes permanent police and fire interest arbitration cap.
Provides for withholding of State payments to vendors for delinquent unemployment and disability taxes.

Establishes procedures for boards of fire commissioners to move annual fire district elections to November, eliminates vote on fire district budgets, except for proposals to raise revenue above the permissible levy cap.
Transfers all probation functions and employees to Bureau of Probation in State Parole Board.
Permits county resident to volunteer for jury service.
Expands definition of "public building" for purposes of the CDS distribution laws.
Allows for suspension of commercial motor vehicle registration under certain circumstances.
Prohibits conflict of interests by governing board members or management employees of homeowners' associations.
Raises maximum eligibility age for exempt fireman certificates and membership in New Jersey State Firemen's Association.
Designates blueberry pie as the New Jersey State Dessert.
Establishes certain requirements for hospitals regarding patient-designated caregivers.
Provides $21 minimum annual energy assistance to qualified families; qualifies families to receive additional nutritional assistance.
Lowers age of compulsory school attendance to age five and requires that all school districts establish kindergarten programs.
Permits removal of State board, commission or independent authority member for failure to attend three consecutive meetings thereof without good cause.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping for certain retired military personnel.
Repeals State moratorium prohibiting taking of horseshoe crabs from State waters.
Establishes penalty for failure to include bittering agent in antifreeze.
Establishes "New Jersey Colorectal Cancer Research Fund"; provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns.
Requires written residential leases to be provided in both English and Spanish in certain municipalities.

Prohibits attorney spouse or domestic partner of elected local government officer in a municipality from representing campaign of candidate for elective office in that municipality to contest election results.
Prohibits attorney serving as elected local government officer in a municipality from representing campaign of candidate for elective office in that municipality to contest election results.
Prohibits elected local government officers from accepting employment with law firm for a period of time if officer voted to award local government contract to firm.
Allows credit against certain charges to CATV customers opting out of premium service within 30 days of CATV company notice of network or programming change.
Allows for five years corporation business tax and gross income tax deductions for net interest amount received on loans to certain qualified UEZ businesses.
Prohibits sale, purchase, and possession of certain merchandise designed to conceal license plate to evade law enforcement.*
Allows firms, designated as qualified UEZ businesses, that experience economic hardship to lower employment levels without losing that designation.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service, and their immediate family members.
Requires telemarketers making sales calls to display their name and telephone number on any caller identification service.
Permits qualified person with post-traumatic stress disorder to obtain handicapped parking placard.
Requires person convicted of criminal sexual contact with person with intellectual disability to register under Megan's Law.
Establishes "State Vehicle Reduction Task Force."
Prohibits elected or appointed officials, and immediate family members, from participating in farmland preservation programs.
Bans campaign contributions and certain political communication by corporations and labor organizations.
Prohibits certain political activity by governmental employees and by public employee unions.
Requires State Treasurer to post information about State contracts for legal services on special website.
Establishes "Fund to Prevent Use of Tobacco and Electronic Smoking Devices"; supports activities to prevent use and promote awareness of associated health conditions.
Changes composition of Automobile Insurance Territorial Rating Plan Advisory Commission.
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain seasonal employers.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from imposing surcharges on consumer credit card purchases.
Requires insurers writing homeowners insurance policies in the State to offer certain coverage for heating oil tanks.
Permits manufacturer to sell electric motor vehicles to consumers under certain conditions.
Makes various changes to interest arbitration procedures; repeals sunset provision.
Requires law enforcement officer to verify vehicle registration with MVC before issuing summons for violation of red light camera.

"Disaster Information Access Act"; requires utility service providers to report severe weather and emergency related service interruptions; directs utility service providers and State Office of Emergency Management to present reported information online and by telephone.
Requires entertainment facilities to provide calorie information for food and beverage items offered for sale.
Requires sharing of revenues derived from major developments situated near municipal borders under certain circumstances.
Clarifies that "upskirting" constitutes invasion of privacy.

Requires county and municipal welfare agencies to determine if person is sex offender within a certain time after initial placement in emergency shelter and to provide notification of placement to law enforcement.
Permits high performing school districts to be monitored by the DOE under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJ QSAC) every seven years rather than every three years.
Increases campus security by allowing institutions of higher education to offer partial tuition credit to police officers enrolled at the institution who agree to be on duty while attending classes.
Authorizes snow removal from covered fire hydrants and locator pole installation.*
Eliminates awards of punitive damages against municipalities, and against employees of municipalities acting within the scope or under color of their office, employment or agency.
Prohibits use of traffic checkpoints for collecting biological samples from drivers.
Authorizes Division of Travel and Tourism to accept gifts and grants to promote NJ tourism.
Authorizes NJ Historical Commission to establish program to promote developing historic projects on website and collect donations for projects on behalf of historic site or organization.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism and NJ Historical Commission to provide volunteer opportunities on Internet website.
Enacts "Truth in Caller Identification Act"; prohibits manipulation of certain telephone caller identification information.
Requires Attorney General to provide certain information regarding certain charitable organizations to public on Internet.
Prohibits imposition of the corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations that only store personal property in this State incident to its importation.
Requires bail agencies to collect at least 10 percent of bail bond amount.
Establishes procedure for consolidating fire districts.

Requires practitioners prescribing Schedule II drugs to check prescription monitoring program prior to issuing prescription and to report prescriptions for Schedule II drugs to program; expands access to program.
Strengthens requirements regarding prescription monitoring program and broadens access to prescription monitoring program by law enforcement agencies.
Establishes per se standard for driving under influence of inhalant; designated as "Kimmie's Law."
Requires pharmacies to report dispensation of Schedule II drugs to prescription monitoring program at least once every five days.
Establishes approval process for proposed offshore wind energy projects and certain benefits to facilitate development of offshore wind energy.
Criminalizes bestiality.
Removes exclusion of "nonimmigrant aliens" from qualifying for in-State tuition rates at public institutions of higher education under certain conditions.
Establishes animal cruelty offense concerning certain use of exotic, non-domestic, or wild animals in traveling performances and exhibitions.
Prohibits lawyers and law firms who lobby public entity from simultaneous employment or contract with that public entity.

Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions by certain taxpayers to New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program and provides a State match for contributions to NJBEST accounts for families meeting certain income guidelines.

Permits instruction on backpack safety to be included in the curriculum of elementary, middle, and high school students as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Provides explicit authorization for the Schools Development Authority to use the design/build/operate/maintain procurement model for school facilities projects.
Requires State Employment and Training Commission to prepare annual report on State workforce.

Requires Secretary of Higher Education, in consultation with various entities, to design a manufacturing career pathway to provide students with skills necessary to gain employment in manufacturing sector.

Directs Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to establish a pilot program to assist certain unemployed and underemployed individuals to complete a career and technical education certificate program in 12 months.*
Establishes "Higher Education Manufacturing Grant Program" for public institutions of higher education to establish or expand programs in manufacturing fields.
Clarifies that only products assembled in U.S. meet "Buy-American" standards of public contracts laws.
Establishes a manufacturing reinvestment account program to incentivize capital investment and workforce training in New Jersey with income tax rate reductions, deferrals, and accelerated deductions.
Provides corporation business tax and the gross income tax credits for insourcing business to New Jersey.
Creates the New Jersey Advanced Manufacturing Council.
Creates pilot program to fund adult education programs for residents of certain communities.
Establishes manufacturing machine and metal trade apprenticeships tax credit program.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Prohibits payment of more than one copayment, coinsurance or deductible for series of vaccinations used in preventive treatment of rabies under certain health benefits plans.
Establishes Animal Cruelty Offender Registry; prohibits purchase, adoption, and breeding of animals by animal cruelty offenders.
Revises animal cruelty offenses involving neglect and abuse, and the penalties therefor; repeals appropriate sections of law.
Revises animal cruelty offenses involving neglect, care and euthanasia of impounded animals, and the penalties therefor.
Establishes process for recovering cost of caring for animals involved in animal cruelty violations.
Establishes cruelly restraining a dog as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.

Revises animal cruelty offenses and penalties concerning animal abandonment and failure to report injuring certain animals with a motor vehicle; increases civil penalties for certain other animal cruelty offenses.
Establishes crimes of dog fighting and leader of a dog fighting network, and updates crime of animal fighting; amends RICO concerning dog fighting.**
Includes adjustment aid in calculation of districts' payments to charter schools under certain circumstances.
Establishes commercial deer harvesting license and allows commercial harvest of deer.
Requires State Police's website to provide a link to report reckless or aggressive driving by school bus driver.
Permits manufacturer to temporarily sell motor vehicles to consumers under certain conditions.
Concerns access to records of wages for prevailing wage public work projects.
Concerns authority of DOLWD to inspect prevailing wage public work projects.
Requires Commissioner of DOLWD to disseminate certain information to contractors who bid on or perform prevailing wage public work.
Revises statutes concerning permissible length of time between certain public questions in certain municipalities.
Increases the number of voting members of the board of governors of Rutgers University from 15 to19 members.
Authorizes design professionals to self-certify construction plans.
Increases amounts municipalities may appropriate and grant for fire safety purposes.

Revises animal cruelty offenses concerning abuse, abandonment, neglect, and improper euthanizing of animals, increases criminal and civil penalties therefor; establishes such penalties for new offenses; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for compressed natural gas used to fuel certain bus operation.
Requires Pinelands Commission to designate North American fox grape as native Pinelands plant within special agricultural production areas.
Concerns property taxes due and owing on real property damaged or destroyed during, or as the result of, a natural disaster when a state of emergency is declared by the Governor. *

Establishes additional ethical requirements concerning sale or conveyance of property or development rights to the State or other public entities by elected public official or immediate family member thereof.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act;" requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Eliminates restriction on placement of special education students in sectarian schools.
Establishes "Opioid Abuse Prevention Commission."
Increases criminal penalties related to certain illegal activities involving controlled dangerous substances.

Extends for five years expiration date of special appraisal process for Green Acres program and farmland preservation program for lands in Highlands Region; makes change to special appraisal process for certain farmers. *
Requires use of goods made in the United States for public contracts; requires disclosures by businesses that receive public contracts or development assistance.**
Directs the expungement of all crimes upon application, after two-year period, execpt crimes of the first degree.
Requires certain companies providing local telephone service within 10-mile radius of nuclear electric generating facility to adhere to certain service quality standards.
Revises certain provisions of New Jersey Prescription Monitoring Program.***
Increases amount of notice driver must receive for license suspension in certain cases and permits driver to provide proof of electronic payment for certain fines and penalties.
Repeals anachronistic, superceded, or invalidated sections of statutory law.
Increases penalties for drunk driving with minor as passenger.
Creates gallery space on State House grounds for display of certain art works.
Revises certain laws governing police and fire interest arbitration; extends two-percent cap on base salary awards.
Requires Rutgers University to create a liberal studies program for intellectually disabled students; appropriates $500,000.
Provides fair standards for elections and recall of officers for homeowners' associations.
Requires landlord to accept charitable payments to satisfy unpaid rent obligations.
Provides premium assistance to certain small employers who purchase health benefits plans; appropriates $10 million.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Child Support Reform.
Requires DOH to establish minimum nurse-to-patient staffing ratios for hospitals.
Establishes strategic road salt reserve fund and strategic road salt reserve within DOT.
Revises certain provisions of New Jersey Prescription Monitoring Program concerning reporting of and access to information, and mandatory use by practitioners and pharmacists.

Requires resource family parent, relative, preadoptive parent, or caretaker to be party to reviews or hearings involving a child under the Division of Child Protection and Permanency in the Department of Children and Families' care.
Requires school districts and charter schools to annually provide to parents or guardians of enrolled students information on certain tests to be administered during the school year.
Establishes certain requirements, including allowable fees, for provision of medical records to patients, legally authorized representatives, and authorized third parties.
Prohibits administration of standardized assessments in kindergarten through second grade.

Requires that if a school district satisfies 80% or more of the required NJ Quality Single Accountability Continuum standards in an area of district effectiveness under State intervention, the State must return that area to local control.
Creates Education Reform Review Task Force; delays implementation of certain assessments and certain changes to teacher evaluation system.

Requires NJT to remove snow from certain stops, stations, and stands for motorbus regular route service and to make name and contact information of entities responsible for snow removal publicly available.
Prohibits manufacture, sale or promotion of personal care products containing microbeads.*
Increases personal needs allowance to at least $50 for low-income persons residing in certain facilities.
Establishes compensation program for State, county, and juvenile corrections officers and parole officers injured while performing official duties.
Provides for special Bronze Star license plates.
Extends Class Two special law enforcement training for time deployed.
Defines a day in session for purposes of a school district's receipt of State school aid.
Allows local government deferred compensation plans to invest in collective investment trusts.
Debars permanently from government contracting any person convicted of certain crimes involving government contracts.
Supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,560,000 for anti-tobacco programs.
Provides for coverage of comprehensive tobacco cessation benefits in Medicaid.
Upgrades initiating, circulating, or transmitting false public alarm to crime of the second degree.
Legalizes possession and personal use of small amounts of marijuana for persons age 21 and over.
Enhances opportunities for qualified residential projects under the Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant Program.
Permits zero emission vehicle manufacturer to directly sell motor vehicles to consumers based on vehicle market.
Requires State, local, and school appointed and certain elected officials to report behavior that may violate criminal laws or ethics statutes.
Revises definition of religious employer in statute concerning insurance coverage of prescription female contraceptives.
Authorizes Governor to enter into interstate compact to clarify Fourteenth Amendment.
Prohibits DOT from putting tolls on I-78 and I-80 and from transferring jurisdiction to independent authority or entity.
Modifies "inherently beneficial use" definition for purposes of zoning variance to discourage siting of wind and solar energy facilities on agricultural land and open space.
Requires insurance producers to perform bona fide services for public entities in order to share commissions; requires disclosure of commission sharing.
Requires NJ State Council on the Arts to establish "Artist Colony" designation and select certain municipalities or areas therefor.
Allows county sheriffs to issue firearms identification cards and permits to purchase handguns; authorizes county sheriffs to accept applications for permits to carry handguns.
Authorizes chiefs of part-time municipal police forces to issue firearms ID cards and handgun purchase permits.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning socio-economic impact statements for proposed rule-making.

Extends limit for nonpublic school busing to 30 miles in Atlantic, Burlington, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Hunterdon, Ocean, Salem, Sussex, and Warren Counties, and requires existing bus stops to be used.
Permits expungement for one-time disorderly persons offense after a period of two years.
Increases number of commissioners on Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor to six; changes process for appointment of commissioners.
Reduces number of manufacturing jobs required to qualify for NJEDA financing and incentive programs.
Provides partial sales tax exemption for energy and utility service to certain manufacturers.
Permits EDA to provide financial assistance to businesses that relocate to NJ from sites in Asia.
Prohibits for 10 years applicability of new State and local rules and regulations to certain manufacturing facilities.
Establishes construction workforce recruitment and training program in DOLWD.
Prohibits plea bargaining for certain repeat criminal offenders.
Implements constitutional amendment providing for pretrial detention of certain criminal defendants.
Authorizes increase in number of wild turkey hunting permits when appropriate.
Requires establishment and implementation in certain circumstances of wildlife management plans for open space and farmland. *
Clarifies that use of propane-powered noise making device is allowed as non-lethal method of wildlife control on farmland.
Requires Fish and Game Council to establish summer bow and arrow hunting season.
Authorizes issuance of multi-species depredation permit for wildlife control on farmland.
Requires funds collected through societal benefits charge not allocated or spent for at least one year be reappropriated in following fiscal year.*
Requires each State agency to review permits issued by agency and make necessary changes to expedite and facilitate permitting.
Exempts certain temporary farm structures from permit and transition area requirements of "Freshwater Wetlands Protection Act."
Prohibits knowingly selling or planting certain invasive plant species.*
Clarifies sales tax collection responsibilities of horse-boarding businesses in New Jersey; makes change retroactive to October 1, 2006.
Permits municipalities to reject proposed off-track wagering facility; removes five-year tax exemption, abatement, or payment in-lieu-of taxes for off-track wagering facilities.
Prohibits import, sale, purchase, barter, or possession of ivory or rhinoceros horn and items containing ivory or rhinoceros horn, with limited exceptions.
Revises certain provisions of New Jersey Prescription Monitoring Program.
Increases State contract sum eligible for payment and performance bond waiver to not more than $300,000; provides for CPI inflation adjustment every four years.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Schedules the termination of the realty transfer fees.
Requires DEP to establish "private wildlife habitat certification program"; creates affirmative defense against municipal nuisance ordinances for properties certified under the program.
Provides county vocational school districts with the authority to name themselves in a manner that more accurately reflects their mission.
Permits municipalities having population under 5,000 to withdraw from civil service by ordinance.
Requires PANYNJ to evaluate certain land holdings to determine if proposed use is consistent with core mission.
Requires PANYNJ to conduct cost-benefit analysis and provide analysis to governors and legislatures of NY and NJ prior to approving certain projects.
Requires PANYNJ to set certain performance goals and prepare annual progress reports.
Directs PANYNJ to review operations for opportunities to have private entities conduct operations or provide services.
Creates special license plates supporting Autism Awareness.
Upgrades and expands crime of criminal mischief under certain circumstances.
Regulates certain servicing activities provided by mortgage servicing organizations for residential mortgage loans.
Limits local enforcing agency fees.
Establishes permanent task force to review and guide implementation of process improvement programs for Executive Branch based on Lean Six Sigma management approach.
Establishes Consumer Finance Advisory Board; abolishes certain advisory boards in DOBI.
Requires disclosure of breach of security of online account.
Prohibits cloud computing service providers from disclosing data collected from public, private, or charter school.
Prohibits advertising of certain products on websites to minors.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support autism programs.
Requires hospital employees assist uninsured patients with creating account to apply for insurance coverage through Federally-Facilitated Marketplace.
Creates Sporting Facility License governing sale of alcoholic beverages under certain cercumstances.*
Provides that school districts must ensure that students with disabilities have opportunities to participate in athletic activities equal to those of other students.
Requires UI employer contribution reports and remittances be submitted to the Division of Revenue.
Provides for withholding of State payments to vendors for delinquent unemployment and disability taxes and charging administrative fees to the vendors.*
Concerns DOLWD personnel access to unemployment claims receipt and processing system.
Concerns certain employer reporting requirements.*
Prohibits sale of certain mobile telecommunications devices unless device includes technology to remotely render device inoperable.
Directs Commissioner of Education to establish full-day kindergarten through grade three school in Trenton modeled on Princeton Day School, for Mercer County residents.
Requires that certain inmates with detainers be provided access to drug treatment programs.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the NJ World War II Veterans' Memorial Fund.
Implements current car seat safety recommendations.
Authorizes executor or administrator to take control of online accounts of deceased person.
Increases annual property tax deduction for senior citizens and disabled persons from $250 to $500.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology without a license and prohibits certain unlicensed employees of certain entities from using title of psychologist.
Requires informational posters about safe placement alternatives for newborn infants be posted in public restrooms used by females.

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
Concerns eligibility requirements for licensed professional counselors and associate counselors.
Permits small, women owned, or minority owned businesses located in designated regional centers or planning areas to qualify for loans from EDA as if located in designated urban center.
Requires DEP to submit annual financial report on status of certain fund balances.
Requires inspection for pest infestation prior to certain demolition.*
Establishes a three-year moratorium on the establishment of new charter schools.
Permits municipality to establish civil penalty for smoking in public places.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate and graduate tuition and fees by more than 4% over the prior academic year.
Requires self-driving motor vehicles to be equipped with ignition interlock device.

Requires DCA to post on its website information about inspection reports for residential health care facilities, boarding homes, and emergency shelters for the homeless, and requires notifications to DHS and counties.*
Permits creation of local hire programs for public work contracts of political subdivisions.
Requires Commissioner of DCA to promulgate rules and regulations providing for veterans' affordable housing assistance preference.*
Categorizes "knockout game" assault as third-degree aggravated assault; eliminates presumption of nonimprisonment for such assault.
Prohibits certain deceptive elections-related practices within 90 days before any election.
Limits rent increases in certain low income rental projects financed by the New Jersey Housing and Mortgage Finance Agency.

Requires public institutions of higher education to provide student-athletes who lose athletic scholarships because of injuries sustained while participating in the athletic program with equivalent scholarships.

Increases statutory mandatory retirement age for Supreme Court Justices, Superior Court Judges, Tax Court Judges, Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and county prosecutors from 70 to 72.
Prohibits development over 35 feet in height in Hudson River Palisades viewshed.
Establishes notification, signage, and monitoring requirements related to combined sewer overflows.
Increases number of votes needed to remove Director of Division of Investment in Department of Treasury from office.
"Fair Debt Collection Practices of New Jersey."
Requires charter schools to annually submit to Commissioner of Education salary and benefit information for certain employees.
Requires property record cards and tax maps prepared in conjunction with revaluations to be produced in electronic format.
Establishes assessment on criminal offenders for "School Safety and Security Fund."
Requires public schools to include instruction on cursive handwriting.
Clarifies that county sheriff provides security for judges at civil commitment proceedings.

Expands EMT and first responder scopes of practice to include the administration of opioid antidotes, and extends immunity under Overdose Prevention Act to such actors, thereby making permanent a DOH waiver that was issued on March 20, 2014.
Requires certain financial institutions to provide schedule of fees, charges, and penalties for deposit accounts.
Authorizes slot machine gambling to be conducted at horse racetracks; dedicates State's share of revenues for open space preservation.
Concerns victim's right to rape care advocate under certain circumstances.
Allows health maintenance organizations to include charity care assessments for purposes of meeting certain loss ratio requirements.
Establishes Partners for Growth Council in DOLWD.
Requires candidates undergo drug testing prior to being placed on election ballot; provides for random drug testing of State and local holders of elective public office.
Increases from 50% to 60% of final compensation PFRS and SPRS active and retired death benefit for surviving spouses; makes any child up to age 22, now 18, eligible for death benefit.
Upgrades penalties for assaulting licensed bounty hunters.
Permits pharmacists to offer customers purchasing prescription drugs discounts and rebates.
"Medicare Advantage Disclosure Act," requires health plans to notify subscribers of differences between plan benefits and original Medicare.
Prohibits pharmacies from charging additional fee for processing prescriptions transmitted by telephone or electronic means.
Requires public schools to include instruction on personal financial literacy as part of core curriculum content standards.
Revises criteria to establish base year for homestead property tax reimbursement after relocation.
Requires that towing companies charge 50 percent of full storage fee if vehicle is retrieved within four hours.
Reactivates annual cost-of-living adjustment for PFRS and SPRS retirees and beneficiaries whose pension is $40,000 or less.
Revises exemption from "unemployment compensation law" for operators of certain motor vehicles.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts and higher education institutions.
Requires disclosure of all fees and charges associated with prepaid debit cards on the package of such cards.
Establishes electronic lien and titling system for New Jersey motor vehicles.
Establishes rights related to property appraisals following natural disasters.
"Economic Opportunity Act of 2014, Part 3."
Special legislation to permit appointment of Christian Kant to Toms River Police Department and enrollment in PFRS.
Extends from 60 days to 120 days amount of time for municipality to refund excess property taxes paid following successful property assessment appeal.
Permits certain zero emission vehicle manufacturers to directly sell motor vehicles to consumers and requires them to operate service facilities.
Requires certain sanitation procedures for mattresses and product labeling regarding such procedures.
Requires persons who transport, store, or sell secondhand mattresses to encase mattresses with protective materials.
Establishes tiered-preference system for purchase of agricultural products by school districts.
Concerns promotion and protection of agriculture.
Requires Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to use certain products manufactured in US.
Removes expiration of required payment by public employees of percentage of cost of health care coverage provided by public employers.
Requires Division of Local Government Services to include certain property tax information on division's web page.
Requires certain additional school district personnel to complete training program on suicide prevention.*
Provides for licensure of chiropractic assistants.
Modifies various aspects of the charter school program, including authorization, regulation, and monitoring of charter schools; appropriates $250,000 from General Fund to DOE.
Clarifies that definition of mental illness in law governing involuntary commitment to treatment includes substance use disorder if dangerous standard met.

Requires sober living homes and other substance abuse aftercare treatment facilities to provide certain notifications to next-of-kin when patient is released from care; designated as "Nick Rohdes' Law." **
Appropriates $22,463,000 in 2003 bond act monies for loans to fund dam restoration projects.*
Expands military leave benefits for certain public officers and employees subject to proof of servive. *
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers to administer opioid antidotes to overdose victims in an emergency, and extends immunity under Overdose Prevention Act to such officers.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Requires certain information regarding Down syndrome be provided to certain parents and families.
Establishes traffic law public awareness campaign.

Reauthorizes use of regional contribution agreements between nine most Superstorm Sandy-impacted counties; permits units transferred to be counted toward recipient municipality's fair share obligation.

Transfers records management functions of Division of Archives and Records Management from Department of State to Department of Treasury; transfers State Records Committee from Department of State to Department of Treasury.
"Lactation Consultants Licensing Act."
Requires family day care providers and certain household members to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Regulates certain activities of religious corporations operating cemeteries.
Requires certification of diligent inquiry in residential mortgage foreclosure actions to be filed by attorneys.
Prohibits certain mental health facilities, drug and alcohol treatment facilities, and homeless shelters in residential zones and within 1,000 feet of schools.
Requires State arts, historical, and cultural grant recipients to offer information on food and lodging in vicinity of event funded.
Establishes publicly accessible Internet registry of offenders who cause bodily harm, or property theft or damage, against disabled persons, senior citizens, or veterans.
Requires EDA and Dept. of State to encourage businesses considering relocation to locate within chronically high unemployment region.
Requires individuals to upload employment resume on Internet website upon filing claim for unemployment insurance benefits.
Requires timeframe of standardbred mare residing in New Jersey breeding farm be inclusive of foaling instead of between foal's conception and birth.
Provides for the inclusion of home-schooled students in the NJ STARS Program.
Establishes the Task Force on Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease in DOH.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide treatment for substance abuse and dependency when determined medically necessary by physician or psychologist.
Excludes certain Medicaid income from gross income tax.
Extends authority to appoint Class Two special law enforcement officers to perform court security duties to all county sheriffs.
Clarifies that law enforcement officers may possess firearms in casinos.
Makes General Fund supplemental appropriation of $350,000 to DMVA for Council on Armed Forces and Veterans' Affairs for preservation of military installations in case of base realignment and closure.
Raises minimum age for purchase and sale of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices from 19 to 21.

Makes total property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans retroactive to effective date of determination of total disability; requires State to reimburse municipalities for reimbursement of property taxes paid to veteran.

Requires teachers of health and physical education in grades kindergarten through six in public schools to possess the appropriate endorsement to the instructional certificate, and includes a "grandfather" provision.

Provides that determination by county agriculture development board or State Agriculture Development Committee as to what qualifies as farm-based recreational activity ine pinelands protection area is binding on Pinelands Commission.*
Provides for drug testing of certain recipients of Work First New Jersey program benefits.
Regulates operation of low-speed electric bicycles.
Allows deduction against gross income for unreimbursed expenses incurred by organ donor.
Designates Dept. of Agriculture as sole agency to administer "Seniors Farmers' Market Nutrition Program."
Requires DEP to obtain approval from Secretary of Agriculture prior to levying penalties against farmers.
Directs DOT, NJTA, and SJTA to permit certain wineries to participate in certain sign programs on freeways, interstate highways, and toll roads.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2015.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2015.
Establishes Equipment Loan Program in NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust; changes submission and approval requirements for financial plan.
Allows counties and municipalities to use open space trust funds for remediation of collapsed mine shafts and sinkholes on property owned by county or municipality.

Requires school districts to ensure that certain student information stored on an electronic data processing system is backed up daily, and that teachers have access to the information for at least150 days.
Confers title of Acting Associate Justice of the Supreme Court on certain judges of the Superior Court, Appellate Division, temporarily assigned to the Supreme Court.
Provides standards for, and requires registration of, home elevation contractors.
Increases and modernizes solvency requirements for certain insurers and authority of DOBI Commissioner to regulate insurer solvency.
Requires written contract between customers and third-party electric power and gas suppliers.
Authorizes youth camps to maintain supply of epinephrine and permit trained employees to administer epinephrine to camp members suffering from anaphylaxis.
Revises procedures concerning access to decedent's safe-deposit box.
Authorizes issuance of certificate for additional persons to solemnize marriage.
"Mainland Memoriam Act"; directs MVC to create graduated driver's license informational material to be distributed by motor vehicle dealers.
Requires telemarketers to provide name, mailing address, and telephone number of person on whose behalf call is made.

Permits certain individuals not appointed pursuant to will to control funeral and disposition of human remains of decedent and requires executor to provide notification of appointment and other information to appointee.
Requires Deleware River Port Authority to use certain products manufactured in U.S.
Requires Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission to use certain products manufactured in U.S.
Requires Delaware River and Bay Authority to use certain products manufactured in U.S.
Prohibits motor carrier transportation contract from indemnifying promisee against liability for loss or damage in certain instances.
Requires disclosure of data recording devices in motor vehicles; limits access to recorded data.
Amends and repeals certain parts of New Jersey firearm statutes.
Requires cost disclosures by health care providers under certain circumstances; applies certain restrictions to charges for medical supplies.
Prohibits advertising of certain products to minors on websites; requires website operators to allow minors to delete posts.
Allows county governing body to establish uniform polling hours and poll worker compensation for type II school districts holding elections in April.
Terminates enrollment in PERS of certain elected public officials upon expiration of term of office.
Requires PANYNJ to report monthly to counties within port district.
Allows gross income taxpayers to use their gross income tax returns to make voluntary contributions to ALS Association for services to New Jersey residents.
Expands exemption to wage and hour requirements for certain summer camp workers.
Permits certain retired law enforcement officers to possess hollow nose ammunition.
Allows military personnel and veterans to present certain identifying documents in lieu of municipal beach tags to gain admission to certain beaches.
Creates motor vehicle offenses related to special paratransit vehicles.
Requires special paratransit vehicles to display flashing warning lights while discharging or receiving passengers.
Modifies education requirement for licensure by the NJ State Board of Cosmetology and Hairstyling.
The "Adopt a Stormwater Management Basin Act."
Directs installation of electric vehicle charging stations at service areas on State's toll roads.
Establishes electronic database of occupants of hotels and multiple dwellings for use by fire safety and emergency service providers.
Clarifies that records custodians are not subject to penalties under State's open public records law if due diligence is exercised.
Prohibits person appointed as arbitrator who subsequently serves as mediator from resuming the role of arbitrator unless the parties agree.
Allows siblings who share and equally co-own a primary residence to claim a joint homestead property tax reimbursement.
Designates Earth Day week each year as Litter Law Enforcement Week for special effort to enforce littering laws.
Increases fine for unlawfully possessing or improperly disposing of hypodermic needle or syringe.
Requires DOT, NJTA, and SJTA to use only native vegetation for landscaping, land management, reforestation, or habitat restoration.
Establishes additional requirements, and penalties for failure to comply, concerning information to be provided to persons purchasing cats or dogs from pet shops. *
Requires fire suppression systems in all elementary and secondary schools 12,000 square feet or larger.
Authorizes all county sheriffs to appoint Class Two special law enforcement officers to perform court security duties.
Requires every State contract to establish fixed price for purchase of goods or services under contract.

Credits increases in employee contributions required by P.L.2011, c.78 as additional contributions to TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS, and SPRS unavailable to reduce normal contributions of State and local employers for actuarial valuations beginning July 1, 2015.
Requires Governor's annual budget message to include description and fiscal analyses of recommendations to raise State revenue estimated at $1 million or more.

Provides that students attending a choice district may only play interscholastic sports on sending district sports teams unless sending district does not offer a sport that the choice district offers.
Revises property assessment calendar.
Establishes Office of State Dental Director and New Jersey Oral Health Commission.*
"Property Rights and Affordable Housing Act of 2014."
Permits counties to share county tax administrators.
Requires Office of Auditing in DHS to review books and receipts of provider of services to persons with mental illness or developmental disabilities before licensing.
Expands definition of "acquisition," for purposes of county and municipal open space trust funds, to include demolition, removal of debris, and restoration of lands being acquired.
Imposes requirements on certain pediatric emergency departments; requires DOH to include information on pediatric emergency departments in its annual hospital performance report.
Authorizes counties to establish mosquito control reserve fund.
Establishes Center for the Study of Health Care Billing Data.
Requires health insurance carriers to encrypt certain information.
Excludes deferred compensation of certain public school and federal tax-exempt organization employees from current taxation under the gross income tax.
Prohibits DCF from placing children in out-of-State child care facilities.
Prohibits immobilization of motor vehicle under certain circumstances.
Concerns renewal of notary public commissions under certain circumstances.
Requires Commissioner of Education to develop lists of approved testing vendors and commercially-developed standardized assessments for use by public school districts.
Adds to property tax levy cap exclusions increases in flood insurance premiums.
Allows persons affected by certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs to receive one year suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Directs Attorney General to establish a criminal firearms recovery clearing house.
Requires health benefits coverage for synchronization of prescribed medications under certain circumstances.
Requires AG to study use of stun guns by Human Services police officers.
Requires State Auditor to report on finances of public institutions of higher education.
Requires New Jersey School Report Card to include indicators of student career readiness.
Requires preparation programs for teachers and school counselors to include programming to improve student career readiness.*

Authorizes the EDA to issue additional $50,000,000 in bonds to provide grants for certain county vocational school district facilities projects and increases debt service district aid percentage for such projects.
Establishes four-year County Vocational School District Partnership Grant Program in DOE.

Allows school districts and requires public colleges to enter into dual enrollment agreements to provide college-level instruction to high school students through courses offered on college or high school campuses.*
Provides that if a career and technical education program of a school district is taught in an industry setting, off-site location will be exempt from certain State regulations.*
Provides additional State school aid to county vocational school districts in which enrollment increases by more than 10%.
Provides State aid for certain adult education programs.
Repeals "Global Warming Response Act" and related sections of Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative implementing law.
Requires nursing homes to obtain form designating beneficiary of personal needs allowance accounts from incoming and current residents.
Clarifies that county sheriff may simultaneously hold position of emergency management coordinator.
Places limit on liens filed by condominium associations for unpaid assessments on timeshares.
Allows reemployment by school district of TPAF retiree as coach of athletic activity when compensation is under $10,000.
Reforms bi-state transportation authorities.
Requires each casino licensee conducting Internet gaming in this State to prominently advertise name of its Atlantic City casino on its Internet gaming websites and advertisements.

Requires taxpayer appealing assessment of real property assessed at more than $1 million to file an appraisal within 90 days of filing the appeal.
Establishes "Milkweed for Monarchs" program.
Establishes "Adopt a Monarch Butterfly Waystation" program.

Requires training for pesticide applicators and operators concerning pollinating bees.

Authorizes tax lien holders other than municipalities to institute in rem tax foreclosure actions against abandoned properties.

Allows person with implanted medical device to voluntarily make notation on driver's license.
Directs MVC to establish certain insurance and safety requirements for companies that use online application program to match passengers with drivers.

Requires State to make pension contribution payments quarterly; provides reduction in State employee contribution rate of 0.1% and penalty for State of 0.1% of payroll for each month State is in arrears for pension payment.
Prohibits manufacture, sale, or installation of counterfeit or nonfunctional air bags in motor vehicles.*
Prohibits mandatory predispute arbitration provisions in consumer contracts.
Increases pension and retirement income exclusions under gross income tax for certain taxpayers.
Requires county boards of taxation to order revaluation of real property in municipalities when necessary.
Provides gross income tax deduction for costs of certain green home improvements that increase building systems resiliency.

Establishes Clean Energy Technology Center and Alternative and Clean Energy Investment Trust Fund for purposes of creating clean energy-related employment opportunities; allocates revenues from societal benefits charge to support its activities.
Authorizes gun violence restraining orders and firearm seizure warrants.
Transportation Sustainability Procurement Program Act.
Requires certain parking garages to have on-site emergency vehicle capable of accessing low-clearance areas.
Designates cheerleading as interscholastic sport; requires safety harness at health clubs with members who are cheerleaders.
Designates State Highway Route No. 71 bridge between Borough of Belmar and Borough of Avon-by-the-Sea as "Robert A. Briant, Sr. Memorial Bridge."
Designates U.S. Route 22 bridge, Easton-Phillipsburg Toll Bridge, as "Sergeant William John Cahir Memorial Bridge."
Directs that one sample ballot shall be delivered to each residence address where at least one resident thereof is registered to vote.
Imposes a two-year moratorium on increases in public utility rates.
Establishes "Government Crowdfunding Act" to allow government entities to conduct fundraising for certain government projects.
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption for synthetic turf field construction by local government units.

Requires boards of education to include instruction, and adopt instructional materials, that accurately portray political, economic, and social contributions of persons with disabilities and lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people.
Expands acts of animal cruelty to include theft or release of animal during burglary.

Reauthorizes use of regional contribution agreements between municipalities within a 10-mile radius of each other for special needs housing; permits units transferred to be counted toward recipient municipality's fair share obligation.
Provides for involuntary commitment to treatment for substance use disorders.
Concerns penalties for violations of wage and hour requirements by certain employers.
Concerns penalties for violations of wage and hour laws.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment, facility renovation, modernization, and expansion.
Authorizes EDA to establish program to promote manufacturing businesses on website and collect funding for projects on behalf those businesses.
Establishes "County Career Technical Education Annual Recognition Awards" to annually recognize best programs implemented by county vocational school districts.
Dedicates $140,000 of revenue from motor vehicle violations to DHS for brain injury services.
Permits transmittal of certain land use documents via email.
Establishes sheriff's officers reemployment lists.
The "New Jersey Meadowlands Tax Relief Act."
Permits Newark to use rental car tax proceeds over three-year period to help reduce its "cash deficit for preceding year" appropriation and operational deficit.
Allows gross income tax deduction for certain donations to the Rutgers University Foundation.
Allows insurer to obtain certificates of ownership or salvage certificates of title for motor vehicles under certain circumstances.
Allows person under age of 16 to operate power vessel with parental supervision.

Abolishes Landscape Irrigation Contractors Examining Board in the Department of Environmental Protection and transfers regulation of landscape irrigation contractors to Department of Community Affairs.
"Licensed Wildlife Rehabilitator Act;" establishes licensure requirements for wildlife rehabilitators.
Exempts school district employees in certain counties from requirement to reside in State as pilot project; requires DOE report.
Requires certain health benefit plans to provide coverage for behavioral health care services when determined medically necessary by physician or psychologist.
Regulates passenger transportation companies that use an online application program to connect drivers to passengers.
Revises 20% affordable housing set-aside requirement for newly-constructed housing developments within regional planning entities.
Concerns attorney fees for workers' compensation awards.
Permits municipalities to issue retail liquor licenses for use in certain historic taverns.
Prohibits purchase of certain items by scrap metal businesses.
Provides for reimbursement of security officer application and registration fees for applicants who meet certification requirements.
Establishes a partial return to work TDI program.
Requires establishment of regulations for solar panel installation, maintenance, and education.
Permits municipality to sell certain impounded vehicles.
Extends economic recovery term under "Municipal Rehabilitation and Economic Recovery Act."
Prohibits insurers from setting prices for non-covered dental services.
Provides for Medicaid coverage of comprehensive tobacco cessation services and prohibits certain restrictions on coverage.
Makes membership in New Jersey Council of County Colleges optional.
Requires regulation of autocabs in certain cities.
Authorizes public financing of primary election campaigns to fill gubernatorial vacancy and general election campaigns to fill vacancy in offices of Governor and Lieutenant Governor.
Creates Task Force on Construction Industry Workplace Safety and Health.
Increases transparency and accountability at PANYNJ.

Requires comparable level of services and supports to be provided to former residents of developmental centers transitioning to community placements and for placements to be located within 30 miles of closed centers.
Provides for early termination of terms of office for certain appointed municipal court positions when two or more municipalities enter into agreements to establish joint or shared municipal courts.
Requires display of State vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all State vehicles.
Revises the "Self-Funded Multiple Employer Welfare Arrangement Regulation Act."
Makes FY 2014 supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,453,000 for family planning services.
Allows charitable assets set aside from the sale of a nonprofit hospital to a for-profit entity to be allocated to a successor nonprofit hospital acquiring the for-profit hospital.
Revises certain laws governing police and fire interest arbitration; incorporates compounding in base salary calculation; extends two-percent cap on base salary awards.
Concerns UI benefits for claimants who leave work to accept other work and are laid off from subsequent work.
Requires board of education to enter into agreement with law enforcement authorities regarding access to live video streams of public school buildings.
Authorizes free fishing licenses for persons with disabilities.
"Drew's Law"; establishes 15 miles per hour speed limit in or near certain public parks.
Authorizes special Combat Action Badge license plate program.
Requires public schools to allow certain students not enrolled in the school to participate in interscholastic athletics.
Prohibits release of home addresses of certain public safety employees by governmental entities.

Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for employers who hire former prisoners.
Requires boards of education to annually conduct comprehensive eye examinations for second grade students.
"Boys & Girls Clubs Keystone Law"; permits minors to give consent for behavioral health care.
Provides loans and tax credits to businesses for costs incurred in purchase and installation of certain equipment to mitigate damage from natural disasters.
Makes it a crime of the fourth degree to unlawfully use a controlled dangerous substance or prescription drug while pregnant.
Prohibits employers from taking adverse employment action based on authorized use of medical marijuana.
Allows gross income tax credit for contributions to nonprofit public school support organizations.
Requires State Board of Education to develop rigorous computer science curriculum guidelines and school districts to incorporate those guidelines in grades six through 12.
Permits school district to request and receive from MVC name and address of student's parent or guardian to verify student's eligibility for enrollment in school district. *
Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in the event of the borrower's death.
Requires New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association to require criminal history records check for person to serve as official at athletic events sanctioned by association.
Clarifies procedures for resignation, removal, and succession of fiduciaries.
Allows gross income tax deductions totaling $300,000 over five taxable years for psychiatrists.
Revises and clarifies prohibition on certain practices of motor vehicle franchisors with respect to sales promotion plans and incentives.
Requires replacement of all electronic voting machines used in State by district-based optical scan voting systems by June 7, 2016; makes appropriation.
Excludes portion of Bloomingdale Borough in Passaic County from Highlands preservation area.
Increases amount of, and income limit for eligibility to receive, senior citizens' and disabled persons' property tax deduction.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide treatment for behavioral health care services when determined medically necessary.
Reinstates transportation planning district for Meadowlands District.
Regulates planting and sale of running bamboo.**
Establishes brain injury screening and education program in DCF.*
Provides two elected members of pension commission of closed Hudson County Employers' Pension Fund may be active or retired county employees.
Amends definition of "Class II renewable energy."
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
Prohibits law enforcement agencies from considering number of arrests made and citations issued when evaluating police officer's professional performance.
Requires DHS to develop or purchase electronic health record system for use by certain agencies providing services to individuals with developmental disabilities.

Extends application period for certain urban hope projects; permits reconstructed facilities as part of projects; and provides additional retirement benefits for certain PERS and TPAF members in certain urban hope districts*
Requires Medicaid coverage for diabetes self-management education, training, services, and equipment for patients diagnosed with diabetes, gestational diabetes, and pre-diabetes. *

Requires 9-1-1 service facilities be equipped with Next Generation 9-1-1 system and provides funding for that purpose; makes texting the 9-1-1 emergency system without purpose of reporting need for 9-1-1 service a fourth degree crime.**
Provides that a school district may be placed under full or partial State intervention pursuant to the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) for no longer than five years.

Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.

Requires DHS to approve providers that serve persons with developmental disabilities in all areas of State.
Revises licensing requirements and procedures under the "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act."
Enhances penalties imposed on drivers who have never been issued a driver's license.
Establishes "Career and Technical Education Scholar Awards" to annually recognize outstanding career and technical education students.
Prohibits discontinuance of certain State facilities and services in counties with chronic high unemployment.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for student loan debt relief.
Establishes "Right to Try Act" permitting terminally ill patients to access investigational drugs and treatment.
Imposes moratorium on Returning Home New Jersey initiative and prohibits transfers from out-of-State placements under certain conditions.
Partially repeals prohibitions against sports wagering at racetracks and casinos in New Jersey.
Permits county governing bodies, by resolution, to revise real property assessment calendar.
Requires psychiatrists to complete screening certificates no later than 12 hours after completion of screening documents.
Requires electric public utilities to obtain written consent and provide written disclosure prior to installing smart meters.
Eliminates consumer data collection requirements for certain gift cards.
Establishes certain requirements for use of physical restraint on students with disabilities in school districts and approved private schools for students with disabilities.
Appropriates $34,133,290,000 in State funds and $15,013,691,000 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2014-2015.
Adjusts the FY2014 budget by making supplemental appropriations totaling $33,348,000 and modifying language provisions.
Imposes a one-year fifteen percent surcharge on Corporation Business Tax liabilities.

Raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $1,000,000 to 10.75 percent for a temporary three-year-period and restores the State earned income tax credit to 25 percent of the federal credit.
Adjusts and clarifies certain State tax compliance standards and restricts certain State tax benefits.
Requires State to pay its pension contributions quarterly on July 15, October 15, January 15 and April 15.
Reinserts in FY 2015 Appropriations Act language that was omitted due to a technical problem.
Grants certain employment protections to campus police officers.
Requires police departments of certain educational institutions to adopt Attorney General Guidelines on internal affairs policies and procedures.
Upgrades crime of assault against certain public employees to aggravated assault in certain circumstances.
Requires law enforcement agencies, correctional facilities, and State Parole Board to adopt maternity policies.
Increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount for the New Jersey estate tax to $5 million over period of five years.
Revises individual cause of action under consumer fraud act.
Requires MVC to accept Transportation Worker Identification Credential as proof of identity for issuance of driver's licenses, certain permits, and nondriver identification cards.

Requires local recreation departments and youth serving organizations to have defibrillators for youth athletic events.**
Requires newly licensed registered professional nurse to attain baccalaureate degree in nursing within 10 years of initial licensure as a condition of renewal of the license.

Authorizes special motion to dismiss a "Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation" ("SLAPP").

Amends law concerning county and municipal stream cleaning activities.

Establishes Division of State Museum in Department of State; continues New Jersey State Museum within division; abolishes museum board of trustees.

Concerns UEZ program funding to qualifying municipalities.

Requires debt collectors, in certain circumstances, to cease debt collections against certain victims of identity theft.
Reinstates sick leave injury program for State corrections officers and juvenile justice officers under certain circumstances.
Ends the estate tax and raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $350,000.
Requires manufacture date of tires be posted at point of sale; requires information concerning used tires over 10 years old be provided at point of sale.
Directs Commissioner of Education to appoint coordinator and regional consultants to coordinate the education of students with traumatic brain injury.
Authorizes creation of "The Song Book of New Jersey."
Regulates pharmacy benefits managers and requires certain disclosures concerning multiple source generic drug pricing.
Establishes designated driver motor vehicle license plates.
Requires electric or gas public utilities to apply residential rates and charges to any business heated or cooled by residential heating or cooling system.
Revises laws concerning access to medical marijuana.
Allows primary caregiver of handicapped person and person with autism to apply for and use handicapped parking.
Prohibits submission of New Jersey license plate information to national photo ticketing system or other states for certain purposes.
Permits DCA to nominate a municipality as a qualified municipality for purposes of NJ Redevelopment Authority program participation.
The "New Jersey Intern Protection Act"; provides legal protections and remedies for persons engaged in internships with employers.
Makes it a fourth degree crime to operate as an unlicensed bail agent, per SCI recommendations.
Requires identification cards for bail agent, per SCI recommendations.

Requires Attorney General to develop written guidelines concerning communication between bail agents and inmates; requires county correctional facilities to adopt policies in compliance, per SCI recommendations.

Limits liability for operators of buildings, facilities, or premises for certain sports, games, and amusement activities.
Reinstates State sick leave injury program for State employees who are members of PFRS or SPRS.

Revises procedure for transferring motor vehicles under certain circumstances.

Requires 9-1-1 service facilities to be equipped with system for processing requests for emergency services sent via text message.

Concerns Superstorm Sandy recovery.
