Requires local governments and authorities to obtain financing cost estimate from NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust for certain projects; revises bond maturities and sale of bonds by NJ Enviromental Infrastructure Trust.*
Requires Medicaid managed care organizations to meet certain conditions prior to reducing reimbursement rates for personal care assistant services and home-based supportive care services.
Requires anyone receiving opioid antidote to treat drug overdose be provided with information concerning substance treatment programs and resources.
Wounded Warrior Caregivers Relief Act; Provides income tax credit to family caregivers of certain armed service members with physical disabilities.
Creates financial planning assistance program for disabled veterans and their caregivers.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Increases income eligibility cap to receive respite care for certain veterans.*
Directs DOT to establish State highway connecting Green Street and Williams Avenue in Boro of Hasbrouck Heights.
Requires Secretary of State to promulgate rules and regulations governing use of official seal of local unit.
Implements recommendations of SCI report concerning bail bond industry.
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.
Limits certain unused sick leave pay and vacation leave carry-forward for school and local employees; limits sick leave use by new public employees before retirement.

Requires professional boards to provide for online processing of application for licensure or renewal.
Authorizes mayors to veto proposed actions of municipal authorities.
Lifts moratorium on new Business Employment Incentive Program grant awards and establishes "New Jersey Business Employment Incentive Program Task Force."

Requires annual notice of assessment on property to contain bolded notice of filing deadline for appeal.
Requires school districts, nonpublic schools, and institutions of higher education to report allegations of sexual assault to law enforcement.

Requires telephone utility to temporarily suspend local exchange telephone service for up to six continuous months when requested by residential customer; allows customer to keep telephone number when resuming service.
Requires unguarded exit doors in public school building to be equipped with alarms that detect unauthorized exit.
Permits municipalities to set amount of developer contribution to affordable housing trust funds in exchange for certain tax abatements.
Requires call box installations along certain waterfronts, funded by red light camera surcharges.
Requires drivers to reduce speed when overtaking bicyclists or pedestrians.
Establishes a small business job creation and preservation account program to incentivize small business workforce expansion in New Jersey with income tax exclusions for interest.
Requires electric public utilities to place distribution infrastructure underground if fully compensated by certain public hospitals and public institutions of higher education.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement to prohibit certain deed restrictions limiting use of casino hotel facility properties.
Limits number of casino licenses issued to person.

Provides supplemental appropriation of $85,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DCA for consolidation study of certain school districts in Atlantic County.
Limits access to data recorded by motor vehicle recording devices.
Prohibits sale of powdered alcohol.
Establishes immunity from liability for manufacturers and sellers in certain product liability actions.
Designates State Highway Route 17 in Waldwick Borough as "Christopher Goodell Memorial Highway."
Prohibits retrofitting diesel-powered vehicles to increase particulate emissions for the purpose of "coal rolling"; prohibits the practice of "coal rolling".
Requires State Lottery Commission to issue licenses for operation and playing of keno games in certain bars and restaurants.

Expands crimes preventing retainer or counsel fee award in action for divorce or dissolution of civil union; clarifies legislative intent concerning no-fault causes of action for divorce or dissolution of civil union.
Directs MVC to establish permit and safety requirements for companies that use online application program to match passengers with drivers.
Provides that retired justices and judges collecting pension or retirement allowance are eligible for recall duties until 85 years of age.
Clarifies that piercing or tattooing animals constitutes needless mutilation and animal cruelty.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare.

Requires public utility to reimburse business customer during period when business ceases operations due to utility repairing or replacing its equipment on business customer's property.

Permits municipalities to adopt ordinances to require certain owners to pay for continuous police patrol of residential rental multiple dwellings located in high-crime areas.
Establishes crimes of dog fighting and leader of a dog fighting network; amends RICO to add leader of a dog fighting network.
Requires prison host benefit payments to certain municipalities.
Provides discounted hunting and trapping license, permit, and stamp fees for senior citizens.
Requires printed advertisements to bear the word "advertisement."
Establishes immunity from civil liability and criminal prosecution to persons who forcibly enter motor vehicle to remove child in danger.
Requires DOE to create military-connected student identifier for inclusion in student-level database.
Provides for issuance of certificate of rehabilitation to certain offenders with substance abuse disorders.
Establishes the "Mental Health Treatment Reform and Violence Prevention Act."
Imposes criminal penalties for leaving child unattended and unsupervised in motor vehicle.
Authorizes municipalities to deposit payments from recovered demolition costs into municipal "Emergency Demolition Fund."
Requires school districts to provide listing of bus stops near residence of sex offender to law enforcement.
Requires interior light of motor vehicle be turned on when stopped by law enforcement.

Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain game birds to certain persons licensed to operate semiwild shooting preserves.
Increases penalties for energy "slamming" practices.
Establishes second degree crime for threatening to kill law enforcement officers.
Clarifies that corporate directors may approve actions without a meeting by electronic transmission.
Renames "county vocational school districts" as "county career academies."
Revises applicability of law concerning derivative proceedings and shareholder class actions.
Permits corporation to impose reasonable limitations or conditions on use or distribution of books and records by shareholders.
Revises circumstances in which certain corporate officers are provided immunity from liability.
Allows certain students including undocumented immigrants who meet certain criteria to qualify for State student financial aid programs.
Requires health insurers, group health plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to share certain health benefits information with Medicaid and other State programs.
"Tyler Banuls' Law"; provides protections for children with developmental disabilities receiving services from DCF.
Establishes a joint legislative and executive branch New Jersey Revenue Advisory Board to provide consensus revenue forecasting advice for State budget purposes.
Prohibits award of State contracts and development subsidies to inverted domestic corporations.*
Authorizes executor or administrator to access digital assets of account holder.
Repeals law establishing application fees for civil service examinations and appeal fee.
Establishes veterans' preference for affordable housing in certain housing projects.
"Water Infrastructure Protection Act."

Eliminates voter registration and in-district residency requirements for certain petition circulators; eliminates in-district residency requirement for petition circulators for partisan primary nominations; establishes petition circulator criteria.
Provides for notification of next-of-kin in event of death of senior citizen in senior housing facility.*
Eliminates spousal and civil union partnership privileges concerning communications, generally, and testifying in criminal proceedings.
Requires Commissioner of Health to review impact of disabilities on persons in minority and underrepresented communities.
The "Full Marriage Recognition for Civil Union Couples Act"; recognizes certain civil unions as marriages dating back to inception of such civil unions.
Partially repeals prohibitions against sports wagering at racetracks and casinos in New Jersey.

Requires chairs of certain ward political party committees to have same rights and responsibilities as chairs of municipal political party committees; specifies certain cities not required to have municipal chairs.
Establishes crime-fraud exception to marital and civil union partnership privilege.
Imposes 66% tax on gross gaming revenue from wagering at Meadowlands Complex casino; provides distributions to State General Fund, CRDA, and Hackensack Meadowlands Tax Sharing Stabilization Fund.
Requires minimum temperature in senior citizen housing projects to be maintained at 70 degrees from October 1 to May 1.
Imposes 66% tax on gross gaming revenue from wagering at casino outside Atlantic City; provides distributions to State General Fund and CRDA.
Establishes young entrepreneurs program in EDA.
Establishes entrepreneur-in-residence pilot program.
Authorizes EDA to provide financial assistance to certain business incubator facilities.
"Innovate New Jersey Act"; establishes tax-free business incubators at institutions of higher education.
Removes prohibition on possession of stun guns.
Prohibits assessment of overlimit fee assessed by issuer of credit or debit cards in certain instances.
Limits overlimit fee assessed by issuer of credit or debit cards.
Limits late fees assessed by issuer of credit cards.
Prohibits fees for certain bill payments.
Requires recipient of alimony or child support to notify payor of certain changes in financial circumstances.
Repeals laws regulating campaign finance and lobbying; abolishes ELEC.
Establishes Special Needs Housing-for Work Pilot Program within DHS to provide certain individuals with supportive housing in exchange for work activity or alternative work experience.*

"New Jersey Sexual Assault Violence in Education Act"; requires institutions of higher education to adopt anti-sexual assault theater program, report allegations of sexual assault to county prosecutor, and provide students with information on sexual assaults.
Requires DHS to develop specific criteria for eligibility of individuals with developmental disabilities for services from adult day health services facilities.
Requires DOH to develop New Jersey Report Card of Hospital Maternity Care.
Provides rental and lease protections for domestic violence victims.
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
"Jade and Michael's Law", establishes additional protections and enforcement related to child abduction by a parent.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide advocates for victims of sexual assault.
Requires institutions of higher education to post information on sexual assaults on website and provide the information to prospective students.
Creates Electric Power Production Siting Commission.

Directs enhanced training for law enforcement and criminal justice personnel in interacting with African American victims of domestic violence; bars certain defendants from participation in Pretrial Intervention.
Prohibits bail bondsmen from accepting bail fees in installments.
Revises statutes concerning incorporation and governance of the Protestant Episcopal Church to remove gender-specific references.
Removes statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands categories of defendants liable in such actions.
Allows for tri-weekly visits from parents or guardians of infants or toddlers under Division of Child Protection and Permanency care.

"Disaster Victims Protection Act"; requires Governor to allocate federal and State disaster aid to municipalities in proportion to amount of catastrophic physical damage sustained within each municipality.

Places five-year limit on State control of any school district; requires local control to be returned in any area of district effectiveness under State intervention for which district meets 80 percent or more of standards.
Revises financial reporting requirements for charitable organizations.
Prohibits eligibility for certain sign programs from being conditioned on availability of free drinking water or public telephone.
Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.

Requires executive county superintendents to submit school district consolidation plan to Commissioner of Education within one year and every five years thereafter and commissioner to approve or modify plan within six months of submission.
Makes FY 2015 supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,453,000 for family planning services.
Permits cities of first class to opt out of county service when that service is provided by city; provides for reduction in city's portion of county property tax levy and for property tax credits.
Provides for Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare coverage and reimbursement for health care services provided through telemedicine.
Requires health insurance carriers, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide coverage for telemedicine.
Requires distribution of homestead benefits on or before October 31 of the State fiscal year during which an appropriation is made.
Provides that certain temporary support orders in pending matrimonial or civil union actions expire in six months or less, subject to renewal.
Prohibits certain domestic corporations that reorganize overseas from being awarded State contracts.
Allows for assessment of civil and criminal penalties for violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1967)" even if violations were not knowingly or recklessly committed.
Prohibits State administered pension fund investment in corporations shifting ownership or operations outside the U.S. for tax purposes.
Prohibits corporations from qualifying for or maintaining State development subsidy grants if corporation qualifies as inverted domestic corporation.
Eliminates language in FY 2015 appropriation act that restricts participation of certain institutions in the Tuition Aid Grant program.
Exempts principal residences from the transfer inheritance and estate taxes.
Requires AG and county prosecutor to remove information from website concerning persons indicted or prosecuted for crimes under certain circumstances.*
Requires government records to be made available on the Internet.
Prohibits anti-tiering clauses in managed care health benefits plans.
Concerns government records requests for communications covered by attorney-client privilege.
Removes outdated reference to kissing Bible formerly associated with administration and solemnity of oaths in court or any legal proceeding.
Designates "The New Jersey Song" as State song.
Allows student with disability to bring service animal on school bus.
Requires nonpublic school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to a local law enforcement.
Extends center and growth center designations pursuant to "State Planning Act" for three years.
Grants full police status to special agents in the Department of Treasury; authorizes special agents to carry firearms at all times.
Imposes conditions on drivers approaching disabled vehicles displaying warning lights.
Imposes mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for habitual driver's license suspensions.
Allows nonimmigrant alien students who have applied for a green card to qualify for in-State tuition at public institutions of higher education.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing, importing, and selling assault firearms for civilian use.
Permits municipalities and counties to issue bonds to fund buy-out of accumulated leave time in order to reduce future terminal leave expenses.
"Consumer Litigation Funding Act."
Provides for licensure of ambulatory care facilities to provide integrated primary care services including behavioral health care.
Establishes New Jersey Business Action Center in Department of State.
Prohibits local governments from requiring private employers to provide paid sick leave.
Establishes crime-fraud exception to marital and civil union partnership privilege; amends evidence statute.
Eliminates eligibility time limit on tuition benefits for spouses of certain public safety workers killed in performance of their duties.
Increases mandatory retirement age for Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and county prosecutors from 70 to 75.
Increases statutory mandatory retirement age for Superior Court and Tax Court judges from 70 to 75.
Authorizes Commissioner of Corrections to establish program to operate managed cellular access system within State correctional facilities.
Increases monetary amounts for transfer of estate assets without administration and for exemption from debts of the deceased.*
Establishes public awareness campaign concerning the dangers of leaving children unattended in and around motor vehicles.
Prohibits MVC from imposing duplicate license or identification card fee and digitized picture fee if duplicate is requested to reflect change in organ donor status.
Partially repeals prohibitions, permits, licenses, and authorizations concerning wagers on professional, collegiate or amateur sport contests or athletic events.*
Requires health care practitioners to inform patients of addiction potential of controlled dangerous substances prior to issuing prescription.

Requires review of Core Curriculum Content Standards to ensure guidence for substance abuse instruction provided to public school students incorporates most recent evidence-based standards and practices.*
Makes FY 2015 supplemental appropriation to DHS for $5 million for substance abuse prevention, and requires substance abuse prevention programs to be evidence-based.

Directs poison control and drug information program to establish clearinghouse of drug overdose information, report on trends, and provide education on safe storage and disposal of medications; appropriates $500,000.
Requires Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services to annually prepare substance use treatment provider performance report, and make available to public.*
Increases Medicaid reimbursement rates for certain evidence-based behavioral health services; designated as the Mental Health Access Act.*
Establishes remote medical consultation assistance grant program in DOH.
Directs certain four-year public institutions of higher education to establish substance abuse recovery housing program.

Extends "Overdose Prevention Act" immunity provisions to certain professionals and professional entities, and permits needle exchange programs to obtain standing order for opioid antidote dispensation.*

Requires establishment of processes to identify Medicaid eligible incarcerated individuals who are awaiting pre-trail release determinations, are being released following period of incarceration, or are undergoing inpatient hospital treatment. *
Requires DHS and DOC to formulate joint arrangement and plan to ensure provision of mental health and substance use disorder services to inmates. *
Permits successful completion of special probation drug court program notwithstading use of medication-assisted treatment.*
Provides additional State school aid to school districts experiencing enrollment increases due to conversion of age-restricted housing developments to non-restricted developments.
Requires dealership to notify buyers of recalls on used motor vehicles for sale.
Authorizes medical marijuana for qualifying patients with post-traumatic stress disorder.
Permits county clerk or register of deeds and mortgages to create Gold Star Parent identification card.
Establishes crime fraud exception applicable to marital and civil union partnership privilege; amends statutory law.

Authorizes AOC to assess, collect, and pay service charges and costs for electronic payment of fees and other obligations owed courts; prohibits defendants from using debit cards for bail and penalty payments for certain crimes.
Requires certain DOC, county, and municipal prison physicians to acquire certain training.

Provides that child's abuse of, or addiction to, alcohol or controlled substances may, under certain circumstances, constitute a child's "severe mental or physical incapacity" justifying continuation of child support after the age of majority.
Requires parole board under certain circumstances to release inmates not convicted of a violent crime under the No Early Release Act at the time of parole eligibility.
Prohibits existing child care subsidy recipient from being treated as a new applicant for subsidy after moving to a new county of residence.
Establishes time limits for DOT to resolve excess land requests.
Establishes high technology corridor program in EDA to attract and retain high technology businesses.
Requires adoption of business attraction, expansion, and retention master plan for southern New Jersey.
Requires insurers to provide minimum of 30 days inpatient treatment for substance abuse when physician determines treatment is medically necessary.
Authorizes establishment of three pilot recovery alternative high schools that provide high school education and substance dependency plan of recovery to test the effectiveness of this model.*
Concerns street light outage reporting.
Creates cidery and meadery license.
Upgrades penalty for theft of an emergency vehicle.
Requires certain documentation as proof of voter identity to vote; updates procedures for challenging voters regarding proof of identity.
Revises requirements for signage indicating accessible facilities for people with disabilities.
Clarifies law concerning local unit purchases of fuel from private service station by fuel credit card.
Exempts disabled persons from the payment of municipal parking meter fees unless otherwise posted.
Prohibits snowplow operators from depositing snow in front of certain access points used by persons with disabilities.
Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for a private citizen to use a tracking device to track another person without that person's consent.
Prohibits sale of powdered caffeine to minors.
Establishes program to provide assistance to qualified veterans in in-patient and out-patient treatment programs to travel to medical counseling in State.*
Requires Adjutant General to create informational webpage for women veterans.*
Requires certain insurance coverage for motor vehicles involved in transportation network company trips.
Limits number of bills member of Legislature may introduce; requires every bill to be heard in committee; requires estimate be prepared of cost of drafting and considering each bill.
Requires hospitals and birthing centers to provide parents of newborns with information on health insurance coverage for newborn children.
Requires AG oversight of transfer of federal surplus military equipment to local law enforcement agencies; establishes review and reporting requirement.
Directs MVC to establish permit, background check, and safety inspection requirements for companies that use online application program to match passengers with drivers.
Requires prosecutorial or law enforcement review of fatal incidents involving police officers or State Police.
Directs BPU to require certain energy businesses to maintain recordings of telemarketing sales calls for three years.
Designates State Highway Route No. 35 bridge between Brielle and Point Pleasant Beach as "Veterans of All Wars Memorial Bridge."
Establishes crime-fraud exception applicable to marital and civil union partnership privilege.
Revises procedures for processing incomplete Medicaid applications; exempts asset transfers of up to $500 per month during look back period for determining eligibility for long-term care services.*
Prohibits student's individualized education program or 504 plan to include use of physical restraints or seclusion.

Permits application for PERS accidental disability benefit for injury sustained after January 2003 while employed at State psychiatric institution or correctional facility immediately prior to PERS membership.
Concerns medical imaging technology licensure; provides licensing of magnetic resonance imaging technologists.
Requires successful completion of firearms education program to obtain initial firearms purchaser identification card and permit to purchase a handgun.
Establishes insurance and safety requirements for companies that use digital network or software application to match passengers with drivers.*
Makes Fiscal Year 2015 General Fund appropriation of $250,000 for restoration and maintenance of A.J. Meerwald.
Establishes NJ Commission on Irish and Irish-American Cultural and Educational Programs.
Establishes identical levels of domestic violence training for judges and judicial personnel.
Increases penalties for crime of false public alarm when false alarm impacts school operations; adds costs incurred by school to total costs imposed under certain circumstances.
Regulates deed procurement services.
Requires health care provider participating in carrier network to give notice to covered person of provider's referral to out-of-network provider.

Provides State Investment Council must report private money managers' fee information and that council's regulations addressing political contributions will apply to federal or national committees and non-State political committees.
Requires lobby security for certain senior citizen high-rise buildings in areas with high violent crime rates.
Establishes a 1,000 foot drug free zone around playgrounds and other public parks, buildings and housing facilities.
Requires NJHMFA to establish reverse mortgage program for certain retirees living in cooperatives.
Transfers Division of Parole in State Parole Board to Department of Corrections.

Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to publish list of certain tamper-resistant opioid drugs; establishes that certain conditions be met for pharmacist to substitute for tamper-resistant opioid drug.
Prohibits sex discrimination in pay and reprisals against employees disclosing employment information or requesting flexible work arrangements.
Prohibits certain credit card issuers from reporting student credit card holders to credit reporting agencies for 90 days following missing payment.
Assesses additional fee for traffic control device violations and dedicates those funds to "Careless Aggressive Reckless (C.A.R.) Driver Awareness Campaign Fund."

Revises criminal history record check procedures for school personnel to provide for communication of post-employment federal criminal record information received through participation in federal rap back program to Commissioner of Education.
Requires certain State oversight of budgets of regional sewerage authorities.
Requires newly-constructed multiple dwellings with six or more residential units to install standby generators to provide electricity in case of emergency.
Authorizes grandparents to obtain certified copies of death certificates of grandchildren.
Subjects county and municipal sewerage authority service rate increases to approval by Board of Public Utilities.
Requires Secretary of State to provide online voter registration up to 48 hours before election; authorizes use of digitized signatures from New Jersey MVC's database.
"Volunteer Medical Professional Health Care Act."
Requires owner of foreclosed property to provide relocation assistance to tenant displaced by termination of illegal occupancy.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide greater assistance to certain students with military obligations.
Increases and makes uniform mileage reimbursement rate for sheriffs, constables, and other court officers for various duties performed.

Streamlines responsibilities of Division of Local Government Services and local governments; designated as the Division of Local Government Services Modernization and Local Mandate Relief Act of 2015.
Creates civil service preference for peacetime veterans.
Concerns expedited process for foreclosing vacant and abandoned residential properties in uncontested actions.*
Eliminates the New Jersey Transfer Inheritance Tax and repeals parts of chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Makes various changes to law governing raffles; requires Legalized Games of Chance Control Commission to create online reporting system and develop single license for conducting multiple games.
Requires DOT to include certain tourist-oriented facilities in New Jersey Delaware Bayshore in Tourist Oriented Directional Sign Program.
Requires preschool tuition rates equal actual cost per pupil.
Authorizes certain county veteran identification cards to serve as proof of status for veteran designation on driver's license or identification card.
Requires State to reimburse counties for costs paid for maintenance of county patients in State psychiatric hospitals who are eligible for federal Medicare or Medicaid coverage.
Requires anticipation of parking fees in county and municipal budgets.
Creates pilot program concerning domestic violence; creates additional Superior Court judgeships.
Provides for a mandatory term of imprisonment for assault involving domestic violence.
Establishes minimum level of domestic violence training for judges and judicial personnel.
Requires State agencies to periodically review administrative rules and regulations to ensure continued efficacy.
Requires earlier mandatory polling hours for school elections; requires discretionary additional polling hours be consistent with current primary and general elections.*
Establishes four-year pilot program in Ocean County for electronic monitoring of certain domestic violence offenders; designated as "Lisa's Law"; appropriates $2.5 million.

Permits educational research and services corporations to act as lead procurement agencies for local units, and publically supported educational institutions; permits Council of County Colleges to act as lead procurement agency for county colleges.*
Allows deduction of certain patent income under gross income tax and corporation business tax for high technology corridor businesses.
Expands the Address Confidentiality Program to include victims of sexual assault and stalking.

Imposes oversight, cost analysis, and fee requirements for State contracts; includes State contract performance in conscientious employee protection act; limits to three years all State contracts; requires certain disclosures on State contracts.

Eliminates contractual tenure for superintendents of schools and administrative principals and reinstates career tenure for these positions after employment of seven years or two contract terms, whichever is longer.
Increases period over which compensation is averaged for calculation of TPAF and PERS pensions when member has different employer just before retirement or for fiscal year of highest compensation.
Adds cyber-harassment to the domestic violence statutes.
Establishes Task Force on School District Regionalization.
Extends for one year expiration date of certain permits pursuant to "Permit Extension Act of 2008." *
Dedicates portion of sales tax derived from electricity, natural gas, and hydrogen used to fuel motor vehicles to Transportation Trust Fund.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for employing immediate family members of members of the Armed Forces of the United States who were killed in action.
Provides corporation business tax credit for certain investment in broadband infrastructure in underserved communities.
Expands eligibility for property tax reimbursement program.
Requires signage indicating when parking kiosk receipt must be displayed in vehicle to avoid citation.
Requires Office of Information Technology to review Consolidated Assistance Support System development project and issue recommendations.
Requires installation of low-flow toilets and low-flow showerheads in multiple dwellings having three or more units.
Concerns consolidation of NJTA and SJTA.
Establishes "Delaware River Port Authority and Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission Consolidation Commission."
Requires DHS to use funds awarded from performance bonuses to increase staffing for processing certain applications and providing certain services.
Establishes Children's Health Promotion Fund.
Requires an annual State debt affordability analysis be included in the State Debt Report.
Permits counties to establish a central municipal drug court.
Permits agriculture-related events on preserved farmland.
Requires health benefits coverage for buprenorphine and buprenorphine/naloxone under certain conditions.
Requires credit check for certain DEP loans to private dam owners and lake associations.
Conforms Megan's Law to requirements of federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act.*
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.
"The Child and Family Suicide Prevention Act;" requires training related to screening for suicide prevention for pediatricians, physician assistants, and advanced practice nurses.*
Permits Governor to notify local governments to fly United States and State flags at half-staff upon death of member of Armed Forces of United States or National Guard who was State resident.
Upgrades simple assault to aggravated assault if committed against certain law enforcement officers and employees because of job status.
Concerns the recording of mortgages.
Increases electric power net metering capacity threshold to 2.9 percent of total annual kilowatt-hours sold in State.*
Requires signs displaying clear instructions be posted in vicinity of parking meters.
Prohibits religious entities from engaging in certain practices involving cemeteries, funeral homes and mortuaries, memorials, mausoleums and burial vaults.
Upgrades violation of a stalking restraining order to a crime of the third degree.*
Permits use of electronic smoking devices in vapor retail establishments.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance allowing voluntary registration of private outdoor video surveillance cameras.*
Reduces number of and establishes usage requirements for State vehicles.
Requires DOE to conduct study on options and benefits of instituting later school start time in middle school and high school.
Establishes third degree crime for certain trespasses involving victim of domestic violence.
Requires certified animal control officers and animal cruelty investigators to engage in continuing education.
Provides civil service preference to military service members who did not serve in theater of operation but received campaign or expedition medal.
Requires BPU to provide links to pricing information to customers from electric and gas public utilities, and third-party electric power and gas suppliers.*
Requires BPU to establish procedures allowing electric power and gas supplier customers to switch energy suppliers.
Imposes contract standards between customers and third-party electric power and gas suppliers.
Requires certain law enforcement officers to wear cameras.
Requires Passaic Valley Water Commission to obtain approval of certain municipalities before entering into certain contracts concerning open-air reservoirs.
Requires transportation network companies to make certain disclosures and register with MVC.
Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring maintenance and repair of certain wharves, piers, docks and bulkheads.

Provides maximum sales and use tax imposition amount for sales and uses of boats and vessels; establishes grace period for imposition of use tax on certain boats and vessels used by resident purchasers.
Establishes "Veterans Court Pilot Program in several counties."

Upgrades crime of stalking when stalking activity is carried out or assisted by installation or use of communication or location monitoring program or device on cellular phone or wireless mobile device.*
Permits public-private partnership agreements for certain building and highway infrastructure projects; provides for EDA oversight.
Clarifies provisions with regard to pet trusts.

Requires school district or nonpublic school that is a member of the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association to certify that its student-athletes have completed character education program.
Requires State to use certain energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Establishes licensure for associate marriage and family therapists.
Protects right to privacy underneath clothing; establishes crime of "upskirting".
Enhances procedures for enforcement of visitation and parenting time when parents' access to child has been denied.
Expands duties and responsibilities of Lieutenant Governor; includes Lieutenant Governor in existing laws governing recall and ethics; establishes Lieutenant Governor's salary and budget.
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements.
Authorizes State-chartered banks, savings banks, savings and loans, and credit unions to conduct certain savings account promotions.
Establishes State Taxi Commission.
Authorizes DOT to enter into public-private partnerships concerning transportation projects.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to advertise and promote tours of breweries in the State.
Prohibits hospitals from referring certain unpaid medical bills to collection agencies.
Authorizes free admission to State parks and forests for active and retired members of U.S. Armed Forces and their immediate family members.
Prohibits business receiving State development subsidies from making certain campaign contributions.
Reforms PANYNJ.
Establishes practice driving requirements for examination and special learner's permit holders.
Upgrades crime of false public alarm under certain circumstances.
Requires public and nonpublic school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to local law enforcement.
Directs Secretary of State to work with chief elections official in other states to identify and eliminate duplicate voter registration records.
Prohibits contribution action against local public entity for cleanup and removal costs or any other damages associated with discharge of hazardous substances.

Removes anhydrous ammonia used for refrigeration as substance regulated by "Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act"; eliminates DOLWD licensing for operators of refrigerating plants using anhydrous ammonia.
Provides additional State aid to county colleges for students enrolled in certain postsecondary career and technical education certificate programs.
Entitles nursing home residents to monitor and record in-room treatment, care, and living conditions using electronic monitoring devices, upon notice to nursing home.
Expands eligibility for veterans civil service preference.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax on Class C beneficiaries and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount for New Jersey estate tax to $1,500,000.
Increases petroleum products gross receipts tax rate; dedicates revenue generated from tax to Transportation Trust Fund; provides gross income tax deduction for certain taxes paid on motor fuel.
Increases reporting requirements for the NJ Basic Skills Training Program for Economic Growth.
Establishes Pedestrian Safety Study Commission.
Establishes school breakfast kiosk pilot program.
Requires continuing care retirement communities to provide residents with information on influenza vaccines for older adults.
Establishes NJ Innovation and Research Fellowship Program in DOWLD.
"Free Means Free Act"; prohibits misleading advertising of free products.
Requires consumer reporting agencies to place security freeze on consumer reports of protected consumers under certain circumstances.
Requires Internet gaming affiliates to be licensed as casinos; prohibits waiver of licensing requirements.
The "Motherhood Violence Act;" creates the offense of fetal homicide.
Changes State assistance to urban enterprise zones over seven years by increasing reduced sales tax in enterprise zones and dedicating increase to zone municipalities.
Allows nonprofit organizations to serve food made from wild game animals at charity and fundraising events and meetings.
Authorizes sale of alcoholic beverages to certain spouses of bona fide benevolent organization club members.
Establishes "no mail" list for residents of this State.
Establishes 80 as maximum age for issuing special handgun carry permits to retired police officers.
Requires local unit approval of applications for participation in federal 1033 program.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax for step-grandchildren.

Requires certain documentation to register and to vote; establishes penalties for failure to obtain NJ driver's license in certain circumstances, and for being registered to vote in this State and another state.
Directs BPU to allow broadband telecommunications service providers to use poles belonging to public utilities or CATV companies in certain instances.
Authorizes operators of motor vehicles to display electronic proof of insurance.
Requires transportation network companies to register with MVC and maintain certain insurance coverages.
Requires electric public utilities to install smart meters and associated infrastructure at the request of customer.
Establishes crime of sexual assault by fraud.
Provides for increase and annual adjustment in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Requires Department of Treasury to provide certain information to public regarding sale of State surplus personal property and to establish registration numbers for certain auction participants.
Requires certain health care facilities to provide information concerning palliative care and hospice services.*
Concerns establishment of wage standards by political subdivisions.
Upgrades burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree; upgrades it to a crime of the first degree if committed while armed.
Establishes special veteran motorcycle license plates.
Revises homestead property tax reimbursement eligibility requirements for certain claimants relocating homesteads within the same municipality.
Refines process of real property assessment in certain counties.
Permits municipalities and municipal parking authorities to create Senior Citizen Priority Parking Program.
"Commercial Motor Vehicle State Highway Parking Act."
Establishes information sharing protocols in DLPS and promotes public awareness concerning computer crime.
"Atlantic City Urban Enterprise Zone and Property Tax Relief Act"; creates urban enterprise zone in Atlantic City for 10 years.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to award pupil transportation contracts that exceed bid threshold through request for proposals.*
Authorizes optometrists to continue prescribing medications containing hydrocodone.
Requires Attorney General to establish mental health screening program for police officers involved in traumatic event.
Exempts county college from motor vehicle registration fee.
Authorizes limited brewery licensee to operate restaurant under certain circumstances.
Concerns certain tobacco sales.

Requires drivers to slow down before passing slow moving vehicles; establishes Statewide educational campaign on rural roadway safety; updates agriculture-related motor vehicle laws to reflect current industry practices.
"Uncompensated Pending Medicaid Beneficiary Payment Relief Act"; provides compensation relief to nursing facilities when resident's Medicaid eligibility determination is delayed more than 90 days.*
Creates exclusion from municipal property tax levy cap for amounts necessary to provide required matching funds to qualify for grants and other funds.
Provides court with sentencing discretion in certain cases under the "Graves Act."
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Provides diamondback terrapins protection as nongame indigenous species.
Requires public bodies under Open Public Meetings Act to display U.S. flag and recite Pledge of Allegiance at beginning of meeting.

Requires DOH to adopt rules and regulations to facilitate nursing home compliance with statutory mattress replacement requirements, and to regularly report on its implementation and enforcement efforts.
Provides credits under corporation business tax and gross income tax for qualified wages of certain disabled veterans.
Establishes right of sexual assault victim to notification of certain developments in criminal case.
Permits use of virtual instruction to meet minimum 180-day school year requirement under certain circumstances.

Upgrades crime of photographing, filming, or disseminating photos or films showing a person's intimate parts or sexual conduct when person has not consented to the photography, filming, or disseminating.
Bars domestic violence defendants from participation in Pretrial Intervention.
Authorizes municipalities to require subdivision approval prior to or as condition of creation or conveyance of certain condominiums or units thereof.
Enhances "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights"; prohibits defendant from entering crime victim's home throughout criminal justice process, including in relation to any investigation or discovery.
Modifies notary public application process by removing requirement for application endorsement by member of Legislature.
Authorizes water supply public-private partnerships.
Allows cultivation of commercial shellfish species in certain coastal and inner harbor waters for research and educational purposes.
Requires disclosures of out-of-network services performed by health care providers under certain circumstances.
"Personal Information and Privacy Protection Act"; restricts collection and use of personal information by retail establishments for certain purposes.*
Requires institutions of higher education to adopt affirmative consent standard and other policies regarding sexual assault, domestic violence, dating violence, and stalking.
Requires money transmitters to provide training materials to delegates concerning financial abuse and exploitation of elder adults.
Requires full pay for certain health care and public safety workers placed in isolation or quarantine.
Permits correctional facilities to utilize body imaging scanning equipment.
Exempts certain vehicles owned or leased by certain health care facilities and other facilities licensed by Department of Human Services or Department of Health from "Angelie's Law."*
Dedicates 30 percent of all UEZ sales tax revenues to respective UEZ account and 70 percent of UEZ sales tax revenues to General Fund.
"New Jersey Health Insurance Marketplace Act."
Authorizes Drinking Water Quality Institute to study and recommend maximum contaminant level for 1,2,3-trichloropropane to DEP.*
Requires development and maintenance of database to advise public about open bed availability in residential substance use disorders treatment facilities.
Authorizes establishment of Achieving a Better Life Experience accounts for persons with certain disabilities.*
Designates State Highway Route 17 in Borough of Ramsey as "Staff Sergeant Timothy R. McGill Memorial Highway."
Prohibits certain employment actions against employees affected by a declared state of emergency.
Revises requirements for establishment of central municipal courts.
Clarifies police powers of sheriff's officers in certain counties to enforce motor vehicle and traffic laws.
Requires State contracts for Internet software to include indefinite support from software manufacturer.
Increases from 17 to 21 public members of New Jersey State Council on the Arts; requires members to be residents iof NJ; imposes specific criteria for four new members initially appointed.*
Provides for receipts for applications for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
Establishes red light camera program in DOT; requires one-half of red light camera ticket revenue be used to improve highway traffic safety.
Requires pharmacies to install and maintain secure prescription medication drop-off receptacles, and Division of Consumer Affairs to post receptacle location information online.
"New Jersey Library Construction Bond Act"; authorizes issuance of $125,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance capital projects at public libraries; appropriates $5,000.

"New Jersey Tuition Equality for America's Military (NJTEAM) Act"; provides in-State tuition at New Jersey public institutions of higher education to military veterans and certain family members living in New Jersey.
Requires public utilities to provide priority service to public schools, private schools, and public safety agencies.
"Hackensack Meadowlands Agency Consolidation Act"; "Hackensack Meadowlands Transportation Planning District Act of 2014"; "New Jersey Meadowlands Tax Relief Act."
Authorizes county vocational school district to request county improvement authority to construct and issue bonds to finance school facilities project.
Extends post-military service protection against mortgage foreclosure.
Allows casino and out-of-State racetrack to negotiate amount casino will pay for simulcast races.
Designates Atlantic City and Pleasantville, Atlantic County, as areas eligible for redemption of pinelands development credits.

Establishes animal importer registration, and animal grooming facility and animal training facility licenses; establishes requirements for animal importers, animal grooming facilities, and animal training facilities and penalties for certain violations.
Protects current out-of-State placements of individuals with developmental disabilities and prohibits transfer in-State under certain conditions.*
Requires DHS to ensure that expedited benefits under Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) are made available to certain households.
Establishes animal cruelty offenses pertaining to chaining or other restraint of animals.
Authorizes veterans to deduct two years military service from age requirement for police officer under certain circumstances.
Requires omnibus drivers to inspect bus at end of route for passengers with disabilities.
Permits demonstration county to terminate its participation in the "Real Property Assessment Demonstration Program."
"Casino Property Taxation Stabilization Act."
Requires holder of casino license to provide certain employees with certain health care and retirement benefits.
Authorizes supplemental State aid to school districts in municipality with significant decrease in commercial property valuation; makes appropriation.
Reallocates casino investment alternative tax to Atlantic City to pay debt service on municipal bonds issued.
Removes provisions of law relating to Atlantic City Alliance.
Permits certain fire police units to appoint fire police officers.
Reduces membership of Rutgers board of trustees and eliminates dual membership on Rutgers board of trustees and Rutgers board of governors.
Requires law enforcement officers to wear body cameras.
Requires various measures to address effects of low levels of lead exposure.
Establishes New Jersey Eco-Ag Tourism Council.
Requires DOT to place tourist oriented directional signs for agri-tourism and natural attractions on State roads; expands sites that qualify as natural attraction.

Requires consideration of ecotourism when evaluating and ranking applications by local government units or qualifying tax exempt nonprofit organizations for acquisition or development of lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Establishes annual photography competition to promote ecological and agricultural wonders of NJ.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to establish Internet webpage promoting and advertising ecological and agricultural tourist attractions on division's website.
Authorizes court to waive certain fees, offer mediation as sentence; authorizes defendant information in presentence report; requires benefits be considered in juvenile plan.
Provides additional deduction and accelerated expensing under corporation business tax for certain purchase and installation of mechanical insulation property.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain services performed to manufacturing equipment.
Limits transmission of ballots by messenger or bearer to two ballots; limits time to allow ballots to be distributed to and by messenger to within 10 days before election.
Confers civil service status on police officers employed by Rutgers University.
Permits increase in municipal free public library tax upon voter approval.
Provides assistance to manufacturing businesses by having certain State agencies promote economic development and identify credentials needed for careers in modern manufacturing.

Limits annual increase in tuition rates charged by school districts, county vocational school districts, county special services districts, jointure commissions, and private schools for students with disabilities to two percent.
Establishes "Atlantic City Growth Tax Credit Program" to grant tax credits to promote the development of non-rental housing in Atlantic City.
Permits certain school districts to be monitored by DOE under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum every six years; requires development of electronic reporting system.
Directs the Department of Corrections to advise new inmates of child support obligations and modification procedures.
Expands category of lists from which a single juror source list is compiled to include recipients of cash assistance or food stamps.

Requires DOC to make reports containing information concerning treatment and reentry initiative participation; requires AOC to establish program that collects recidivism data and make reports concerning adults sentenced to period of probation.*

Clarifies that Division of Mental Health Advocacy in Office of Public Defender is required to represent indigent patients in all mental health commitment proceedings, whether related to inpatient or outpatient treatment.

Directs Attorney General to establish "Student-Athlete's Bill of Rights" for interscholastic sports teams similar to requirement that Attorney General establish "Pledge's Bill of Rights" for fraternities and sororities at institutions of higher education.
Authoirizes recitation of Pledge of Allegiance by public body at public meeting; permits discretionary court award of certain fees and costs to public body.
Establishes "Tiny Home Pilot Program" in three regions of State; appropriates $5 million.
Eliminates mortgage guaranty insurance coverage cap of 25% of outstanding balance of insured loan.
Requires non-citizen designation on driver's license, driving permit, or identification card.
Excludes projects funded by Transportation Trust Fund from prevailing wage requirements.

Removes presumption of nonimprisionment in certain assault cases involving domestic violence victims; expands criminal coercion statute; revises Pretrial Intervention procedures in certain criminal cases.*

Requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, or food boxes in certain areas located in black bear habitat under certain circumstances, including garbage collection, and prohibits certain actions that would result in feeding of black bears.
Authorizes operation of lottery courier services.
Designates five State songs.
Transfers Palisades Interstate Park Commission police force to New Jersey State Park Police.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for capital gains from sale of certain employer securities by qualified business that result in net positive benefit to the State.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Provides annual salary supplement for teachers earning National Board certification; appropriates $500,000.
"Equitable Permit Extension Act of 2014."
Creates "Fishing Buddy License."
Establishes New Jersey Caregiver Task Force to evaluate and provide recommendations on caregiver support services.
Requires installation of baby-changing stations in certain public restrooms.
Requires shareholder approval of campaign contributions and certain independent expenditures made by New Jersey corporations.
Permits service of parking tickets by mail.
Establishes "breakfast after the bell" incentive fund.

Eliminates requirement that school district grant up to two days with full pay for attendance at NJ Education Association convention; provides that granting of paid leave or reimbursement for professional development is subject to bargaining.
Provides that superintendent salary caps are applicable to charter school administrators and requires charter schools to annually submit list of employees subject to cap.
Regulates use of motor vehicle payment assurance devices.*
Requires notification to certain buyers of health club services of automatic renewal clauses in health club contracts.
Prohibits sale of powdered caffeine.
Authorizes board of education to establish community service credit program for high school students.*
Limits annual increase in tuition rates charged by county vocational school districts to two percent.
Requires school districts to observe Veterans Day as school holiday.
Establishes patient-centered medical home program.
Requires county clerk to set annual compensation of personnel in office of county clerk.
Makes provisions of the "New Jersey False Claims Act" retroactive under certain circumstances.
Designates State Highway Route 15 in Sussex County as "Senator Robert E. Littell Memorial Highway."
Requires DCA to make information on homeless prevention programs and services available on its Internet website.
Requires a public school district to provide a daily recess period for students in grades kindergarten through 5.
Bars domestic violence defendants from participation in Pretrial Intervention.
Exempts certain property from attachment.
Creates Office of Sustainability.
Requires installation of grab bars in certain public restrooms.
Provides $21 minimum annual energy assistance to qualified families; qualifies families to receive additional nutritional assistance.
Exempts local public contracts with start-up manufacturers that invest in redevelopment areas from bidding requirements.
Requires NJ Energy Star Homes Program incentives be available Statewide.
Provides for licensing of pool and spa service contractors, and pool and spa builders and installers.
Requires institution of higher education to provide victim-centered training to employees who assist student victims of sexual assault.
Permits certain qualified nonprofit organizations to participate in State purchasing contracts.
Prohibits NJ State Forest Nursery from undercutting private nurseries by selling forestation stock below average market price.
Establishes New Jersey Rare Disease Advisory Council.
Prohibits provisions in consumer contracts which penalize a consumer for commenting negatively about goods or services rendered.
Requires State to recognize permits to carry handguns issued to certain New Jersey residents by other states.
Establishes amber light duration at traffic control signals.
Requires environmental sustainability plan for State House Complex.
Requires students in grade 12 to pass United States Citizenship and Immigration Services civics test as part of high school graduation requirements.
Permits reimbursement of COBRA health benefit costs of survivors of certain deceased public safety employees; appropriates $750,000.**
Requires certain minimum motor vehicle liability insurance coverage upon conviction of certain offenses involving motor vehicles.

Allows qualifying counties and municipalities to become "agriculture development counties" and "agriculture development municipalities" and provides certain associated resulting benefits therefrom to encourage, protect, and preserve agriculture and related businesses.
Revises law concerning prohibition of certain unsolicited checks.
Revises penalty provision of law concerning prohibition of certain unsolicited text messages.
The "Municipal Volunteer Property Tax Reduction Act"; permits certain municipal property owners to perform volunteer services in return for property tax vouchers.
Establishes appraisal method for taxation of watershed lands.
Establishes position of State Oceanographer.
Limits authority of court to order one or both parents to pay post-high school education expenses on behalf of a child if both parents agree that they will not pay such expenses.
Requires fire suppression and alarm systems in certain group homes.
Extends eligibility to participate in Neighborhood Revitalization Tax Credit Program to areas located in municipality in which casino gaming is authorized.
Requires installation of carbon monoxide detectors in certain structures; designated as "Korman and Park's Law."
Requires State contracts to include provisions imposing penalties on vendor or contractor for contract violations.
Provides expedited procedure for foreclosing residential properties in uncontested actions.
Requires health insurance carriers to reimburse network providers of diagnostic radiologic services at the same rate.
Requires public institutions of higher education to offer two-hour seminar on prevention of sexual assault to certain students.
"Sexual Assault Survivor Protection Act of 2015"; authorizes the court to issue protective orders for victims of certain nonconsensual sexual conduct.
Directs Department of Agriculture to publish on its website "New Jersey Gleaning Week" and "Farmers Against Hunger Day" page.
Requires insurers that sell flood insurance to provide certain policyholders with certain information.
Clarifies that law enforcement officer who knowingly chokes another person engages in use of deadly force.
"Port Support Zone Act of 2015."
Prohibits "gay panic" defense for murder; prevents reduction of murder charge to manslaughter committed in heat of passion under certain circumstances.
Expands eligibility to receive the veterans' property tax deduction and the veterans' property tax exemption.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for businesses that employ apprentices in DOL registered apprenticeships.
Requires DOE to include military-connected student identifier in student-level database; requires district inform teacher when military-connected student enrolls in class taught by teacher.
Requires pharmaceutical manufacturers and wholesale distributors accept and provide a rebate for certain returned drugs.
Establishes "Hazardous Drug Safe Handling Act;" requires DOLWD to promulgate standards and regulations concerning safe handling of hazardous drugs by health care personnel.
Revises certain provisions of dental service corporation law.
Requires DHS establish a Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program enrollment program.
Allows certain on-site generation facilities to deliver electricity without utilizing electric public utility infrastructure.
Imposes certain registration and reporting requirements to prevent illegal trade of tigers.
Prohibits certain possession, sale, offering for sale, trade or distribution of shark fins.
Permits administration of epinephrine auto-injector device by persons who complete approved educational program.
Requires State to lower compensation rate of civilly committed sexually violent predators to same level as State inmates for institutional work.
Prohibits termination of law enforcement officer based upon determination that officer is physically unable to perform duty under certain circumstances.
Prohibits certain provisions in consumer contracts.
Prohibits sale or distribution of liquid nicotine except in child-resistant containers.
Extends to all county sheriffs authorization to appoint Class Two special law enforcement officers to perform court security assignments.
Requires hospital patient's medical record to include notation if patient has Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.
Provides US Armed Forces and Reserves members with protection against interference with their employment, trade or business.
Provides US Armed Forces and Reserves members with protection against interference with enjoyment of any accommodation, facility, public accommodation, or privilege.
Creates workforce training program for former casino workers.

New Jersey Stolen Valor Act; makes unauthorized use of military uniforms, medals or insignias, and certain false statements regarding receipt of military awards with intent to obtain benefit crimes of third degree.
Expands scope of law governing registration of security guards; designated as " Detective Vincent Santiago's Law." *
Establishes "Stun Gun Purchase and Training Fund" to provide stun guns and training to law enforcement officers.
Requires auctioneers to register with Division of Consumer Affairs.
Requires law enforcement agencies to obtain search warrant prior to accessing telecommunications subscriber's personal information.
"Santiago/Ramos/Liu Police Protection Act"; requires certain law enforcement vehicles to have tinted windows.
Requires MVC conduct study and make recommendations concerning electronic driver's licenses and mobile applications.
Establishes certain minimum and maximum temperatures in emergency shelters, rooming and boarding houses, and certain nursing homes and residential health care facilities.
Stipulates that retail motor fuel dealers, when paying interchange fees, shall not be charged for costs associated with certain taxes.
Directs DOT to add certain portion of Rising Sun Road in Bordentown Township to State highway system.
Allows municipality to establish reserved parking zone on property adjacent to disabled person's residence.
Prohibits hotels from interfering with wireless networking services.
Permits primary elections to be conducted by mail.
Reestablishes crime of incest; criminalizes knowingly marrying or entering into civil union, or engaging in sexual activity, with certain family members.
Requires DHS to prioritize placement of parents of children receiving services from DCPP in mental health and substance abuse treatment programs.
Establishes "New Jersey Out-of-School Time Advisory Commission" to review before-school, after-school, and summer programs.
Extends urban enterprise zone designation in all qualifying municipalities for additional 10 years. *
Provides certain definitions for biofuels under "Motor Fuels Tax Act."
Establishes pilot program to allow certain counties and municipalities to use single firm for design and inspection services on certain transportation projects.
Requires casino licensee to apply every five years for casino license renewal.
Establishes affirmative defense against builder's remedy lawsuits.
Requires annual evaluation reports by Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development on survey responses to be obtained from certain employers that end operations in this State.*
Provides active duty Armed Forces and Reserves members with exemption from jury duty and protection from assault while on military duty.
Permits BPU to approve qualified wind energy project; requires BPU to provide application periods for those projects.*
Establishes "New Jersey Business Advisory Council" in Business Action Center.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on interacting with law enforcement as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Social Studies.
Permits application of certain tinting materials on motor vehicle windows and windshields.
Permits group self-insurance plans for, and collective bargaining agreements improving the provision of, workers' compensation.
Allows dispensation of certain nutritional supplements by physician or podiatric physician.
Requires boards of education to adopt policies to make schools asthma-friendly.
Makes changes to procedures used by medical examiners for autopsies or dissections performed over religious objections.
Provides that parent of nonpublic school pupil who lives more than 20 miles from school will receive payment toward transportation costs.
Requires survey of certain businesses having more than 100 full-time employees in certain areas of Philadelphia and Wilmington region regarding their back office operations.
Establishes workforce training program for underemployed individuals.
Establishes temporary mortgage relief programs for certain owners of real property impacted by "Superstorm Sandy."*
Provides that Secretary of State, as leader of tourism and economic development, will have authority to designate and prepare special commemorative day, week, month, or year for the State.
Permits publication of legal notices by governments and individuals on official government website instead of newspaper.
Requires public agency responding to record request to redact information contained in accident report, except for drivers' names and diagram of accident.
Permits holders of certain alcoholic beverage licenses to be issued amusement game license and updates definition of recognized amusement park.
Requires insurance producer licensing examination and registration materials to be offered in English and Spanish, and examination instructional materials to be available in Spanish.
Establishes durational time limits for receipt of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits.
Authorizes DEP and NJ Marine Fisheries Council to regulate taking and management of striped bass; establishes interim taking restrictions.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for certain firefighter training graduates.
Provides an excused absence on Veterans Day for pupil who participates in certain activities for veterans or active duty members of United States Armed Forces or New Jersey National Guard.
Expands number of safe havens for leaving newborn infants.
Establishes the offense of incest.
Establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank Fund within New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust.
Requires law enforcement to obtain a warrant as the only means for accessing certain information from providers of electronic communication services.
Establishes resisting arrest public awareness campaign.
Clarifies law governing appointment of freeholder as county counsel or county treasurer.
Prohibits the restraint of prisoners during and immediately after childbirth.
Establishes task force to study issues related to sexual assault on college campuses.

Requires Commissioner of Transportation to publish notice of certain transportation-related infrastructure projects and activities on Internet website, and directs State Comptroller to monitor publication of those notifications.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.
Establishes certain requirements for 9-1-1 public safety answering points and public safety dispatch points.
Allows parent or guardian to be present during behind-the-wheel instruction of minor.
Requires certain CATV companies to provide Internet service at public libraries with business customer class Internet access bandwidth and circuit capacity proportional to public libraries' needs.
Requires Attorney General to appoint special prosecutor when criminal complaint is filed against law enforcement officer.
Revises law concerning foreign country money-judgment recognition.
Concerns county government dissolution.
Allows parent or guardian to exclude student from administration of certain assessments.
Requires employers and health care institutions to disseminate information regarding certain leave and benefits.*
Requires DHS to notify enrollees in Programs of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly of Medicare eligibility.
Requires providers to submit to DHS expenditure details of enrollees in Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly.
Requires DHS to monitor utilization and billing of services for Medicaid home and community-based long-term care.
Prohibits homeowners insurance premium increase based on first claim during coverage period.
Requires creditors to maintain vacant and abandoned non-residential properties under foreclosure.
Requires creditors to maintain interior of vacant and abandoned residential property under foreclosure.

Requires Division of Purchase and Property to provide additional notification of contracting opportunities to vendors or potential vendors providing or interested in providing home health care services to State agencies.

Requires safeguards for anonymity and confidentiality with respect to communications presented through phone lines, electronic communication systems, or websites dedicated to accepting anonymous tips for use by law enforcement in criminal investigations.
Imposes $0.25 surcharge on alcoholic beverages to be dedicated to Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund.
Allows person on police officer or firefighter eligible list who is unable to complete requirements for employment due to certain military service to have name placed on subsequent eligible list.
Restricts use of eminent domain by private pipeline companies to those demonstrating pipeline is in the public interest and that agree to certain regulation by BPU.
Prohibits use of snares in trapping of wildlife.
Establishes microgrid pilot program.
Authorizes use of juvenile records for prosecution of gang criminality.
Prohibits firearm possession by persons convicted of carjacking, gang criminality, racketeering and terroristic threats.
Permits elections by mail for certain local government units.

Requires Division of State Lottery to reduce advertising expenses for multi-state lottery games by sharing expenses with other participating states and to conduct evaluation of advertising expenses for State lottery games on annual basis.
Requires municipal land use plan element of master plan to address smart growth and storm resiliency, and environmental sustainability issues.
Establishes "Solar Roof Installation Warranty Program" in EDA and transfers $2 million from societal benefits charge to initially fund program.

Allows intergovernmental transfer of law enforcement officer without consent of sending jurisdiction if officer completed two or more consecutive years of employment and consent was refused previously.
Clarifies that Alzheimer's disease and related disorders may be listed as secondary cause of death on death certificate when appropriate.
Allows NJ gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions of food made from business inventory.
Imposes three-year moratorium on use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers for certain purposes.
Establishes the State Debt Capacity Advisory Commission.
Requires establishment of and compliance with infection control risk assessment minimum training for persons performing certain hospital construction work.
Requires school districts and charter schools to provide educationally appropriate alternative activities to students not participating in administration of certain standardized assessments.
Authorizes mobile electronic waste destruction units to operate without DEP permit.
Requires evaluation of appropriateness of light frame construction for multiple dwellings and imposes moratorium on light frame construction until determination and recommendations are adopted.
Clarifies and revises certain aspects of the "Hackensack Meadowlands Agency Consolidation Act."
Implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for certain enviromental purposes; revises States's open space, farmland, and historic preservation programs.**
Provides that recent law requiring palimony agreements to be in writing encompasses palimony agreements made prior to the effective date unless certain circumstances apply.
Caps liability of public entities and public employees for compensatory, noneconomic losses in tort actions at $350,000.
Extends immunity for sports and recreational activities to premises located in residential and semi-rural areas for activity of sledding.
Prohibits installation and sale of wheel weights containing lead or mercury; prohibits sale of new motor vehicles equipped with wheel weights containing lead or mercury.
Requires NJ State Council on Arts to establish "Artist District" designation and select certain municipalities or areas within municipalities for such designation.
Implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for certain environmental purposes; revises State's open space, farmland, and historic preservation programs.
Requires online data brokers to establish accountability and transparency measures for collection and use of personal informaton.
Establishes air quality standards and requires certificate from Commissioner of Health for operation of indoor ice arenas, indoor motorsports arenas, and special indoor motorsports events.
Implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for open space, farmland and historic preservation purposes.

Requires public school students with concussion to be evaluated by licensed health care professionals before return to school; requires school districts to provide restrictions or limitations to student as needed.*
Prohibits award of custody or visitation rights to persons convicted of certain sex crimes against minors.
Requires DOE to establish NJ Dyslexia website.
Bars judicially sanctioned name change to persons required to register as sex offender.
Requires persons convicted of sex offense in foreign countries to comply with Megan's Law.
Recognizes American Sign Language as a world language for meeting high school graduation requirements.
Permits unregulated solicitation to perform snow shoveling within 24 hours of predicted snowstorm.
Requires students enrolled in public institutions of higher education to complete course on financial literacy.
Increases amount annually credited to Shore Protection Fund to $50 million.
Requires sex offenders to report internet identifiers and name changes.
Requires suspension of driver's license for gross income tax deficiency under certain circumstances.
Revises certain laws concerning domestic violence and firearms.
Eliminates mandatory newspaper publication of legal notices by governments and individuals; permits voluntary publication of legal notices in newspapers or on Internet.
Concerns temporary registration certificates for automobiles.*
Provides that certain ethical standards will apply to Governor.
Harmonizes the disqualifying offenses and certain other criminal history record background check requirements applicable to home instructors employed under DOE or DHS authority.
Requires MVC to accept death certificate as proof of name change.
Establishes renewable energy portfolio standards.

Exempts transfers of property to Class C beneficiaries from transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount under estate tax to $5,000,000 over five-year period.
Requires students to pass test identical to United States Citizenship and Immigration Services civics test as part of high school graduation requirements.
