Directs DOT to update advisability studies concerning cost difference between using in-house forces versus consultants for bridge inspections, construction inspections, and design projects.
Requires DEP and Division of Travel and Tourism to include ecologically based tourism areas on official State travel and tourism map.
Concerns unlawful employment practices based on provision of health benefits plans.
Establishes separate class of claims against insolvent estates for child support judgments; modifies order for payment of claims by representative of insolvent estate.
Authorizes health care practitioners to provide health care services through telemedicine.
Establishes "North Jersey District Water Supply Commission and Passaic Valley Water Commission Consolidation Committee."
Provides Medicaid coverage for advance care planning.
Declares the rights of a parent to be fundamental and not subject to infringement by the State absent compelling need.

Permits municipalities to issue two separate property tax bills to property taxpayers; requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Requires board of elections to count mail-in ballot of voter who dies prior to election if voter was otherwise qualified to vote.

Requires Standardbred organization to use certain portion of purse moneys from in-State Standardbred races to fund foundation providing retired Standardbred race horses pre-adoption care and support Standardbred racing and breeding legislation with nonpublic funds.
Provides that records of convictions for carjacking and promoting prostitution of a child shall not be expunged.
Continues tax exempt status of certain real property owned by disabled veterans during reconstruction of homes destroyed by flood, storm, or other act of God.
Eliminates certain prohibitions to expungements of criminal records.
Establishes NJ STEM Entrepreneur Fellowship Program in DOLWD.
Establishes minimum Medicaid reimbursement rate for personal care services.
Establishes six-year alternative parole eligibility pilot program for certain offenders.
Establishes pilot reentry court program.
Reduces helicopter operations at certain aviation facilities licensed by State.
Prohibits purchaser of used motor vehicle from waiving dealer's obligation regarding emissions control equipment.
Allows individual appointed as State monitor to remain employed for more than two years without cancellation of retirement benefits.
Permits municipal land banking in conjunction with online property database development.*
Requires newborn infant screening for tongue tie.
Revises definition of "antique firearm" to include handguns.
Imposes a wholesale sales tax on electronic cigarettes and similar nicotine delivery products, changes tax base and requires licenses to conduct business in tobacco products.
Authorizes trustees of PERS, TPAF, PFRS, SPRS, and JRS to control investment of assets of each system.
Provides that unlawful use, manufacture, or distribution of controlled dangerous substance by parent or caregiver in presence of child constitutes crime of endangering welfare of that child.
Upgrades assault on school personnel to crime of the third degree in all instances.
Clarifies that electronic public records do not have to be converted to different electronic formats under the State's open public records law.
Changes records custodian liability threshold; creates natural disaster exemption.
Clarifies that chief of police or Superintendent of State Police has burden of proving applicant's disqualification for permit to purchase handgun or firearms purchaser identification card.
Clarifies liability for discharges of hazardous substances from drilling platforms that enter NJ waters.
Requires photographic identification cards for bail agents.
Requires natural gas pipeline utilities to repair or replace leaking natural gas pipelines.
Requires State to include distributed energy resource in certain new State buildings and consider retrofitting certain existing State buildings with distributed energy resource.

Provides gross income tax credit for income derived from certain live performances contracted for and rendered by A-list performing artists within the Atlantic City Tourism District on a recurring basis and within the State.
Requires reimbursement of certain Casino Reinvestment Development Authority grants and payment of those grants to Atlantic County for property tax relief.
Ensures equal rights and opportunities for pregnant graduate students in institutions of higher education.

Permits municipal, county, and regional police and fire forces to establish five-year residency requirement for police officers and firefighters; allows exceptions to requirement under certain circumstances.**
Revises criteria for determining whether dog is vicious or potentially dangerous.

Creates new liquor licenses for certain restaurants and permits the issuance of additional liquor licenses; provides tax credit under corporate business tax and gross income tax for fair market value of certain alcoholic beverage licenses.
Establishes Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers Task Force.
Requires counties to establish crisis intervention services programs and advisory councils.
Establishes "MVP Emergency Alert System" for missing persons with mental, intellectual, or developmental disabilities.
Mandates health benefits coverage for opioid analgesics with abuse-deterrent properties. *
Establishes criminal penalties for violating quarantine orders.
Establishes vocational training pilot program in DOC; provides for inmate compensation for education and workforce training participation.
The "New Jersey Corporation Political Expenditure Shareholder's Protection Act."
"New Jersey Secure Choice Savings Program Act"; establishes retirement savings program for certain workers.

Updates factors for consideration for grandparent and sibling petitions seeking visits with child over objection of parent, guardian, or custodian; adds preference for child's temporary placement with grandparent under "Child Placement Bill of Rights Act."
Establishes "gun-free" and "weapon free" zones around certain school and public properties.
Requires DMAVA to develop online historic tour identifying locations of war battles and places of significance to war efforts in State. *
Regulates pharmacy benefits management companies.
Expands juror qualifications to include persons previously convicted of indictable offenses under certain circumstances.
Amends Fiscal Year 2015 budget to provide one-half of certain environmental damage amounts recovered are appropriated for costs of remediation, restoration, and clean up.
Amends and repeals sections of "Respiratory Care Practitioner Licensing Act."
Requires owner or operator of certain trains to have discharge response, cleanup, and contingency plans to transport certain hazardous materials by rail.
Implements certain governance and transparency reforms at PANYNJ.
Requires certain funds paid to CRDA to be awarded to Atlantic County for property tax relief.
Authorizes transfer of excess medical marijuana inventory between alternative treatment centers.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
"Secure Schools for All Children Act"; establishes State aid program for security services, equipment, or technology to ensure safe and secure school environment for nonpublic school students.
Allows municipalities to acquire and sell inactive plenary retail consumption licenses.
Authorizes members of public bodies to use electronic agendas at meetings.
Permits volunteer fire company or volunteer first aid or rescue squad licensed to conduct bingo games to use public building for operation of bingo games under certain circumstances.
"Madison Holleran Proper Reporting Act"; requires institutions of higher education to post information on student suicides and attempted suicides on website.

"Madison Holleran Suicide Prevention Act"; requires institutions of higher education to have health care professionals who focus on reducing student suicides and attempted suicides available 24 hours a day.
Adds as additional aggravating factor in sentencing that the person committed an act of domestic violence in presence of a child under 16 years of age.
Allows businesses due to receive grant under Business Employment Incentive Program to elect to receive corporate or gross income tax credit if grant funds are not available.

Exempts sales of certain products from sales and use tax, and provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes for certain small businesses that use New Jersey goods or agricultural produce.
Modifies the gross income tax to enable the carryforward of capital losses and exclude capital gains from the sale of closely held businesses.
Requires institutions of higher education to offer cats and dogs no longer used for educational, research, or scientific purposes to animal rescue organizations for adoption.
Makes certain reforms to juvenile justice system.

"Volunteers in Public Service Pension Reform Act," allows municipal elected officials in PERS to retire based on other PERS service and remain in office with no salary or health care benefits for that office.
Upgrades domestic violence-related assault to crime of the fourth degree; upgrades second or subsequent offense to crime of the third degree.
Requires posting of signs warning of presence of, and potential danger caused by, duckweed on water bodies in public parks.
Adds two public members to NJT board.
Establishes program allowing certain applicants to perform community service in lieu of paying motor vehicle surcharges.
Establishes grant program for homeless veterans shelters.
Reduces number of voters for whom person can serve as messenger; limits to three number of voted mail-in ballots transmittable by bearer; modifies conviction standard under vote by mail law.
Increases required public notice from 30 days to 60 days for settlements entered into by DEP pursuant to Spill Compensation and Control Act.
Requires mental health evaluation for all animal cruelty offenders; designated as "Shyanne's Law."

Transfers Division of Mental Health Advocacy to DHS; re-titles director as Mental Health Advocate; provides diversion for mental health treatment for persons subject to prosecution in municipal court; appropriates $15,000,000.
Prohibits tourist helicopter operations in New Jersey.
Allows PFRS to pay pension to member who resigns and retires from PFRS-covered employment to assume elective office with same employer to eliminate conflict of incompatible positions.
Prohibits State from billing counties for cost of psychiatric hospitalization when the patient or legally responsible relative is responsible for costs by court order.
Prohibits any entity receiving public funds from banning display of United States flag under certain circumstances.
Eliminates certain sales restrictions on recreational vehicles.
Permits DOH licensure of elective angioplasty facilities.
Increases efficiency and transparency in distribution of Superstorm Sandy aid money.
Authorizes court to impose rescue operation costs of public entity under certain circumstances.
Requires explosive gas detectors to be installed in certain residential properties.
Establishes a one-year pilot program in the Office of the Attorney General concerning field testing for synthetic drugs.
Requires MVC to refund certain motor vehicle registration fees.
Removes municipal referendum and site requirements for issuance of amusement gaming licenses.
Revises timeframes for issuance of certain construction permits by DEP in 90 days.
Expands timeframe for renewal of driver's license, registration, and inspection by military personnel and immediate family members under certain circumstances.*
Includes all disabled veterans in NJT discount program for senior citizens and persons with disabilities.
Makes changes to electronic waste recycling program.
Reforms annual State revenue estimating and reporting, and executive State budget presentation and revenue certification processes.
Directs State Board of Education to authorize computer science education endorsement to instructional certificate.
Establishes Response to Intervention initiative in DOE to support and encourage school districts in implementation of Response to Intervention framework.
Exempts certain real estate brokers, broker-salespersons and salespersons from continuing education requirement.
Authorizes installation of automatic standby generators in certain residences without zoning or planning board approval.
Establishes requirements for training programs for homemaker-home health aides in care of patients with Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.*
Permits municipal redevelopers to receive tax credits under Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program for certain mixed use parking projects.*
Exempts certain activities of alarm businesses from statutes governing practice of locksmithing. *
Expands scope of New Jersey Regulatory Flexibility Act dealing with economic impact of rules on small businesses.
Sets criteria for online learning provided to public school students.
Prohibits transfer of individuals with developmental disabilities from out-of-State to in-State placements under certain conditions.
Expands eligibility of inmates for medical parole and requires inmate's enrollment in Medicaid under certain circumstances.
Designates Io moth as State Moth.
Designates Thomas Alva Edison as State Inventor.
Directs DEP to establish three-year pilot program to permit for-hire vessels to fish for summer flounder in Delaware waters pursuant to Delaware regulations.
Requires development and maintenance of data dashboard report to advise of open bed availability in residential facilities providing behavioral health services.
Concerns conveyance of certain State-owned lands.
Requires county and municipal police departments to establish cultural diversity training course and plan.
Criminalizes using drones to conduct surveillance of or fly over critical infrastructures; requires certain drones to be registered and insured.*
Requires annual General Fund appropriation to DMVA for purposes of base realignment and closure.*
Permits municipal clerks to solemnize marriage and civil union ceremonies when authorized by mayor.
Requires State Police to conduct criminal history record background check for taxicab driver applicants.
Requires criminal history record background check for rifle and shotgun purchases.
"HOPE Initiative Act;" requires establishment of public awareness campaign to educate citizens about dangers and causes of, and appropriate responses to, heroin and opiod addiction.
Creates penalties for using mobile applications to aid in commission of crime.
Establishes three-year moratorium on increases in charter school enrollment.

Prohibits DOE from regulating maximum salary amount school district may pay superintendent of schools and eliminates TPAF enrollment exception for certain certified superintendents and administrators.
"Music Therapist Licensing Act."
Requires employees of private entity with access to student information under contract with DOE, school districts, or charter schools to undergo criminal background check.
Designates "Franklinite" as official mineral of State of NJ.
Establishes State Transportation Cost Analysis Task Force.
Establishes Small Business Unit and Small Business Task Force within Business Action Center in Department of State.
Expands implied consent statute to include urine testing.

Requires that school district's request for permission to use unrecognized position title include list of abolished positions and positions in which there have been layoffs and detailed job descriptions for them.
Provides job security to certain organ and bone marrow donors.
Revises definition of all-terrain vehicles.
Requires legislative approval of changes to core curriculum content standards and Statewide assessments.
Prohibits local units of government from adopting increased minimum wage and mandatory paid sick leave for private employers.
Permits wineries to produce hard cider.
Permits farm wineries to create alternating proprietorship for production of wine.
Exempts certain plenary winery licensees from filing requirements imposed on retail sellers of litter-generating products.
Authorizes annual issuance of permit to sell alcoholic beverages at seasonal farm market.
Creates viticulture trail tourist directional signs.
Revises acreage requirement for plenary winery licenses; permits certain holders of plenary winery licenses to hold plenary retail consumption licenses.
Authorizes issuance of craft distillery license to certain other alcoholic beverage manufacturing licensees.
The "School Safety and Security Act"; establishes penalties for certain criminal acts committed on school property.
Concerns enterprise zone assistance fund project approval; dedicates certain revenues to UEZs or UEZ municipalities.
Expands financing opportunities for low and moderate income housing.
Requires Secretary of Higher Education to adopt new comprehensive master plan within six months and every seven years thereafter.
Upgrades crime of false public alarm under certain circumstances and establishes reporting requirements concerning crime.
Clarifies definition of agricultural deed restriction.
Directs State Board of Agriculture and Department of Agriculture to develop and adopt certain terms and standards concerning local agricultural and horticultural products.
Allows collection of seeds from wild native plants.
Directs DOH to issue guidance concerning food safety at farmers markets.
Establishes multi-species depredation permit.
Establishes "Jersey Canned Goods Program."
Establishes "Jersey Frozen Foods Program."

Requires issuance of food vouchers in "Senior Farmers' Market Nutrition Program" in multiple monetary denominations; establishes pilot program to allow Senior Farmers' Market Nutrition Program participants to obtain shares of farm products from community supported agriculture.
Requires BPU to render decision on case within 12 months of final public hearing or hold another public hearing prior to deciding case.
"Responsible Dog Ownership Act."

Permits candidates for school board to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot; permits short nonpolitical designation of principles on petitions and ballots; provides for study of impact of changes.
Requires MVC to allow submission of "Next-of-Kin Registry" information upon issuance of permit, driver's license, or identification card.
Designates State Highway 184 in Woodbridge Township as "Bruce Turcotte Memorial Highway."
Permits certain breweries to sell beer at community farm markets.
Allows consumption of food on limited brewery premises.
Authorizes restricted breweries to annually sell up to 1,000 barrels of beer to in-State and out-of-state retailers.
Requires reporting of Clostridium difficile infections in hospitals and nursing homes.
Requires government entities to provide law enforcement agencies with access to exterior security recordings under certain circumstances.
Requires modernization of DCA website to establish one-stop shop for redevelopers.
Permits appointment of certain lawful permanent residents to county and municipal forces and State Police.
Criminalizes luring or enticing mentally incapacitated person to commit act likely to be injurious to his welfare.
Requires composting or recycling of food waste by large volume generators.
Provides immunity against "wrongful birth" and "wrongful life" suits.

Provides PERS or PFRS member who continues to be volunteer firefighter after retirement with employer from whom member retires has bona fide severance from employment for compliance with NJ regulations and Internal Revenue Code.
Establishes fast track hearing for challenges to shared service agreements and municipal consolidations.
Requires insurers to reimburse for medically necessary emergency and urgent care health care services in outpatient settings.
Extends eligibility for short-term financial assistance under Transitional Aid to Localities program to municipalities that lose a major commercial ratable.
Codifies in statute case law developed legal standards for establishing grandparent and sibling visitation with a child when visitation objected to by child's parent, guardian, or legal custodian.

Provides for Attorney General to handle investigation and prosecution of crime involving death caused by law enforcement officer while in performance of officer's duties; requires officer indictment by State grand jury.
Upgrades offense of endangering welfare of incompetent person; establishes new crime of enticing certain disabled persons to commit act likely to be injurious to their own welfare.
Establishes technology transfer assistance program in EDA.
Requires law enforcement agencies to obtain court order prior to use of imaging surveillance device.
Requires public hearings concerning public utility rate increase to be conducted within two years of public utility's application for rate increase.
Requires State agencies to vacate certain property in Trenton; allows EDA to offer incentives to private entities to locate to that property.
Requires online parking ticket payment system, NJMCDirect, to process payments 24 hours per day.
Reduces public employer salary paid to reemployed retiree of TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS or SPRS by $1 for each $2 of pension up to Social Security yearly earnings limit.
Reduces pension paid to TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS or SPRS retiree reemployed with public employer by $1 for each $2 earned up to Social Security yearly earnings limit.
Prohibits awarding of economic development subsidy to business if business is in default on previously awarded subsidy that was loan or loan guarantee.
Requires exemption of certain students from administration of State assessments, and requires DOE notify districts of availability of certain assessment accommodations.*
Establishes State Seal of Biliteracy to recognize high school graduates who have attained a high level of bilingual proficiency.
Establishes Behavioral Mental Health Advisory Board in Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services in DHS.
Creates nine-member "New Jersey Casino Oversight Consolidation Commission."
Provides veterans with up to 60 credits tuition-free at county college serving county of residence.
Provides that crimes committed outside the State under certain circumstances may be prosecuted in New Jersey.
Requires certain notifications for termination of services to persons with developmental disabilities and providers.
"Holocaust Reparations Tax Exemption Act"; exempts value of certain payments to Holocaust survivors and their eligible descendants from transfer inheritance and estate taxes.
Provides that school districts will present character awards to students during annual Week of Respect.
Establishes surplus revenue reserve account in the Property Tax Relief Fund if certain levels of unanticipated gross income tax revenue are collected.
Requires Governor to file annual report disclosing expenditures made from funds provided thereto as allowance.
Establishes the "New Jersey Safe and Responsible Driver Act."*
"Linnette Lebron's Law" modifies procedures for marriage or civil union where a party is terminally ill.*
Extends voting rights of representatives of sending districts on receiving district board of education.
Permits vapor lounges for use of electronic smoking devices to be opened under certain circumstances.
Provides preferences for certain businesses applying for workforce development grants.
Provides for jurisdiction for prosecution for certain crimes against minors committed outside New Jersey.
Criminalizes manufacture, sale, and possession of substances containing kratom.
Upgrades crime of false public alarm whenever response to alarm results in law enforcement's use of forcible entry into any place, or use of force or threat of use of force on another person.
Provides alternate standard for involuntary commitment to treatment in out patient setting.
Decriminalizes manufacture and certain possession of slingshots.
Requires non-binding mediation for disputes regarding access to public records.
Provides that cabinet-level public officials, Attorney General, and county prosecutors may serve in acting capacity for no longer than six months without nomination.*

Modifies laws regarding compensation and leaves of absence for certain public employees who served in the military; requires public employers follow certain policies and procedures for leaves of absence.
Raises maximum workers' compensation fees for evaluating physicians.*
Requires municipalities to file copies of tax abatement and exemption agreements with county chief financial officer and county counsel within 30 days of execution.
Requires municipalities to share certain payments received in lieu of taxes with counties and school districts; informs counties and school districts of application for tax exemption.
Prohibits awarding of economic development subsidy to business if business failed to repay previously awarded subsidy that was loan or loan guarantee.
Makes it crime of the fourth degree to recklessly engage in conduct which creates substantial risk of serious injury to another.
Requires DOH to increase the number of contracted early intervention service providers in areas experiencing significant population growth.
"Out-of-network Consumer Protection, Transparency, Cost Containment and Accountability Act." *

Limits payments under health benefits plans to in-network amounts in certain circumstances; prohibits out-of-network health providers from charging carriers more than 150 percent of Medicare rate in certain circumstances.
Requires MVC to automatically transmit applicant information to Secretary of State for automatic voter registration; permits applicant to decline voter registration.
Establishes defense against exclusionary zoning litigation seeking builder's remedy.
Prohibits State-sponsored travel to states adopting religious freedom statutes without protection against discrimination.
Permits local units to adopt single resolution for acquisition of certain surplus federal property, and to do so in closed session.
Establishes Office of International Trade and Protocol in EDA.
Establishes "Business Tax and Incentive Task Force."
Authorizes establishment of regional economic development partnerships.
Establishes specialty agriculture development program in Department of Agriculture.
Establishes JerseySource Supply Network database and business visitation program for NJ businesses in EDA.
Requires certain gas companies to use existing right-of-way when constructing new transmission lines where practicable and to seek consent of municipalities prior to initiating certain projects.
Criminalizes possession and sale of alpha-pyrrolidinopentiophenone (alpha-PVP) commonly known as "flakka," or "flocka."
Dedicates 0.1 percent of cigarette tax revenue to anti-smoking initiatives.
Requires MVC to check Social Security Administration records and mark deceased individuals in MVC database once per month.

Provides for an annual assessment upon certain rail carriers transporting crude oil and dedicates assessment revenue for State aid to municipalities for use by local government unit emergency responders.
Expands membership of NJ Task Force on Child Abuse and Neglect.
Changes pejorative terminology referring to persons with certain disabilities.
Clarifies law concerning conduct of certain legislative investigations.
Revises laws concerning real estate licensees.
Sets fees for DEP permits and approvals for repair or reconstruction of Sandy-damaged structures at no more than amount in effect on October 28, 2012.
Requires DMVA assist and mentor veterans through criminal justice system.
Provides tuition benefits at public institutions of higher education for dependents of certain veterans.
Establishes failure to provide certain specific protections from weather and during emergencies for domestic companion animals as animal cruelty.
Requires retail establishments to allow persons with certain medical conditions access to employee restrooms.
Makes fraudulent use of social security number to collect lottery winnings crime of fourth degree.
Upgrades crime of false public alarm when act done knowing it will result in law enforcement response against certain persons.
Designated as "Protection of Fetuses from Dismemberment Abortion Act"; prohibits dismemberment abortions.

Requires school districts to inform DOE of number of students in certain out-of-State placements and number of students with individualized education programs identifying DHS or DCF for transition services.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to study impact of State business income taxes on business out-migration, business formation, and employment.
Establishes Office of Tourism Research; requires specific measures concerning tourism advertising, marketing, research, and tourism-related business training.
Establishes insurance and other requirements for transportation network companies and their drivers.
Requires certain surgical practices and ambulatory care facilities licensed in this State to be owned by hospital or medical school located in the State. *
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
"Digital Currency Jobs Creation Act."
Upgrades certain penalties for resisting arrest; prohibits merger of resisting arrest with other criminal convictions.
Enacts new "Uniform Interstate Family Support Act"; repeals previous uniform law.

Extends immunity from liability to nonprofit associations engaged in organizing, teaching, refereeing, or coaching sports activity under State law requiring protective eyewear for children who participate in certain sports.
Prohibits institutions of higher education from requiring students who have children to purchase meal plans, live in on-campus housing, or pay gym fees.

Prohibits institution of higher education that provides child care from charging student-parent who receives child care voucher under "New Jersey Cares for Kids Program" an amount for child care in excess of voucher amount.
Requires institutions of higher education to inquire about student's marital and parental status.
Prohibits withholding of State school aid based on student participation rate on State assessments.
Provides mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain crimes of domestic violence.
Concerns payment of leave time to employee in year of employee's retirement.
Clarifies five-month window established by Supreme Court begins after trial court establishes standards.
Clarifies that defendants are to be credited for pre-sentence jail time directly attributable to specific offense for which sentence is imposed.
Creates NJ Cybersecurity Commission; appropriates $50,000.
Requires DOH license additional angioplasty facilities, with at least one facility in each county.
Provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes for qualified farmers that develop housing for their agricultural workforce.
Establishes "Veterans Affordable Housing Section 8 Voucher Pilot Program."
"Nail Salon Worker Protection Act."
Requires health care facilities make efforts to ensure inclusion in managed care plan networks.
Authorizes creation of Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation license plates.
Concerns procedure applicable to applicants for professional or occupational licences who would otherwise be barred from licensure due to certain child support or related obligations.*
Requires health benefits coverage for juvenile depression screenings.
Makes various changes to tenure of faculty and other professional staff at State and county colleges.
Establishes automatic voter registration process using MVC applicant information to be transmitted to Secretary of State; permits applicant to decline voter registration.
Requires BPU to allow public comment at public meetings; establishes requirements for public meetings concerning installation of natural gas conductors and related facilities.
Prohibits person with foreign criminal conviction from seeking and holding elective public office in this State under certain circumstances; increases penalty for election bribery offense.
Prohibits placement of certain intrastate natural gas pipelines within 100 feet of buildings.
Permits dogs in outdoor seating areas of restaurants under certain circumstances; codifies current requirements concerning live animals in food establishments.
"Healthy Small Food Retailer Act"; provides funding to small food retailers to sell fresh and nutritious food.
Codifies the Judiciary's Foreclosure Mediation Program; dedicates monies from foreclosure filing fees and fines.
Prohibits tobacco use in dormitory and other student residence buildings of institutions of higher education.
Permits county governing bodies, by resolution after a public hearing, to revise real property assessment calendar.
"Pain-Capable Fetus Protection Act"; bans abortion 20 weeks or more after fertilization.
Restricts use of isolated confinement in correctional facilities.
Affords civil immunity to private colleges and their police officers in certain cases.

Delaware Bay Fishing Empowerment Act; requires DEP to pursue changes to certain fishing laws and regulations; provides tax exemptions for sales of noncommercial ships and boating and fishing-related goods and services in certain counties.
Establishes task force to study issues and make recommendations related to use of educational technology in public school classrooms.
Regulates the authority of the court to make provision for the educational expenses of an unemancipated child in certain instances involving child support.
Regulates autocycles.
Requires DEP to offer to purchase and demolish certain contaminated residential property.
Establishes civil immunity for damages arising out of birth injury or congenital defect for physicians providing prenatal care under certain circumstances.
Modifies and clarifies provisions of certain economic incentive programs.*
Creates Clinical Trials Working Group.
Increases the amount of the New Jersey Angel Investor Tax Credit for certain taxpayers.
Establishes Main Street Economic Growth Program to encourage business development in small, highly developed municipalities.
Permits sale of motor fuels that have not been blended with ethanol for certain purposes.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement leak detection programs.
Provides that teacher who commits act of sexual penetration with student 18 years old or older and less than 20 years old is guilty of sexual assault under certain circumstances.

Appropriates $12 million in constitutionally dedicated CBT revenues for preservation, restoration, and revitalization of Jersey City Reservoir property for recreation and conservation and historic preservation purposes.
Revises certain requirements concerning provision of emergency medical services.
Makes certain changes to Environmental Infrastructure Trust Financing Program.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2016.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2016.
Concerns random drug testing of certain inmates.
Creates new criminal offenses concerning endangering another person; repeals N.J.S.2C:12-2 and N.J.S.2C:24-7.
Requires health insurance carriers to provide notice of termination of coverage to covered persons in certain circumstances.
Concerns training of employees about access to public facilities for individuals with service or guide dogs.
Authorizes Edward J. Bloustein School of Planning and Public Policy to calculate affordable housing obligations.
Directs COAH to use growth share methodology to calculate fair share affordable housing need.
Establishes the "New Jersey Schedules That Work Act."
Establishes Study Commission on Gender Pay Discrimination.
Provides employee time off for events regarding education of their children.
Codifies donated leave program for State employees.
Permits self-service dispensing of motor fuels.
Eliminates certain motor vehicle registration renewal.
Increases judicial salaries by set amount over multiple years, and thereafter provides for annual salary cost of living adjustment.
Establishes Class Three special law enforcement officers to provide security in public and nonpublic schools.
Requires condemnor to acquire road access easement for property owner if condemnation eliminates road access.
Increases to under $15,000 from under $10,000 amount of permitted annual compensation paid to TPAF retiree reemployed as athletic coach by former school district within 180 days of retirement.
Expands cities permitted to regulate days and hours when packaged goods may be sold.
Imposes certain requirements on use of automated license plate readers by law enforcement agencies.
Establishes pilot program in Paterson authorizing non-disclosure of records of certain expungements.
Concerns disclosure requirements for certain propane sales.
Authorizes impoundment of all-terrain vehicles and dirt bikes for certain crimes and offenses.

Requires tuition bills of public institutions of higher education to include details on student fees and opt-out provision for student-managed entertainment fees, and requires certain institutions' websites to include student fee information.
Allows installment payments for senior and disabled property taxpayers to repay overpayments of homestead credits and homestead property tax reimbursements.
Establishes procedures for registering equivalent of vicious or potentially dangerous dog relocated into State from out of State.
Permits modification of alimony award based on cohabitation of supported spouse.
Requires county emergency management coordinators to establish Code Blue Program to shelter homeless during severe weather events.
Revises definition of "antique handgun;" provides exceptions to certain firearm laws.
Directs the removal of certain records from domestic violence central registry.
Appropriates $4,750,000 from various Green Acres funds for grants to certain nonprofit entities to acquire or develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Appropriates $88,592,361 from "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" and various Green Acres bond funds for local government open space acquisition and park development projects.
Permits persons convicted of driving with suspended license to be sentenced to labor assistance program.
Concerns rights of Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission employees.
Requires school districts and DOE to post on their websites information regarding student participation in certain assessments.
Designates striped bass (Morone saxatilis) as New Jersey saltwater fish.

Clarifies DHS authority to regulate sober living homes and halfway houses as residential substance abuse aftercare facilities; requires background checks and other protections for residents of residential substance abuse facilities.
Applies local public contract bid threshold amounts to local pay to play and prevailing wage laws.
Establishes criminal penalties for unlawful control over weapons of any law enforcement officer and interface with equipment or duties of law enforcement officers and emergency services personnel.
Prohibits certain school districts under State intervention from leasing building if purchase price would be less than total costs of lease.
Requires DHS to take action to raise public awareness of privacy laws that prevent disclosure of health care enrollment information to immigration authorities.
Requires DHS to create English and Spanish-language Internet websites to promote enrollment in affordable health care plans.
Establishes restricted use driver's license endorsement for certain motor vehicle offenders with suspended license.
Revises law concerning partnerships, limited partnerships, and limited liability companies.
Provides tuition benefits at public institutions of higher education to New Jersey residents who are members of reserve component of Armed Forces of United States.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $25,000,000 to DOE to provide additional State school aid to Paterson School District.
Establishes "The Democracy Act" to revise various voter registration and voting procedures.
Creates definition of certified mail.*
Requires lowest possible price not exceeding certain cap for inmate telephone calls.*
Requires health benefits coverage for donated human breast milk under certain conditions.
Provides State Comptroller with express authority to engage certified public accountants as independent contractors on contingency fee basis.
Makes changes to funding provisions for financial assistance and grants from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.

Revises court filing fees, assessments, penalties, fines, and certain firearms licensing fees to fund Pretrial Services Program, e-court information system and Legal Services of New Jersey; repeals certain statutory provisions concerning court fees.
Allows eligible landscape operators to make certain purchases of certain materials and supplies without payment of sales and use tax.
"Drama therapists and Dance/Movement Therapists Licensing Act."

Disallows tax deduction under corporation business tax and gross income tax for punitive damages paid in connection with legal action; includes amount paid as punitive damages on behalf of taxpayer in income for tax purposes.
Requires DNA sample be taken from certain arrestees.
Establishes right to contest accuracy of parking meter.
Eliminates requirement that one license be staged casino facility license; permits use of renovated building by small-scale or staged casino facility.
Requires facilities providing services to persons with developmental disabilities and schools to adopt policies permitting administration of medical marijuana to qualifying patients.
Reduces ambulatory care facility assessment.
Facilitates identification of municipal liens on residential property of certain seniors and disabled persons.

Requires DCA to establish county assistance programs aiding seniors in property tax lien foreclosure; notification of certain county offices upon senior property tax lien sale; collector to provide requested lien satisfaction information within seven days.
Reforms PANYNJ; "Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Transparency and Accountability Act of 2015."
Requires owner of railroad bridge to submit bridge inspection records to DOT.
"Revised State Medical Examiner Act"; establishes Office of the Chief State Medical Examiner in DOH.
Provides governance, transparency, and accountability reforms at PANYNJ.
Requires health insurers to limit patient cost-sharing and provide appeal process concerning certain prescription drug coverage.
Prohibits charging prospective tenants of affordable units credit and criminal background check fees unless unit will be available within 30 days.
Requires charter school to apply for new charter to open new school building or satellite campus.
Requires charter schools to disclose on website and recruitment materials certain information regarding staff certifications.
Requires State to make charter school payments for initial year of charter school's operation.
Appropriates $35,347,174,000 in State funds and $17,323,048,000 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2015-2016.
Makes fiscal year 2015 State supplemental appropriations, reduces State appropriations and amends language provisions.
Increases State earned income tax credit from 20% to 30% of federal earned income tax credit for taxable years 2015 and thereafter.*
Imposes a one-year surcharge on Corporation Business Tax liabilities.
Provides Medicaid coverage for family planning services to individuals with incomes up to 200 percent of the federal poverty level.
Requires State to pay its pension contributions on quarterly basis by August 1, November 1, February 1 and May 1 of each year.

Makes FY 2015 supplemental State appropriations totaling $300,000,000 for prepayment of portion of FY 2016 employer contributions to State-administered public employee defined benefit retirement systems.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental appropriations of $6,500,000 and adds language provision.
Increases number of arbitrators on panel determining contested cases involving tenured employees in school districts and gives Commissioner of Education discretion on setting fees.
Establishes maximum fees for providing copies of patient medical records.
Reforms PANYNJ; requires appearance by PANYNJ before legislative committees.
Establishes "The Democracy Act" to modify various voter registration and voting procedures.
Makes fiscal year 2016 State supplemental appropriation and reduces State appropriation to transfer appropriation from preschool education aid to TPAF.
Establishes Office of Economic Research in Department of State.
Extends by two months seasonal retail consumption alcoholic beverage license.
Permits certain health clubs to offer swimming lessons and otherwise remain exempt from first aid and personnel and lifeguarding requirements.*
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to include crime victims as protected status.
Waives population restriction for issuance of alcoholic beverage licenses to operate brew pub in downtown area.
Revises definition of victim in "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights."
Increases maximum legal fee to represent victims from $1,000 to $3,000.
Removes age restriction on testifying via closed circuit television in certain sex crimes cases.
Prohibits victims from being charged certain costs and fees and clarifies victims' right to obtain certain interviews.
Expands rights of crime victims.
Establishes uniform rates for water and sewer services for residential use based exclusively on metered consumption.
Prohibits use of light frame construction in certain municipalities; establishes fire safety protocols for light frame construction projects.
Requires proof of ownership to register off-road vehicle.
Regulates tethering of, and outdoor shelter for, dogs.
Requires combined reporting of corporation business tax by certain members of unitary business groups.
Provides that, upon request of applicant, change of name would be confidential and not constitute public record.
Establishes Student Loan Lottery with winnings applying only to outstanding student loans.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing.
Establishes uniform timelines for charter schools to accept applications, conduct lottery, and notify parents of students' acceptance.
Permits charter school to limit admission to single gender, students at-risk of academic failure, students with disabilities, or English language learners.
Requires Office of the Ombudsman for the Institutionalized Elderly to develop informational posters describing phone-based complaint procedure, to be conspicuously displayed in certain facilities.
Establishes minimum certified nurse aide-to-resident ratios in nursing homes.*
Provides transparency and accountability reforms at PANYNJ; modifies governance structure; provides legislative oversight of PANYNJ.
Requires DCPP to implement policies and procedures to ensure caseworker safety; "Leah's Law." *
Establishes Mike Adler Aphasia Task Force to assess needs of persons with aphasia, and their families, and ensure adequate provision of support services and information thereto.*
Modifies certain provisions of EDA incentive programs; requires EDA to provide report with review and analysis of those programs.
Requires direct payment of homestead credit to claimant following sale of qualifying homestead and upon claimant request.
Removes cap on tax on transfers of hazardous substances to fund emergency preparedness and response to certain spills.
Establishes solar power incentive program.
Provides use tax exemption for certain boats and other vessels used in connection with qualified fishing contests.
Concerns minimum wage for certain farm laborers.
Prohibits distribution of certain casino simulcasting moneys to closed home racetrack.
Eliminates applicable court costs in certain medical event-related motor vehicle accidents.

Provides public employee in State-administered retirement system who continues preexisting volunteer relationship with employer from whom employee retires has bona fide severance from employment for compliance with NJ and federal regulations.
Requires information and access be provided to certain relatives of persons subject to order of guardianship.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Monmouth Park racetrack, upon voter approval; dedicates one-third net proceeds to General Fund, one-third to State education aid, and one-third to horse racing industry.
Permits certain audiologists to dispense and fit hearing aids.
Requires Public Health Counsel to promulgate rules and regulations for use of quality control programs in bio-analytical and clinical laboratories.*
Requires teachers of health and physical education in grades kindergarten through six in public schools to possess appropriate endorsement to instructional certificate.
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to solicit proposals from school districts willing to be certified as district of residence for students who reside on certain federal property.
Requires certain disclosures by non-fiduciary investment advisors.
Requires driver safety classes for certain drivers with suspended license.
Refines five-month window established by Supreme Court begins after trial court establishes standards.
Requires public utility employees to immediately place 9-1-1 call to report emergencies that arise from work conducted by public utility employees.
Establishes task force to study issues and make recommendations regarding Marie H. Katzenbach School for the Deaf.
Permits independent contractors to provide cosmetology and hairstyling services or ancillary services,
Requires certain professional boards to report licensure exam passage rates.
Provides for DOH to issue identification card to person with autism or intellectual or developmental disability to help emergency responders with recognition and response techniques.

Prohibits utility from billing customer for costs incurred for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure; allows costs for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure be recovered in utility's rate base.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; upgrades crimes against individuals with developmental disabilities.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies that boycott Israel or Israeli businesses.

"Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act"; authorizes access by executor, agent, guardian, or trustee to digital property and electronic communications of decedent, principal, incapacitated person, or trust creator.
Prohibits business expense deductions for punitive damages paid in civil litigation under the corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Dedicates five percent of cigarette tax revenue to anti-smoking initiatives.
Requires DOH to provide information about crib safety on its Internet website.
Permits up to 10 children to be cared for by a registered family day care provider.
Establishes New Jersey Commission on Higher Education and Business Partnerships.
Repeals law suspending certain licenses, registrations and certifications for failure to repay student loans.
Establishes the New Jersey Film and Television Project and Employment Incentive Program.
Establishes "Superstorm Sandy Homeowners Protection Act."
Requires bidder on State contract to be evaluated on report of its gender-based pay equity and job equality standards for its employees.
Provides excused absence for student who participates in State Agricultural Convention to receive recognition award.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $3,100,000 to DOE to provide additional State school aid to Manchester Regional School District.
Requires hospitals to establish sepsis recognition and treatment protocols.
Establishes asset forfeiture reporting requirements.
Gives priority to applicants for firearms purchaser identification card and permits to purchase handguns when domestic violence restraining order is in effect.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Freehold Raceway, upon voter approval; dedicates one-third net proceeds to General Fund, one-third to State education aid, and one-third to horse racing industry.
Exempts homeless student or student in resource family home who transfers between school districts after second year of high school from local graduation requirements.
Modifies process for renewals and revocations of charters under which charter schools operate.

Directs Rutgers Discovery Informatics Institute, Office of Information Technology, NJ Edge.Net Inc., and New Jersey Big Data Alliance to develop advanced cyberinfrastructure strategic plan; appropriates $150,000.
Permits municipality with UEZ to participate in Downtown Business Improvement Zone Loan Fund.
Permits cosmetologist-hairstylists to operate mobile facilities to provide services.
Exempts sales to homeowner assistance and recovery programs from realty transfer fees.
Delays certain documentation submission deadlines under certain business tax credit programs.*
Requires registration, inspection, testing, cleaning, and disinfection of cooling towers to control outbreaks of Legionnaire's Disease.
Permits pharmacists to prescribe self-administered hormonal contraceptives under certain circumstances; clarifies certain health insurance coverage requirements for contraceptive prescriptions.

Requires Commissioner of Education to include data on chronic absenteeism and disciplinary suspensions on School Report Card and requires public schools to make certain efforts to combat chronic absenteeism.
Establishes New Jersey Advisory Council on Home and Community-Based Settings to implement DHS Statewide Transition Plan.
Requires health insurance coverage for contraceptives to include prescriptions for 12 months.
Expands civil rights protections to include breastfeeding; requires employers to provide reasonable accommodations for breastfeeding mothers.
Requires parents of children receiving subsidized child care services or enrolled in preschool to complete nutrition education classes.
Includes boarding of guard dogs in definition of kennel; increases license fees for kennels and pet shops.
Requires DCF to collect and disseminate data about individuals with developmental disabilities and publish report.
Imposes tax on petroleum received by rail at marine terminals, storage or transfer terminals, and refineries, to fund local emergency preparedness and response to spills.

Provides that if minor appears to have been sexually assaulted, health care professionals in addition to physicians may authorize forensic sexual assault examination and urgent medical care without parental consent.
Increases tax credit cap by $165 million for certain qualified residential projects under Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program and restricts increase to certain projects.**
Provides up to $25 million in tax credits under Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant Program for certain infrastructure at Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey.
"Certificates of Insurance Act;" governs use of certificates of insurance; provides DOBI with enforcement authority.
Establishes pilot program for incentive-based value payment system for long-term care provided by home health agencies.
Establishes Office of Student Loan Ombudsman; regulates student loan servicers.
Requires carriers to classify medically necessary procedures as covered benefits and remit certain payments to hospitals for services rendered.
Prohibits employers from seeking or releasing salary history of certain employees.
Establishes pilot program for incentive-based value payment system for nursing homes.
Prioritizes investment of State administered pension funds in in-state infrastructure project investments over comparable out-of-state infrastructure project investments.
Allows NJ STARS and NJ STARS II scholarship recipients to maintain program eligibility in the event that medical condition prevents enrollment as full-time student.
Requires HMFA to establish "Sustainable Tiny Home Pilot Program" in three regions of State; appropriates $5 million.
Limits liability of caregivers when facilitating normalcy for children in foster care.
Authorizes Victims of Crime Compensation Office to make payment for relocation expenses of certain witnesses of crimes.
Modifies performance and maintenance guarantee requirements under "Municipal Land Use Law."
Requires firearm retailers to sell personalized handguns.
Requires Governor's resignation from office if Governor becomes candidate for President of the United States.
Extends use of stored driver's license picture for person undergoing chemotherapy or other treatment for certain medical illnesses.
Requires notification of member or retiree of State-administered retirement system under certain circumstances when member or retiree requests change in beneficiary for group life insurance.
Increases number of signatures required for petition of nomination for election to school board of education.
Establishes Prescription Drug Review Commission; requires production costs be reported for certain prescription drugs.
Establishes Military and Defense Economic Ombudsman in Department of State; makes appropriation.
Establishes New Jersey Military Skills Council.
Provides incentives for certain businesses associated with military installations.
Provides preference to certain employers applying for workforce development grants.
Facilitates coordination of land use planning between civilian and military interests to preserve viability of federal military installations within State.
Directs DOLWD to provide information regarding employee leave and benefit rights.
Suspends fines for certain first-time paperwork violations committed by small businesses.
Requires NJT to hold public hearing and provide notice prior to any curtailment of certain bus and rail services.
Voids deed restrictions on publicly-owned or leased property in Atlantic City Tourism District; grants public entity 18 months to sell property or submit public use plan.
Establishes criminal penalties for physicians who fail to provide certain information prior to performing abortion procedure involving donation of cadaveric fetal tissue.
Provides religious exemption for clergy and religious organizations concerning same-sex marriages and civil unions.
Facilitates widespread establishment of electronic tax sales.
Regulates certain auditing and disclosure practices of pharmacy benefits management companies.
Maintains property tax exemption for certain non-profit hospitals with on-site for-profit medical providers.
Designates Killed in Action flag as an official State flag; mandates it be displayed at certain public buildings.
Authorizes placement of patron-operated lottery terminals at running and harness horse racetracks.
Allows certain State Lottery functions to be conducted for seven days during state of emergency due to failure to enact general appropriation law.
Prohibits municipal ordinance to create sanctuary city; Establishes State and local employee ethics violation upon noncompliance with federal immigration enforcement request.
Expands crime of bias intimidation to include law enforcement officers.
Enhances oversight of Emergency Services Length of Service Award Program; requires annual audits.
Increases criminal penalties for selling fetal tissue and requires documentation of costs associated with processing, transportation, and storage.
Permits construction of natural gas transmission lines on areas of preserved farmland already subject to existing utility easements under certain circumstances.
Deems dispute between local government and pipeline operator concerning danger posed by certain natural gas pipelines as contested case.

Requires BPU to hold public hearings on certain proposed intrastate natural gas pipelines; requires pipeline operator to provide written notice to property owners located within blast area of certain proposed intrastate natural gas pipelines.
Permits homeless to receive certified copy of birth certificate without fee.
Exempts homeless from fee for non-driver identification cards.
Prohibits certain steering and marketing practices involving dispensing of prescription drugs and drug samples.
Requires police vehicles to be equipped with Global Positioning System tag devices.
Designates football as State sport.
Imposes prevailing wage for public work on properties receiving tax abatements or exemptions.

Provides that criminal history record checks for employees of nonpublic schools are mandatory and requires staff if formerly-exempt child care centers to undergo child abuse and criminal backround checks.*
Transit Ridership Innovation and Participation Act; provides income tax credits for employer-provided public transportation benefits.

Requires NJT to limit fare increases under its discount program for senior citizens, persons with disabilities, and college students; designated as "Fare Affordability and Ridership Empowerment (FARE) Act."

"Transparency, Responsibility, and Accountability for New Surcharges and Increases in Ticketing (T.R.A.N.S.I.T.) Act"; increases number of public hearings NJT is required to hold prior and subsequent to fare increase or change or abandonment of service.
Imposes transportation infrastructure development fee and dedicates portion to municipality, county, and Transportation Trust Fund.
Directs BPU to promulgate rules and regulations concerning gas public utilities' response to public reporting of suspected natural gas leaks.
Provides courts authority to sentence disorderly and petty disorderly persons to house arrest.
Requires health care practitioners to discuss risk of addiction when prescribing certain drugs to patients who are minors.
Authorizes seizure and impoundment of a dog believed to have attacked, severely injured, or killed another domestic animal.
Establishes "Neighborhood Solar Energy Investment Program."
Revises "Electronic Waste Management Act."
Expands municipal authority to license and inspect residential rental property.*
Establishes Child Advocacy Center-Multidisciplinary Team Advisory Board and certification program for child advocacy centers and multidisciplinary teams; appropriates $10 million.

Requires certain common interest community associations to publish certain information; requires that homeowners' association contracts for management and maintenance include 24-hour emergency services.
Permits marriage or civil union license to be obtained in any municipality in the State.
Requires county superintendent of elections to operate pursuant to county administrative code.
Limits increase in annual budget requests of certain county entities.
Provides a gross income tax exclusion for attorney's fees and costs received in connection with certain unlawful discrimination or unlawful retaliation claims or actions.
Requires filing of financial agreement for long term tax exemption with county finance officer and counsel; requires quarterly payment of county share of payment in lieu of tax.
Permits counties to impose one-percent hotel tax.
Prohibits possession and transport of parts and products of certain animals at PANYNJ airports and port facilities.*
Establishes cap on amount that hospital can charge patients for laboratory services to 150 percent of Medicare.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for value of certain fruit and vegetable donations made by commercial farm operators.
Requires Division of Developmental Disabilities to make comprehensive list of its programs available to public.
Establishes protection from adverse employment action for authorized medical marijuana patients.
Allows expungement of multiple crimes and offenses resulting from one-time spree under certain circumstances.

Designates June as "New Jersey Arts, Culture, History, and Tourism Month."

Designates first week of May as "National Travel and Tourism Week" in NJ.

Designates March 30 of each year as "Doctor's Day" in New Jersey.
Designates June of each year as "Native Plant Appreciation Month."
Urges Governor and Legislature of New York to enact legislation requiring Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor to accept applications for inclusion of new employees to longshoremen's register.
Designates May of each year as "General Aviation Appreciation Month."
Designates first Saturday in October of each year as "Animal Rescue Day."
Declares August 16 of each year as "Dominican Restoration Day" in New Jersey.*
Designates October of each year as "Cranberry Harvest Month."
Designates October of each year as "Opioid Abuse Prevention Month."
Designates third Wednesday in May as "ALS Awareness Day" and May as "ALS Awareness Month" in NJ.

Designates November of each year as "Caregivers Awareness Month."
Designates May of each year as "Milkweed for Monarchs Month."
Declares second Saturday of July of each year as "Dominican Pride Day" in New Jersey.
Designates last full week of September of each year as "New Jersey Beer, Wine and Spirits Week" and Wednesday of that week as "New Jersey Dine Out Day."
Designates first week in May of each year as Wounded Warrior Appreciation Week.
Designates July 22 of each year as "Fragile X Awareness Day."
Designates fourth week of March of each year as "Military Caregivers Week."
Designates March of each year as "Adrenoleukodystrophy Awareness Month."
Designates September of each year as "Hunger Action Month" in New Jersey.
Designates second full week in May of each year as "New Jersey Beer, Wine and Spirits Week" and Wednesday of that week as "New Jersey Restaurant Day." *
Designates October of each year as "New Jersey Energy Action Month."
Permanently establishes September 4th as "Richard Somers Day."
Designates October of each year as "Linemen Appreciation Month."
Designates July 1 of each year as "U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps Day."
Creates 13-member "New Jersey Elections Technology Study Task Force."*
Urges DEP to suspend certain actions concerning open-air reservoirs until after EPA completes its next scheduled review of certain guidelines.
Establishes temporary Commission on Opioid Antidote Administration and Aftercare to study and report on procedures to be used following administration of an opioid antidote to a hospital patient.
Permanently designates third Thursday in November as "Children's Grief Awareness Day" in New Jersey.
Designates October 9 of each year as "Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorder Associated with Streptococcus/Pediatric Acute-Onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome Awareness Day."
Urges Oxford University Press and Merriam-Webster, Inc. to add word upstander to Oxford English Dictionary and Merriam-Webster's Collegiate Dictionary, respectively.
Designates the month of November in each year as "Men's Health Awareness Month."
Urges Congress to pass "Common Sense Housing Investment Act of 2013," which converts mortgage interest deduction to tax credit and dedicates money saved to National Housing Trust Fund.
Designates third week of September as "New Jersey Gleaning Week." *
Designates Wednesday of third week of September as "Farmers Against Hunger Day." *
Designates September of each year as "School Absentee Awareness Month."
Permanently designates January as "National Mentoring Month" in New Jersey.
Recognizes 100th anniversary of Armenian Genocide.
Designates first week in February each year as "Chicano History Week in New Jersey."
Designates September 21 of each year as "Evans Syndrome Awareness Day."
Designates first week in August of each year as "Coast Guard Week" and honors Cape May as U.S. Coast Guard's enlisted accession point and recruit training center.
Designates first week of March as "Consumer Protection Week" in NJ.
Urges federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration to adopt recommendations of U.S. Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board.
Urges United States Department of Defense and New Jersey Civil Service Commission to permit civil service examinations during deployment.

Permits county commissioners of registration and boards of election to conduct "Electronic Poll Book Demonstration Project" in certain districts during 2016 elections; requires Division of Elections review and approval of proposed projects.*
Designates last full week in June each year as "Home and Community Garden Gleaning Week."
Designates May of each year as "Home-Schooling Month" in New Jersey.
Designates last full week of September of each year as "New Jersey Wine Week."
Designates May of each year as "Asthma Awareness Month."
Designates third weekend in October each year as "Shuck, Sip, and Slurp Weekend" to promote NJ oysters, wine, and beer.
Designates first full week of June each year as "New Jersey Fishing and Boating Week."
Designates November 7 of each year as "Extra Life Day" in New Jersey.
Designates May of each year as "Cystic Fibrosis Awareness Month."
Designates third week in October of each year as "New Jersey Careers in Utilities Week."
Establishes task force to study and make recommendations concerning stabilization and growth of volunteer first responder community.
Creates the "New Jersey Biotechnology Task Force."
Designates second week of May of each year as "Week of the Military Woman."
Urges Congress to restore funding to Vets4Warriors veteran suicide hotline.
Designates Saturday following Thanksgiving of each year as "Small Business Saturday."
Designates third week of October of each year as "Male Breast Cancer Awareness Week."
Designates April as "Genocide Awareness Month."
Designates June 21 of each year as "ASK Day" to promote children's health and gun safety.
Condemns Boycott, Divestment, and Sanctions movement and increasing incidents of anti-Semitism.
Recognizes Delaware Bayshore as region of special significance in NJ.
Recognizes and supports essential and brave service of law enforcement officers at 2015 Summer Jam concert.
Designates second Wednesday of October as "Health Cares About Domestic Violence Day."
Designates October of each year as "Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Month" in New Jersey.
Designates one night in November of each year as a "Night of Conversation" about drug and alcohol addiction.
Designates July of each year as "Cockayne Syndrome Awareness Month" in New Jersey.
Designates third full week in September as "Direct Support Professional Recognition Week."
Declares aquaculture an important State economic driver and urges State to include aquaculture industry in its economic development plans.
Designates last full week of May of each year as "Osteopetrosis Awareness Week" and last Saturday of May of each year as "Osteopetrosis Awareness Day."
Encourages sharing of services; makes appropriations.

Establishes the New Jersey Direct Property Tax Relief Program by providing a property tax relief credit under the gross income tax and increasing the current gross income tax credit for homestead property taxes.
The "Out-of-network Consumer Protection, Transparency, Cost Containment and Accountability Act."
Increases benefit amounts under New Jersey earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal earned income tax credit amounts beginning in Tax Year 2012.
Establishes "The Democracy Act" to modify various voter registration and voting procedures.
Allows credit against certain charges to CATV customers opting out of premium service within 30 days of CATV company notice of network or programming change.
Requires certain DOC, county, and municipal prison physicians to acquire certain training.
Requires correctional facilities to provide inmates with prescription medication that was prescribed for chronic conditions existing prior to incarceration.
Requires annual notice of assessment on property to contain bolded notice of filing deadline for appeal.
Requires notice requirements by CATV companies for changes to station channel positions to be consistent with federal law.
Limits forum of consumer contract disputes to New Jersey.
Regulates individuals engaged in the facilitation of like-kind exchanges of property pursuant to Section 1031 of the United States Tax Code.
Creates a civil cause of action for stalking.
Adds conviction of unlawfully possessing weapon to list of crimes that statutorily prohibits someone from buying or owning firearm.
Upgrades crime of manslaughter to aggravated manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Permits theaters with 250 seats or more to apply for liquor license.
Deletes CAFRA permit exemption for reconstruction activities in coastal area.
Establishes procedures for determining enforceability of standard form contracts; invalidates certain indemnification clauses.
Creates New Jersey Coastal Commission; reallocates certain funds from DEP to commission; and appropriates $20 million.
Changes types of development requiring CAFRA permit from DEP.
Limits enforcement of certain employment contracts of individuals eligible for unemployment compensation.
Establishes a 1,000 foot drug free zone around playgrounds and other public parks, buildings and housing facilities.
Requires installation of low-flow toilets and low-flow showerheads in multiple dwellings having 3 or more units.
Subjects county and municipal sewerage authority service rate increases to approval by Board of Public Utilities.
Requires holder of rental security deposit account to provide second notice before account is deemed abandoned under the "Uniform Unclaimed Property Act."
Requires owner of foreclosed property to provide relocation assistance to tenant displaced by termination of illegal occupancy.
Requires certain State oversight of budgets of regional sewerage authorities.
Requires lobby security for certain senior citizen high-rise buildings in areas with high violent crime rates.
Transfers Division of Parole in State Parole Board to Department of Corrections.
Allows two elected members of pension commission of closed Hudson County Employees' Pension Fund to be active county employee or retired county employee.

Changes certain eligibility criteria for TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS and SPRS disability benefits; requires Attorney General to establish fraud unit; creates temporary committee to recommend accidental disability standard for systems.
The "Save the Hudson River Palisades Act."
Authorizes award of attorney's fees and expenses in landlord-tenant actions under certain circumstances.

Eliminates payments for unused sick leave earned after effective date; limits carry forward of unused vacation leave; requires suspension and forfeiture of certain payments; limits use of unused sick leave in year before retirement.
Requires NJHMFA to establish reverse mortgage program for certain retirees living in cooperatives.

"Save New Jersey Electric and Gas Public Utility Customer Service and Call Center Jobs Act"; requires notification by electric and gas utilities when relocating customer and call centers out of State.
"Property Tax Lien Pilot Program," establishes pilot program to allow certain municipalities greater control over sale of tax liens.
Requires newly-constructed multiple dwellings with six or more residential units to install standby generators to provide electricity in case of emergency.
Increases amount of, and income limit for eligibility to receive, senior citizens' and disabled persons' property tax deduction.
Authorizes grandparents to obtain certified copies of death certificates of grandchildren.
Requires that victims of sex offense be informed of offender's risk of re-offense upon release.
Permits State aid to fund start-up costs for local shared services projects.
Provides loan redemption for certain physicians who work in State 10 years.
Expands the domestic violence statutes to encompass minors aged 16 and older.
Requires Commissioner of DHSS to convene a strategic planning summit to analyze the State's physician workforce supply.
Requires labeling of foods containing genetically modified material.
Requires HIV tests for certain convicted sex offenders.
Requires hospital to notify patient admitted for observation of possible increased prescription charges and allow patient to use patient's own medication.
"Volunteer Medical Professional Health Care Act."
Directs DEP and Monmouth County to form study commission to examine nonpoint source pollution and stormwater management issues in Wreck Pond Watershed.
Directs BPU to adopt best practices and standards for public utility disaster response.
Permits certain public and private entities to qualify for BPU grants or low interest loans for cost of alternative power generation devices.
Establishes penalty for failing to report unintentional discharge of firearm in private residence.
Authorizes disclosure by DCF of child abuse and neglect information to religious institutions.
Protects home addresses of law enforcement officers from being released by governmental entities.
Requires prescribers and pharmacists to check prescription monitoring program prior to prescribing and dispensing Schedule II drugs.

Requires school districts to incorporate age-appropriate sexual abuse and assault awareness and prevention education in grades preschool through 12 as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for positron emission tomography to diagnose Alzheimer's disease.
Requires insurers to provide minimum of 30 days inpatient treatment for substance abuse when physician determines treatment is medically necessary.
Requires municipalities that receive transitional aid to certify that all municipal buildings adhere to fire codes.*
Requires court to consider gang affiliation when making bail determinations.
Requires public schools to include instruction on the events relating to September 11, 2001 and the death of Osama bin Laden, as part of core curriculum content standards.
Requires, for roof mounted solar photovoltaic systems, identifying emblem on certain structures, and fire department notification for all structures.
Establishes a State aid program for charter school facilities.
Prohibits State agencies from posting emergency medical technicians' personal information on web sites.
Requires the reporting of criminal offenses occurring on school property to law enforcement authorities.
Provides for a presumption of joint physical custody in a child custody determination; addresses relocation.
Clarifies that crime victims' rights must be recognized by all courts in the State.
Provides that English shall be the official language of the State.
Exempts from sales and use tax sales of carbon monoxide detectors and any device or equipment sold for residential use to detect, warn of, abate, or extinguish fires.
Provides for reciprocity of certain out-of-State EMT certification.
Requires adoption agency, court, or DYFS to maintain child's religious upbringing when placing child in adoptive or resource family home.
