Requires retail food establishments to donate surplus unused baked goods and surplus canned and packaged goods close to retail sale date to local nonprofits and charities.
Requires 30-day grace period prior to accrual of interest on late water and sewer bill payments.
Requires security guards at institutions of higher education which do not employ police officers to immediately report crimes committed on campus to the local police department.
Expands number of safe havens for leaving newborn infants.
Upgrades burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree; upgrades it to a crime of the first degree if committed while armed.
Provides two-year window for persons to transfer, render inoperable or surrender assault firearm.
Requires public schools to allow certain students not enrolled in the school to participate in interscholastic athletics.*
Revises certain motor vehicle fines imposed on motor vehicle drivers or operators for failing to have required documentation.
Excludes deferred compensation of certain public school and federal tax-exempt organization employees from current taxation under the gross income tax.
Indexes the maximum gross income tax deduction for homestead property taxes to certain changes in the State average residential property tax.
Clarifies when penalty points are to be assessed for convictions of driving in an unsafe manner.
Requires fingerprinting for certain disorderly persons offenses.
Revises eligibility for expungement of criminal records for certain youthful offenders.
Makes various changes to civil service law concerning seasonal appointments, temporary layoffs, and rescinding adoption of civil service.
Establishes farm brewery and winery-brewery beverage license and permits farm wineries to produce hard cider.
Requires criminal background check for name change and prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from changing their name.
Permits high performing school districts to be monitored by the DOE every seven years rather than every three years.
Permits sale of home-baked goods under certain circumstances.
Grants law enforcement agencies authority to order road closures; increases penalty for violations.
Requires court to deny defendant's right to copy or reproduce images of child pornography as part of discovery.
Establishes Hunterdon-Somerset Flood Advisory Task Force.
Requires sex offenders to note criminal status on social network accounts.
The "Bio-based Heating Oil Act."
Provides that Good Samaritans are not required to pay for ambulance service if injured while rendering emergency care.
Makes discretionary driver's license suspension for first offense of driving without motor vehicle liability insurance under certain circumstances.
Requires certain health benefits coverage for diagnosing and treating autism and other developmental disabilities.
Reduces number of rooms necessary for historic hotel to receive liquor license.
Clarifies that aggravated assault on victim of sexual assault constitutes aggravated sexual assault under certain circumstances.
Expands implied consent statute to include blood and urine testing; permits use of reasonable force to obtain blood sample in certain cases.

Provides for disclosure of person's medical records related to AIDS or HIV infection for investigations or prosecutions of crime of diseased person committing act of sexual penetration; makes crime ineligible for expungment.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district, jointure commission, or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services.
Establishes county-based centers for transition for young adults with developmental disabilities.
Clarifies intent of P.L.2007, c.340 regarding NJ's required participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.
Requires certain user fees for the provision of traditional municipal services to be included within the 2% municipal and county property tax levy cap.
The "New Jobs for New Jersey Act."
Revises statutes concerning firearms purchaser identification cards and handgun purchase permits; makes handgun purchase permit valid for four years.
Requires principals and teachers of public schools to conduct an oral recitation from the Declaration of Independence before the opening of school each day in grades 3-12; appropriates $10,000.
Changes restrictions on certain county or municipal stream cleaning activities.
Establishes "Commission on College Tuition."
Requires in public schools instruction on the contributions of United States veterans and the observance of patriotic exercises on certain holidays.
Increases and makes uniform mileage reimbursement rate for sheriffs, constables, and other court officers for various duties performed.
Establishes certain traffic privileges for funeral processions.
Concerns interest rate chargeable by licensed pawnbrokers on certain transactions.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide greater assistance to certain students with military obligations.
Permits court to order involuntary outpatient treatment in any county; concerns patient compliance with taking medication.
Concerns various authorities, boards, commissions, councils, divisions, and task forces.
Authorizes a teacher leader endorsement to the instructional certificate.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Requires government records to be made available on the Internet and permits custodian to advise requester of the record to obtain record directly from Internet.*
Requires simple majority for proposal to increase school tax levy above tax levy growth limit.
Authorizes Office of Public Defender to provide legal representation for child in proceedings after parental rights have been terminated.
Provides that certain disabled veterans may purchase special automobile insurance policies.
Permits veteran's property tax deduction for tax year when veteran was previously qualified to receive deduction and became owner of real property after October 1 of pretax year.

Exempts disabled veterans and recipients of the Purple Heart from the payment of municipal parking meter fees when their vehicles bear a disabled veteran's or Purple Heart license plate issued by the New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission.

Revises calculation of assessments concerning certain casino licensee fees; clarifies certain conditions of employment concerning Atlantic City Tourism District; makes non-gaming tourism district and certain CRDA project site properties eligible for tax credits.
Immunizes from civil liability first responders who forcibly enter property to provide emergency assistance.
Permits liens in favor of planned real estate development associations for unpaid assessments in planned real estate developments.
Requires Department of Agriculture to publish on its website information concerning wineries and community supported agriculture entities in NJ.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for compressed natural gas used to fuel certain bus operation.

Revises "Overseas Residents Absentee Voting Law;" to mirror federal law; permits overseas voters to vote in any election; permits use of federal write-in absentee ballot to vote, register or request ballot for all elections.
Clarifies that a single State college may enter into a joint purchasing agreement with other contracting units.
Provides certain small businesses impacted by Hurricane Sandy a corporation business tax or gross income tax credit for certain reinvestment in shore municipalities.

Establishes small business loan guarantee program in EDA to support capital purchases and operating expenses and permits certain qualified businesses in regional centers to qualify for certain EDA loans.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from imposing surcharges on consumer credit card purchases.
Establishes criteria and requirements for shore protection project priority list and funding from Shore Protection Fund.
Establishes pilot program within Office of Emergency Management to provide zero-interest loans to certain gas stations that install appropriate wiring for generators.
Permits Internet gaming equipment to be located at certain secure facilities in Atlantic City.
Permits municipality to sell certain impounded vehicles.
Requires certain bidders for prevailing wage public work to provide proof that the prevailing wage will be paid.
Concerns eligibility for certain leave and benefit programs.
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Requires prosecutors to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Broadens eligibility for certain veterans' benefits by eliminating requirement of service during specified dates or in specified locations.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Establishes a New Jersey Coordinating Council on the Decommissioning of Nuclear Power Generating Facilities.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Requires certification that persons directly or indirectly receiving State monies or privileges are not unauthorized aliens.
Imposes mandatory term of life imprisonment without eligibility for parole on persons who commit particularly brutal sexual assaults.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Creates offense of financial exploitation of the elderly.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Increases penalties for identity theft when victim is a senior citizen or veteran.

Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Allows judgment for restitution of stolen public funds to be levied against convicted employee's retirement allowance or pension contributions.
Allows CRDA to finance certain highway projects outside of Atlantic City Tourism District.
Allows certain drug dealing offenses to be graded by "units," rather than weight, of controlled dangerous substances.
Creates New Jersey Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act.
Increases penalties for certain heroin offenses by revising threshold amounts for first, second, and third degree crimes of manufacturing, distributing, and dispensing heroin.
Provides for payment to small municipalities, in certain cases, of certain penalty moneys assessed for violations of fish and game laws.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties.
Prohibits municipal officers and employees serving on redevelopment or housing agencies from voting to condemn property.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act"; imposes mandatory term of imprisonment; provides for negotiated reduction of mandatory term under certain circumstances. *
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Expands civil rights protections to include pregnancy and breast-feeding; requires employers to provide daily break to breast-feeding mothers.
Shortens term of municipal court judges from three years to one year.
Requires DHSS to post on website information concerning hospital emergency department staffing and services for pediatric patients.
Prohibits the restraint of prisoners during and immediately after childbirth.

Requires tenure charges be filed against any public school employee found to have bullied a student and requires the employment of any nontenured public school employee be terminated for such activity.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to the families of NJ troops overseas.
Prohibits animal cruelty violators from working at, or owning or operating, an animal-related enterprise; designated as "Moose's Law."
Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional science, technology, engineering and mathematics programs.
Extends alternate route police training certification for military personnel for time deployed.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program," in two vicinages including Burlington County.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain employer-provided child care expenditures.
Increases fine for violation of certain laws concerning pedestrian safety and traffic control; dedicates funds to certain roadways.
Requires percentage of motor vehicle fines be used to support safe routes to school initiatives.
Increases penalties for motor vehicle violations resulting in serious bodily injury or death to certain persons in highway.
Requires certain disclosures in advertisements by health care professionals.
Affords emergency services peer counselors confidentiality privileges.
Makes a $3 million supplemental appropriation for increased Per Capita Library Aid.
Requires public school students in grades 9 through 12 to receive instruction in cardiopulmonary resuscitation and use of an automated external defibrillator prior to graduation*
Directs DOT Commissioner to allocate Transportation Trust Fund monies for concept development and design of Route 55 extension.
Revises qualifications for handgun permit, establishes crimes for certain handgun use; establishes annual fee of $100.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.

Requires municipalities to exempt 100% disabled veterans from construction permit surcharge fees for improvements to promote living unit accessibility; appropriates $20,000 for municipal reimbursements.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Provides for representation of certain regions of State on New Jersey Turnpike Authority.
Authorizes veterans property tax exemption for totally disabled veterans who did not serve in theater of war.
Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority to hold regular meetings in various counties in the State.
Permits a joint meeting by the Senate and Assembly Budget Committees to review and veto utility rate increases approved by BPU.
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Establishes telemarketing fraud investigation unit.
Restores State fiscal year 2011 reductions to Garden State Preservation Trust payments in lieu of taxes; appropriates $3,400,000 to DCA.*
"Compounding Pharmacy Quality Assurance Act"; requires accreditation of compounding pharmacies.
Authorizes school district hiring preference for veterans.
Clarifies definition of reasonably necessary deviation when legally transporting firearm or weapon in motor vehicle.
Excludes .22 caliber tubular magazines from large capacity ammunition magazine definition.

Establishes Common Core State Standards Evaluation Task Force; delays use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers until task force submits final report.
Creates State Dredging Task Force.
Establishes pilot project to install global positioning system (GPS) devices on certain State vehicles.
Authorizes the establishment of federal impact aid reserve account.
Provides gross income tax credits to support development of New Jersey-based small business start-ups.
Provides corporation business tax credit and allows gross income tax deduction for purchase of electric or plug-in hybrid electric vehicles.
Permits municipalities to use up to 15% of affordable housing trust fund monies to provide financial assistance grants to owners of property that sustained certain weather-related damage.
Establishes "Back to Work NJ Program"; makes an appropriation.
Establishes special license plates for honorably discharged veterans.
Encourages development of electric vehicle charging stations in transportation projects.
Permits a board of education to adopt a salary policy of up to five years.
"Thomas P. Canzanella Twenty First Century First Responders Protection Act"; concerns workers' compensation for public safety workers.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain amino acid-based elemental formulas.
Requires high school driver education course, certain new driver brochures, and driver's license written exam to include aggressive driving information.

Transportation for Hazardous Walking Routes Act; requires school districts to provide busing for students required to walk to school along hazardous routes and prohibits school bus stops within 250 feet of residence of sex offender.
Requires certain energy tax receipts to be paid directly to municipalities.
Limits contributions to legal defense fund of candidate for or holder of elective public office; requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Requires suspension of pay of local elected officials during period between indictment and conviction for certain offenses involving moral turpitude.
Provides that solar and photovoltaic energy facilities and structures on farmland are not an inherently beneficial use, per se, for purposes of zoning approvals.
Eliminates State aid growth limit for school districts in which individuals age 65 and over comprise more than 33.3 percent of the population.
Prohibits certain energy suppliers from making false and misleading claims to potential customers; prohibits suppliers' calls to customers where no business relationship exists.
Requires training program for school bus drivers and school bus aides on interacting with students with special needs, and requires development and use of student information cards.*
Requiring electric public utilities and municipal and county shade tree commissions to meet annually concerning vegetation management; requires commissions to implement vegetation management plans.
Revises certain provisions of Megan's Law and imposes monthly penalty on sex offenders to fund their monitoring and supervision by the parole board.
Regulates certain practices of pharmacy benefits management companies.

Establishes one-year moratorium on replacement of copper-based landline telephone service with non-copper-based landline or wireless telephone service; requires BPU to report to Governor and Legislature.
Revises sales and use tax treatment of garbage removal services.
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Authorizes certain municipalities to impose a tax on the storage of empty shipping containers to fund redevelopment plan activities.
Reestablishes and revises public contract set-aside program.
Establishes the "Private Investment in Public Education Fund."
Specifies certain requirements for approval of a charter school application.
Requires binding arbitration to determine contested cases involving dismissal or reduction in compensation of tenured public school employees.
Establishes a three-year moratorium on the establishment of new charter schools.
Establishes DCA oversight of Passaic Valley Sewerage Comissioners.
Authorizes municipalities to impose penalties on creditors that fail to timely remedy code violations of certain properties in foreclosure.*
Establishes pilot program in DOE to ameliorate disparities among school districts with respect to educational technology.
Establishes division in Department of Treasury to oversee and enforce equal employment opportunity requirements with regard to public works contracts.
Provides that a school district may be placed under full or partial State intervention pursuant to the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) for no longer than five years.
Strengthens criminal sanctions for intentionally damaging a rental premises to establish a warranty of habitability violation.

Requires installation of standby emergency power generators in senior and disabled housing; creates BPU assistance program for generator purchase and installation costs in existing senior and disabled housing.
Establishes certain equal employment opportunity requirements in connection with expenditure of federal funds received for Hurricane Sandy relief and for any future emergencies.
Requires board of education to provide an individual textbook for each student enrolled in a class.
Codifies the Judiciary's Foreclosure Mediation Program; dedicates monies from foreclosure filing fees and fines.
Permits municipality to hire private company to provide construction officials, subcode officials, and technical assistants.
Expands role of temporary guardian to include arranging placement of alleged incapacitated person in appropriate, less restrictive environment.
Provides for electronic scanning of certain certificates for initiating court proceedings for involuntary commitment.
Establishes "New Jersey Out-of-School Time Advisory Commission" to review before-school, after-school, and summer programs.*
"Innovative Services for Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act."
Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities to implement a municipal consolidation.
"PANYNJ Transparency and Accountability Act."
"Blue Acres Floodplain Protection Bond Act of 2012," authorizes bonds for $100 million, and appropriates $5,000.
Requires Financial Policy Review Board to issue certain reports and create and maintain website.
Allows corporation business tax or gross income tax credits to developers for certain capital investments for repurposing qualified health care facilities.
Establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank within New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust.
Amends "Flood Hazard Area Control Act" to require DEP to take certain actions concerning delineations of flood hazard areas and floodways.
Exempts certain properties acquired by municipalities from county, school, and fire district taxes immediately upon aquisition.
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption for artificial turf field construction by local government units.
Permits counties to charge a fee to fund infrastructure through voter approval.
Subjects Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to New York's Freedom of Information Law and New Jersey's Open Public Records Act.
Concerns importation and delivery of motor fuel during certain emergencies.
Concerns sale of certain motor fuel during certain emergencies.
Provides that participation by New Jersey residents in contests of skill does not constitute unlawful gambling.
Increases flexibility, clarity, and available tools of optional municipal consolidation process.
Establishes "Study Commission on E-Licensing."
Establishes "Collaborative Mental Health Care Pilot Program" in DOH; appropriates $750,000.
Establishes a limited license for threading within the practice of cosmetology and hairstyling.

Requires forms for homestead property tax reimbursement, veterans' property tax exemption, veterans' property tax deduction, and senior and disabled property tax deduction to be available in certain languages.
Permits municipality to establish civil penalty for smoking in public places.
Provides that nonpublic school nursing services may include nursing services for a preschool pupil in the event of an emergency.
Allows nonpublic schools to participate in joint purchasing agreements entered into by two or more school districts.
Establishes Behavioral Health Insurance Claims Advocacy Program.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping for certain retired military personnel.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service, and their immediate family members.
Authorizes free admission to State parks and forests for retired veterans living in NJ and their immediate family members.
Protects property owned by military personnel and first responders from condemnation.
Increases the penalty for certain gang related crimes.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on municipalities and counties.
Requires Commissioner of Education to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on school districts.
Allows certain owners of preserved farmland to reacquire development rights for land underlying and next to farm buildings or structures.
Establishes crime of initiating a false "Amber Alert."
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Exempts, for five years, certain new business activities in pinelands area from compliance with Pinelands Commission development approval process.
Requires life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of the murder of a minor under the age of 18 in the course of the commission of a sex crime.
Concerns sale of cemetery, grave, monument and historical markers.
Eliminates the office of the executive couny superintendent of schools and transfers all the duties of that office to the Commissioner of Education.
Requires BPU to issue written decision concerning utility rate increase approvals to public via its website.
Revises requirements related to public hearings on proposed public utility rate increases.
Requires public utilities to provide customers notice of request for increase in rates; revises requirements related to hearings on proposed rate increases.
Requires public utilities to mail customers detailed explanation of rate settlement agreements prior to final BPU vote.
Gives priority status for connection of solar photovoltaic systems for customer-generators who are public entities.
Prohibits smoking at State parks, forests, beaches, and wildlife management areas.
Prohibits smoking on property acquired or developed for recreation and conservation purposes by local government units or nonprofit organizations using State funds.
Requires DCA to establish school security construction code applicable to construction of new public school facilities and school additions.
Provides immunity from liability for certain persons who install or inspect child restraint systems.
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
Extends certain federal income tax advantages of individual health savings accounts to individual taxpayers under the New Jersey gross income tax.
"Zero-Based Budget Act;" requires State Treasurer to develop and integrate certain zero-based budgeting practices and procedures in preparation and submission of Governor's annual budget message.
Requires physicians to provide patients opportunity to undergo obstetrical ultrasound or sonogram within 48 hours of performing abortion.
Phases out estate tax over five-year period.
"New Jersey Jobs Protection Act;" requires verification of employment.
Suspends "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" until certain conditions are met.

Requires voter registration forms be available when applying for hunting, fishing, or trapping license; requires display and collection of completed application if the applicant wishes to register at public agency.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in all counties.
Establishes per se standard for driving under influence of inhalant; designated as "Kimmie's Law."
Revises definition of "landlord" to include rooming and boarding house owners and operators with regard to ordinances holding landlords to certain standards of responsibility.
Directs State agencies to take certain action to expedite permitting through use of general permits.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for development of Northern New Jersey Veterans Memorial Cemetery.
Allows commercial farmer to recover reasonable costs and attorney fees of defending against unreasonable complaints under "Right to Farm Act."

Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for a public servant, during a state of emergency, to use or make disposition of a public resource in an unauthorized manner with purpose to obtain a benefit for himself or another.
Concerns access to information maintained by Prescription Monitoring Program.
Implements recommendations of the SCI report entitled "Scenes from an Epidemic" concerning prescription drug and heroin abuse.

Eliminates requirement that at least one of two licenses issued under small-scale and staged casino facility pilot program must be staged casino facility license; permits these facilities to be located in renovated buildings.
Expands wrongful death act to allow recovery for mental anguish, emotional pain and suffering, loss of society and loss of companionship.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program.
Clarifies policyholder notice requirements as well as Rate Counsel jurisdiction regarding certain prior approval insurance rate filings seeking rate increase.
Recognizes litigation right, and requires arbitration of, uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage causes of action arising from private passenger automobile insurance.
Clarifies right to recover certain uncompensated medical expenses under private passenger automobile insurance.
Restricts access to motor vehicle accident reports under certain circumstances.
Concerns attorney fees for workers' compensation awards.
Provides private cause of action for bad faith in settlement of insurance claims.
Limits fees charged in connection with certain prepaid debit accounts; requires access to certain account information.
Requires "No Turn on Red" signs be affixed to certain traffic control signals.
Establishes the "General Durable Power of Attorney Act."
Provides for two-year post-employment restriction on certain employees of the Department of Banking and Insurance.
Prohibits certain violations of terms of service for Internet ticket sales.
Requires liability insurance for permit to possess certain dangerous animals.
"Aid in Dying for the Terminally Ill Act"; permits qualified terminally ill patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner. *
Requires water utilities to cover costs related to flooding damage under certain circumstances.

Lengthens yellow light at traffic signal with red light camera; sets penalty for failing to stop before turning right on red when detected by camera; implements one second delay for red light camera violations.

Revises penalty provisions for certain drunk driving violations, including use of and applicable time periods covering driver's license suspensions and installations of ignition interlock devices on motor vehicles.*
"Consumer Protection Act of 2012."

Permits two or more candidates for school board to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot for same term; permits short nonpolitical designation of principles on petitions and ballots.*
Exempts traffic summons records from public access under State's open public records law.

Permits qualifying patients to possess and use medical marijuana legally obtained from another jurisdiction; extends State medical marijuana laws to qualifying out-of-State patients; expands ability of parents to serve as primary caregiver to minor children.

Eliminates requirement that candidates file with county clerk duplicate copy of report of contributions and expenditures; requires each county to provide link to ELEC website on county Internet site.*
Requires two-way communications equipment on school buses.
Requires health insurance coverage for hair headpieces for patients receiving chemotherapy treatment for cancer.
Expands DNA database to include samples from disorderly persons who are fingerprinted and permits law enforcement officers to collect certain biological samples.
Prohibits purchaser of used motor vehicle from waiving dealer's obligation regarding emissions control equipment.
Prohibits motor fuel wholesaler from increasing price more than once in 24-hour period.
Requires notice of development applications be given to residential tenants on that property.
Requires video cameras at certain ATMs.
Requires adult corrections officers in State facilities to complete in-service training program.
Provides for forfeiture of vehicle where weapon was unlawfully possessed.
Establishes grant program in DCA to provide funding to youth mentoring programs.
Establishes design-build delivery system for New Jersey Turnpike Authority projects.
Requires DOT Commissioner to develop public awareness programs and use variable message signs to inform motorists about State's "move over" law.*
Upgrades crime of soliciting or recruiting for criminal street gang while on school property.
Expands eligible municipalities under the "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act" to include Harrison Town in Hudson County.
Establishes State payment in lieu of taxes to municipalities for loss of revenues due to an overburden of tax-exempt cemetery property; appropriates $66 million.
Requires disclosure of data recording devices in motor vehicles; limits access to recorded data.
Permits certain officials to possess pepper spray in quantity carried by law enforcement officers.
Establishes that volunteer firemen appointed to paid positions are not required to be recertified in certain instances.
Requires managed care plans to allow any clinical laboratory to participate in provider network.
Directs State acquisition of Troy Meadows Natural Area, Morris County, for recreation and conservation purposes and designates it as natural area and wildlife sanctuary.
Decreases sales and use tax rate from 7% to 6%.
Provides for reduced sales tax imposition on certain sales in certain Highlands Region Preservation Area municipalities.
Requires sex offenders in satellite-based monitoring program to pay for certain equipment and monitoring costs.
Authorizes use of retail coupons for purchase of milk by consumers.
Requires immediate resumed qualification as dependent covered person under certain health benefits plans after active military duty under certain circumstances.
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits for surviving dependents of public safety workers who die in the line of duty.

Forbids members of the State Investment Council from voting on transactions concerning investment with which a member has certain financial or familial conflicts and requires removal for violations thereof.
Replaces TPAF, PERS, PFRS and SPRS accidental disability benefits with reduced work-related disability benefit; modifies JRS disability benefit.

"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website; requires certain public entities receiving State funds to establish similar website; makes an appropriation.
"Flood Control, Mitigation, and Prevention Bond Act of 2012," authorizes bonds for up to $2 billion, and appropriates $5,000.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from requiring certain consumer identification for return of merchandise.
Reduces gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act of 2012"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
"Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Cargo Facility Charge Act."
Requires municipal governing body approval of new municipal free public library capital projects.
Requires school districts to allow nonpublic school students to participate in interscholastic sports programs on resident district's sports teams.
Authorizes municipalities to regulate use of certain explosives.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for pediatric cancer research.
Restricts sale and use of remaining State-owned portion of Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital property in Morris County.
Permits payments in subsidized adoption until child becomes 21 years of age under certain circumstances.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Requires members of governing boards of public institutions of higher education to complete a training program developed by the Commission on Higher Education.
Provides for designation of new charter school authorizers.
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements.
Expands jurisdiction of municipal arson investigators.

Modifies various aspects of charter school program including student enrollment procedures, revocation of charter, monitoring of charter schools, and collaboration between school districts and charter schools.
Requires each public institution of higher education to post its budget on the institution's website.
Allows municipalities to designate redevelopment entities and certain non-profits to act as land bank entities.*
Broadens municipal arson investigators' powers.
Permits a child who moves out of a school district due to a family crisis to remain enrolled in that district until the end of the school year.
Requires school districts to adopt policies concerning electronic communications between employees and students.
"Higher Education Citizenship Equality Act;" defines domicile for dependent students for the purpose of eligibility for State student loans, grants, or scholarships and in-State tuition rate.
Establishes a pilot program in DOE to increase the length of the school day and school year and provides tax credits for corporate contributions to fund the program.
Prohibits contribution action against local public entity for cleanup and removal costs or any other damages associated with discharge of hazardous substances.*
Establishes Response to Intervention initiative in DOE to support and encourage school districts in implementation of Response to Intervention framework.
Requires DOE to train teachers and administrators and monitor districts on bias and discrimination in special education classification.
Directs DOE to make database of special education decisions available on website.
Requires each school district to annually submit interscholastic athletic opportunity report to the Commissioner of Education.
Creates corporate business tax and gross income tax credits to fund education enrichment demonstration program.
Authorizes public schools to serve to students certain produce grown in community garden.
Establishes Office of the Special Education Ombudsman in DOE.
"The New Jersey Social Innovation Act"; establishes social innovation loan pilot program and study commission within EDA.
Directs DOH to develop plan to phase out use of latex gloves in health care facilities and food establishments.
Increases mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain repeat sex offenders.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Uphold Democracy."
Eliminates eligibility time limit on tuition benefits for spouses of certain public safety workers killed in performance of their duties.
Allows deduction against gross income for unreimbursed expenses incurred by organ donor.
Establishes "New Jersey Fire and EMS Crisis Intervention Services" telephone hotline.
Increases penalties for certain motor vehicle right-of-way violations and requires attendance at Driver Improvement Program.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance regulating where sex offenders may reside; restricts locations of certain child care centers and school bus stops.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DHSS.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Requires DEP to establish certification program for septic system inspectors.

Establishes annual sales tax holiday during first weekend of August for certain retail sales of computers, school computer supplies, school supplies, school art supplies, and school instructional materials.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
Authorizes South Jersey Vietnam Veterans' Association license plates with proceeds to veterans' and emergency management operations.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain student athlete physical examinations.
Revises criteria to establish base year for homestead property tax reimbursement after relocation.
Requires annual physical examination of child 19 years of age or younger include certain questions related to cardiac health.*
Creates Task Force on Distracted Driving.
Requires BPU to provide grants for cost of purchase and installation of certain electric metering equipment for solar power generation systems.
Prohibits possession of ammunition capable of penetrating body armor.
Requires certain information regarding Down syndrome be provided to certain parents and families.
Designates Pine Barrens treefrog as New Jersey State Amphibian.
Reduces drug free school and public property zones to 200 feet.
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.
Establishes residency requirement for police officers and firefighters in certain municipalities.
Requires incarcerated individual from State to be counted at residential address for legislative redistricting purposes.
Increases penalties for failing to yield when violation results in death to pedestrian.
Allows application for PERS accidental disability benefit for injury sustained while employed at State psychiatric institution or correctional facility immediately prior to PERS membership.
Establishes "MarcAnthony's Law;" criminalizes use of defaced or stolen firearm to injure a police officer; enhances penalties for defacing a firearm.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide to prospective students certain cost, loan, and debt information in financial aid shopping sheet.
Requires president of public institution of higher education to regularly report on-campus criminal and fire events to the institution's governing board.
"The Opportunity to Compete Act;" establishes certain employment rights for persons with criminal histories.
Requires reporting of the graduation rates of State tuition aid grant recipients.
Establishes durational limits and enumerates certain factors concerning modification and termination of alimony; establishes "open durational" alimony."*
Authorizes institutions of higher education to grant college credit to high school students who complete the Jersey Boys State or Jersey Girls State program.
Requires school districts to pay advanced placement examination fees for certain students and the State to reimburse school districts for the cost.
Establishes compensation program for certain law enforcement officers injured while performing official duties.*
Changes certain eligibility and benefit provisions of Employees' Retirement System of Jersey City.
Prohibits additional jughandles on roads or highways in the State.
Recodifies offenses against animals under State criminal code; increases degree of crime for certain offenses.
Establishes animal cruelty offenses pertaining to chaining or other restraint of animals.
Ensures operation of certain motor fuel storage, distribution and dispensing facilities during disasters and emergencies.
"Homestead School Property Tax Reimbursement Act"; provides State reimbursement for 50% of school property taxes paid by seniors, 65 years and older.
Eliminates remarriage prohibition for PFRS death benefits; provides retirement allowance to certain survivors of PFRS members.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Permits municipalities and school districts to contract for video monitoring systems to assist in enforcing law against unlawfully passing a school bus.
Enhances penalty for leaving the scene of a boating accident.
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Establishes NJ Animal Abuser Registry.
Establishes offense of soliciting image of minor with unlawful purpose.
Provides for electronic monitoring of domestic violence offenders and notification to the victim; designated as "Lisa's Law."
Establishes the "Healthy Puppies and Kittens Assurance Act."
Requires school districts to provide instruction on the dangers of texting while driving as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Requires installation of emergency power supply systems to certain common areas of new planned real estate developments; provides related tax incentives.
Prohibits public utility from filing rate increase petition under certain circumstances.
Concerns valuation of property condemned for dune construction or beach replenishment.

Requires health certificate, bill of sale, and certain breeder information for each cat or dog sold in the State and such information be made available to consumers; establishes penalties for violations.
Increases criminal penalties if leaving loaded firearm within easy access of minor results in injury or death.
Requires mortgage lenders to maintain vacant, age-restricted dwelling units during foreclosure.
Prohibits use of education and occupation as rating factors in automobile insurance underwriting.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members on federal active duty to temporarily defer mortgage loan payments and suspend property tax payments.*

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers to redeem loan amounts received under the New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public or nonpublic schools in New Jersey.
Provides for automatic expungement of records of certain juveniles adjudicated delinquent for engaging in prostitution.
Regulates certain rental-purchase agreements.
Regulates pharmacy benefits management companies.
Prohibits employers from obtaining, requiring, or discriminating on the basis of credit reports.*
Establishes pilot program in the Department of Law and Public Safety requiring the electronic recording of certain police interrogations.
The "Real Estate Installment Contract Act."
Provides local board of education with approval authority of charter school application.
Provides that person convicted of sexual assault that resulted in the birth of a child shall not be awarded custody or visitation under any circumstances.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing, importing, and selling assault firearms for civilian use.
Establishes compensation limits for licensed public adjusters.
Establishes a regulatory program for rifle and shotgun ammunition sales.
Strengthens State's assault weapons ban.
"Certificates of Insurance Act."
Requires Commissioner of Banking and Insurance to establish public awareness campaign about new federally required health insurance exchange.
Requires boards of education to adopt policies to make schools asthma-friendly.
Requires availability of early voting for certain elections; makes appropriation.
Requires certification of persons installing medical gas piping in dental offices, dental clinics, and animal or veterinary facilities.
Requires replacement of all electronic voting machines used in State by district-based optical scan voting systems by June 7, 2016; makes appropriation.
The "New Jersey Intern Protection Act"; provides legal protections and remedies for persons engaged in internships with employers.*
"New Jersey Health Insurance Marketplace Act."
The "Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at child care centers and certain schools.
Requires post-secondary educational institutions to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.
Permits municipality to establish restricted parking spaces for certain volunteer firefighters.
Establishes Extended School Day and School Year Study Commission.
Requires NJ Energy Star Homes Program incentives be available Statewide.
Establishes cruel restraint of a dog as an animal cruelty offense.
Requires physicians and other prescribers to obtain informed consent from parents or guardians of minors for certain medications with "black box warnings."
Establishes "Naturally Occurring Retirement Community" pilot program; appropriates $250,000.
Permits up to 10 children to be cared for by a registered family day care provider.
Authorizes executor or administrator to take control of online accounts of deceased person.
Prohibits right on red turns at intersections with red light cameras; requires certain additional signage if red light camera is in safe corridor.
Permits automatic expungement for certain persons completing a sentence to drug court under the special probation statute.
Permits domestic violence victim witness to testify via closed circuit television under certain circumstances.

Requires disclosure of contributions received and expenditures made by committees or organizations not affiliated or coordinated with any candidate, or committee organized to support or oppose public questions.
Adds Sons of The American Legion to list of organizations whose representatives receive paid leaves of absence to attend State and national conventions.
Establishes microenterprise training program and assistance for micro entrepreneurs.
Expands implied consent statute to include blood and urine testing.
Establishes drug disposal program in Division of Consumer Affairs.
Requires public institutions of higher education to establish policies for the implementation of fees.
Requires certain information to be contained in application for homestead property tax reimbursement and revises application deadline.
Requires presumption that any bail paid by defendant charged with certain weapons offenses will be in the form of full cash.
Requires health insurance carriers to encrypt certain information.*
"Carryout Bag Reduction and Recycling Act."
Establishes "Solar Roof Installation Warranty Program" in EDA and transfers $2 million from societal benefits charge to initially fund program.
Establishes temperature control guidelines and standards for school facilities.
Requires the State and local contracting units to purchase biodiesel or biodiesel blended fuel manufactured in NJ.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.

Requires development and implementation of mitigation plans for radon contamination in certain child care centers; requires DOE to develop such plans for child care centers operating in public schools, request funding, and implement plans when funded.
Establishes governance structure for county administrative school districts.
Concerns conveyance of certain State-owned lands.*

Authorizes sale of certain property interests in public roads by local governments to connect certain electric generating facilities with customers; provides for net metering, virtual net metering and connections by public utility.
Amends law concerning application, sale, and use of fertilizer to exempt organic fertilizer from certain requirements.
Establishes apprentice firearm hunting license and apprentice bow and arrow license.*
Prohibits use of certain fishing gear at artificial reef sites.

Concerns combined sewer overflows; exempts improvements thereto from 2% property tax cap; requires certain permit holders address such overflows in capital improvement plans; and appropriates $5 million.
Permits certain deer control activities; prohibits deer feeding; and establishes check-off donation on hunting license applications to support venison donation program.

The "Preserve New Jersey Act of 2013"; implements constitutional dedication of sales tax revenue for preservation of open space, including lands that protect water supplies and flood prone areas, farmland, and historic properties.
Provides sales and use tax exclusion for charges for student parking provided by certain colleges and universities.
Authorizes creation of stormwater utilities for certain local government entities.
The "Green Acres, Water Supply and Floodplain Protection, and Farmland and Historic Preservation Bond Act of 2014," authorizes bonds for $600 million; appropriates $5,000.

Directs Rutgers Discovery Informatics Institute, Office of Information Technology, NJ Edge.Net Inc., and New Jersey Big Data Alliance to develop advanced cyberinfrastructure strategic plan; appropriates $150,000.*
Designates New Jersey Big Data Alliance as State's advanced cyberinfrastructure consortium.*
Requires adoption of 2012 International Building Code and 2012 International Green Construction Code.
Designates "I'm From New Jersey" as State song.
Prohibits use of public funds by employers for certain employee influence activities.
Permits conduct of lottery games on Internet.

Requires members of Legislature and officers and employees of Legislative Branch to disclose to Joint Legislative Committee on Ethical Standards when charged, indicted, or convicted of crime while in office or employment.
Requires DHS to establish training, educational assessment, and remedial instruction programs, and minimum educational standards for staff at State psychiatric hospitals.
Provides penalties for sexually offensive or abusive communication through social networking websites.

Permits New Jersey Thoroughbred Horsemen's Association and Standardbred Breeders' and Owners' Association of New Jersey to use purse funds received from off-track and account wagering for care of retired race horses.
Extends service prevailing wage requirements to certain food service contracts.
Regulates advertising of manufacturer
Establishes Inspector General of Statewide Interscholastic Sports to monitor the operating and financial activities of the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association.
Creates special license plates supporting Autism Awareness.
Requires disclosure of all fees and charges associated with prepaid debit cards on the package of such cards.
Requires each public school to observe a period of silence on September 11 of each school year.
Requires that certain motor vehicle surcharge revenues be dedicated to the Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Requires mandatory imprisonment for child luring and requires certain information about Megan's Law to be provided to sex offenders annually.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing, importing, and selling assault firearms for civilian use.
Reduces lawful maximum capacity of certain ammunition magazines in New Jersey.
Exempts from disclosure as public record personal identifying information provided to government agency for emergency notification purposes.
Raises minimum age for purchase and sale of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices from 19 to 21.
Requires certain notifications prior to conducting blasting operations; raises minimum property insurance to use explosives.
Increases benefit amounts under New Jersey earned income tax credit program to 25 percent of federal earned income tax credit amounts beginning in Tax Year 2013.

Requires driver's license examination to include questions on distracted driving; makes it a violation for motorists to talk or text on hand-held wireless devices while vehicle is temporarily stopped.
Increases penalities for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving.
Requires an institution of higher education that receives state support to suspend a student for a second violation of cheating on an examination.
Provides immunity from liability for certain recreational activities and from injuries caused by acts of God.
Requires the Director of the Division of Taxation to establish a gross income tax payment system by credit card or debit card.
Authorizes DMV to offer a red heart-shaped identifying symbol on personalized license plates.
Allows property taxpayers an additional year to file tax appeal after revaluation.
Includes auxiliary police officers in Emergency Services Length of Service Award Program.
Establishes that passenger vehicles other than police vehicles have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.
Reduces statute of limitations for medical malpractice liability actions to four years.

Requires health insurers to cover treatment ordered by health care provider for covered person based on generally accepted standards of health care practice, subject to appeal; creates Carrier Appeals Program.
Concerns medical malpractice procedures and liability.
Requires penalties to be levied against renters and homeowners who violate affordability controls on affordable housing units.
Limits to $5,000 per election amount contributed to and by county committee of a political party.

Prohibits former elected official from receiving for five years compensation from charitable or non-profit organization when official's candidate committee donated campaign contributions to organization.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HIV vaccine.
Eliminates requirement that candidate campaign treasurer reports be filed with county clerk for legislative, local and school board candidates.
Implements measures to strengthen oversight of hospital charity care subsidies.
Prohibits solid waste collectors from billing for residential collection services more than 30 days in advance of the service.
Clarifies that certain former New Jersey National Guard members may be eligible for higher education tuition assistance.
Clarifies calculation of at-risk weight in school funding formula.
Requires certain persons on boats less than 21 feet long to wear personal flotation device between November 1st and May 1st.
Clarifies breath test warnings provided to persons arrested for intoxicated driving and boating need only be in English and those warnings are not element of offense of refusing breath test.
Permits complainant to withdraw complaint from county or municipal ethics board if decision not rendered within 180 days of receipt and submit to Local Finance Board.
Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to issue one license plate instead of two.
Removes provision permitting dismissal of de minimis violations for offenses involving corruption of public resources.
Prohibits the use of county and municipal vehicles by part-time elected local government officers.
Requires certain school buses to be equipped with lap and shoulder seat belts.
Exempts certain municipalities from payment for certain State Police services.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $500 income tax deduction.
Requires proof of lawful presence in the United States to obtain certain benefits.
Requires school districts to inform the parent or guardian of a student recommended to use certain medications of the possible side effects and potential negative consequences of those medications.
Limits the transportation costs of school districts sending students to county vocational school districts located outside the county of residence.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Permits DEP air quality regulation of certain outdoor wood burning units only in response to complaint.
Provides one-third of motor vehicle fine moneys generated through State Police issued tickets go to municipality where violation occurred.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
Provides public employee salaries at all levels of government cannot exceed salary of Governor.
Extends property tax benefit to veterans who performed active service in U.S. Armed Forces during Cold War.
Restricts use of accumulated sick leave by public employees in year prior to retirement.
Authorizes reimbursement for EMT training from EMT Training Fund for certain volunteer firefighters.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program; prohibits future use of red light cameras in State.
Exempts disabled veterans from certain fees at State parks and forests.

Blocks beach fees in shore municipalities accepting certain government provided beach replenishment funding and dedicates two percent of taxable receipts under the sales and use tax collected in the shore municipalities to the shore municipalities.
Authorizes chiefs of part-time municipal police forces to issue firearms ID cards and handgun purchase permits.
Designates State Route 173 between Clinton and Phillipsburg as "173rd Airborne Brigade Highway."
Provides that a teaching staff member dismissed by a district due to a reduction in force who subsequently retires must be removed from preferred eligible lists and has no right of reemployment.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.
Extends certain PERS benefits to veterans of "Operation Uphold Democracy".
Permits counties to share county tax administrators.
Creates crime of victimization of persons with disabilities and senior citizens.
Requires employers and birthing facilities to notify insured pregnant women if their health insurance coverage is not subject to 48-hour maternity law.
Allows person on police officer or firefighter eligible list who is unable to complete requirements for employment due to certain military service to have name placed on subsequent eligible list.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situtations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply; repeals section 2 of P.L.1999, c.47.
Requires criminal history record background checks for public employees handling vital records.
Provides voter registration assistance to persons completing parole, probation, and criminal sentences.
Amends Health Enterprise Zone law to allow municipalities more discretion in granting property tax exemptions to medical offices.
Establishes "Court Security Enhancement Fund" and increases certain court fees and assessments.*
Provides prescriber or health care facility with discretion to number prescription blank forms consecutively.
Prohibits local public employer continuation of pay programs.

Requires Division of Purchase and Property to provide additional notification of contracting opportunities to vendors or potential vendors providing or interested in providing home health care services to State agencies.
Expands definition and licensure requirements for health care service firms.
"Let Them Be Little Act"; provides for screening newborn infants for MPS I and MPS II.*
Requires forms and materials for individuals with developmental disabilities to be available in languages other than English.

Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions by certain taxpayers to New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program and provides a State match for contributions to NJBEST accounts for families meeting certain income guidelines.
Requires DHS and DMVA to conduct or contract for follow-up studies of former residents transitioning to community from their facilities.*
Provides disabled persons with discount on fishing license fees.
Requires blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death; designated as "Michelle's Law."
Directs NJEDA to establish pilot program to assist with permit and approval process related to redevelopment of certain properties.
Requires assessments prior to laboratory and diagnostic testing of persons undergoing mental health screening.
Revises law concerning ticket sales.
Provides for presumptive parole; establishes parole compliance credits; requires inmate disciplinary database; bases commutation credits on custodial sentence.*
Imposes certain registration and reporting requirements to prevent illegal trade of tigers.

Allows establishment of county-wide purchasing system for certain school district services in certain counties; offers employment protections for certain food or custodial services employees; and regulates subcontracting by districts and public higher education institutions.
Requires police to provide certain reports free of charge to crime victims.
Provides for issuance of certificate of rehabilitation to certain offenders with substance abuse disorders.
Establishes process to bar certain health care providers from receiving reimbursement under PIP.
Concerns arbitration for certain non-teaching school staff.
Revises definition of destructive device to include certain weapons of 50 caliber or greater.
Reduces number of voters for whom person can serve as messenger; limits to three number of voted mail-in ballots transmittable by bearer; modifies conviction standard under vote by mail law.
Requires Division of Addiction Services to grant residential drug treatment program licenses to certain programs operating in State correctional facilities and county jails.

Requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, or food boxes in certain areas located in black bear habitat under certain circumstances, including garbage collection, and prohibits certain actions that would result in feeding of black bears.
Recognizes same-sex marriages entered into outside the State.
Prohibits certain possession, sale, offering for sale, trade or distribution of shark fins; and allows in NJ the processing or sale of wild striped bass caught outside of NJ.
Authorizes licensing of operators to provide restricted foreign Internet wagering to foreign patrons under certain circumstances.
"New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Directs Commissioner of Education to establish per pupil expenditure limits for classroom instruction, support services, and administrative costs.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to study impact of State business income taxes on business out-migration, business formation, and employment.
Establishes the New Jersey State Commission on Education Reform to develop academic outcome-based per pupil public school funding amounts.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion.

Abolishes legislative leadership committees; reduces contributions to State political party committees to $12,500 per year, to county committees to $10,000 per year and to municipal committees to $5,000 per year.
Authorizes hunting of game animals every day of the week during hunting season.

Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements and to approve school district collective negotiations agreements prior to execution of agreement.
"Parent Empowerment and Choice Act"; enables parents to initiate reform in low performing schools through a petition process.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.

Requires tuition bills of public institutions of higher education to include details on student fees and opt-out provision for student-managed entertainment fees, and requires certain institutions' websites to include student fee information.
The "Family and Private Burial Grounds Preservation Act."
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave.
Authorizes installation of residential automatic standby generator without zoning or planning board approval.
Expands definition of "acquisition," for purposes of county and municipal open space trust funds, to include demolition, removal of debris, and restoration of lands being acquired.

"Direct Tax Relief for New Jersey Families Act"; Establishes the New Jersey Direct Property Tax Relief Program; increases the renter's gross income tax credit for property taxes; and increases the earned income tax credit.
Strengthens rights of certain sexual assault victims to sole custody; allows victim to place child for adoption without notice to person who committed sexual assault resulting in birth of the child.
Expands definitions of "abused child" or "abused or neglected child" to include prenatal exposure of child to controlled substances.
Permits minors to engage in certain construction work for nonprofit organizations.
Provides certain offers and sales of securities from registration.*
Increases penalty for harboring or concealing certain sex offenders.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
"The 10-20-Life Law."
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Establishes new limits for campaign contributions by individuals, certain groups and campaign committees.
Requires sex offender's tier designation to be completed and reviewed by the court prior to release from incarceration.
Prohibits good faith allegations of child abuse from being used against the accuser in a child custody proceeding; makes it a disorderly persons offense to file a false allegation of child abuse.
Amends State college law to remove certain employees from civil service system and allow boards of trustees to conduct collective bargaining.
Permits high performing school districts to be monitored by the DOE under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJ QSAC) every seven years rather than every three years.
Expands domestic violence protection for adoptive parents.
Establishes "Government Functions and Services Study Commission."

Expands duties of State Auditor to include performance audits at request of legislator; establishes Performance Audit Committee, consisting of eight public members, to help conduct performance audits.
Expands eligibility under the Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act by broadening certain municipal qualifier provisions.

Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research institutions; allows certain technology businesses located in certain innovation zones to receive certain tax credits under Grow New Jersey Assistance Program.**
"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to taxpayers contributing to scholarships for low-income children.
Restricts certain campaign contributions by public employee labor organizations.
Transfers responsibility for establishment and enforcement of ethical standards for local officials to State Ethics Commission.**
Allows military member to qualify for resident tuition rate at county college.
Establishes "New Jersey Higher Education Funding Formula Commission."
Revises various provisions of Megan's Law and enhances penalties for certain violations.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act"; imposes mandatory term of imprisonment; provides for negotiated reduction of mandatory term under certain circumstances.
Directs MVC to establish driver's license endorsement for autonomous vehicles.
Creates crime of home invasion; makes crime subject to No Early Release Act.
Establishes crimes of dog fighting and leader of a dog fighting network, and updates crime of animal fighting; amends RICO concerning dog fighting.*

Clarifies that encouraging another person to cause bodily injury, by filming, photographing, or otherwise recording injury-causing act for circulation, publication, or distribution, is form of crime of endangering an injured victim.
Creates a Business Court.
Requires Police Training Commission to develop accelerated training course for certain corrections officers.

Increases penalties for counterfeiting if the offense creates risk of bodily injury, serious bodily injury or death; creates new offense within Criminal Code of counterfeiting products related to health.
Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands horse racetrack, subject to voter approval.
Requires that each school district conducting an interscholastic athletic program must employ one or more school athletic trainers.
Enacts "Truth in Caller Identification Act"; prohibits manipulation of certain telephone caller identification information.
Adds certain crimes as crimes which have bail restrictions.
Establishes the number of students to be supported under the veterinary medicine education program and a service requirement for students who participate in the program.
Establishes "New Jersey Gaming Industry Study Commission" to evaluate impact of enacted gaming and technological reforms and explore future prospects for casino gaming and horse racing in this State.
Excludes appropriations to reserve for uncollected taxes in excess of two percent from calculations of municipal adjusted tax levy.
Revises responsibility for meadowlands adjustment payments.
Imposes surcharge on motor vehicle offenses to fund upgraded electronic systems for police vehicles.
Increases workers' compensation for loss of hand or foot; requires Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to study effectiveness of workers' compensation program.
Establishes Solar Thermal Expansion Loan and Grant program; appropriates $10 million.
Prohibits persons under 19 from smoking in public and purchasing tobacco products.
Increases monetary penalties to be assessed upon conviction for Megan's Law offenses and fixes amount of penalty.
The "Green Building and Infrastructure Tax Credit Act"; provides tax credits for certain green buildings and wood utility poles.*

Provides certain exemptions from sales and use tax for compressed natural gas, liquefied natural gas, or propane fueled vehicles and plug-in hybrid electric vehicles, and for equipment used for refueling or recharging certain vehicles.
Creates sporting facility license governing sale of alcoholic beverages under certain circumstances.*
Increases penalties for improper prescribing of drugs.
Expands NJ Meadowlands Commission responsibilities to include flood control activities.
Revises population formula for issuance of certain plenary retail consumption licenses.
Sets forth certain requirements for sale of alcoholic beverages for off-premise consumption of plenary retail distribution licensees or certain retail consumption licenses.
Revises law concerning the rights and responsibilities of motor vehicle franchisees and franchisors.
Adds to property tax levy cap exclusions increases in flood insurance premiums.
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Increases and revises membership of New Jersey Cemetery Board.
Prohibits cemetery company from charging additional fee for rendering certain services on Sunday.

Modifies current law regarding regulation and restrictions on business entities who are public contractors and make campaign contributions to certain office holders, candidates and political organizations.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.

Requires insurers to cover comprehensive ultrasound breast screening if a mammogram demonstrates certain dense breast tissue and requires certain mammogram reports to contain information on breast density.
Establishes procedures and standards regarding public service privatization contracts.
Modifies powers and allocation of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.*
Establishes "Monica's Law" concerning domestic violence risk assessment pilot program.
Establishes "Domestic Violence Health Care Response Act."
Limits amount of contribution to legal defense fund of holder of elective public office and requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Requires disclosure of campaign contributions received or expenditures made by individual seeking election as political party committee officer.

Requires governmental affairs agents to disclose on notice of representation form compensation amount received from State or local government entities; requires notice to be posted on Internet site of Election Law Enforcement Commission.
"The Truth In Tolling Act"; requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to display toll amount paid when EZ-Pass user passes through toll collection point.
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.

"Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act"; enhances film and digital media tax credits, revises and expands tax credit eligibility requirements, and requires EDA to study development of film studio at North Jersey location.*
Directs Department of Corrections to provide employment assistance to inmates prior to release.
Makes various changes to law addressing meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and information about meetings.
Makes certain access changes to open public records act; establishes State public finance website and creates program for development of local websites; makes appropriation.
"Unfair Wage Recovery Act"; provides that unlawful employment practice occurs each time individual is affected.
Makes FY 2014 supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,453,000 for family planning services.*
Concerns earned sick leave.
Expands infertility coverage under certain health insurance plans.
Concerns enforcement, penalties, and procedures for law regarding failure to pay wages.
The "Marriage Equality Act"; recognizes same-sex marriage.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
Prohibits candidates and elected public officials charged with crimes from using campaign contributions for their legal defense.
Imposes mandatory terms of imprisonment on persons convicted of certain sex crimes against minors.
The "New Jersey Right to Home Defense Law."
Upgrades crime of invasion of privacy under certain circumstances.
Upgrades the crime of invasion of privacy if it results in death or serious bodily injury to a crime of the second degree.
Prohibits the unauthorized photographing or videotaping of a child.
Requires certain commissions to maintain meeting minutes; establishes Governor's authority to approve or veto the minutes of those commissions.
Provides for automatic waiver of juvenile case to adult court for repeat juvenile offenders.
