Provides for mandatory forfeiture of retirement benefits of elected official convicted of crime involving office held.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.*
Requires ELEC to provide ethics training for governmental affairs agents.
Requires schools to maintain supply of epinephrine and permit administration of epinephrine to any student having anaphylactic reaction.
Authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoir levels prior to certain severe weather events.
Upgrades penalties for certain crimes committed during a state of emergency.
Upgrades burglary of a residence to a crime of the second degree; requires mandatory period of parole ineligibility if residence was occupied at time of offense.
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and harassment under certain circumstances.
Requires persons subject to Megan's Law registration to provide law enforcement with any Internet identifiers.
Establishes permissive inferences related to conduct that serves as predicate to sex offenses against minors.
Provides primary and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act," requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Requires State to use energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Changes fire district election date from third Saturday in February to third Tuesday in April, the annual election day in type II school districts.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for qualified wages of certain veterans.
Prohibits use of certain accidents involving certain insureds during the course of employment with a government entity as rating factor in automobile insurance underwriting.
Upgrades the disorderly persons offense of desecration of a venerated object to a crime of the third degree if the object desecrated is a military monument.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Authorizes counties to charge inmates for costs of incarceration and to place a lien to ensure payment.
Adjusts fee schedule for county and municipal golf courses for certain veterans and service members.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Praying Mantis."
Authorizes special license plate for distinguished service medal recipients.
Directs Department of Law and Public Safety to engage in Internet privacy and social media responsibility campaign.
Requires public institutions of higher education to waive or reimburse application fees and transcript fees for veterans and members of the military.
Requires Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to develop career exploration report for students in grades 7 through 12.
Excludes certain increases in school security expenditures from tax levy and appropriation cap, as applicable, for school districts, municipalities, and counties.
Includes e-mail addresses in list of confidential items to be redacted from public records under OPRA.
Makes consent to register with Selective Service part of driver's license application process for males under age 26.
Requires gubernatorial candidates' statements be posted online.
Creates motor vehicle offense of smoking in a motor vehicle with a child present, and dedicates penalties to "Smoking Cessation Fund."*
Enacts "Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act."

"Assistance to Firefighters' Families Act"; doubles State survivor pension amounts for beneficiaries of certain deceased volunteer emergency service providers; requires municipal life insurance and burial expenses for volunteer firefighters; permits fire code inspection surcharge.
Waives commercial driver's license fees for certain volunteer firefighters.
Permits voter registration of certain persons at age17 for voting at next election occurring on or after18th birthday.
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.
Establishes procedures for awarding of design-build contracts.
Enhances penalties for false incrimination and making fictitious reports.*
Establishes special motorcycle license plates for veterans.
Requires State Agricultural Development Committee to establish pilot program permitting special occasion events to be conducted on preserved farmland at wineries under certain circumstances.*

"Drug Dealer Accountability Act;" increases penalties for distribution of phencyclidine; establishes criminal liability for drug dealers under certain circumstances; imposes civil and criminal penalties for combinations of controlled dangerous substances.
Renames Mountainview Youth Correctional Facility as "William H. Fauver Youth Correctional Facility."
Requires workers employed in certain public works to have completed a registered apprenticeship program.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain expenses paid or incurred for care and support of qualifying senior family member; designated as Caregiver's Assistance Act.
Provides that certain funds in Casino Simulcasting Special Fund will be paid to Atlantic City Racetrack and prescribes use thereof with certain amounts remaining paid to other racetracks.
Requires all temporary emergency shelters be equipped with alternative emergency power generators; designated the "Safe Shelter Act."
Establishes the "Neighborhood Scholar Revitalization Pilot Program."
Requires that sexual abuse against a child be reported to law enforcement officials.
Enhances penalty for leaving the scene of boating accident.
Establishes judicial criteria for determining pretrial detention of persons charged with first degree crimes; establishes statutory bail alternatives for non-violent offenders.
"Government Energy Reliability and Savings Public-Private Partnership Act."

"New Jersey Tuition Equality for America's Military (NJTEAM) Act"; provides in-State tuition at New Jersey public institutions of higher education to military veterans and certain family members living in New Jersey.
Authorizes gradation of certain drug dealing offenses by "units" of controlled dangerous substances.
Requires emblems be placed on certain structures to notify firefighters of solar panels; requires that certain solar panel information be filed with local fire department.
Requires municipalities which license peddlers and solicitors to accept background check results from other municipalities.*

Provides corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization, and expansion, or hiring and training of new employees for manufacturing purposes.
Requires that certain health care facilities be generator ready; allows health care facilities to qualify for NJEDA loans for cost of generators.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."
Requires public utilities to set bill due date to no earlier than 28 days past postmarked date if mailed by regular mail, or 28 days past sent date if sent electronically.
Requires policy on use of alternative dispute resolution for State agencies; expands duties of Dispute Settlement Office of Department of Public Advocate.
Revises the statutes concerning oaths and affidavits.
Establishes gross income tax credit for cost of certain postage for sending goods to members of United States Armed Forces and National Guard who are serving their country away from home.
"Health Care Transparency and Disclosure Act."
Directs New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to study and report on potential revenue generating services of rest areas and service plazas. *
Clarifies intent of Legislature to protect certain senior tenants; aligns housing age restrictions with federal law.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties within 20 mile radius.
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHS as ambulatory care facilities.
Establishes the Workforce Shortage Loan Redemption Program.
Authorizes certain gestational carrier agreements.
Revises requirements for emergency medical services delivery.
Removes statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands categories of defendants liable in such actions.
"Healthcare Disclosure and Transparency Act."
"Consumer Access to Health Care Act"; eliminates requirement of joint protocol with physician for advanced practice nurses to prescribe medication.
Permits municipalities to hold certain inactive liquor licenses reserved for smart growth developments for an additional five years.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in certain portfield sites.
Permits adoptees and certain others to obtain adoptee's original birth certificate and other related information.
Revises statutes regarding practice of physical therapy.
Provides that President of Municipal Clerks' Association of New Jersey and one additional public member serve as members of Government Records Council.
Requires hospitals and health care professionals to offer hepatitis C testing to certain individuals; authorizes certain labortories to perform rapid hepatitis C testing.*
Limits payment to certain public employees for accumulated sick leave upon retirement; requires fine and reprimand or termination for violation of sick leave by public employee.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective and appointive positions.
Provides for mandatory imprisonment and forfeiture of retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction and veterans' property tax exemption to residents of continuing care retirement communities.*
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Reduces corporation business tax rate and provides an additional rate reduction for three years for taxpayers that relocate corporate headquarters to New Jersey.
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Establishes public bidding and contracting procedures for Rutgers, the State University that mirror those in place for the State colleges.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement, in consultation with New Jersey Racing Commission, to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks.
Provides for establishment and operation of casino at Meadowlands Complex.
Requires forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
Requires State Treasurer, in consultation with State Comptroller, to promulgate rules and regulations concerning best practices for awarding independent State authority contracts.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
Allows host municipalities to offer property tax abatements on former Fort Monmouth property under terms and conditions established by those municipalities.

Directs the executive county superintendent of schools to select a new district of residence for students who reside on certain federal property who are not the dependent children of military personnel.
Clarifies DOBI's regulatory authority over certain flood insurance claims.
Requires insurers writing homeowners insurance policies in the State to offer certain coverage for heating oil tanks.
Prohibits location of off-road vehicle training or recreation facility within five miles of residential zone.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; designated as "Stephen Komninos' Law."
Reinstates moratorium on imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until January 2015.
"Protection for Individuals with Developmental Disabilities in Institutional and Community Settings Act."
Establishes the "Mental Health Court Pilot Program" in several vicinages.
Requires Commissioner of Health to review impact of disabilities on persons in minority and underrepresented communities.
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.
Requires veterinarians at for-profit veterinary facilities to provide written notification concerning absence of supervision after normal business hours; designated as "Betsy's Law."**
Appropriates $26,140,000 for dredging projects and dredged material disposal projects related to navigational waterways.
Requires DEP assume responsibility for dredging of waterways providing boat access to lagoon communities; appropriates $6,000,000.
Establishes special dredging account; directs $5,000,000 of sales tax collected annually be deposited therein; directs DEP to administer account and dredging program with certain requirements.
Makes annual compensation paid to surviving spouses of certain blind or disabled veterans payable from date of veteran's death.
Requires public hearings on proposed off-track wagering facilities to be held in municipalities contiguous to site where proposed facilities will be located.
Concerns awarding of professional services contracts by public agencies and requires certain disclosures by State and local government officials and candidates for elective public office.
Extends veteran's property tax exemption to tenant shareholders in cooperatives and mutual housing corporations.
Revises law concerning sexually oriented businesses.
Revises current law permitting paid leave of absence for municipal police officers.
Permits conversion of fines for violation of certain municipal ordinances into tax liens.
Converts loan awarded to Barnegat Bay Decoy and Baymen's Museum from loan to grant.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Provides for discounted resident trapping license fees for senior citizens.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to fully disabled veterans.
Dedicates up to $400,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach and Liberty State Parks to special funds to be used to support certain park programs, and makes appropriations from the funds.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Provides temporary period for making certain estate tax refund claims and directs notice be given to certain affected parties.
Establishes civil action for damages against organizations that support terrorism.
Clarifies that punitive damages may not be awarded against public entities or public employees acting within the scope of their employment in any action.
Authorizes counties to reduce greenhead fly populations; appropriates $50,000.
Eliminates standard waiting period for issuance of marriage or civil union license.
Creates new offense of theft by financial exploitation of a vulnerable person.
Requires Division on Civil Rights and DCA to post information regarding disability accommodation rights for owners and occupants of condominiums, cooperatives, and other common interest communities.
Revises law concerning the rights and responsibilities of motor vehicle franchisees and franchisors.**
"Economic Opportunity Act of 2014, Part 1."
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits.
Requires State designated children's hospitals to have Pediatric Emergency Physician on duty at all times in emergency department.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Authorizes penalties for failure to file certain public employment contracts; clarifies requirement for electronic posting of public employment contracts and interest arbitration awards.
Establishes best practices for procurement and payment of legal services by local governments and school districts.
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act."
Requires filing of financial and conflict disclosure statements as condition of development approval.
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act"; prohibits COAH from basing prospective need portion of fair share obligation on commercial development.

Requires mail-in ballot applications be available at polling places on election day for voting in future elections; requires poll workers to discuss application instructions with applicant upon request.

Requires issue advocacy organization disclosure; increases disclosure of campaign finance information; raises amount of money contributable to committees; modifies restrictions on contributions by certain business entities performing public contracts.
Designates Black Swallowtail butterfly as State Butterfly.
Clarifies "knockout game" assault as third-degree aggravated assault; provides mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for such assault.
Requires landlord to accept charitable payments to satisfy unpaid rent obligations.
Provides standards for, and requires registration of, home elevation contractors.*
The "Adopt a Stormwater Management Basin Act."
Authorizes rural electric cooperative and certain municipalities to establish municipal shared services authority.*
Provides gross income tax exclusion for capital gains from sale of certain employer securities.

Implements constitutional amendment providing for pretrial detention of certain criminal defendants; establishes non-monetary bail alternatives for release; authorizes Judiciary to revise fees for certain legal programs and services.*
Extends health benefits coverage of a newborn infant.
Exempts from sales tax for two years certain highly fuel efficient vehicles and energy efficient appliances.
Revises "Contractors Registration Act" to include water remediation services.
Requires insurance producers to perform bona fide services for public entities in order to share commissions; requires disclosure of commission sharing.
"Michael Massey's Law"; requires sanitation vehicles display flashing lights in certain circumstances and imposes conditions on drivers approaching sanitation vehicles displaying flashing lights.
Requires health care representative to make health care decisions for incapacitated patient in accordance with patient's religious beliefs.
Authorizes innocent spouse relief under the gross income tax.
Modifies school funding law to incorporate recommendations of DOE's Education Funding Report and Educational Adequacy Report.
Imposes requirements on certain pediatric emergency departments; requires DOH to include information on pediatric emergency departments in its annual hospital performance report.
Permits persons at racetracks, off-track wagering facilities, and casino simulcasting facilities to place instant racing wagers.
Creates cigar night smoking ban exemption at racetracks and off-track wagering facilities.
Creates voluntary survey for physicians as part of biennial registration process with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.
Requires registration of certain vacant and abandoned properties with municipalities and provides enforcement tools related to maintenance of these properties.

Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Early Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics programs for students in grades K through 8.
Prohibits charging fee to stop publishing personal identifying information obtained through the criminal justice system.*
Allows school districts to enter into school construction public-private partnership agreements with private entities.
Grants subpoena power to Office of Inspector General at Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in furtherance of investigations.
Increases benefit amounts under New Jersey earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal earned income tax credit amounts beginning in Tax Year 2014.
Prohibits retail sales establishment from storing certain magnetic-stripe data; requires reimbursement for costs incurred by financial institution due to breach of security.
Establishes procedures for the approval of the closure of a public school.
Enacts the "Reader Privacy Act."
Removes examination and educational course requirements for licensure as a real estate referral agent.
Exempts construction, expansion or renovation of public institutions of higher education, public schools, and police and fire academies from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Requires additional fines for certain crimes against minors to fund Amber Alert system.
Requires account numbers to be truncated on certain sales receipts.
Criminalizes fifth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.
Supplemental appropriation of $250,000 to DLPS to assist local police departments in paying for new National Crime Information Center terminals.
Increases prison time for certain persons convicted of a motor vehicle offense when license suspended for DUI.
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Exempts certain aspects of out-of-State business operations from certain tax, fee, registration, and licensing requirements during performance of in-State declared disaster or emergency related work.
Establishes "College Affordability Study Commission" to examine issues and develop recommendations to increase the affordability of higher education in New Jersey.
Authorizes permits for certain New Jersey casinos for interstate and foreign Internet wagering; requires Internet gaming payment processors be licensed as casino service industry enterprises.
Excludes the value of certain manufacturer rebates from the sales price of motor vehicles taxable under the sales and use tax.
Authorizes "100 percent Disabled Veteran" license plates for qualified veterans; entitles holders to handicapped parking privileges.
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.

Exempts transfer of ownership of real property between individual and business entity controlled by that individual from realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on transfer of ownership of certain real property.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Heating Oil and Propane Reserves.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Establishes Governor's authority over approval of minutes of certain regional commissions.
Increases contribution limit by counties and municipalities to volunteer first aid, ambulance, and rescue squads.
Establishes 12-month moratorium on establishment of new virtual charter schools and creates Virtual Charter School Task Force.

Authorizes Judiciary to revise or supplement fees, subject to limitations, to fund Legal Services of New Jersey and e-court information system; requires review and reporting on fees and expenditures of such fees.
Increases certain filing fees, penalties and enhances enforcement provisions and procedures for violations of cigarette tax and unfair cigarette sales laws by cigarette license holders.
Establishes "Truck Operator Independent Contractor Act."
Reduces maximum capacity of ammunition magazines to 10 rounds.
Requires halfway houses to permit attorneys and certain representatives of attorneys to visit incarcerated clients.
Establishes in DOC, supervised community reintegration program for certain victims of domestic abuse.*
Concerns procedures for public comment about matters before municipal planning and zoning boards.
Revises statutes concerning permissible length of time between certain public questions in certain municipalities.
Directs State Board of Agriculture and Dept. of Agriculture to adopt regulations concerning confinement of pregnant sows during gestation.
"Property Tax Reduction Work Act"; permits local units to recruit residents to perform services in return for property tax vouchers.
Increases certain arson offenses to a crime of the third degree.
Provides for establishment of child support lien against life insurance proceeds; requires insurers perform child support judgment search.
Prohibits residential development fees on reconstruction after natural disasters.
Exempts all transfers made to lineal relatives from the Transfer Inheritance Tax.
Requires insurers and SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for ovarian cancer.
Revises method of determining reimbursement costs when a law enforcement entity hires a recently trained officer from another law enforcement entity.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Establishes task force to preserve original Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital main building.
Provides for notification to law enforcement authorities of discharge of certain persons brought to screening services for evaluation and assessment for mental health services.
Requires State designated children's hospitals to have Pediatric Emergency Physician on duty at all times in emergency department.
Reinstates moratorium on imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until January 2015.*
Establishes new offenses concerning the unlawful possession and use of credit card scanners.
Requires local governing body and DCA to suspend collection of certificate of occupancy and related inspection fees for homes being rented by persons identified by FEMA as displaced individuals.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to include sales of properties in age-restricted developments by third parties in table of equalized valuations.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Directs NJ Sports and Exposition Authority to conduct feasibility study of Meadowlands convention center project.
Excludes from gross income the contributions that certain federal employees classified as criminal investigators make to the federal Thrift Savings Fund.
Provides certain homestead exemption in medical malpractice judgments; prohibits insurers from raising medical malpractice liability insurance premiums under certain circumstances.
Requires newly-constructed grocery stores to have generators.
"Post-Viability Protection Act."
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
Dedesignates portions of Route 24.
Permits consolidation of all fire districts in a municipality; sets forth procedure for consolidation.
Revises distribution of monies from Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund to municipalities.

Exempts certain transactions of residential property involving senior, blind, and disabled citizens from general purpose fee under realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on real property selling for more than $1,000,000.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.
Designates State Highway Route No. 35 bridge between Brielle and Point Pleasant Beach as "Veterans of All Wars Memorial Bridge."
Clarifies that fishing license is not required to fish at a private community lake.
Prohibits sale, distribution, and use of urea as an ice melt.
Imposes criminal penalties for discharges of untreated sewage from containment devices installed on watercraft.
Requires labeling of ingredients and restricts phosphorus in household cleansing products.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Provides for use of prepaid debit cards as standardized form of disbursement for certain State and local government payments to individuals and business entities.
Provides for distribution of gross income tax refunds via prepaid debit cards.

Establishes Commission on State-owned Historic Sites in Department of State, transfers administration of State-owned historic sites to commission, and transfers historic preservation programs from DEP to Department of State.
Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.
The "Jobs, Trade and Democracy Act."
"Wage Transparency Act"; requires reporting of public contractor employment information.

Requires teacher preparation program for instuctional certificate to include certain amount of instruction or clinical experience in special education and for students with disabilities endorsement to include credit hours in autism spectrum disorder.*
Requires carriers to classify medically necessary procedures as covered benefits and remit certain payments to hospitals for services rendered.

Prohibits treatment, discharge, disposal, application to roadway, or storage of wastewater, wastewater solids, sludge, drill cuttings or other byproducts from natural gas exploration or production using hydraulic fracturing.*

Provides that expression of a political view or of a personal opinion on a school district budget by school board member does not constitute action that may form the basis of a school ethics complaint.
Authorizes a school district that moves its annual school election to November to submit separate proposals for additional school spending for the budget year and the subsequent budget year.
Adds aneutronic fusion to types of Class I renewable energies as defined for purposes of "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Establishes the "Mental Health Court Pilot Program," in Mercer and Essex Counties.
Concerns alterations in child support obligations in response to changes to status of supported child.
Permits reuse of returned prescription drugs within licensed health care facilities; directs Commissioner of Health to evaluate feasibility of reuse for treatment of indigent persons.
Limits when bidders can be required to submit a financial statement in order to bid on a local public contract or county college contract.
Concerns school bus safety inspections.

Extends for five years expiration date of special appraisal process for Green Acres program and farmland preservation program for lands in Highlands Region; makes change to special appraisal process for certain farmers.*
Provides a sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain high-efficiency home heating equipment.
Excludes certain federal employee Thrift Savings Fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain costs of home bedbug infestation remediation.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Revises certain exemptions to "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Repeals Highlands planning and environmental permitting provisions of "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act," and amends various statutes to reflect repeal thereof.
Requires municipality to comply with State audit prior to receiving State aid.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.
Exempts sale of recreational safety helmets from sales and use tax.
Removes investigation and security services from imposition of sales and use tax.
Clarifies that non-credit courses are eligible courses under the volunteer tuition credit program.
Caps State use portion of energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Permits county board of chosen freeholders to appoint interim member of county tax board under certain circumstances.
Individual's status as minor may not disqualify him from bone marrow donation if medical criteria and informed consent requirements are met.
Establishes free smoke detector program in DCA.
Requires managed care plans to deem valid referral for a covered health care service as satisfying requirements for prior notification.
Establishes mutual aid assistance request protocols for 9-1-1 ambulance dispatchers.
Establishes 80 as maximum age for issuing special handgun carry permits to retired police officers.
Creates new motor vehicle offense of engaging in a pattern of aggressive driving.
Expands membership of Police Training Commission to include representative from Chiefs of County Detectives/Investigators Association of NJ.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Establishes "William's Law," pertaining to pool safety.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for employers who employ certain individuals who have received training from certain community rehabilitation programs.
Prohibits improper release of photographs or videos captured by public entities.
Increases maximum penalty under "Local Government Ethics Law."

Permits municipal affordable housing trust funds and payments-in-lieu fees transferred to the New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund to be returned to the originating county for affordable housing purposes.
Requires replacement of door and ignition locks on county and municipal vehicles prior to sale.
Authorizes municipality to deliver property tax bills, construction permits, and receipts for payment via e-mail.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.
Changes membership of Lake Hopatcong Commission and requires DEP to develop water level management plan for Lake Hopatcong to be approved by commission.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under gross income tax, eliminates income cap on exclusion.
Allows certain fuel dealers and distributors refunds of petroleum products gross receipts tax and credits against motor fuel tax for certain bad debts from sale of fuel.
Directs DOE to develop and implement pilot program for compressed natural gas school buses, and authorizes establishment of permanent voluntary program under certain circumstances.
Prohibits emergency service fees.
Requires health benefits plans in Medicaid, NJ FamilyCare, SHBP, and SEHBP to offer equal terms for participation of certain health care providers in their provider networks.
Codifies Lyme disease reporting requirements.
Clarifies that crime victim has a right to make a victim impact statement directly to the defendant at sentencing.
Requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Concerns property taxes due and owing on real property damaged or destroyed during, or as the result of, a natural disaster when a state of emergency is declared by the Governor. *
Extends time period for municipalities to commit to expend collected development fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units.
Reduces amount of fire duty required in order to receive exempt fireman certificate.
Requires MVC to accept death certificate as proof of name change.
Clarifies insurance coverage for certain home and health care agency employees under their own private passenger automobile insurance.

Transfers records management functions of Division of Archives and Records Management from Department of State to Department of Treasury; transfers State Records Committee from Department of State to Department of Treasury.
Requires display of State vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all State vehicles.
Requires ATM facilities to be equipped with access to emergency telephone service.
Exempts certain motor vehicle repair dealers from consumer fraud law and regulation under certain circumstances.
Provides for the inclusion of home-schooled students in the NJ STARS Program.
Establishes a grant program for school districts to establish substance abuse prevention programs for eighth grade students.
"New Jersey G.I. Bill"; provides higher education benefits to New Jersey veterans.
Adds members representing fire fighting and fire safety interests to the Domestic Security Preparedness Planning Group.
Establishes process by which a fiduciary is discharged.
Requires DEP to obtain legislative approval and authorization before increasing a fee or imposing a new fee, but retains DEP authority to use ordinary administrative procedure when decreasing a fee.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations and partnerships.
The "New Jersey Parental Rights and Property Tax Reduction Act."
Requires public and independent institutions of higher education to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.
Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to issue exempt certificates for motor vehicles not required to be inspected.
Allows county sheriffs to issue firearms identification cards and permits to purchase handguns; authorizes county sheriffs to accept applications for permits to carry handguns.
Implements Governor's "Tool Kit" proposals for public employer-public employee collective negotiation agreements.
Exempts agricultural driver's licensees from certain graduate driver law restrictions when operating farm equipment and vehicles.
Specifies that certain images generated by body scans violate State statutes prohibiting invasion of privacy, pornography, and endangerment of child welfare under certain circumstances.
Expands eligibility for reduced-cost spaying and neutering program to any disabled State resident.
Establishes program authorizing lease of historic buildings and structures in State parks, forests, and wildlife management areas.

Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes and adjusts administration of setoffs against gross income tax refunds and homestead rebates or credits.
Modifies "inherently beneficial use" definition for purposes of zoning variance to discourage siting of wind and solar energy facilities on agricultural land and open space.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.
Eliminates the alternative minimum assessment under the corporation business tax.
Increases income threshold for qualifying for farmland assessment.
Provides that preserved farmland may be sold by the State or a local government unit only to established farmers and restricts size of farmer residence which may be built thereon.
Requires boil water notices to be provided by certain public water systems via telephone, email or text message.
Requires boil water notices be provided to mayor and municipal clerk within one hour.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 4% over the prior academic year.
Requires superintendent to assume responsibilities of principal in certain school districts.
Allocates $10 million to the City of Trenton to hire 75 additional police officers.
Concerns automobile insurance practices.
Eliminates award of attorneys' fees, filing fees and costs of suit for technical violation of the consumer fraud act.
Establishes electronic reporting system for purchasers of precious metals or jewelry.
Concerns rights of Delaware River and Bay Authority employees.
Prohibits employers from obtaining, requiring, or discriminating on the basis of credit reports.
Requires disclosure of certain adverse actions based on consumer credit reports.
Establishes pilot program to utilize value-based benefit design in SHBP to increase health benefits coverage for certain employees concerning chronic health conditions.
Increases State hotel and motel occupancy fee revenues required to be annually appropriated to fund certain arts and cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.
Permits NJ boat manufacturers to qualify for EDA loans for renewable energy technology, equipment, or systems.
Applies prevailing wage to work on Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital grounds and facilities.

Permits participation agreements between casinos and casino service industry enterprise licensees for purchase or lease of slot machines, which pay licensees portion of proceeds from operation thereof.
Prohibits sale and possession of undetectable firearms manufactured using three dimensional printing technology.
Allows installation of solar arrays by municipalities on preserved open space in certain circumstances.
Allows New Jersey gross income taxpayers to elect to deduct certain losses from certain investment arrangements discovered to be criminally fraudulent.
Authorizes, by court order, furnishing of tax records or files, or information contained therein, for criminal investigations or prosecutions of non-tax crimes.
Concerns exclusion of individuals with certain employment history in advertisements for job vacancies.

Requires school districts to ensure that certain student information stored on an electronic data processing system is backed up daily, and that teachers have access to the information for at least150 days.
Establishes special parking for hybrid, electric, and alternative fuel vehicles.
Increases penalties for certain alteration of an automobile's computer and establishes penalty for resulting death or injury.
Provides for licensure of dementia care homes by DOH.
Excludes certain conveyances of graves, crypts and niches from 15% fee charged by cemetery company.
Clarifies statutory exemptions from mandatory immunizations for students.
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics, and federally qualified health centers.
"New Jersey Long-Term Care Oversight Act."
Concerns environmental permits in low-income, minority communities.
Requires medical examination and submission of student work portfolios for home-schooled children; provides that children under supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Permits attending advanced practice nurse to determine cause of death and execute death certification of patient if nurse is patient's primary caregiver.
Requires for-profit hospitals to report certain information to DOH.
Permits water and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings.
Clarifies deadline to request mail-in ballot application.
Allows gross income tax deduction for 50% of contributions of $100 or more to domestic violence shelters.
Requires DHS to make list of drugs with "black box" warnings accessible through its website.
Concerns hospital asset transformation program.
Requires party bidding on, or performing, a State contract to provide employee health care benefits.
"Revised State Medical Examiner Act"; establishes Office of the Chief State Medical Examiner in DOH.
Increases additional penalty assessment for drunk driving; dedicates revenue to VCCB.
Establishes and enhances certain insurance fraud prevention measures.
Clarifies the effective date of the "New Jersey False Claims Act."
Establishes "Rutgers, The State University Study Commission."
Establishes process for county colleges to offer baccalaureate degree nursing programs.
Makes various changes to current system for approval, issuance, administration, and discontinuance of various types of special license plates.
Removes statutory authority of DOH and Board of Medical Examiners over medical standards governing declarations of death upon the basis of neurological criteria.
Requires newborn infant screening for tongue tie.
Requires registered qualifying patient's authorized use of medical marijuana to be considered equivalent to use of any other prescribed medication.
Provides premium assistance to certain small employers who purchase health benefits plans; appropriates $10 million.
Establishes certain requirements, including allowable fees, for provision of medical records to patients, legally authorized representatives, and authorized third parties.
Requires coverage of medication therapy management in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare.
"Parkinson's Disease Public Awareness and Education Act."
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology without a license and prohibits certain unlicensed employees of nonprofit community agencies from using title of psychologist.
Clarifies that insurance broker transparency requirement only applies to sale of health benefits plans.
Requires certain health care facilities to offer, and health care workers to receive, annual influenza vaccination.
Establishes permanent sterile syringe access program; appropriates $95,000.
Establishes Medication Management, Outreach and Support Program in DHS; appropriates $8 million.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million for grants to certain nursing schools to address shortage of nursing faculty.
"New Jersey Public Water Supply Fluoridation Act."
Prohibits substitution of prescribed epilepsy drugs by pharmacists without prior notification to and written consent of physician and patient.
Requires newly licensed registered professional nurse to attain baccalaureate degree in nursing within 10 years of initial licensure.
Establishes minimum registered professional nurse staffing standards for hospitals and ambulatory surgery facilities and certain DHS facilities.
Revises requirements for licensure and creates physician-delegated scope of practice for physician assistants.
Makes technical corrections to individual health coverage and small employer health benefits programs and to NJ FamilyCare.
Revises "Local Bond Law" provisions to exempt certain energy projects from appropriation requirement for five percent down payment.
Requires DHS to conduct follow-up study of former residents of North Princeton Developmental Center.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Prohibits bio-analytical laboratories from charging certain patients more than 115% of the applicable Medicare rate.
"Naturopathic Doctors Licensing Act."
Establishes Center for the Study of Health Care Billing Data.
Allows health maintenance organizations to include charity care assessments for purposes of meeting certain loss ratio requirements.
Clarifies that conversions of housing cooperatives into condominiums are subject to notice provisions of "The Planned Real Estate Development Full Disclosure Act."
Extends Medical Malpractice Liability Insurance Premium Assistance Fund and collection of annual surcharges for five years.
Revises procedure for issuance of amended birth certificate for person who has undergone change in sex.
Permits health care providers to report certain patient health problems to MVC.
Expands the means to obtain a protective order for a minor.
Appropriates $1,886,375 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund to NJ Historic Trust for grant to Proprietary House Association for historic preservation purposes.
Defines "mobile home park" as "multiple dwelling" for inspection purposes.
Concerns eligible municipalities under the urban transit hub credit.

Creates new taxable category of alcoholic beverages called flavored malt beverages, imposes separate rate of taxation on new category pursuant to alcoholic beverages tax and allocates associated revenue.
Authorizes creation of economic recovery districts; authorizes certain economic recovery district management corporations to issue bonds secured by incentive grants.
Provides Medicaid coverage for family planning services to individuals with incomes up to 200 percent of the federal poverty level.
Concerns availability of services and administrative requirements of federally qualified health centers.
Codifies in statute case law developed legal standards for establishing grandparent and sibling visitation with a child when visitation objected to by child's parent, guardian, or legal custodian.

Requires health insurers SHBP, SEHBP, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to provide coverage for ancillary medical services in connection with outpatient diagnostic screening and surgical intervention services.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Coordination Among Nonprofit Social Service Organizations.
Establishes public awareness campaign advising pregnant women and new parents of the benefits of breasfeeding.*
Provides for licensure of human milk banks.
Concerns victim's right to rape care advocate under certain circumstances.
Requires audits of managed care plan provider networks.
Exempts veterans' organizations from nonprofit corporation annual report filing fee.
Increases tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax rates to be on par with tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax; dedicates revenue for smoking and tobacco use cessation programs.
Supplemental appropriation of $50 million from General Fund to DHS for substance abuse treatment and prevention.
Appropriates $1,000,000 for outreach and enrollment activities in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare programs.
"New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database Act"; establishes New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database and arbitration process for reimbursing out-of-network health care providers.
Requires at least one State developmental center in each region of State; requires certain factors to be considered for transfer of residents between developmental centers.
Allows certain State agencies to sell Internet advertisements on agencies' websites as pilot program.*
Provides for Medicaid coverage and reimbursement for mental health services provided through telepsychiatry.
Expands definition of "public building" for purposes of the CDS distribution laws.
"Group Home Fire Safety Act."
Rescinds recommendation of the Task Force on the Closure of State Developmental Centers and creates new task force.
Provides for child custody arrangements with parenting time to include provisions for electronic communications between parent and child.
Establishes the "New Jersey Family Collaborative Law Act." *
Directs portion of Unclaimed Child Support Trust Fund be used to balance unpaid receivables of State agency responsible for disbursement of child support.
Prohibits person from serving as officer of more than two political campaign committees.
Changes when proof of veteran status is required for civil service examinations for certain veterans.
Provides procedure for suspension of county board of elections member charged with certain crimes.
Authorizes fine for failure to maintain certain vacant properties; requires out--of-state creditors to designate in-State representative.
Requires monitoring of prescriptions for human growth hormones.
Restricts health insurers from limiting access to pain medication.
Establishes Office of State Dental Director and New Jersey Oral Health Commission.**

Provides for designation of surrogates to make health care decisions for certain patients; establishes demonstration program for transition of isolated patients from inpatient care to post-acute care.
Appropriates $2 million in constitutionally dedicated CBT revenues for hazardous substance discharge remediation to DEP for White Swan Cleaners/Sun Cleaners Superfund site cleanup in Monmouth County.
Establishes pilot program in Edison Township requiring Attorney General to perform police internal affairs functions.
Establishes "Bleeding Disorders Treatment Fund."
Provides for review and consolidation of certain toll free telecommunications services maintained and operated by certain State and local entities.
Modifies interest rates and accrual of interest on certain unpaid water and sewer utility bills and delinquent municipal taxes, assessments, and other municipal liens and charges.
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption, and clarifies municipal planning or zoning authority, for certain development along commercial corridors in Highlands Region.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.
Provides certain immunities from spectator-based lawsuits arising from youth sports events.
Reduces number of rooms necessary for certain hotels constructed prior to 1920 to receive liquor license.
Upgrades penalties for drag racing.
Exempts police from jury duty.
Establishes mandatory penalties for committing burglary and theft during a state of emergency.
Requires police notification when driver's license is suspended.
Requires State park and forest restroom facilities to include an exclusive family restroom.
Prohibits smoking at State-owned beaches.
Establishes Medicaid Smart Card Pilot Program.
Authorizes State and local governments to enter into group purchasing agreement for advanced technology vehicles and alternative fueled vehicles.
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.
Permits installation of GPS navigation devices which do not obstruct a motor vehicle operator's vision.
Sets States mileage reimbursement rate at IRS rate for business use of automobile.
Exempts certain persons from HVACR licensing requirement; clarifies definition of heating, ventilating, air conditioning, and refrigeration.
Prohibits advertising of certain products to minors on websites; requires website operators to allow minors to delete posts.
Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research universities, colleges or research hospitals.
Requires BPU to mandate electric power supply reliability and prevent market manipulation by electric power suppliers.
Authorizes the court to issue restraining orders to defendants charged with a crime as a condition of release on bail.
Exempts certain surviving spouses and surviving civil union partners of certain disabled veterans from components of the realty transfer fee.
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
Prohibits plea bargaining and eliminates sentence reduction in weapons cases involving minors.
Establishes employment goals and requirements for development subsidies.
Concerning development subsidies and certain employment practices.
Requires repayment of development subsidies in certain cases of failure to meet job creation or retention requirements.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Requires full-day kindergarten in all school districts and establishes uniform age requirement for enrollment in kindergarten.
Modifies timeframe during which charter school applications are submitted to and approved by DOE.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to make payment to school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing upon adoption of resolution by municipal governing body.
Increases penalties for drunk driving with minor as passenger.

Establishes crimes of operating school bus with suspended or revoked driving privileges and being involved in accident causing bodily injury; permanently prohibits passenger and school bus CDL endorsements for persons convicted of those crimes.
Directs Attorney General to establish a criminal firearms recovery clearing house.
Requires DOT to issue guidance on certain aspects of red light camera pilot program.
Provides that any superintendent salary caps adopted by the commissioner will apply to charter school administrators.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers in certain fields to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in certain failing schools.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to recruit disadvantaged or minority men to teach in certain failing schools under alternate route program.
Removes limousine services from sales and use tax imposition.
Requires electric public utilities to provide electric circuit maps to municipalities every five years.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental Grants-in-Aid appropriation of $10 million to DCA for Lead Hazard Control Assistance Fund.**
Provides a gross income tax deduction for certain water supply and sewerage charges.
Allows a gross income tax credit to certain taxpayers for capital improvements made to principal residence.
Exempts sale of energy and utility service to manufacturing facilities from payment of sales and use tax.
Permits creation of local hire programs for public work contracts of political subdivisions.

Provides additional State school aid to, and increases tax levy growth limitation for, certain school districts experiencing significant increase in tuition costs, appropriates $1,719,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE.
Permits sale of raw milk under certain conditions and establishes raw milk permit program.
Prohibits use of body imaging scanners to screen passengers and airline crew members.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.
Revises law concerning the rights and responsibilities of motor vehicle franchisees and franchisors.
Allows Attorney General to prevent halfway house placement of murderers.
Creates the crime of victimization of a senior citizen or a person with a disability.
Clarifies that "entering" a public place for a drug deal is conduct included in C.2C:33-2.1.
Places temporary moratorium on use of eminent domain; creates Eminent Domain Study Commission to examine its use Statewide.
Requires certain persons licensed or appointed to inspect homes to pass criminal history background check.
Eliminates transfer inheritance taxes on brothers and sisters of a decedent.
Allows refundable gross income tax credit for certain unreimbursed hearing aid expenses.
Excludes certain federal employee retirement fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Allows persons affected by certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs to receive one year suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Upgrades offense of simple assault to aggravated assault when victim is employee of DHS and clearly engaged in duties conducting investigation.
Requires adult Work First New Jersey recipients to complete secondary education under certain circumstances and receive life skills training.
Requires DEP to conduct vibration analysis along routes for disposal of dredged material from Delaware River.
Permits a tax deduction under the New Jersey gross income tax for taxpayers who operate or maintain for their employees a licensed child care center or who have paid the cost of outside child care.
Concerns special needs trusts for persons with developmental disabilities.
Creates special fallen firefighter plates with proceeds to children of fallen firefighters.
Requires certain police vehicles to be equipped with cameras.
Establishes the "Superstorm Sandy Bill of Rights."
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Allows school district to teach about traditional winter celebrations, display holiday symbols on school property, and include musical selections with religious themes.
Concerns homeowners insurance coverage with respect to dogs harbored on insured property.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amounts under New Jersey estate tax in accordance with provisions of federal tax law.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for active duty members of United States Armed Forces, Reserve components thereof, and National Guard from New Jersey.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for maintenance of certain State memorials honoring war veterans.

Excludes from gross income under the gross income tax certain United States military compensation paid to members of units of the NJ National Guard and reserve components of the United States Armed Forces.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the NJ World War II Veterans' Memorial Fund.
Makes "Skinner's and Michelle's Law" violators subject to No Early Release Act sentencing guidelines.
Permits certain retired law enforcement officers to possess hollow nose ammunition.
Eliminates certain components of realty transfer fee.
Requires OAL to maintain Internet database summarizing all State rule-making actions.
Establishes mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for harming or threatening to harm animal owned or used by a law enforcement agency or a search and rescue dog.
Directs State Comptroller to identify and recommend certain programmatic budget reductions for certain State agencies, authorities, and instrumentalities.
Permits municipalities to contract with animal and humane societies which engage in animal foster care.
Excludes veteran disability compensation from income qualification limits under homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to Cold War veterans.
Authorizes property tax deferment for deployed military personnel.
Provides family leave insurance for certain first responders.
Directs DOT to establish roadside accident memorial program.
Extends Right to Farm Act protections to commercial beekeepers, with some restrictions.
Establishes cruelly restraining a dog as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.
Establishes process for recovering cost of caring for animals involved in animal cruelty violations.
Expresses additional rationale for existing statutory prohibition of self-service dispensing of motor fuel at service stations.
Allows judge to admit evidence of prior sexual offenses in current sexual offense actions.

Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in urban enterprise zone program; allow zone funds to pay for storm related recovery costs for five years.
Designates New Jersey Route 47 from Wildwood City to Maurice River Township as "Veterans Memorial Highway at Delsea Drive."
Authorizes mayors to veto proposed actions of municipal authorities.
Requires issuance of construction permits for installation of wheelchair ramps on residential real property within 5 business days of application. *
Provides fair standards for elections and recall of officers for homeowners' associations.
Makes disabled persons receiving disability payments pursuant to federal Railroad Retirement Act eligible to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Requires DCA to establish training and certification program and arbitration standards for new home warranty arbitrators and publish a "New Home Buyer's Bill of Rights."
Allows for a gross income tax deduction for any honorably discharged member of the US Armed Forces, reserve unit or national guard.
Establishes penalty for failure to include bittering agent in antifreeze.
Establishes farmland preservation inheritance tax deduction program within Department of Agriculture.

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.
Requires debt collectors, in certain circumstances, to cease debt collections against certain victims of identity theft.
Authorizes party to a final divorce judgment or judgment for the dissolution of a civil union to request name change without notifying opposing party.
Concerns the recording of mortgages.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to establish the "Senior Citizen Home Repair and Modification Program"; appropriates $10 million.
Revises certain procedures for real property tax appeals.
Concerns street light outage reporting.*
Requires any State entity administering State or federal public benefit programs to verify recipient's personal information against death records to prevent payment to deceased individual.
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years based on cost analysis.
Establishes "State Vehicle Reduction Task Force."
Creates State contract set-aside program for businesses owned and operated by disabled veterans.
Revises animal fighting laws; establishes minimum penalty for criminal animal cruelty offenses; establishes additional penalties for animal cruelty offenses.

Revises animal cruelty offenses and penalties concerning animal abandonment and failure to report injuring certain animals with a motor vehicle; increases civil penalties for certain other animal cruelty offenses.
Concerns recorded telephone messages.
Prohibits sending unsolicited advertising by text messaging, and requires companies offering text messaging services to allow customers to block all incoming and outgoing text messages.*
Requires State to enable applicants for State agency-issued permits to electronically track the progress and status of their permit application.
Concerns UEZ program funding to qualifying municipalities.
Reinstates sick leave injury program for State corrections officers and juvenile justice officers under certain circumstances.
Reinstates State sick leave injury program for State employees who are members of PFRS or SPRS.
Provides for one-time increase of PFRS retiree annual pensions under $32,000.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees from 11 to 13 members.
Concerns time frames for establishing or enforcing property rights related to adverse possession.
Authorizes court to order submission of DNA evidence to national database to determine whether the evidence matches a known individual or a DNA profile from an unsolved crime.*
Requires notice prior to lapse of life insurance policy due to nonpayment of premium.
"Common Interest Community Manager Licensing Act."
Prohibits incarcerated individuals from receiving Medicaid, Work First New Jersey, or Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits.
Requires DHS to approve providers that serve persons with developmental disabilities in all areas of State.
Designates four State songs.

Authorizes AOC to assess, collect, and pay service charges and costs for electronic payment of fees and other obligations owed courts; prohibits defendants from using debit cards for bail and penalty payments for certain crimes.
Prohibits certain individuals from membership on county boards of elections.
Requires civil service desk audit of provisional employees after layoff action by local employer.
Increases pension benefits for certain retirees in certain municipal retirement systems.

Modifies laws regarding compensation and leaves of absence for certain public employees who served in the military; requires public employers to follow certain policies and procedures for leaves of absence.*
Establishes moratorium on hydraulic fracturing for purpose of natural gas exploration or production until certain federal laws are changed.
Establishes Rail Passenger Bill of Rights and authorizes Division of Consumer Affairs to enforce provisions.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for certain energy products and services used for consumption at certain manufacturing facilities.
Increases length of time in which to file certain lien claim forms under "Construction Lien Law."
Prohibits motor carrier transportation contract from indemnifying promisee against liability for loss or damage in certain instances.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support autism programs.
Prohibits unsolicited telemarketing sales calls to commercial mobile service devices.
Requires law enforcement officer to verify vehicle registration with MVC before issuing summons for violation of red light camera.
Requires health insurance carriers to use standard explanation of benefits form.
Prohibits use of anti-concurrent causation clauses in homeowners insurance policies.
Prohibits law enforcement officer from arresting student for violation of school policy under certain circumstances.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees.
Eliminates requirement that notice of elections list polling place locations; requires notice include Division of Elections Internet site providing polling place locations.

Permits board of chosen freeholders to change title to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner"; requires county that changes terms to update website.
Increases income eligibility limit for reduction or abatement of municipal or county utility authority fees.
Requires notaries public to be U.S. citizens and mandates notaries public under certain circumstances to advertise information to public regarding limitations on their scope of authority.
Requires DHSS to study relationship between autism and ultrasounds and issue protocol for use of ultrasounds.
Permits ambulatory care facility to deduct Medicaid payments when calculating gross receipts assessment.
Permits ambulatory care facility to deduct up to $125,000 in Medicare reimbursements when calculating gross receipts assessment.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.
Expands ability of the court to order payment of attorney fees and costs by parties who file frivolous lawsuits.
Requires informational posters about safe placement alternatives for newborn infants be posted in public restrooms used by females.
Makes homeowners' association in which developer's control of executive board has not been surrendered a public body under "Senator Byron M. Baer Open Public Meetings Act."
Eliminates exception to public advertising and bidding requirements for certain public contracts involving insurance coverage and consulting services.
Requires certain common areas and facilities of assisted living facilities to be generator ready; provides related tax relief.
Prohibits sale of food and beverage packaging and containers made with bisphenol A.
Prohibits sale of mercury batteries and consumer products that use mercury batteries; prohibits disposal of used mercury batteries as solid waste.
Enhances the reporting and disclosure requirements concerning State tax expenditures and limits the duration of new State tax expenditure enactments.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for attendance at New Jersey county colleges.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Establishes N.J. Historical Commission program for preservation and promotion of graves of significant individuals of the American Revolutionary period; appropriates $200,000.
Expands programs in BPU to include low-interest loans and grants to municipalities for energy efficient programs and innovative energy technologies.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Establishes offense of advertising commercial sexual abuse of minor.
Provides for time period during which complaints may be filed for certain motor vehicle violations.
Requires that sexual abuse against a child be reported to law enforcement officials.
Prohibits payment of temporary disability benefits to incarcerated individuals.
Requires BPU financial incentives for photovoltaic equipment for residences that are Energy Star compliant receive preferred treatment.
Concerns low emission and zero emission vehicles; establishes Clean Vehicle Task Force.
Requires NJ Environmental Infrastructure Financing Program to give additional weight in ranking system to projects including green or blue roof.
Requires adoption of certain rules and regulations by DCA and DEP concerning blue roofs and green roofs.
Requires construction of new buildings, facilities, and structures using State, EDA, or NJ Schools Development Authority funds to include green or blue roofs.
Requires certain State departments, divisions, commissions, and authorities to consider use of green or blue roof in construction of certain new State buildings, facilities, and structures.
Requires appointments for safety-related recalls on vehicles to be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis.
Requires paint producers to implement or participate in paint stewardship program.*
Establishes minimum and maximum sentences and penalties for election officers and employees convicted of fraud.
Allows gross income tax deduction for first $200,000 earned by certain new physicians and dentists in first seven taxable years of practice in NJ.
Authorizes issuance of "municipal solid waste disposal only" license to certain applicants.

Requires Commissioner of Transportation to publish notice of certain transportation-related infrastructure projects and activities on Internet website, and directs State Comptroller to monitor publication of those notifications.
Requires applicants for liquor licenses and license transfers to notify residents within 200 feet of licensed premises.
Establishes a 500 foot drug free zone around child care centers.
Establishes identification cards for persons without permanent residence.
Requires correctional facilities to submit voting rights information packets to inmates.
Prohibits certain sales of alcoholic beverages within 1,000 feet of schools or religious institutions.
Establishes judicial presumption in favor of10 percent bail option in lieu of a bail bond issued by licensed surety for repeat criminal offenders.
Requires minimum level of police staffing based on municipal population and violent crime rate.
Requires State Comptroller to perform compliance audit to verify municipal implementation of corrective action plan following performance audit.
Protects certain politically active employees from retaliatory action by employers.
Makes residential mortgage fraud a separate crime.
Provides foreclosure forbearance for certain residential borrowers and exempts certain lenders that offer sustainable mortgage modifications.
Exempts sales to homeowner assistance and recovery programs from realty transfer fees.
The "New Homebuyers' Bill of Rights Act."
Enhances protections afforded purchasers in planned real estate developments.
Strengthens State construction code.
Prohibits employment discrimination based on applicant employment status.
Concerns repayment of unemployment compensation overpayments.
Requires written security plan when school is polling place and open to students; provides that schools may be used as polling places only under certain circumstances; makes an appropriation.
Requires school bus safety instruction in all school districts which provide pupil transportation.
Prohibits the sale of jewelry containing phthalates.
Establishes 30-day grace period for consumer to cancel contract for telephone or cable service.
Provides exemption to renewal requirement for identification cards and placards issued to persons with certain disability.
Prohibits posting, publishing on the Internet, or disclosing certain information regarding law enforcement officers.*
Allows consumers to return vehicles for full repayment under the lemon law.
Increases the penalty for committing robbery against Turnpike Authority employee; upgrades offense of simple assault to aggravated assault when victim is employee of Turnpike Authority.
Revises definition of volunteer first aid, rescue, and ambulance squad under New Jersey Highway Traffic Safety Act of 1987.
Clarifies that members of volunteer first aid squads that bill third parties do not lose right to use emergency warning lights.
Transfers all probation functions and employees to Bureau of Probation in State Parole Board.
Provides grants to eligible businesses equal to 5 percent of annual base salary of new employees hired under employment grant component of Invest in New Jersey Business Grant Program.
Provides tax credit against gross income tax for cost of certain property that conserves energy or promotes energy efficiency and for other energy efficiency measures.
Requires certain CATV companies to make CATV service available throughout residential areas of municipality within specified number of years after CATV company first provides service to municipality.
Requires Division of Rate Counsel to evaluate NJT fare increases and determine whether increases are necessary and fair to NJT customers.
Requires telephone companies regulated by BPU to mail certain service discontinuance notices via certified, return receipt requested.
Requires movie theaters to install captioning technology for use by hearing impaired patrons.
Requires municipal agency under MLUL to notify prospective applicant of potential need for additional governmental approvals.
Establishes circumstances under which municipalities may base development approval, the timing thereof, or denial, on sufficiency of local transportation infrastructure.
Clarifies power of municipalities to zone for separation of incompatible land uses through specification of reasonable separation limitations.
Requires retail store operators to establish in-store recycling programs that provide opportunities for customers to return clean plastic carryout bags.
Amends "State Transfer of Development Rights Act," and provides for impact fees and other incentives for establishment of transfer of development rights programs.
Requires Governor's annual budget message to include certain contract information.
Provides certain individuals, businesses or other organizations performing public contracts are prohibited from making certain contributions.
Restricts campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations that purchase or acquire property involved in eminent domain proceedings.
Prohibits political contributions by county and municipal political party committees to other committees; increases certain penalties.
Requires disclosure of information about contributions and expenditures for candidates for elective public office, or for public questions, by publicly traded corporations doing business in State.
Requires any candidate convicted of crimes or offenses to return campaign contributions to donors; freezes most campaign funds of candidates indicted for crimes or offenses.
Creates a directory of registered telemarketers.
Provides additional penalties for violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1997)" involving certain persons.
Requires contractors to provide Department of the Treasury with employment information about contracts with public bodies.
Provides corporation business tax credit and allows gross income tax deduction for purchase and installation of electric vehicle charging stations.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of compressed natural gas vehicles.
Increases renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements under "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Makes certain repeat offenders ineligible for parole.
Prohibits certain unsolicited checks.
Repeals State moratorium prohibiting taking of horseshoe crabs from State waters.
Increases maximum municipal contribution to fire districts and volunteer fire companies; indexes amount biennially for inflation.
Designates certain interchanges of Garden State Parkway in honor of Melvin M. Loftus and Christopher Meyer.*
Requires Site Improvement Advisory Board to offer recommendations to encourage sustainable development.
