Imposes water consumption and diversion user fees to fund open space and farmland preservation projects.
"The Opportunity to Compete Act;" establishes certain employment rights for persons with criminal histories.
Directs New Jersey Economic Development Authority and Secretary of Higher Education to promote the establishment of higher education and business partnerships.
Revises certain procedures for municipal redevelopment programs; prohibits certain campaign contributions by redevelopers.
Authorizes issuance of special emergency notes to finance special emergency appropriations for payment of current year property assessment appeal refunds over three years.
Provides corporation business tax incentives for life sciences research.
Allows gross income tax deductions for certain contributions to NJBEST college tuition savings program.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for qualified investment in certain biotechnology businesses.
Requires DHSS to review standard of care at health care facilities in which 40% or more of direct patient care nursing staff are temporary hires.
Requires, after assessment, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem.
Requires, after study, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem, and requires DEP to adopt nutrient standards for NJ marine waters.
Authorizes Ocean County Planning Board and municipal planning boards in Ocean County to take certain measures to control stormwater runoff and nonpoint source pollution in Barnegat Bay watershed.
Establishes online portal for acceptance of donations to certain funds to which contributions may be made on gross income tax returns.

Authorizes the State, with prior approval by the State House Commission, to use eminent domain power to acquire lands for recreation and conservation purposes provided lands are protective of drinking water sources.
Establishes notification, signage, and monitoring requirements related to combined sewer overflows.
Eliminates exemption from noise control restrictions for certain bars in Atlantic City Tourism District.*
Provides for notice to schools of court-ordered domestic violence restraints restricting contact in schools; increases penalty for violation of such orders.
Directs public utilities and pipeline operators to reimburse municipalities for certain emergency services.
Requires State Board of Education regulations regarding school nurse certification to include certain minimum eligibility requirements.
Clarifies that first aid, ambulance or rescue squads, as entities, have immunity from civil damages in certain circumstances.
Requires contracting units and boards of education to credit contractors with interest earned on certain funds withheld from payment to contractors.
Requires DOT and DEP to conduct study on options to alleviate congestion on Route 47.
Requires person convicted of criminal sexual contact with person with intellectual disability to register under Megan's Law.
Authorizes special Distinguished Flying Cross license plates.
Establishes recreational fishing license plate; dedicates fees to coastal fishing research.
Establishes the "Mortgage Assistance Pilot Program."
Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.

Authorizes municipalities to facilitate private financing of water conservation, storm shelter construction, and flood and hurricane resistance projects through the use of voluntary special assessments.*
Establishes the Renewable Energy Infrastructure and Advanced Technology Vehicle Task Force.
Repeals law providing CAFRA permit exemption for certain grading or excavation of a dune.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits and approvals for development related to drilling for oil and natural gas off NJ coast.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain tolls paid via E-ZPass.
Criminalizes fourth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Requires each municipality to establish a Reverse 9-1-1 system.
Regulates sale of certain bicycles with quick release wheels.
Allows business tax credit to employers giving paid leave to employees for service with volunteer emergency services organizations under corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Requires employers and health care providers to disseminate information regarding certain leave and benefits.
Requires municipality to post sign on property subject of development application.
Requires DOC to transfer certain payments of restitution to Victims of Crime Compensation Office.
Requires preservation of certain biological evidence.
Authorizes Victims of Crime Compensation Office to make payment for relocation expenses of certain witnesses of crimes.
Provides that crime victims do not have to pay fees to obtain records relating to the crime and that requests for such records are not public information.*

Requires suspension of payment for unused sick or vacation leave payable to person indicted for criminal offense; requires forfeiture of such payment upon service deemed dishonorable or conviction for crime.
Revises laws concerning traffic control signals and traffic control signal monitoring systems.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
Requires Attorney General to provide certain information regarding certain charitable organizations to public on Internet.
Commences payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt real property owned by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

Requires governmental affairs agents retained by government entities to file certain reports with ELEC; requires certain government entities retaining governmental affairs agents to file annual reports with ELEC.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.
Transfers probation employees from Judiciary to State Parole Board.
Requires State Board of Medical Examiners to conduct international criminal history background checks and check employer references for licensees.
Enhances penalty for tampering with evidence after fleeing the scene of an accident resulting in death.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
Establishes aid program for certain municipalities with State correctional facilities.
Revises procedures for the use of eminent domain and compensation for loss of business in municipal redevelopment programs.

"Family Home Occupation Act;" classifies certain home-occupations as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing or retailing activities.
Provides that records of convictions for carjacking and promoting prostitution of a child shall not be expunged.
Provides for a mandatory minimum term for assaulting a law enforcement officer.
"New Jersey Housing Assistance for Veterans Act," establishes pilot program to assist certain veterans with housing modification and rehabilitation; appropriates $5 million.
Enacts the "NJ Family First Employer Act"; establishes award for certain employers.
Requires court to issue animal protection order against person found guilty of abusing an animal.
Requires municipal court to hear certain violations of animal cruelty statutes within 14 days of the summons date.
Immunizes employers from civil liability for certain disclosures regarding employees and former employees.
Authorizes the AG or the Commissioner of DOLWD to obtain expedited injunction for violations of law requiring prenotification of certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs.
Concerns free access to certain job training courses for employees affected by plant closings, mass layoffs or transfer of operations.
Regulates certain activities of religious corporations operating cemeteries.
"Economic Opportunity Act of 2014, Part 3."
Increases the State earned income tax credit from 20 percent to 25 percent of the federal earned income tax credit over two taxable years.
Grants immunity from civil liability to persons reporting information concerning crimes related to terrorism.
Abolishes Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission, transfers bridges to NJ DOT and Penn DOT, removes tolls.
Mandates basic training for certain newly-appointed entry-level firefighters and supervisory training for full-time firefighters promoted to certain positions.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to victims injured in September 11th and 1993 World Trade Center attacks.
Clarifies that using motor vehicle to publicly display obscene material is fourth degree crime.
Requires impact statement for any proposed regulation affecting volunteer ambulance squads and fire companies.
Requires hiring preference for veterans seeking position with State Police.
Allows adopted person or other authorized requester access to original birth certificate under certain circumstances.
Revises and expands duties and responsibilities of State Auditor in performance of certain audits and reviews.
Prohibits bad faith assertion of patent infringement.
Provides for attachment of real property relating to terrorism.
Creates procedure for destruction of all records pertaining to juveniles who are arrested but subsequently not charged with delinquency.
Requires DOH to establish carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide air quality standards and certification requirements for ice arenas.
Establishes DOT roadside memorial program for fallen police officers, sheriff's officers, EMS workers, and firefighters; designated as "Patrolman Joseph Wargo's Law."*
Grants certain leaves of absence for Vietnam Veterans of America conventions.
Allows certain members of PFRS to serve until age 70 upon approval by municipal governing body.
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
Designates State Highway Route No. 71 bridge between Borough of Belmar and Borough of Avon-by-the-Sea as "Robert A. Briant, Sr. Memorial Bridge."
Permits inclusion of volunteer firefighters and other emergency responders within municipal eligible employee group for purposes of the small employer health benefits plan statutes.
Provides for early termination of terms of office for certain appointed municipal court positions when two or more municipalities enter into agreements to establish joint or shared municipal courts.
Requires telemarketers making sales calls to display their name and telephone number on any caller identification service.
Provides for appointment of certain municipal court judges at the local or county level.
"Licensed Wildlife Rehabilitator Act;" establishes licensure requirements for wildlife rehabilitators.
"Wildlife Rehabilitation Act"; establishes Wildlife Rehabilitation Board and continuing education requirements and permit program for wildlife rehabilitators.

Requires immediate forfeiture of public office, position or employment, without application by the prosecutor, for public officials and employees convicted under federal law of certain public corruption offenses.
Upgrades theft to a crime of the first degree if amount involved is $500,000 or more.
Provides for dismissal of certain traffic summonses if repairs are made within 72 hours.
Prohibits administration of standardized assessments not required under State or federal law.
Exempts sales of county property from certain requirements under certain circumstances.

Requires public school districts to provide an annual, in-school community service opportunity for high school pupils; requires DOE to include community service statistics in annual school report card.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program.
Establishes guidelines for creditworthiness determinations concerning affordable housing programs.
Provides awarding of contracts for professional services by State, county, municipal, and school district through competitive contracting process.
Requires spousal consent to election of certain pension payout options under TPAF, JRS and PERS.
Reinstates automatic COLA for retirement benefits of members of the State-administered retirement systems.
Amends eligibility for expungement of criminal records.
Provides that Probation Division would file child support judgement as a lien only when amount of judgement equals or exceeds amount of child support due for a one-month period.
Deletes requirement for certain cable television companies to fund "CATV Universal Access Fund."
Requires certain electric public utilities to file emergency response plan with Board of Public Utilities.
Establishes "Police Officer, Firefighter, Public School Teacher, Corrections Officer, and Sanitation Worker Home-buyer Assistance Act."; appropriates $5 million.*
Requires a public school district to provide a daily recess period for students in grades kindergarten through 5.
Increases minimum wage for tipped workers.
Requires voter approval at the annual school election or by the board of school estimate prior to the establishment of a charter school.
Authorizes State constitutional convention to reform system of property taxation; makes appropriation.
Establishes that payment plan for motor vehicle surcharges is mandatory upon request; extends payment period.
Increases the gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates revenue from tax rate increase for direct real property tax relief for taxpayers.
Requires certain public contracts for insurance coverage and consulting services to be awarded through competitive contracting process.
Debars permanently from government contracting any person convicted of certain crimes involving government contracts.
Changes date for election of fire commissioners from third Saturday in February to day of primary election.

Establishes new procedure to fill congressional vacancies by election; eliminates special election option; requires congressional vacancy be filled on general election day; requires Governor to make appointment from same party to temporarily fill Senate vacancy.
Prohibits investment of certain public funds in companies doing business in countries that sponsor terrorism.
Limits non-debt service portion of sewerage and utilities authority charge or fee increases to no more than two percent over previous year.
Clarifies law authorizing application of reciprocal limitations against businesses from states that give in-state preference in awarding public contracts.
Designates May of each year "Military Appreciation Month" in New Jersey.
Revises licensing requirements and procedures under the "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act."
Modernizes business filing statutes to include entity conversion and domestication.
Requires certain health care facilities and operators of certain transient dwellings to maintain agreements for bedbug eradication services.
The "New Jersey Bleacher Safety Act."
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Requires State to offer surplus State police vehicles to certain volunteer fire and emergency service organizations.
Prohibits certain agencies from establishing checkpoints limited to specific vehicle types.*
Provides for special Bronze Star license plates.
Establishes designated driver motor vehicle license plates.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Extends Class Two special law enforcement training for time deployed.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.
Authorizes municipalities to contract with appropriately trained municipal firefighters to provide paramedic services.
Gives priority in training programs to long-term unemployed.
Provides for withholding of State payments to vendors for delinquent unemployment and disability taxes and charging administrative fees to the vendors.*
Requires carbon monoxide detectors in school buildings.
Establishes prescription drug donation repository program.
Requires housing authority to advertise when applications are being accepted for housing assistance waiting lists on its Internet website or webpage.
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Establishes School Asthma Protocol Task Force.
Allows security officer applicant to demonstrate rehabilitation if previously convicted of crime.
Prohibits smoking in certain outdoor public places.
Requires counseling for certain domestic violence offenders.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Child Support Reform.
Upgrades assault on victims who are disabled.
Provides for mandatory life imprisonment for sexual assault upon a minor.
Concerns payment of homestead property tax reimbursement as credit on property tax bill.
Regulates deed procurement services.
Regulates smoking in multiple dwellings; requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to promulgate construction standards for new multiple dwellings permitting smoking.

Requires tenant notification and documentation on landlord registration form whenever rental premises is adjudicated to have caused constructive eviction because of mold presence; requires Department of Community Affairs to maintain registry.
Establishes gross income tax credit for full-time tuition cost at certain New Jersey institutions of post-secondary education.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Provides for philosophical exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Makes various changes in the charter school program in regard to student enrollment procedures, charter revocation, and monitoring of charter schools.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.
Enhances penalties upon corporate violators of housing codes.

"Home-Based Jobs Creation Act"; classifies certain home businesses as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing, or retailing activities.
Allows certain emergency squad volunteers holding municipal elective office to vote on emergency squad concerns.
Authorizes appointment of part-time county tax administrators.
Authorizes public financing of primary election campaigns to fill gubernatorial vacancy and general election campaigns to fill vacancy in offices of Governor and Lieutenant Governor.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Appropriates $22,463,000 in 2003 bond act monies for loans to fund dam restoration projects.*
Restricts placement of inmates in certain housing units of State correctional facilities.
Establishes NJ Water Supply and Pharmaceutical Product Study Commission.
Provides for awarding of certain costs to defendants who prevail in DEP enforcement actions.
Authorizes business entities to designate representatives in court proceedings without the necessity for representation by an attorney.
Requires shore municipalities accepting government funds for storm-damaged beach replenishment to provide free beach access and public toilet facilities.
Revises application and issuance procedures for employment certificates for minors.
Requires minimum water usage charge to be applied per dwelling unit in multi-family dwelling.
Establishes public-private partnership for certain transportation projects; requires 10% of public-private partnership projects to be set aside for small businesses.
Supplemental appropriation of $2,200,000 to Maritime Industry Fund in Office of Maritime Resources in DOT.
Provides counties and municipalities with additional discretion when leasing public land for agricultural or horticultural use.
Requires State agencies to review operations and to implement use of Internet to conduct public business when cost savings may be realized, with certain exceptions.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson in the Division of Consumer Affairs.
Prohibits retail motor fuel dealer from charging a credit card customer in excess of four percent above the purchase price for same fuel sold to customer paying by cash.
Changes priorities for financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
Changes priorities for financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund.
Allows veteran or personal representative to withdraw honorable discharge papers from county clerk.
Grants credit against business taxes to developer of rental housing reserved for occupancy by veterans.
Limits motor vehicle rental companies vehicle license cost recovery fee to good-faith estimate of actual costs; requires company to annually adjust fee to reflect actual costs.
Creates New Jersey Cold War medal.
Enables collection of voluntary contributions for New Jersey Nonprofit Veterans Organizations through gross income tax returns.
Imposes a two-year moratorium on increases in public utility rates.
Permits juveniles to be admitted to drug court program under certain circumstances.
Excludes certain district boards of election poll workers from employee wage withholding and coverage under UI, TDI, and family disability leave insurance programs.
Requires school districts to allow home-schooled students to participate in school-sponsored extracurricular activities in the student's resident district.
Establishes special license plates for veterans.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Permits DCA to nominate a municipality as a qualified municipality for purposes of NJ Redevelopment Authority program participation.
Requires MVC to immediately suspend driver's license of alleged drunk drivers who cause a death.
Adds "significant bodily injury" to assault by auto or vessel statute; upgrades penalties for inflicting serious bodily injury.
David's Law; establishes crime of negligent vehicular homicide.
Repeals the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote."
Requires Mandated Health Benefits Advisory Commission to study financial impact of all enacted mandated health benefits.
Authorizes Sunday bow hunting on federal military installations and William J. Hughes Technical Center.*
Clarifies local government unit obligations with regard to DEP loan awards for dam repairs.
Provides supplemental enrollment growth aid to districts that experienced significant enrollment growth; appropriates $21,881,000 to DOE.
Requires electric public utilities to conduct vegetation management adjacent to service lines on certain real properties.
Permits students made homeless by act of terrorism or natural disaster to attend tuition-free the school district in which they resided prior to being homeless for two school years after the event.
Establishes a loan redemption program for public school teachers who meet certain academic requirements and teach Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics subjects or special education.
Permits alternate members of county planning boards to vote in place of any absent public member.
Reduces thresholds for certain heroin offenses.
Requires State Auditor review of certain Department of Corrections privatization contracts.
Authorizes special Support Our Veterans license plate with proceeds supporting New Jersey homeless veteran's centers.

Extends limit for nonpublic school busing to 30 miles in Atlantic, Burlington, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Hunterdon, Ocean, Salem, Sussex, and Warren Counties, and requires existing bus stops to be used.
Requires school districts to employ a certain number of student assistance coordinators based on district enrollment.
"Transparency in Government Act"; provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Establishes driving privilege cards for New Jersey residents who cannot prove lawful presence in United States.
Upgrades penalty for unlawful possession of certain firearms on grounds of an educational institution.
Provides that possession of air or spring gun for an unlawful purpose is a crime of the third degree.
Extends exemption from charitable immunity for certain civil actions to persons of any age who are beneficiaries of the nonprofit corporation.
Regulates teen nights by requiring security provided by police officers, prohibiting persons under age 15 from attending, and disqualifying registered sex offenders from employment.
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Conforms Megan's law to requirements of federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act.
Permits municipalities to recover certain costs and fees from alcoholic beverage licensees charged with violations.
Establishes Sex Offender Management Commission; amends Megan's Law in response to federal Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006.
Establishes requirements for pharmacists to dispense biological products.*
Provides a plan to rebalance State resources to provide community services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities.
Concerns cigarette manufacturers and production of certain tobacco products using roll-your-own tobacco machines at retail establishments within this State.
Permits municipal court to order certain offenders to perform community service in lieu of payment of penalty.
Eliminates statute of limitations for kidnapping and increases statute of limitations for other serious crimes to 10 years.
Designates September 11 each year "September 11 Remembrance Day" in New Jersey.
Requires local governments and school boards in SHBP/SEHBP to certify savings based on three bids from non-SHBP/SEHBP plans before continuing SHBP/SEHBP in new collective negotiations agreements.
Requires all personal audio players distributed in New Jersey to contain warning about volume and hearing loss.
Clarifies application of business personal property tax on local exchange telephone companies that were subject to tax as of April 1, 1997.
Creates Office of Clean Energy in BPU.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax.
Requires hotels to upgrade phone systems to allow guests to dial 9-1-1 without first dialing any other digit.
Prohibits certain employment actions against employees affected by a declared state of emergency.
Permits juror donation of statutory juror compensation to Legal Services of New Jersey through AOC; provides for payment of State matching funds, equal to juror donation amount, to same organization.
Requires prior written authorization for third-party charges to be placed on cellular telephone bills.
Revises statutes concerning incorporation and governance of the Protestant Episcopal Church to remove gender-specific references.
Clarifies procedures for resignation, removal, and succession of fiduciaries.
Clarifies procedures for restoration of driver's license after suspension; authorizes the court to waive imprisonment under certain circumstances.
Adds two employees to the boards of trustees of the State colleges and the county colleges.
Adds two student representatives to board of governors of Rutgers University.

"Disaster Information Access Act"; requires utility service providers to report severe weather and emergency related service interruptions; directs utility service providers and State Office of Emergency Management to present reported information online and by telephone.
Imposes certain restrictions on sale of products containing dextromethorphan.
Includes reverse rate evasion as form of insurance fraud and provides for civil and criminal penalties.
Establishes task force to study issues related to the establishment of full-day kindergarten.
Directs BPU to study whether State's electric distribution system meets certain standards.
Requires electric distribution lines be located underground in areas affected by severe weather or natural disasters.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Borough of Seaside Heights.
Repeals requirement for general hospitals and State psychiatric hospitals to hold annual public meetings.
Caps noneconomic damages in medical malpractice actions at $250,000.
Provides for no net loss of DEP lands for fishing, hunting, and trapping purposes.
Allows for exclusion of certain properties from Highlands preservation area.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning conflicts between rules of different State agencies.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses providing employment to certain National Guard or reservists.
Authorizes creation of urban enterprise zones in Garfield, Harrison and Keansburg as well as a joint urban enterprise zone in Cliffside Park and Fairview.
Requires an annual State debt affordability analysis be included in the State Debt Report.
Provides that committing a sex act with a minor constitutes sexual assault against the minor under certain circumstances.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Establishes New Jersey General Accounting Office.
Expands registration requirements under Megan's Law to include persons committing human trafficking crimes or engaging in prostitution, when crimes involve minors.
Allows jurors to designate donation of their jury duty fees to various charitable funds.
Establishes a Medical Malpractice Court.
Permits boards of education to convey certain school property to nonprofit senior citizen organizations for nominal consideration.
Provides for full State funding of the special education costs of students who reside in resource family homes.
Requires veterinarians to provide written prescriptions and certain notifications.
Exempts storage facility space furnished to active duty military personnel from sales and use tax.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Utility Sub-metering.
Creates a civil "rape shield" law for certain civil suits.
Requires issuance of one free copy of a veteran's death certificate to certain authorized persons upon request.
Exempts certain New Jersey teachers' purchase of qualified teaching materials from sales and use tax.
Requires certain official State forms to contain the language oath or affirmation and swear to or affirm when the forms are reprinted.
Provides additional State school aid to certain districts with expenditures below districts' adequacy threshold.
Requires payment of certain attorney's fees, expenses and costs in identity theft cases; adds debit card numbers to definition of "personal identifying information".
Prohibits certain drunk driver claims against licensed alcoholic beverage servers.
Allows identity theft victims to petition for judicial determination of factual innocence.
Requires school districts to provide information to high school students on cancers of the reproductive system as part of the health curriculum.
Recognizes American Sign Language as a world language for meeting high school graduation requirements.
Requires Department of Education to encourage boards of education to offer instruction in media literacy.
Requires school districts and child care centers to distribute information on Megan's Law and instructions on how to access the Megan's Law sex offender registry website.
Requires school districts to notify DOE whenever law enforcement is called to respond to incident occurring at school.
Permits sealing of certain criminal records.
Prohibits State Board of Education from limiting number of certain two-year college credits that may be applied towards meeting teacher certification requirements.
Imposes tax on certain State lottery winnings to finance grant program for not-for-profit entities operating after school programs in certain districts.
Provides mandatory minimum terms and fines for persons who travel to another municipality and sell or purchase controlled dangerous substances there.
Revises the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Establishes a partial return to work TDI program.
Requires lowest possible price not exceeding certain cap for inmate telephone calls.*
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.
Establishes publicly accessible domestic violence Internet registry.

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions, earnings, and qualified distributions associated with special needs trusts.
Makes various changes to the "Law Against Discrimination."
Creates annual inspection cycle for certain hotels and motels under "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."

Establishes presumption of grandfathering of certain governing documents of homeowners' associations upon conflict with new statutory or regulatory provisions unless majority of members vote to amend.
Requires emergency action plans for delivery of oxygen to patient residences during public health emergency.
Creates matching grant program for small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Creates "New Jersey Life Sciences Internship Challenge" program.

Appropriates $250,000 from societal benefits charge revenues for grants to community colleges and vocational schools to create training programs on electric, compressed natural gas, and liquefied petroleum vehicle conversions.
Requires assisted living residences and comprehensive personal care homes to ensure connection of emergency cords in residential units to facility staff.
Provides for $5 million grant program encouraging compressed natural gas fueling stations and electric charging stations.
Creates offense of impairing communications, which would constitute domestic violence in certain circumstances.
Modifies tax levy apportionment methodology in certain school districts; restricts authority for certain municipalities to enter long-term tax exemption agreements.
Directs installation of electric vehicle charging stations at service areas on State's toll roads.
Revises process for awarding certain public contracts in connection with an emergency.
Establishes "Energy Infrastructure Study Commission."

Lowers age of eligibility for surviving spouse under homestead property tax reimbursement program; extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Creates grant program for newly established small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Provides PFRS member in federal or State military service who is injured or killed with disability or death benefits.
Extends county-based real property assessment pilot program to Atlantic County. *
Creates the option to make a voluntary contribution for the support of local libraries on gross income tax returns.
Requires State plan for expenditure of Superstorm Sandy federal aid contain certain provisions for equitable and transparent distribution of aid.
Allows individual appointed as State monitor to remain employed for more than two years without cancellation of retirement benefits.
Provides for establishment and operation of casino at Meadowlands Complex and Monmouth Park racetrack.
Removes expiration of required payment by public employees of percentage of cost of health care coverage provided by public employers.

Expands statute authorizing temporary restraining orders for certain alleged stalking victims to include victims of any age or mental capacity.
Requires use of goods made in the United States for public contracts; requires disclosures by businesses that receive public contracts or development assistance.**

"Military Dependents Scholarship Fund Act"; provides college scholarships to the spouses and children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, or Operation New Dawn.
Requires each State agency to review permits issued by the agency and make necessary changes to expedite and facilitate permitting.
Establishes permanent police and fire interest arbitration cap.
Imposes time constraints on submission and analysis of rape kits.
Establishes Become A Nurse license plates and dedicates fees for nursing scholarships.
Requires nursing homes to provide training to staff in behavioral health issues.
Supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,560,000 for anti-tobacco programs.
Provides for coverage of comprehensive tobacco cessation benefits in Medicaid.
Prohibits the use of simulated government documents in advertising.
Requires that school districts use a model contract developed by the Commissioner of Education when employing a superintendent of schools.

Includes limitations on amount of retirement compensation which may be provided by a school board in the employment contracts of superintendents of schools, assistant superintendents of schools, and school business administrators.
Clarifies school district employees subject to statutory provisions concerning supplemental compensation for unused sick leave and vacation carry forward requirements.
Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2014.
Authorizes criminal background checks for au pairs and nannies.
Decreases the penalty for certain parole violations.
Establishes system of graduated parole violation sanctions.
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under legal drinking age.

Permits voter registration up to 14 days before election.

Mandates that certain personnel critical to certain State finance and revenue generating activities are essential employees during a declared State government shutdown due to failure to enact an annual appropriation act.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in hedge funds and derivative contracts.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.
Requires aftercare treatment program as part of community supervision.

Provides tax relief through three refundable tax credits under the gross income tax, for homestead property taxpayers, renters and working poor.
Establishes Menhaden Personal Use and Limited Sale License, and permits use of certain gear for taking of menhaden.
Establishes Medicaid demonstration project to cover room and board services for certain terminally ill patients in the home or other non-institutional setting.

Concerns permits, letters of exemption, and enforcement with regard to agricultural activities under "Freshwater Wetlands Protection Act".
Concerns leases of publicly-owned land for agricultural or horticultural use.
The "Smart Container Act."
Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in the urban enterprise zone program.
Requires electric or gas public utilities to apply residential rates and charges to any business heated or cooled by residential heating or cooling system.
Prohibits certain unsolicited political calls by political organizations or candidates to persons in this State.

Requires charter schools to annually submit to Commissioner of Education salary and benefit information for certain employees.

Requires DCA to post on its website information about inspection reports for residential health care facilities, boarding homes, and emergency shelters for the homeless, and requires notifications to DHS and counties.*

Establishes measures to deter steroid use among students; appropriates $45,000 to DOE for New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association testing of student-athletes for steroids and other performance enhancing substances.*
Requires hepatitis B to be considered a priority under "Eliminating Health Disparities Initiative."
Clarifies that electronic funds transfers are included within the scope of the statute concerning issuing or passing bad checks.

Permits new cigar bar or cigar lounge to be opened under certain circumstances.

Increases motor fuels tax five cents per year for three years.
Provides that civil actions concerning home improvement contracts for residential or non-commercial property may be brought in the county where the property is located.

Imposes a wholesale sales and use tax rate on tobacco products, imposes tax on electronic cigarettes and similar nicotine delivery products, changes tax base, and requires licenses to conduct business in tobacco products.*

Creates an integrated State medical examiner system by increasing the authority of the State Medical Examiner regarding forensic investigations, establishing regional medical examiner offices, and eliminating the county medical examiner system.
Revises certain laws governing police and fire interest arbitration; extends two-percent cap on base salary awards.
Establishes additional requirements, and penalties for failure to comply, concerning information to be provided to persons purchasing cats or dogs from pet shops. *
Requires mandatory registration of family child care providers; requires family child care providers to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Requires victims of the criminally insane to be notified upon release, escape, or transfer of offender from mental health facility.

Concerns proof of workers' compensation coverage with certain legally required annual reports of employers.

Requires that if a school district satisfies 80% or more of the required NJ Quality Single Accountability Continuum standards in an area of district effectiveness under State intervention, the State must return that area to local control.
Legalizes possession and personal use of small amounts of marijuana for persons age 21 and over.

"Pet Groomers Licensing Act;" designated as "Bijou's Law."

Provides for conscientious exemption to mandatory immunizations.

The "Toxic-free Beverage Containers Act."

Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.

Abigail's Law; requires that newly-manufactured school buses be equipped with sensors.

Appropriates $33,785,208,000 in State funds and $17,323,048,000 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2015-2016. *

Revises exemption from "unemployment compensation law" for operators of certain motor vehicles.

"Uniform Trust Code."

Provides for use of directed trust to administer particular assets separate from other assets placed in trust; clarifies duty to inform between co-fiduciaries concerning administration of trusts and other governing instruments.

Removes statutory requirement that health officers and registered environmental health specialists employed by municipalities receive maximum salary within their range within five years from date of appointment.

Permits rehiring of certain law enforcement officers who were terminated for reasons of the economy.

Requires chairs of certain ward political party committees to have same rights and responsibilities as chairs of municipal political party committees; specifies certain cities not required to have municipal chairs.
Allows certain military service members convicted of certain crimes to vote while serving sentence, or on parole or probation.
Revises motor fuel tax to rate based on 7% of retail price of unleaded regular gasoline and provides gross income tax deduction for certain taxes paid on motor fuel.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to $50 million.

Requires PANYNJ to use certain products manufactured in US.

Increases loss ratio reporting and disclosure requirements for carriers offering individual and group health insurance plans; applies loss ratio requirement to large group health insurance plans.

Requires certain undergraduate students to file degree plan and requires public institutions of higher education to develop pathway systems to graduation.

Eliminates voter registration and in-district residency requirements for certain petition circulators; eliminates in-district residency requirement for petition circulators for partisan primary nominations; establishes petition circulator criteria. *

Clarifies that defendants are to be credited for pre-sentence jail time directly attributable to specific offense for which sentence is imposed.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.

Requires school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to local law enforcement.
Requires board of education to enter into agreement with law enforcement authorities regarding access to live video streams of public school buildings.

Increases State contract sum eligible for payment and performance bond waiver to not more than $300,000; provides for CPI inflation adjustment every four years.
Requires certain parking garages to have on-site emergency vehicle capable of accessing low-clearance areas.

Reauthorizes use of regional contribution agreements between municipalities within a 10-mile radius of each other for special needs housing; permits units transferred to be counted toward recipient municipality's fair share obligation.

Allows elected officials who retire based on other PERS service to remain in office; prohibits retirees newly elected to municipal office from receiving pension credit, health care or salary for that office.

Establishes procedures for governing bodies of municipalities or voters to opt to move annual fire district elections to November and eliminates vote on fire district budgets, except for proposals to raise revenue above levy cap.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses paying a salary differential to National Guard members or reservists on active duty.
Establishes program certifying certain broadcast station personnel to undertake certain actions during emergencies.

Authorizes Secretary of Higher Education to impose a fine against an institution of higher education that fails to appropriately respond to a student's allegation of sexual assault by another student.
Allows reemployment by school district of TPAF retiree as coach of athletic activity when compensation is under $10,000.
Requires food and ingredients to be labeled with FDA approval status.
Requires retail food stores to notify consumers of certain recalled food products.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain employers engaged in farming operations.

Requires DCA to establish procedures for inspection and abatement of mold hazards in residential buildings and school facilities, and certification programs for mold inspectors and mold hazard abatement workers.
Establishes time periods for adverse possession of certain property.
Authorizes proportional property tax exemption for honorably discharged veterans having a service-connected permanent disability.
Authorizes hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Allows military personnel and veterans to present certain identifying documents in lieu of municipal beach tags to gain admission to certain beaches.
Requires any POW-MIA flag purchased with State funds be manufactured in United States.
Establishes task force to study issues facing returning members of the United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard and make recommendations on how State should address issues.
Exempts individuals with certain types of military service from certain professional and occupational fees and continuing education requirements.
Exempts veterans' organizations from motor vehicle registration fee.
Creates housing purchase matching grant program for members of United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations.
Requires MVC to provide Gold Star Family decals to certain family members of armed services members who died while on active duty.
Requires elevators in new buildings be at least a certain size.
Creates Education Reform Review Task Force; delays certain uses of certain assessments and certain changes to teacher evaluation system.

Permits a child whose parent or guardian is ordered into active military service to remain enrolled in the school district where the child's parent or guardian resided prior to active military service.
Exempts nursing mothers from jury duty.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide coverage for behavioral health care services when determined medically necessary by physician or psychologist.
Requires necessary services and supports to be provided to former residents of developmental centers transitioning to community placements.*
Transportation Sustainability Procurement Program Act.

Requires State Board of Education to adopt standards and benchmarks of performance for the improvement of teacher preparation programs and teacher certification candidates who complete the programs, and develop a program rating system.
Provides that beginning with the 2016-2017 grade nine class, Advanced Placement computer science course may satisfy a part of the mathematics credits required for high school graduation.*
Authorizes gun violence restraining orders and firearm seizure warrants.
Revises "Accountancy Act of 1997."
Prohibits insurers from setting prices for non-covered dental services.
Requires Secretary of Higher Education to adopt new comprehensive master plan within six months and every seven years thereafter.
"Comprehensive Regulated Grease Recycling Act."
Permits Newark to use rental car tax proceeds over three-year period to help reduce its "cash deficit for preceding year" appropriation and operational deficit.
Provides that deed restrictions on affordable housing units are not extinguished by foreclosure proceedings.
Exempts school district employees in certain counties from requirement to reside in State as pilot project; requires DOE report.

Extends in Highlands Region, and establishes in certain transfer of development rights sending zones, special appraisal process for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs; and revises calculation of market value of lands in sending zones.

Permits fifth and sixth class counties to assume control and responsibility for operation and maintenance of beaches bordering Atlantic Ocean unless control and responsibility are reserved by a municipality.
Clarifies liability for discharges of hazardous substances from drilling platforms that enter NJ waters.
Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in the event of the borrower's death.
Prohibits manufacture, sale, or installation of counterfeit or nonfunctional air bags in motor vehicles.*
Establishes Statewide Assessment Review Task Force.
Extends economic recovery term under "Municipal Rehabilitation and Economic Recovery Act."
Prohibits manufacture, sale or promotion of personal care products containing microbeads.*
Clarifies that certain drunk driving offenders who drive with suspended driver's license are guilty of fourth degree crime.
Requires certain health benefits plans to provide coverage for behavioral health care services.*
Increases transparency and accountability at PANYNJ.
Permits independent contractors to provide cosmetology and hairstyling services or ancillary services,
Requires PANYNJ be subject to NY Freedom of Information Law and NJ open public records act.
Authorizes seizure and impoundment of a dog believed to have attacked, severely injured, or killed another domestic animal.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts and higher education institutions.
Establishes "Right to Try Act" permitting terminally ill patients to access investigational drugs and treatment.
Establishes pilot project to permit certain overseas and military voters to vote in certain elections using Internet; makes an appropriation.
Requires disclosure of breach of security of online account.
Prohibits cloud computing service providers from disclosing data collected from public, private, or charter school.
Requires DHS to develop or purchase electronic health record system for use by certain agencies providing services to individuals with developmental disabilities.
Requires Medicaid coverage for diabetes self-management education, training, services, and equiopment for patients diagnosed with diabetes, gestational diabetes, and pre-diabetes.*
Permits county correctional facilities to annually use 10 percent of inmate welfare fund to offset costs of certain medical services.
Authorizes special "We Support the Arts" license plates with proceeds to New Jersey State Council on the Arts.
Establishes tiered-preference system for purchase of agricultural products by school districts.
Requires written contract between customers and third-party electric power and gas suppliers.
Allows State residents who are outside of New Jersey to place wagers on horse races using account wagering system.
Allows person with allergy to drugs or medications to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.
Imposes moratorium on DHS transitions and transfers of residents of State developmental centers until certain conditions are met.
Concerns telemarketing political calls.
Extends authority to appoint Class Two special law enforcement officers to perform court security duties to all county sheriffs.
Authorizes youth camps to maintain supply of epinephrine and permit trained employees to administer epinephrine to camp members suffering from anaphylaxis.
Establishes "County Tourism Incentive Grant Fund" within Department of Treasury to provide funding for grants to counties to support tourism advertising and promotion.
Prohibits escrow agent evaluation services from charging escrow agents fees.
Establishes a fixed term for Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director of PANYNJ; requires approval from Governors of New Jersey and New York prior to employment of directors.
Requires bi-state transportation authorities to make advance notification of certain projects or operations expected to impede traffic.
Establishes new crime of official interference with transportation.
Establishes "Bi-State Commission to Recommend Reforms to the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey."
Requires State Comptroller to receive and provide certain independent authority employee information on State Comptroller's website.
Establishes various good governance requirements at State and local authorities.
Establishes various good governance requirements at certain bi-state authorities.
"Nikhil's Law"; requires MVC to inform and test drivers on dangers of failing to comply with traffic safety laws and "STOP for Nikhil Safety Pledge."
The "Commercial Identity and Likeness Protection Act"; concerns certain unauthorized commercial uses of a person's identity or likeness.
Authorizes special Combat Action Badge license plate program.
Concerns occupational safety and health for public employees of certain interstate authorities.
Allows nonimmigrant alien students who have applied for a green card to qualify for in-State tuition at public institutions of higher education.
Requires release of bid list prior to bid date under "Local Public Contracts Law."
Allows public contractors paying benefits under collective bargaining agreements to count benefit costs toward compliance with local "living wage" ordinances.
Makes revisions to the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Ends the estate tax and raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $350,000.
Revises the "Self-Funded Multiple Employer Welfare Arrangement Regulation Act."
"School Children First Act"; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires principal consent for teacher placement; eliminates certain seniority rights.
Allows counties and municipalities to use open space trust funds for remediation of collapsed mine shafts and sinkholes on property owned by county or municipality.

Authorizes the EDA to issue additional $50,000,000 in bonds to provide grants for certain county vocational school district facilities projects and increases debt service district aid percentage for such projects.
Requires New Jersey School Report Card to include indicators of student career readiness.
Requires preparation programs for teachers and school counselors to include programming to improve student career readiness. *

Allows school districts and requires public colleges to enter into dual enrollment agreements to provide college-level instruction to high school students through courses offered on college or high school campuses.*
Provides that if a career and technical education program of a school district is taught in an industry setting, off-site location will be exempt from certain State regulations.*
Establishes four-year County Vocational School District Partnership Grant Program in DOE.
Provides additional State school aid to county vocational school districts in which enrollment increases by more than 10%.
Provides State aid for certain adult education programs.
Requires DHS to use and update NJ Elder Index and related data to the extent possible.*
Permits certain motor vehicle offenders to apply for a restricted use license.
Clarifies that records custodians are not subject to penalties under State's open public records law if due diligence is exercised.

Abolishes Landscape Irrigation Contractors Examining Board in the Department of Environmental Protection and transfers regulation of landscape irrigation contractors to Department of Community Affairs.
Eliminates consumer data collection requirements for certain gift cards.
Designates U.S. Route 22 bridge, Easton-Phillipsburg Toll Bridge, as "Sergeant William John Cahir Memorial Bridge."
Authorizes issuance of restraining orders for situations in which domestic violence statutes do not apply.
Exempts certain persons from licensing requirements of the "New Jersey Residential Mortgage Lending Act."
Provides for drug testing of certain recipients of Work First New Jersey program benefits.
Designates May of each year "Military Appreciation Month" in New Jersey.
Establishes trunk fighting as animal cruelty offense and crime of the third degree.
Modifies education requirement for licensure by the NJ State Board of Cosmetology and Hairstyling.

"Drew's Law"; allows counties and municipalities to establish, or request DOT to establish, 15 miles per hour speed limit in or near certain parks and to set increased penalty for violating speed limit.*
Enhances penalties imposed on drivers who have never been issued a driver's license.

Requires teachers of health and physical education in grades kindergarten through six in public schools to possess the appropriate endorsement to the instructional certificate, and includes a "grandfather" provision.
Reinstates transportation planning district for Meadowlands District.
Expands WC coverage to parking areas provided by employer.
"Mainland Memoriam Act"; directs MVC to create graduated driver's license informational material to be distributed by motor vehicle dealers.
Imposes moratorium on Returning Home New Jersey initiative and prohibits transfers from out-of-State placements under certain conditions.
Partially repeals prohibitions against sports wagering at racetracks and casinos in New Jersey.
Increases monetary amounts for transfer of estate assets without administration and for exemption from debts of the deceased.*
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Concerns registration of contractors and sets criteria for responsible bidders in public work.
Authorizes snow removal from covered fire hydrants and locator pole installation.
Establishes pilot project to permit voters in military service on active duty overseas, and their eligible family members, to vote in certain elections using the Internet; makes appropriation.*
Requires DMVA to encourage and facilitate returning service members' registration with VA. *
Expands exceptions to minimum age requirement for operating a boat to include nontidal waters.
Prohibits sale of certain laser pointers that exceed certain power output.
Revises definition of "necessary care" in the State's animal cruelty law to include more specific requirements.
Modifies certain fees charged by, and requirements imposed on, check casher licensees.
Requires certain notifications and free credit reports for customers following breach of security of personal information within business or public entity.
Imposes a one-year fifteen percent surcharge on Corporation Business Tax liabilities.

Raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $1,000,000 to 10.75 percent for a temporary three-year-period and restores the State earned income tax credit to 25 percent of the federal credit.
Extends application period for certain urban hope projects and permits reconstructed facilities as part of projects.**
Requires State to pay its pension contributions quarterly on July 15, October 15, January 15 and April 15.
Establishes certain requirements for use of physical restraint on students with disabilities in school districts and approved private schools for students with disabilities.
Directs that jury service shall extend for one day or one trial if selected to serve on a trial.
Adjusts and clarifies certain State tax compliance standards and restricts certain State tax benefits.

Credits increases in employee contributions required by P.L.2011, c.78 as additional contributions to TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS, and SPRS unavailable to reduce normal contributions of State and local employers for actuarial valuations beginning July 1, 2015.
Provides two elected members of pension commission of closed Hudson County Employers' Pension Fund may be active or retired county employees.

Revises criminal history record check procedures for school personnel to provide for communication of post-employment federal criminal record information received through participation in federal rap back program to Commissioner of Education.
Requires hospitals implement Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection prevention programs in all units except inpatient psychiatric units.
Restricts bail for persons charged with violent crimes; establishes bail alternatives for non-violent offenders.
Directs MVC to establish permit and safety requirements for companies that use online application program to match passengers with drivers.
Designates cheerleading as interscholastic sport; requires safety harness at health clubs with members who are cheerleaders.
Reinserts in FY 2015 Appropriations Act language that was omitted due to a technical problem.
Directs Governor to withdraw from compact establishing Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor; dissolves compact and commission; transfers commission's NJ operations to State Police.
Prohibits pharmacies from charging additional fee for processing prescriptions transmitted by telephone or electronic means.
Establishes Division of State Museum in Department of State; continues New Jersey State Museum within division; abolishes museum board of trustees.
Authorizes special Alpha Kappa Alpha license plate.
Exempts guide dogs and service dogs temporarily placed in foster homes from dog licensing and registration tag requirements.*
Amends definition of "Class II renewable energy."
Permits municipalities to reject proposed off-track wagering facility; removes five-year tax exemption, abatement, or payment in-lieu-of taxes for off-track wagering facilities.
Requires Medicaid managed care organizations to meet certain conditions prior to reducing reimbursement rates for personal care assistant services and home-based supportive care services.

Imposes 66 percent tax on gross gaming revenue from wagering at Meadowlands Complex casino; provides distribution to State General Fund, CRDA, and Hackensack Meadowlands Tax Sharing Stabilization Fund.
Requires 10 percent bail premium unless lesser amount approved by court; authorizes installment payments.
Creates fourth degree crime for certain actions concerning bail and incarcerated individuals; requires license revocation of bail agents and agencies in certain circumstances.
Requires county correctional facilities to implement written policies relating to bail agents and inmates; directs Attorney General to develop uniform guidelines.
Requires photographic identification cards for bail agents.
Establishes crime of operating as bail agent without license.
Codifies and increases fees for licensing and renewal of bail-bond agents.
Transfers authority to regulate bail agents to DLPS; establishes Bail Agent Enforcement Unit.
Revises individual cause of action under consumer fraud act.
Allows insurer to obtain certificates of ownership or salvage certificates of title for motor vehicles under certain circumstances.
Requires property tax bills to contain eligibility information on State tax relief programs.
Criminalizes bestiality.
Requires State oversight of budgets of joint meetings.
Lifts moratorium on new Business Employment Incentive Program grant awards and establishes "New Jersey Business Employment Incentive Program Task Force."
Revises requirements and training standards for first responders under New Jersey Highway Traffic Safety Act of 1987.
Provides that retired justices and judges collecting pension or retirement allowance are eligible for recall duties until 85 years of age.
Regulates pharmacy benefits managers and requires certain disclosures concerning multiple source generic drug pricing.
Establishes penalty for destruction of man-made native bee hive.
Designates Common Eastern Bumble Bee as New Jersey State Native Pollinator.
Increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount for the New Jersey estate tax to $5 million over period of five years.
Requires DHS to develop specific criteria for eligibility of individuals with developmental disabilities for services from adult day health services facilities.

Imposes oversight, cost analysis, and fee requirements for State contracts; includes State contract performance in conscientious employee protection act; limits to three years all State contracts; requires certain disclosures on State contracts.
Expands authority of emergency management departments in requesting assistance outside normal territorial jurisdictions.
Permits transmittal of certain land use documents via email.
Sets forth certain standards to be followed by law enforcement agencies and fire departments when utilizing drones.
Prohibits business receiving State development subsidies from making certain campaign contributions.
Revises laws concerning access to medical marijuana.
Authorizes installation of automatic standby generators in certain residences without zoning or planning board approval.
Revises and clarifies prohibition on certain practices of motor vehicle franchisors with respect to sales promotion plans and incentives.
Requires public utility to reimburse business customer during period when business ceases operations due to utility repairing or replacing its equipment on business customer's property.
Requires fire suppression systems in new single and two family homes.
Requires school districts, nonpublic schools, and institutions of higher education to report allegations of sexual assault to law enforcement.
Limits certain unused sick leave pay and vacation leave carry-forward for school and local employees; limits sick leave use by new public employees before retirement.
Modifies various aspects of charter school program, including authorization, regulation, and monitoring; appropriates $250,000 to DOE for expenses of charter school authorizing board.
Provides certain emergency workers with certain parking privileges.
Designates State Highway Route 17 in Waldwick Borough as "Christopher Goodell Memorial Highway."
Establishes Office of River Maintenance in DEP; repeals P.L.1993, c.376 concerning stream cleaning activities.
Establishes procedure for licensure of timeshare salespersons.
Permits municipalities to designate newly-appointed tax assessors as professional service contractors.
Prohibits State from disclosing New Jersey driver's license holders' personal information to other states seeking to issue speed camera or red light camera citations.*
Prohibits release of home addresses of certain public safety employees by governmental entities.
Provides discounted hunting and trapping license, permit, and stamp fees for senior citizens.
Requires Secretary of State to establish secure Internet website for online voter registration; authorizes use of digitized signatures from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission's database.
Establishes guardianship monitoring program in Office of the Public Guardian for Elderly Adults.
Expands military leave benefits for certain public officers and employees subject to proof of service.*

Requires telephone utility to temporarily suspend local exchange telephone service for up to six continuous months when requested by residential customer; allows customer to keep telephone number when resuming service.
Concerns location of workers' compensation hearings.
Provides for licensure of chiropractic assistants.

Requires DOC to make reports containing information concerning treatment and reentry initiative participation; requires AOC to establish program that collects recidivism data and make reports concerning adults sentenced to period of probation.*Requires DOC to make reports containing information concerning treatment and reentry initiative participation; requires AOC to establish program that collects recidivism data and make reports concerning adults sentenced to period of probation.*
Establishes compensation program for certain injured probation officers.
Transfers immunity from civil liability for certain healthcare providers to other healthcare providers in certain circumstances.
Provides for Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare coverage and reimbursement for health care services provided through telemedicine.
Requires health insurance carriers, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide coverage for telemedicine.
Requires certain employers to plan and implement traffic reduction programs for employees.
Requires State to include distributed energy resource in certain new State buildings and consider retrofitting certain existing State buildings with distributed energy resource.*
Prohibits law enforcement agencies from considering number of arrests made and citations issued when evaluating police officer's professional performance.
Dedicates $140,000 of revenue from motor vehicle violations to DHS for brain injury services.
Prohibits existing child care subsidy recipient from being treated as a new applicant for subsidy after moving to a new county of residence.
Requires institutions of higher education to offer cats and dogs no longer used for educational, research, or scientific purposes to animal rescue organizations for adoption.
Expands and clarifies definition of gang criminality.
Authorizes free fishing licenses for persons with disabilities.
Permits municipalities to establish weapons free zones around schools and public facilities.
Requires institutions of higher education to develop open textbooks available to students at no charge and requires buyback of used textbooks at 50 percent of purchase price.
Implements recommendations of SCI report concerning bail bond industry.
Establishes a small business job creation and preservation account program to incentivize small business workforce expansion in New Jersey with income tax exclusions for interest.
Expands the Address Confidentiality Program to include victims of sexual assault and stalking.
Authorizes court to include in domestic violence restraining orders a provision making the order applicable to a pregnant victim's child upon birth of the child.
Prohibits awarding alimony to domestic violence offenders; permits termination of alimony based on conviction for crime or offense involving domestic violence.
Requires local governments and authorities to obtain financing cost estimate required to be provided by NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust for certain projects.
Requires successful completion of firearms education program to obtain initial firearms purchaser identification card and permit to purchase a handgun.
Requires corporations qualifying for certain State development subsidy grants to repay entire grant amount if corporation fails to uphold grant terms.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide victims of sexual assault with contact information for sexual assault crisis services.*
Requires institutions of higher education to post information on sexual assaults on website and provide the information to prospective students.
Allows certain students including undocumented immigrants who meet certain criteria to qualify for State student financial aid programs.
Requires notification of local law enforcement prior to expungement of certain mental health records of prospective firearms purchasers.
Prohibits award of State contracts and development subsidies to inverted domestic corporations.*
Eliminates requirement that public-private partnership agreements for construction of certain higher education facilities be submitted to EDA for review and approval by certain dates.
Eliminates DOT approval of municipal traffic calming measures in business districts.
Requires local unit approval of applications for participation in federal 1033 program.
Requires AG oversight of transfer of federal surplus military equipment to local law enforcement agencies; establishes review and reporting requirement.
Requires health care practitioners to inform patients of addiction potential of controlled dangerous substances prior to issuing prescription.

Requires review of Core Curriculum Content Standards to ensure guidence for substance abuse instruction provided to public school students incorporates most recent evidence-based standards and practices.*
Makes FY 2015 supplemental appropriation to DHS for $5 million for substance abuse prevention, and requires substance abuse prevention programs to be evidence-based.
Codifies "Project Medicine Drop" program; requires Division of Consumer Affairs to maintain secure prescription medicine drop-off receptacles at certain law enforcement agencies.*
Requires pharmacies and prescribers to notify patients about how to ensure proper and safe disposal of unused prescription drugs.

Directs poison control and drug information program to establish clearinghouse of drug overdose information, report on trends, and provide education on safe storage and disposal of medications; appropriates $500,000.
Authorizes Attorney General to coordinate Statewide law enforcement efforts against opioid drug abuse.*
Requires Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services to annually prepare substance use treatment provider performance report, and make available to public.*
Increases Medicaid reimbursement rates for certain evidence-based behavioral health services.
Provides for licensure of ambulatory care facilities to provide integrated primary care services including behavioral health care.
Establishes remote medical consultation assistance grant program in DOH.
Directs certain four-year public institutions of higher education to establish substance abuse recovery housing program.
Extends "Overdose Prevention Act" immunity provisions to certain professionals and professional entities, and permits needle exchange programs to obtain standing order for opioid antidote.*

Requires establishment of processes to identify Medicaid eligible incarcerated individuals who are awaiting pre-trial release determinations, are being released following period of incarceration, or are undergoing inpatient hospital treatment.*
Requires DHS and DOC to formulate joint arrangement and plan to ensure provision of mental health and substance use disorder services to inmates.*
Permits successful completion of special probation drug court program notwithstanding use od medication-assisted treatment.*

"New Jersey Sexual Assault Violence in Education Act"; requires institutions of higher education to adopt anti-sexual assault theater program, report allegations of sexual assault to county prosecutor, and provide students with information on sexual assaults.

Establishes Special Needs Work-for-Housing Pilot Program within Department of Human Services to provide certain individuals with supportive housing in exchange for work activity or alternative work experience.
Permits pharmacists to offer customers purchasing prescription drugs discounts and rebates.
Transfers New Jersey State Forestry Services and related entities to Department of Agriculture.
Prohibits snowplow operators from depositing snow in front of certain access points used by persons with disabilities.
Establishes limited duration homestead property tax reimbursement.
Provides for the removal of a State Board of Education member for failure to attend three consecutive board meetings without good cause.
Establishes veterans' preference for affordable housing in certain housing projects.
Requires pupil transportation for certain kindergarten students attending enrichment programs.
Permits county clerk or register of deeds and mortgages to create Gold Star Parent identification card.
Permits registered voters to receive mail-in ballots automatically for all elections under certain conditions.
Establishes crime-fraud exception to marital and civil union partnership privilege.*
Prohibits student's individualized education program or 504 plan to include use of physical restraints or seclusion.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare.
Allows gross income taxpayers to use their gross income tax returns to make voluntary contributions to ALS Association for services to New Jersey residents.
Prohibits corporations from qualifying for or maintaining State development subsidy grants if corporation qualifies as inverted domestic corporation.
Prohibits State administered pension fund investment in corporations shifting ownership or operations outside the U.S. for tax purposes.
Requires law enforcement officers to wear body cameras.
Establishes central registry for sickle cell trait diagnoses; provides for informational outreach and genetic counseling.
Amends and repeals sections of "Respiratory Care Practitioner Licensing Act."
Establishes New Jersey Council on Responsible Fatherhood and Responsible Fatherhood Fund.
Permits immediate expungement of court records when person is acquitted or discharged without conviction, or when charges have been dismissed.

Places five-year limit on State control of any school district; requires local control to be returned in any area of district effectiveness under State intervention for which district meets 80 percent or more of standards.
Allows corporations to indemnify corporate agents without approval from board of directors.
Phases out ambulatory care facility assessment over five years.
Increases statute of limitations for prosecution of theft of firearm.
Establishes crime-fraud exception applicable to marital and civil union partnership privilege.
Prohibits plea bargain if sex offender who committed Megan's Law offense would not be required to register.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $85,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DCA for consolidation study of certain school districts in Atlantic County.
