Establishes crime fraud exception applicable to marital and civil union partnership privilege; amends statutory law.
"Water Infrastructure Protection Act."
Eliminates language in FY 2015 appropriation act that restricts participation of certain institutions in the Tuition Aid Grant program.
Concerns DOLWD personnel access to unemployment claims receipt and processing system.
Requires UI employer contribution reports and remittances be submitted to the Division of Revenue.
Concerns stalking and related restraining order protections for adoptive children and their adoptive parents victimized by persons whose parental rights to the adoptive children have been terminated.
Revises definitions in Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor compact to clarify jurisdiction of commission.
Prohibits retrofitting diesel-powered vehicles to increase particulate emissions for the purpose of "coal rolling"; prohibits the practice of "coal rolling".
Prohibits contribution action against local public entity for cleanup and removal costs or any other damages associated with discharge of hazardous substances.
Increases electric power net metering capacity threshold to 2.9 percent of total annual kilowatt-hours sold in State.**
Requires DOT to incorporate objectives of "Global Warming Response Act" into annual transportation capital program.
Requires natural gas pipeline utilities to repair or replace leaking natural gas pipelines.
Establishes electronic lien and titling system for New Jersey motor vehicles.
Requires municipal land use plan element of master plan to address smart growth and storm resiliency, and environmental sustainability issues.

Requires each school district with middle school or high school to establish food services advisory committee to consider menu options that reflect students' cultural, traditional, and dietary preferences.
Requires public schools to weight courses in visual and performing arts equally with other courses worth same number of credits in calculating grade point average.
Requires State arts, historical, and cultural grant recipients to offer information on food and lodging in vicinity of event funded.
Provides county vocational school districts with the authority to name themselves in a manner that more accurately reflects their mission.
Directs BPU to require certain energy businesses to maintain recordings of telemarketing sales calls for three years.

Provides State Investment Council must report private money managers' fee information and that council's regulations addressing political contributions will apply to federal or national committees and non-State political committees.
Prohibits sale of powdered caffeine to minors.
Requires notification of member or retiree of State-administered retirement system under certain circumstances when member or retiree requests change in beneficiary for group life insurance.
Limits access to data recorded by motor vehicle recording devices.
Stipulates that retail motor fuel dealers shall not be responsible for certain fees associated with credit, debit and rewards cards.
Provides Medicaid coverage for advance care planning.
Prohibits sale of certain products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.*

"Disaster Victims Protection Act"; requires Governor to allocate federal and State disaster aid to municipalities in proportion to amount of catastrophic physical damage sustained within each municipality.
Designates five State songs.
Authorizes the establishment of federal impact aid reserve account.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the "NJBEST college savings program."
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to, or purchases of credits from, federally qualified tuition program.
Establishes NJ Innovation and Research Fellowship Program in DOWLD.
Revises population formula for issuance of certain plenary retail consumption licenses.
Establishes requirements for provision of energy from Class I renewable energy sources.*
Prohibits MVC from imposing duplicate license or identification card fee and digitized picture fee if duplicate is requested to reflect change in organ donor status.
Establishes licensure for steel construction contractors.
Permits group self-insurance plans for, and collective bargaining agreements improving the provision of, workers' compensation.
Imposes mandatory forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
"Shyanne's Law"; requires mental health counseling for all animal cruelty offenders.
Eliminates penalties for asset transfers up to $500 per month during look-back period for determining eligibility for Medicaid long-term care services.
Imposes $0.25 surcharge on alcoholic beverages to be dedicated to Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund.
Provides courts with sentencing discretion for certain convictions concerning possession of a firearm.
Requires earlier mandatory polling hours for school elections; requires discretionary additional polling hours be consistent with current primary and general elections.*

Streamlines responsibilities of Division of Local Government Services and local governments; designated as the Division of Local Government Services Modernization and Local Mandate Relief Act of 2015.*
Requires Adjutant General of DMVA to issue State flag to resident enrolling in federal service academy.
Imposes conditions on drivers approaching disabled vehicles displaying warning lights.
Requires that certain inmates with detainers be provided access to drug treatment programs.
Permits municipal redevelopers to receive tax credits under Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program for certain mixed use parking projects.**
Establishes the Task Force on Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease in DOH.
Partially repeals prohibitions, permits, licenses, and authorizations concerning wagers on professional, collegiate, or amateur sport contests or athletic events.
Creates cidery and meadery license.

Requires 9-1-1 service facilities be equipped with Next Generation 9-1-1 system and provides funding for that purpose; makes texting the 9-1-1 emergency system without purpose of reporting need for 9-1-1 service a fourth degree crime.
Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for a private citizen to use a tracking device to track another person without that person's consent.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.
Makes desecration of a military monument a crime of the third degree.
Requires BPU to provide links to pricing information to customers from electric and gas public utilities, and third-party electric power and gas suppliers.*
Requires BPU to establish procedures allowing electric power and gas supplier customers to switch energy suppliers.
Imposes contract standards between customers and third-party electric power and gas suppliers.
Establishes sheriff's officers reemployment lists.
Establishes home elevation fund and dedicates up to $5 million of realty transfer fee revenue annually for this purpose.
Prohibits award of State contracts and development subsidies to inverted domestic corporations.
Increases mandatory retirement age for Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and county prosecutors from 70 to 75.

Upgrades crime of stalking when stalking activity is carried out or assisted by installation or use of communication or location monitoring program or device on cellular phone or wireless mobile device.*
Prohibits bicycle riding on sidewalks with limited exceptions; requires bicycle operator yield to pedestrian.
Provides civil service preference to military service members who did not serve in theater of operation but received campaign or expedition medal.
Permits use of virtual instruction to meet minimum 180-day school year requirement under certain circumstances.
Makes all persons convicted of sexual assault subject to the No Early Release Act; specifies that any use of force elevates sexual assault to aggravated sexual assault.
Requires institutions of higher education to adopt affirmative consent standard and other policies regarding sexual assault, domestic violence, dating violence, and stalking.
Adds as additional aggravating factor in sentencing that the person committed an act of domestic violence in presence of a child under 16 years of age.
Requires law enforcement officers to search domestic violence restraining order registry upon conducting an arrest.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Domestic Violence and Abuse.
Concerns prompt payment of construction contracts.
"Tyler Banuls' Law"; provides protections for children with developmental disabilities receiving services from DCF.
Requires DOE to conduct study on options and benefits of instituting later school start time in middle school and high school.
Prohibits religious entities from engaging in certain practices involving cemeteries, funeral homes and mortuaries, memorials, mausoleums and burial vaults.
Increases personal needs allowance to at least $50 for low-income persons residing in certain facilities.
Establishes requirements for sale of alcoholic beverages for off-premise consumption by certain plenary retail distribution licensees and retail consumption licenses.
The "Full Marriage Recognition for Civil Union Couples Act"; recognizes certain civil unions as marriages dating back to inception of such civil unions.
Permits public-private partnership agreements for certain building and highway infrastructure projects; provides for EDA oversight.
Consolidates Meadowlands Commission and Sports and Exposition Authority; re-establishes Hackensack Meadowlands Transportation Planning District.
Establishes position of State Oceanographer.
Removes statutory limitation on number of permits that may be issued by Division of Fish and Wildlife for the taking of beaver.
Establishes four-year pilot program in Ocean County for electronic monitoring of certain domestic violence offenders; designated as "Lisa's Law"; appropriates $1 million.
Requires composting or recycling of food waste by large volume generators.
Authorizes State-chartered banks, savings banks, savings and loans, and credit unions to conduct certain savings account promotions.
Requires labeling of foods containing genetically engineered material.
Eliminates mortgage guaranty insurance coverage cap of 25% of outstanding balance of insured loan.
Prohibits purchase of certain items by scrap metal businesses.

Requires sober living homes and other substance abuse aftercare treatment facilities to provide certain notifications to next-of-kin when patient is released from care; designated as "Nick Rohdes' Law." *
Clarifies that piercing or tattooing animals constitutes needless mutilation and animal cruelty.
Providing for AG representation of employees of county prosecutors' offices in certain civil actions and providing for State indemnification in certain cases.
Requires Commissioner of DCA to promulgate rules and regulations providing for veterans' affordable housing assistance preference.*
"Boys & Girls Clubs Keystone Law"; permits minors to give consent for behavioral health care.
Revises certain financial reporting requirements imposed on general hospitals.
Eliminates the New Jersey Transfer Inheritance Tax and repeals parts of chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring maintenance and repair of certain wharves, piers, docks and bulkheads.
Requires credit check for certain DEP loans to private dam owners and lake associations.
Authorizes certain county veteran identification cards to serve as proof of status for veteran designation on driver's license or identification card.
Changes State assistance to urban enterprise zones over seven years by increasing reduced sales tax in enterprise zones and dedicating increase to zone municipalities.
Allows charitable assets set aside from the sale of a nonprofit hospital to a for-profit entity to be allocated to a successor nonprofit hospital acquiring the for-profit hospital.

Removes anhydrous ammonia used for refrigeration as substance regulated by "Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act"; eliminates DOLWD licensing for operators of refrigerating plants using anhydrous ammonia.
Modernizes the distribution of gross income tax refunds by making direct deposit the default distribution method.
Establishes Task Force on Engineering Curriculum and Instruction.
Permits holders of certain alcoholic beverage licenses to be issued amusement game license and updates definition of recognized amusement park.*
Confers title of Acting Associate Justice of the Supreme Court on certain judges of the Superior Court, Appellate Division, temporarily assigned to the Supreme Court.
"Parkinson's Disease Public Awareness and Education Act."
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for employing immediate family members of members of the Armed Forces of the United States who were killed in action.
Requires certain law enforcement officers to wear cameras.
Concerns insurance coverage for motor vehicles involved in transportation network company trips.
Establishes a three-year Statewide "Veterans Treatment Court Pilot Program." *
Establishes Pedestrian and Bicycle Safety Advisory Council.*
Revises homestead property tax reimbursement eligibility requirements for certain claimants relocating homesteads within the same municipality.
Permits municipalities and municipal parking authorities to create Senior Citizen Priority Parking Program.
The "Municipal Volunteer Property Tax Reduction Act"; permits certain municipal property owners to perform volunteer services in return for property tax vouchers.
Establishes the "Mental Health Treatment Reform and Violence Prevention Act."
Requires Passaic Valley Water Commission to obtain approval of certain municipalities before entering into certain contracts concerning open-air reservoirs.
Requires prosecutorial or law enforcement review of fatal incidents involving police officers or State Police.
Requires boards of education to annually conduct comprehensive eye examinations for second grade students.
Increases reporting requirements for the NJ Basic Skills Training Program for Economic Growth.
Provides additional State school aid to school districts experiencing enrollment increases due to conversion of age-restricted housing developments to non-restricted developments.
Provides that no more than 120 credits will be required for baccalaureate degree awarded by a public institution and no more than 60 credits for an associate degree.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to revoke proprietary school's license to award academic degrees if school fails to achieve certain minimum graduation rates.
Expands eligibility for veterans civil service preference.

Requires laboratory analysis of waste or material generated by hydraulic fracturing; requires DEP permit, and disclosure of plans, methods, or processes to treat, store, process, or dispose of such waste or material.
Establishes right of sexual assault victim to notification of certain developments in criminal case.
Requires health care provider participating in carrier network to give notice to covered person of provider's referral to out-of-network provider.
Makes it a crime of the fourth degree for certain persons to willfully and knowingly fail to report child abuse if they know the child abuse has occurred.
Prohibits use of snares in trapping of wildlife.
Bars domestic violence defendants from participation in Pretrial Intervention.
Upgrades violation of a stalking restraining order to a crime of the third degree.*
Regulates litigation funding providers.
Enhances retail competition in electric power and gas supply industries.
Removes exclusion of "nonimmigrant aliens" from qualifying for in-State tuition rates at public institutions of higher education under certain conditions.
Establishes process for consideration of offers from short sale buyers during residential mortgage foreclosures.
Concerns expedited process for foreclosing vacant and abandoned residential properties in uncontested actions.*
Prohibits sale, purchase, and possession of certain merchandise designed to conceal license plate to evade law enforcement.
Reestablishes certain historic driving privileges afforded holders of agricultural driver's licenses in operating farm equipment and vehicles.
Authorizes limited brewery licensee to operate restaurant under certain circumstances.
Creates Construction Trades Licensing Board for licensing and regulation of several construction professions; creates new division for homeowner protection in Department of Law and Public Safety.
Creates pilot program concerning domestic violence; creates additional Superior Court judgeships.
Extends for one year expiration date of certain permits pursuant to "Permit Extension Act of 2008."

Upgrades crime of photographing, filming, or disseminating photos or films showing person's intimate parts or sexual conduct when person has not consented to the photography, filming, or disseminating.

Makes retroactive current law requiring "palimony" agreements to be in writing; provides that pre-existing palimony agreements are unenforceable unless put into writing within one year of enactment of this bill.
Requires DHS to develop timeline for use by individuals with developmental disabilities to gain benefit of State and federal programs; requires posting timeline on DHS, DCF, and DOE websites.
Establishes identical levels of domestic violence training for judges and judicial personnel.

Requires boards of education to include instruction, and adopt instructional materials, that accurately portray political, economic, and social contributions of persons with disabilities and lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people.
Requires Legal Services of New Jersey to submit annual report to Legislature on its staffing, caseload, and resources.
Enhances procedures for enforcement of visitation and parenting time when parents' access to child has been denied.

Removes presumption of nonimprisionment in certain assault cases involving domestic violence victims; expands criminal coercion statute; revises Pretrial Intervention procedures in certain criminal cases.*
Requires DOH to authorize Jersey City to issue certified copies of birth certificates by September 1, 2015.
Establishes "Local Governmental Process Activities Disclosure Act."
Requires report and public hearing prior to DEP recommendation of site for inclusion on Superfund list.

Prohibits sewerage authorities, municipal authorities, and local units of government from charging interest on unpaid sewer fees and charges attributable to State or local entities, including housing authorities.
Requires police departments of certain educational institutions to adopt Attorney General Guidelines on internal affairs policies and procedures.
Excludes corrugated containers sold by the manufacturer from definition of "litter-generating product"; exempts such sales from user fee imposed under "Clean Communities Program Act."
Provides additional State aid to county colleges for students enrolled in postsecondary career and technical education certificate programs.
Creates "Fishing Buddy License."
Establishes program to provide assistance to qualified veterans in in-patient and out-patient treatment programs to travel to medical counseling in State.*
Requires Adjutant General to create informational webpage for female veterans.
Extends post-military service protection against mortgage foreclosure.
Establishes "Tiny Home Pilot Program" in three regions of State; appropriates $5 million.
"Casino Property Taxation Stabilization Act."
Requires holder of casino license to provide certain employees with certain health care and retirement benefits.
Authorizes supplemental State aid to school districts in municipality with significant decrease in commercial property valuation; makes appropriation.
Reallocates casino investment alternative tax to Atlantic City to pay debt service on municipal bonds issued.
Removes provisions of law relating to Atlantic City Alliance.
Provides three-year protection against foreclosure to owners of real property damaged during "Superstorm Sandy," which made landfall on October 29, 2012.
Authorizes optometrists to continue prescribing medications containing hydrocodone.
Increases and modernizes solvency requirements for certain insurers and authority of DOBI Commissioner to regulate insurer solvency.
Allows nonprofit organizations to serve food made from wild game animals at charity and fundraising events and meetings.
Adds cyber-harassment to the domestic violence statutes.
Permits religious institutions to request DCF conduct child abuse record checks of certain prospective and current employees and volunteers.
Upgrades simple assault to aggravated assault if committed against certain law enforcement officers and employees because of job status.
Requires annual suicide prevention instruction for public school teaching staff members as part of professional development requirement.
Authorizes sale of alcoholic beverages to certain spouses of bona fide benevolent organization club members.
Requires certain sanitary and protective procedures for used mattresses.*
Requires certain sanitation procedures for mattresses and product labeling regarding such procedures.
Restricts use of isolated confinement in correctional facilities.
Requires DOH to establish pilot program to test feasibility of increasing number of contracted early intervention service providers in areas experiencing significant population growth.*
Wounded Warrior Caregivers Relief Act; Provides income tax credit to family caregivers of certain armed service members with physical disabilities.
Requires installation of baby-changing stations in certain public restrooms.
Regulates passenger transportation companies that use an online application program to connect drivers to passengers.
Eliminates brand registration requirement for certain wines.
Requires public utilities to provide priority service to public schools, private schools, and public safety agencies.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain services performed to manufacturing equipment.
Exempts certain vehicles owned or leased by certain health care facilities and other facilities licensed by Department of Human Services or Department of Health from "Angelie's Law."*
Upgrades harassment to fourth degree crime when committed against parking enforcement officers under certain circumstances.
Establishes licensure for associate marriage and family therapists.
Provides certain definitions for biofuels under "Motor Fuels Tax Act."*
Prohibits transfer of individuals with developmental disabilities from out-of-State to in-State placements under certain conditions.*
Allows student with disability to bring service animal on school bus.
Establishes a joint legislative and executive branch New Jersey Revenue Advisory Board to provide consensus revenue forecasting advice for State budget purposes.
Prohibits anti-tiering clauses in managed care health benefits plans.
Requires pawnbrokers to record and report certain information.
Requires disclosures of out-of-network services performed by health care providers under certain circumstances.
Increases income eligibility cap to receive respite care for certain veterans.*
Requires public schools which have automated external defibrillators to adopt policies concerning usage.
Requires public bodies under Open Public Meetings Act to display U.S. flag and recite Pledge of Allegiance at beginning of meeting.
Authorizes tax lien holders other than municipalities to institute in rem tax foreclosure actions against abandoned properties.
Requires professional boards to provide for online processing of application for licensure or renewal.
Requires newly-constructed multiple dwellings with 25 or more residential units to install standby generators to provide electricity in case of emergency.
Provides court with sentencing discretion in certain cases under the "Graves Act."
Establishes "no mail" list for residents of this State.
Provides diamondback terrapins protection as nongame indigenous species.
Establishes Commission on Career and Technical Education and creates initiatives that promote career and technical education programs in State.
Requires DEP to adopt regulations to allow cultivation of commercial shellfish species in certain coastal and inner harbor waters for research, educational, or restoration purposes.*
Continues tax exempt status of certain real property owned by disabled veterans during reconstruction of homes destroyed by flood, storm, or other act of God.

Permits educational research and services corporations to act as lead procurement agencies for local units, and publically supported educational institutions; permits Council of County Colleges to act as lead procurement agency for county colleges.*
Authorizes State Agricultural Development Committee to permit operation of certain microenterprises on certain preserved farms; designated as "New Jersey Rural Microenterprise Act."
Requires DHS to use funds awarded from performance bonuses to increase staffing for processing certain applications and providing certain services.
Establishes restricted use driver's license endorsement for certain motor vehicle offenders with suspended license.
Requires law enforcement agencies in this State to establish minority recruitment and selection programs; establishes reporting requirement.
Requires DEP to establish "private wildlife habitat certification program"; creates affirmative defense against municipal nuisance ordinances for properties certified under the program.

Establishes animal importer registration, and animal grooming facility and animal training facility licenses; establishes requirements for animal importers, animal grooming facilities, and animal training facilities and penalties for certain violations.
Allows casino and out-of-State racetrack to negotiate amount casino will pay for simulcast races.
Designates State Highway Route 17 in Borough of Ramsey as "Staff Sergeant Timothy R. McGill Memorial Highway."
Ends the estate tax and increases the gross income tax's retirement income exclusions.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing; reinstates moratorium on Statewide non-residential development fees until January 2015.
Concerns certain tobacco sales.
Provides for involuntary commitment to treatment for substance use disorders.

Requires electric public utilities to provide training, equipment, indemnity, and reimbursement to certain municipal employees for moving and securing detached, above-ground distribution lines impeding vehicular traffic during lengthy power outages.
Authorizes board of education to establish community service credit program for high school students.*
Dedicates 30 percent of all UEZ sales tax revenues to respective UEZ account and 70 percent of UEZ sales tax revenues to General Fund.
Provides credits under corporation business tax and gross income tax for qualified wages of certain disabled veterans.
Creates financial planning assistance program for disabled veterans and their caregivers.
Removes prohibition on possession of stun guns.
Regulates sale of arrowhead ammunition.
Requires liability insurance for certain vessels.
Establishes New Jersey Caregiver Task Force to evaluate and provide recommendations on caregiver support services.
Requires DOE to include military-connected student identifier in student-level database; requires district inform teacher when military-connected student enrolls in class taught by teacher.
Dedicates 30 percent of all UEZ sales tax revenues to respective UEZ account and 70 percent of UEZ sales tax revenues to General Fund.
Establishes red light camera program in DOT; requires one-half of red light camera ticket revenue be used to improve highway traffic safety.
Requires development and maintenance of database to advise public about open bed availability in residential substance use disorders treatment facilities.
Makes provisions of the "New Jersey False Claims Act" retroactive under certain circumstances.
"Hackensack Meadowlands Agency Consolidation Act"; "Hackensack Meadowlands Transportation Planning District Act of 2014"; "New Jersey Meadowlands Tax Relief Act."
Reduces membership of Rutgers board of trustees and eliminates dual membership on Rutgers board of trustees and Rutgers board of governors.
Establishes "Police Body Camera Implementation Task Force" to study and make recommendations concerning use of body cameras by law enforcement agencies in this State.
Requires various measures to address effects of low levels of lead exposure.

Clarifies that breath test warnings given to suspected drunk drivers are to be in English; requires applicants for driver's licenses to be able to read and understand English and directs MVC to offer examinations only in English.
Permits farm wineries to create alternating proprietorship for production of wine.
Designates "Garden State" as State Slogan.
Establishes "Atlantic City Growth Tax Credit Program" to grant tax credits to promote the development of non-rental housing in Atlantic City.
Prohibits eligibility for certain sign programs from being conditioned on availability of free drinking water or public telephone.
Designates State Highway Route 15 in Sussex County as "Senator Robert E. Littell Memorial Highway."
Limits annual increase in tuition rates charged by county vocational school districts to two percent.

Limits annual increase in tuition rates charged by school districts, county vocational school districts, county special services districts, jointure commissions, and private schools for students with disabilities to two percent.
Authorizes county vocational school district to request county improvement authority to construct and issue bonds to finance school facilities project.
Creates Office of Sustainability.
Provides for receipts for applications for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
Requires DHS to ensure that expedited benefits under Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) are made available to certain households.
Shortens waiting periods for expungement of criminal and other records and information; makes various changes to other expungement procedures and requirements.*

Requires employees of institutions of higher education who assist student victims of sexual assault to receive victim-centered training and students participating in student organizations or athletic programs to receive campus sexual assault prevention training.*
Requires health insurance carriers to reimburse network providers of diagnostic radiologic services at the same rate.
Creates Clinical Trials Working Group.
Requires DOLWD to permit veterans and other groups to apply for UI benefits online.
Establishes "MVP Emergency Alert System" for missing persons with mental, intellectual, or developmental disabilities.*
Establishes "breakfast after the bell" incentive fund.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $200,000 to Rutgers University - Camden for support of Citizenship Rutgers events.
Clarifies small business consultants are subject to consumer fraud act.
Permits Sunday motor vehicle sales in certain counties.
Establishes teacher recruitment grant program in DOE; appropriates $6 million to DOE.
Requires appropriate community notification when sex offender is placed in halfway house; prohibits certain county inmates in halfway house.
Revises definition of "responsible charge" as it pertains to licensed professional engineers and licensed architects.
Exempts Holocaust reparations payments from legal process, and from estate recovery under Medicaid program.
Amends law concerning county and municipal stream cleaning activities.
Requires insurers that sell flood insurance to provide certain policyholders with certain information.
Provides expedited procedure for foreclosing residential properties in uncontested actions.
Authorizes operators of motor vehicles to display electronic proof of insurance.
Exempts certain property from attachment.
Provides annual salary supplement for teachers earning National Board certification; appropriates $500,000.
Provides certain employees access to certain personnel records.
Allows municipality to establish reserved parking zone on property adjacent to disabled person's residence.
Excludes sale of and services associated with mausoleums, memorials, and vaults from sales and use tax.
"Sexual Assault Survivor Protection Act of 2015"; authorizes the court to issue protective orders for victims of certain nonconsensual sexual conduct.
Requires installation of carbon monoxide detectors in certain structures; designated as "Korman and Park's Law."
Requires State contracts to include provisions imposing penalties on vendor or contractor for contract violations.
Prohibits termination of law enforcement officer based upon determination that officer is physically unable to perform duty under certain circumstances.
Allows certain on-site generation facilities to deliver electricity without utilizing electric public utility infrastructure.
Establishes microgrid pilot program.
Requires environmental sustainability plan for State House Complex.
Revises certain provisions of dental service corporation law.
Prohibits sale or planting of certain invasive plant species.
Requires MVC conduct study and make recommendations concerning electronic driver's licenses and mobile applications.
Requires that certain information be redacted from motor vehicle accident reports submitted to the public.
Requires State to lower compensation rate of civilly committed sexually violent predators to same level as State inmates for institutional work.
Permits certain fire police units to appoint fire police officers.
Provides assistance to manufacturing businesses by having certain State agencies promote economic development and identify credentials needed for careers in modern manufacturing.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $12,960,000 to DOE for additional State aid to certain school districts.
Requires creditors to maintain vacant and abandoned non-residential properties under foreclosure.
Requires creditors to maintain interior of vacant and abandoned residential property under foreclosure.
Requires dealership to notify buyers of recalls on used motor vehicles for sale.

New Jersey Stolen Valor Act; makes unauthorized use of military uniforms, medals or insignias, and certain false statements regarding receipt of military awards with intent to obtain benefit crimes of third degree.
Prohibits installation of payment assurance device as condition of securing motor vehicle financing.
Provides US Armed Forces and Reserves members with protection against interference with their employment, trade or business.
Provides US Armed Forces and Reserves members with protection against interference with enjoyment of any accommodation, facility, public accommodation, or privilege.
Establishes "Business Tax and Incentive Task Force."
Establishes "New Jersey Business Advisory Council" in Business Action Center.
Requires annual evaluation reports by Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development on survey responses to be obtained from certain employers that end operations in this State.*
Permits BPU to approve qualified wind energy project; requires BPU to provide application periods for those projects.*
Requires school business administrator to annually report to board of education on district contracts.
Requires certain CATV companies to provide free Internet access to public libraries.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax for step-grandchildren.
Establishes "Hazardous Drug Safe Handling Act;" requires DOLWD to promulgate standards and regulations concerning safe handling of hazardous drugs by health care personnel.

Requires that school district's request for permission to use unrecognized position title include list of abolished positions and positions in which there have been layoffs and detailed job descriptions for them.
Extends protections of the new vehicle "lemon law" to new farm tractors purchased or leased in New Jersey.*
Requires Attorney General to appoint special prosecutor when criminal complaint is filed against law enforcement officer.
Makes changes to procedures used by medical examiners for autopsies or dissections performed over religious objections.
Establishes technology transfer assistance program in EDA.

Provides gross income tax credit for A-list performing artists for income derived from certain live performances contracted for and rendered within the Atlantic City Tourism District on a recurring basis and within the State.
Permits EDA to designate institutions of higher education or other qualified entities as manufacturing and production business resource centers.
Establishes NJ STEM Entrepreneur Fellowship Program in DOLWD.
Excepts certain youthful offenders convicted of sex offense from sex offender registration and notification requirements.
Requires Attorney General to establish Statewide gun buyback program.
Requires electric utility bills to separately list the amount of State sales tax, societal benefits charge and transitional energy facility unit rate assessment surcharge.
Establishes Task Force on School District Regionalization.
Requires pharmacies to install and maintain secure prescription medication drop-off receptacles, and Division of Consumer Affairs to post receptacle location information online.
Authorizes health care practitioners to provide health care services through telemedicine.

Restricts sale, lease, and use of certain ultrasound equipment and distribution of images created by ultrasound equipment; establishes registration requirements for certain organizations using such equipment.
Provides an excused absence on Veterans Day for pupil who participates in certain activities for veterans or active duty members of United States Armed Forces or New Jersey National Guard.
Requires students in grade 12 to pass United States Citizenship and Immigration Services civics test as part of high school graduation requirements.
Authorizes DEP and NJ Marine Fisheries Council to regulate taking and management of striped bass; establishes interim taking restrictions.
Concerns eviction of residential tenants.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance allowing voluntary registration of private outdoor video surveillance cameras.
Provides rental and lease protections for domestic violence victims.
Extends urban enterprise zone designation in certain cities for additional 10 years.
Permits service of parking tickets by mail.
"Port Support Zone Act of 2015."
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain child and dependent care expenses.
Permits unregulated solicitation to perform snow shoveling within 24 hours of predicted snowstorm.
Establishes insurance and safety requirements for companies that use digital network or software application to match passengers with drivers.
Establishes the offense of incest.
Extends eligibility to participate in Neighborhood Revitalization Tax Credit Program to areas located in municipality in which casino gaming is authorized.
Requires prison host benefit payments to certain municipalities.
Allows board of education to award pupil transportation contracts that exceed bid threshold through request for proposals.
Provides active duty Armed Forces and Reserves members with exemption from jury duty and protection from assault while on military duty.
Restricts use of eminent domain by private pipeline companies to those demonstrating pipeline is in the public interest and that agree to certain regulation by BPU.
Requires students enrolled in public institutions of higher education to complete course on financial literacy.
Requires providers to submit to DHS expenditure details of enrollees in Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly.
Requires DHS to notify enrollees in Programs of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly of Medicare eligibility.
Requires DHS to monitor utilization and billing of services for Medicaid home and community-based long-term care.
Provides for licensure and regulation of small business consultants.
Requires continuing care retirement communities to provide residents with information on influenza vaccines for older adults.
Requires insurance producer licensing examination and registration materials to be offered in English and Spanish, and examination instructional materials to be available in Spanish.
Provides for notification of next-of-kin in event of death of senior citizen in senior housing facility.
Authorizes establishment of regional economic development partnerships.
Provides dedicated funding for New Jersey Commission on Cancer Research from Workforce Development Partnership Fund.
Establishes Office of Tourism Research; requires specific measures concerning tourism advertising, marketing, research, and tourism-related business training.
Provides preferences for certain businesses applying for workforce development grants.
Establishes Office of Economic Research in Department of State.
Requires money transmitters to provide training materials to delegates concerning financial abuse and exploitation of elder adults.
Establishes per se standard for driving under the influence of drugs.
Requires DCA to post on its Internet website information about enforcement of maintenance violations for vacant and abandoned properties under foreclosure.
Requires school districts and charter schools to annually provide to parents or guardians of enrolled students information on certain tests to be administered during the school year.
Prohibits administration of standardized assessments in kindergarten through second grade.
Allows parent or guardian to exclude student from administration of certain assessments.
Imposes three-year moratorium on use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers for certain purposes.
Implements 2014 constitutional dedication of CBT revenues for certain environmental purposes; revises State's open space, farmland, and historic preservation programs.
Authorizes establishment of Achieving a Better Life Experience accounts for persons with certain disabilities.**
Designates Thomas Alva Edison as State Inventor.
Requires evaluation of appropriateness of light frame construction for multiple dwellings and imposes moratorium on light frame construction until determination and recommendations are adopted.
Requires clinical laboratory that provides services for accountable care organization to establish clinical laboratory testing advisory board.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Increases amount annually credited to Shore Protection Fund to $50 million.

Exempts transfers of property to Class C beneficiaries from transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amount under estate tax to $5,000,000 over five-year period.
Allows businesses due to receive grant under Business Employment Incentive Program to elect to receive corporate or gross income tax credit if grant funds are not available.
Prohibits sale of certain items during certain time on Thanksgiving.
Requires posting of information about availability of services from substance abuse treatment facilities on county and DHS websites.
Directs Attorney General to develop plan to disseminate Amber and Silver Alert information through social media.
Provides exception to "New Jersey Smoke-Free Air Act" authorizing establishment of hookah lounges under certain circumstances.
Requires NJTA and SJTA to provide electric vehicle recharging stations at certain rest areas on New Jersey Turnpike, Garden State Parkway, and Atlantic City Expressway.*

Permits municipal, county, and regional police and fire forces to establish five-year residency requirement for police officers and firefighters; allows exceptions to requirement under certain circumstances.*

Provides partial exemption and maximum sales and use tax imposition amount for sales and uses of boats and vessels; establishes grace period for use tax imposition on certain boats and vessels used by resident purchasers.*
Requires criminal history record background check for rifle and shotgun purchases.
Revises certain laws concerning domestic violence and firearms.
Establishes vocational training pilot program in DOC; provides for inmate compensation for education and workforce training participation.

"Volunteers in Public Service Pension Reform Act," allows municipal elected officials in PERS to retire based on other PERS service and remain in office with no salary or health care benefits for that office.
Allows PFRS to pay pension to member who resigns and retires from PFRS-covered employment to assume elective office with same employer to eliminate conflict of incompatible positions.
Amends Fiscal Year 2015 budget to provide one-half of certain environmental damage amounts recovered are appropriated for costs of remediation, restoration, and clean up.
Increases from 17 to 21 public members of New Jersey State Council on the Arts; requires members to be residents of NJ; imposes specific criteria for four new members initially appointed.*
Implements certain governance and transparency reforms at PANYNJ.
Allows NJ gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions of food made from business inventory.
Permits local health boards to require minimum temperature of 70 degrees from October through April in certain buildings occupied by seniors and disabled persons.
Authorizes placement of involved animal with animal welfare agency or similar entity pending adjudication of alleged animal cruelty violation when not adjudicated in seven days.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Provides for increase in relocation assistance amounts based on increase of CPI.
Requires inspection for pest infestation prior to certain demolition.
Clarifies that compensation may be paid for expenses related to service animals required due to injuries resulting from crime against victim.
Reduces helicopter operations at certain aviation facilities licensed by State.
Establishes grant program for homeless veterans shelters.
Adds two public members to NJT board.
Requires coach of interscholastic sports team to provide athletic director with certification that no one associated with team was involved in player recruitment.
Removes restrictions on convicted drug offenders receiving general assistance benefits under Work First New Jersey program.
Establishes committee to develop consolidation plan for Newark Watershed Conservation and Development Corporation, North Jersey District Water Supply Commission, and Passaic Valley Water Commission.
"Madison Holleran Suicide Prevention Act"; requires institutions of higher education to have individuals who focus on reducing student suicides and attempted suicides available 24 hours a day.*
"Madison Holleran Proper Reporting Act"; requires institutions of higher education to post information on student suicides and attempted suicides on website.
Permits application of certain tinting materials on motor vehicle windows and windshields.
Establishes State Transportation Cost Analysis Task Force.
Establishes task force to study issues related to sexual assault on college campuses.
Clarifies statutory exemptions from mandatory immunizations for students.
Increases nonpublic pupil transportation to 30 miles from the pupil's residence.
Requires pharmaceutical manufacturers and wholesale distributors accept and provide a rebate for certain returned drugs.
Requires mental health evaluation for all animal cruelty offenders; designated as "Shyanne's Law."
Allows parent, guardian, or adult student to prevent disclosure of student information to certain entities.
Modifies requirements concerning preliminary site plan and subdivision approvals under the MLUL.
Directs Department of Agriculture to publish on its website "New Jersey Gleaning Week" and "Farmers Against Hunger Day" page.

Requires drivers to slow down before passing slow moving vehicles; establishes Statewide educational campaign on rural roadway safety; updates agriculture-related motor vehicle laws to reflect current industry practices.
Creates striped bass license plates.

Updates factors for consideration for grandparent and sibling petitions seeking visits with child over objection of parent, guardian, or custodian; adds preference for child's temporary placement with grandparent under "Child Placement Bill of Rights Act."
Provides veterans with up to 60 credits tuition-free at county college serving county of residence.
Requires certain new residential buildings to have fire barriers in cocklofts, concrete or steel frames, and fire stops.
Increases efficiency and transparency in distribution of Superstorm Sandy aid money.
Exempts certain real estate brokers, broker-salespersons and salespersons from continuing education requirement.

Transfers Division of Mental Health Advocacy to DHS; re-titles director as Mental Health Advocate; provides diversion for mental health treatment for persons subject to prosecution in municipal court; appropriates $15,000,000.
Establishes program allowing certain applicants to perform community service in lieu of paying motor vehicle surcharges.
Authorizes court to impose rescue operation costs of public entity under certain circumstances.
Prohibits sale of powdered caffeine.
"New Jersey Secure Choice Savings Program Act"; establishes retirement savings program for certain workers.
Permits correctional facilities to utilize body imaging scanning equipment.
Requires explosive gas detectors to be installed in certain residential properties.
Prohibits municipalities from charging annual fee for storm water permits and inspections.
Permits voter registration at polling place on days of municipal, primary, and general elections.
Expands scope of New Jersey Regulatory Flexibility Act dealing with economic impact of rules on small businesses.
"Atlantic City Urban Enterprise Zone and Property Tax Relief Act"; creates urban enterprise zone in Atlantic City for 10 years.
Guarantees full and equal access to all housing to disabled persons who retain their retired service or guide dog as a pet, and who also obtain a new service or guide dog.
Requires denial of grant by NJEDA or other State agency to include critique of how applicant business falls short of requirements and standards.
Creates workforce training program for former casino workers.
Prohibits tourist helicopter operations in New Jersey.
Permits animal facilities to use artificial turf in outdoor enclosures.
Authorizes operation of lottery courier services.
Requires school districts and DOE to post on their websites information regarding student participation in certain assessments.*
Allows municipalities to acquire and sell inactive plenary retail consumption licenses.
Prohibits sale of powdered alcohol.
Creates a Land Use Court.
Affords immunity to private colleges and their police officers in certain cases.
Requires immediate suspension of driver's license for allegedly driving while intoxicated.
Requires DHS to prioritize placement of parents of children receiving services from DCPP in mental health and substance abuse treatment programs.

Requires local units and agencies to extend family health coverage for six months to surviving spouse and dependents of public safety officers who had family medical coverage but did not die in the line of duty.
Establishes P-20 Workforce Development Advisory Council to advise various State agencies of workforce development needs.
Prohibits installation and sale of wheel weights containing lead or mercury; prohibits sale of new motor vehicles equipped with wheel weights containing lead or mercury.
Eliminates requirement for State residency for public officers and employees with limited historic exceptions.
Requires health benefits coverage for buprenorphine and buprenorphine/naloxone under certain conditions.
Authorizes the court to order the deletion, sealing, labeling, or correction of certain personal information in government records involving certain victims of identity theft.

Provides for an annual assessment upon certain rail carriers transporting crude oil and dedicates assessment revenue for State aid to municipalities for use by local government unit emergency responders.
Requires owner or operator of certain trains to have discharge response, cleanup, and contingency plans to transport certain hazardous materials by rail.
Creates Office of Licensing, Grant-making, Approvals and Permitting Efficiency Ombudsman and establishes task force on feasibility of online State permit and approval transactions.
Eliminates demand side management programs from cost recovery through societal benefits charge.
Establishes Office of International Trade and Protocol in EDA.
Establishes JerseySource Supply Network database and business visitation program for NJ businesses in EDA.
Establishes specialty agriculture development program in Department of Agriculture.
Establishes New Jersey Commission on Higher Education and Business Partnerships.
Prohibits local units of government from adopting increased minimum wage and mandatory paid sick leave for private employers.
Clarifies and revises certain aspects of the "Hackensack Meadowlands Agency Consolidation Act."
Permits municipal land banking in conjunction with online property database development.
Requires DOE to establish NJ Dyslexia website.
Authorizes county colleges to offer retirement incentive to employees age 65 or older with 25 years of service credit in ABP.
Prohibits State-sponsored travel to states adopting religious freedom statutes without protection against discrimination.
Automatically registers or updates voter registration as part of driver's license application or renewal.
Requires Office of the Ombudsman for the Institutionalized Elderly to develop informational posters describing phone-based complaint procedure, to be conspicuously displayed in certain facilities.

Requires Standardbred organization to use certain portion of purse moneys from in-State Standardbred races to fund foundation providing retired Standardbred race horses pre-adoption care and support Standardbred racing and breeding legislation with nonpublic funds.
Designates "Franklinite" as official mineral of State of NJ.
The "School Safety and Security Act"; establishes penalties for certain criminal acts committed on school property.
Requires certain surgical practices and ambulatory care facilities licensed in this State to be owned by hospital or medical school located in the State.*
Prohibits sale or distribution of liquid nicotine except in child-resistant containers.
Establishes minimum certified nurse aide-to-resident ratios in nursing homes.*
Modifies provisions of certain economic incentive programs.
Provides up to $25 million in tax credits under Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant Program for certain infrastructure at Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey.
Prohibits withholding of State school aid based on student participation rate on State assessments.
Requires health benefits coverage for orthotic and prosthetic appliances from licensed podiatrists.
Prohibits smoking in automobiles when children are present.
Permits administration of epinephrine auto-injector device by persons who complete approved educational program.
Increases age for helmet requirement for bicycling, roller skating, and skateboarding to 17 and younger; extends helmet requirement to ice skaters and operators of non-motorized scooters.
Establishes program authorizing lease of historic buildings and structures in State parks, forests, and wildlife management areas.
Establishes three-year moratorium on increases in charter school enrollment.
Requires county and municipal police departments to establish cultural diversity training course and plan.
"Secure Schools for All Children Act"; establishes State aid program for security services, equipment, or technology to ensure safe and secure school environment for nonpublic school students.
Permits increase in municipal free public library tax upon voter approval.
Revises definition of all-terrain vehicles.
Requires annual review of law enforcement officers' motor vehicle records.
"New Jersey Library Construction Bond Act"; authorizes issuance of $125,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance capital projects at public libraries; appropriates $5,000.
Establishes minimum Medicaid reimbursement rate for personal care services.
"Uncompensated Pending Medicaid Beneficiary Payment Relief Act"; provides compensation relief to nursing facilities when resident's Medicaid eligibility determination is delayed more than 90 days.
Prohibits awarding of economic development subsidy to business if business is in default on previously awarded subsidy that was loan or loan guarantee.
Requires all attorneys engaged in private practice of law in New Jersey be covered by legal malpractice liability insurance.
Authorizes medical marijuana for qualifying patients with post-traumatic stress disorder.
Authorizes transfer of excess medical marijuana inventory between alternative treatment centers.
Directs BPU to promulgate rules and regulations concerning gas public utilities' response to public reporting of suspected natural gas leaks.
Limits to six months time public officer may serve in acting capacity without nomination.
Provides for jurisdiction for prosecution for certain crimes against minors committed outside New Jersey.
Prohibits certain provisions in consumer contracts.
Establishes automatic voter registration process using MVC applicant information to be transmitted to Secretary of State; permits applicant to decline voter registration.
Establishes pilot program in Camden County directing MVC to automatically transmit applicant information to Secretary of State for automatic voter registration.

Limits payments under health benefits plans to in-network amounts in certain circumstances; prohibits out-of-network health providers from charging carriers more than 150 percent of Medicare rate in certain circumstances.
Requires MVC to offer driver's license knowledge test in Italian.
Refines process of real property assessment in certain counties.
Amends "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law"; makes corrections and modifies notice provisions.
Permits certain breweries to sell beer at community farm markets.
Allows consumption of food on limited brewery premises.
Authorizes restricted breweries to annually sell up to 1,000 barrels of beer to in-State and out-of-state retailers.

Provides for Attorney General to handle investigation and prosecution of crime involving death caused by law enforcement officer while in performance of officer's duties; requires officer indictment by State grand jury.
Establishes Small Business Unit and Small Business Task Force within Business Action Center in Department of State.

Prohibits permanent change of child custody during period of active military service; provides that absence due to active military duty, by itself, is insufficient justification to modify a child custody or visitation order.
Ensures equal rights and opportunities for pregnant graduate students in institutions of higher education.
Provides that crimes committed outside the State under certain circumstances may be prosecuted in New Jersey.

Raises the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $1,000,000 to 10.75 percent for a temporary four-year-period and restores the State earned income tax credit to 25 percent of the federal credit.
Increases required public notice from 30 days to 60 days for settlements entered into by DEP pursuant to Spill Compensation and Control Act.
Allows motor vehicle dealers to temporarily remove records from premises in certain instances and requires MVC to provide motor vehicle dealers time to correct certain violations.
Requires employees of private entity with access to student information under contract with DOE, school districts, or charter schools to undergo criminal background check.

Requires DOE on its website to link to Department of Treasury's website where list is maintained of all third party individuals and vendors employed or retained for work associated with State assessments.*

Requires school district or charter school to provide notification to parent or guardian of enrolled student on upcoming administration of State assessments or commercially-developed standardized assessments.
Authorizes local tax on storage of empty shipping containers.
Establishes driver's license for residents who cannot prove lawful presence in US.
Excludes from gross income compensation paid to members of district boards of election for services rendered in elections.
Establishes Capture, Control, and Conserve Reward Rebate Program in DEP to encourage property owners to implement certain techniques to conserve water or control stormwater runoff.
Creates additional judgeships for Superior Court in northern, central, and southern regions of State with purpose of providing additional support for special probation drug court program.
Makes various changes to tenure of faculty and other professional staff at State and county colleges.
Requires certain health care facilities to provide information concerning palliative care and hospice services.
Creates NJ Cybersecurity Commission; appropriates $50,000.
Establishes the "New Jersey Schedules That Work Act."
Establishes Study Commission on Gender Pay Discrimination.
Provides employee time off for events regarding education of their children.
Codifies donated leave program for State employees.
Requires accountability of NJSPCA and county societies for prevention of cruelty to animals to Attorney General and county prosecutors, respectively.
Revises law concerning disposition of assets of a county society for the prevention of cruelty to animals that has dissolved or has had its charter revoked, canceled, or suspended.
Changes membership of, and election process for, NJSPCA board of trustees.
Creates new criminal offenses concerning endangering another person; repeals N.J.S.2C:12-2 and N.J.S.2C:24-7.
Prohibits transfer of individuals with developmental disabilities from out-of-State to in-State placements if written objection provided and one or more conditions exists.
Reforms annual State revenue estimating and reporting, and executive State budget presentation and revenue certification processes.
Provides a gross income tax exclusion for attorney's fees and costs received in connection with certain unlawful discrimination or unlawful retaliation claims or actions.
Provides for regulated consumer choice in the dispensing of fuel at service stations.
Requires fire barriers be installed in cocklofts of certain residential buildings.
Exempts employees of for-profit, non-religious summer camps from minimum wage and overtime requirements.
Concerns random drug testing of certain inmates.
Requires online data brokers to establish accountability and transparency measures for collection and use of personal information.
Requires expenses incurred by Governor during out-of-State travel for political activities not be paid with or out of public funds.
"Personal Information and Privacy Protection Act"; restricts collection and use of personal information by retail establishments for certain purposes.
Permits tenant to be removed from leased housing due to criminal activity under certain circumstances.
Expands timeframe for renewal of driver's license, registration, and inspection by military personnel and immediate family members under certain circumstances.

Extends immunity from liability to nonprofit associations engaged in organizing, teaching, refereeing, or coaching sports activity under State law requiring protective eyewear for children who participate in certain sports.
Enacts new "Uniform Interstate Family Support Act"; repeals previous uniform law.
Establishes independent Office of Comptroller of Education and removes authority of State Comptroller with regard to oversight of boards of education.
Establishes cap on amount that hospital can charge patients for laboratory services to 150% of Medicare.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2016.
Extends summer season for seasonal retail consumption alcoholic beverage licenses by moving start date back from May 1 to March 15.*
Requires hospital patient's medical record to include notation if patient has Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.
Establishes requirements for training programs for homemaker-home health aides in care of patients with Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.*
Clarifies that Alzheimer's disease and related disorders may be listed as secondary cause of death on death certificate when appropriate.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2016.
Requires DOH to provide information about crib safety on its Internet website.
Makes certain changes to Environmental Infrastructure Trust Financing Program.
Requires Secretary of State create e-mail notification system alerting when US and State flags flown at half-staff.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Permits small businesses to qualify for loans from NJEDA for costs of energy audit and making energy efficiency or conservation improvements.
Establishes failure to provide certain specific protections from weather and during emergencies for domestic companion animals as animal cruelty.
Requires retail establishments to allow persons with certain medical conditions access to employee restrooms.
Requires DCA to make information on homeless prevention programs and services available on its Internet website.
"Music Therapist Licensing Act."
Requires DMVA assist and mentor veterans through criminal justice system.
Revises electronic waste recycling laws.
Imposes certain requirements on use of automated license plate readers by law enforcement agencies.
Establishes pilot program in Paterson authorizing non-disclosure of records of certain expungements.
Expands cities permitted to regulate days and hours when packaged goods may be sold.
Expands scope of law governing registration of security guards; designated as "Melvin Santiago's Law."
Authorizes mobile electronic waste destruction units to operate without DEP permit.
Requires owner of railroad bridge to submit bridge inspection records to DOT.
Revises certain requirements concerning provision of emergency medical services.
Requires maximum contaminant level to be established for 1,2,3-trichloropropane in drinking water.
Requires condemnor to acquire road access easement for property owner if condemnation eliminates road access.
Establishes Class Three special law enforcement officers to provide security in public and nonpublic schools.
Requires suspension without pay and health care benefits if public officer or employee formally charged with crime involving or touching office, position, or employment.
Establishes certain requirements for 9-1-1 public safety answering points and public safety dispatch points.
Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Permits 15 liquor licenses to be issued in three municipalities located in Fort Monmouth redevelopment area.
Permits smoking in certain facilities for purpose of medical or scientific health-related research.
Imposes mandatory 30 days' imprisonment and 30 days' community service for crime of initiating, circulating, or transmitting false public alarm.
Upgrades offense of endangering welfare of incompetent person; establishes new crime of enticing certain disabled persons to commit act likely to be injurious to their own welfare.
Establishes defense against exclusionary zoning litigation seeking builder's remedy.
Clarifies five-month window established by Supreme Court begins after trial court establishes standards.
Authorizes Edward J. Bloustein School of Planning and Public Policy to calculate affordable housing obligations.
Directs COAH to use growth share methodology to calculate fair share affordable housing need.
Revises requirements for establishment of central municipal courts.
"Linnette Lebron's Law" modifies procedures for marriage or civil union where a party is terminally ill.
Allows dispensation of certain nutritional supplements by physician or podiatric physician.
Authorizes impoundment of all-terrain vehicles and dirt bikes for certain crimes and offenses.
Establishes Behavioral Mental Health Advisory Board in Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services in DHS.
Concerns disclosure requirements for certain propane sales.
Establishes "Integrated Roadside Vegetation Management Program."
Creates Task Force on Construction Industry Workplace Safety and Health.
Criminalizes possession and sale of alpha-pyrrolidinopentiophenone (alpha-PVP) commonly known as "flakka," or "flocka."
Permits municipality with UEZ to participate in Downtown Business Improvement Zone Loan Fund.
Provides that teacher committing act of sexual penetration with student who is 18 or older is guilty of sexual assault under certain circumstances.
Mandates public school teachers complete professional development related to appropriate professional teacher-student relationships.
Regulates autocycles.
Expands eligibility of inmates for medical parole and requires inmate's enrollment in Medicaid under certain circumstances.
Requires DOH license additional angioplasty facilities, with at least one facility in each county.
Allows certain businesses to qualify as mega projects under the "Grow New Jersey Assistance Act."
Upgrades crime of false public alarm under certain circumstances and establishes reporting requirements concerning crime.
Establishes multi-species depredation permit.
Permits sale of motor fuels that have not been blended with ethanol for certain purposes.
Removes cap on tax on transfers of hazardous substances to fund emergency preparedness and response to certain spills.
Permits cosmetologist-hairstylists to operate mobile facilities when providing services.
Requires MVC to allow submission of "Next-of-Kin Registry" information upon issuance of permit, driver's license, or identification card.
Establishes New Jersey Advisory Council on Home and Community-Based Settings to implement DHS Statewide Transition Plan.

Establishes procedures for boards of fire commissioners to move annual fire district elections to November, eliminates vote on fire district budgets, except for proposals to raise revenue above the permissible levy cap.
Requires filing of financial agreement for long term tax exemption with county finance officer and counsel; requires quarterly payment of county share of payment in lieu of tax.
Exempts certain activities of alarm businesses from statutes governing practice of locksmithing.
Provides tuition benefits at public institutions of higher education to New Jersey residents who are members of reserve component of Armed Forces of United States.
Appropriates $88,592,361 from "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" and various Green Acres bond funds for local government open space acquisition and park development projects.
Appropriates $4,750,000 from various Green Acres funds for grants to certain nonprofit entities to acquire or develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Revises laws concerning real estate licensees.
Sets fees for DEP permits and approvals for repair or reconstruction of Sandy-damaged structures at no more than amount in effect on October 28, 2012.
Provides that strangulation of victim resulting in bodily injury during commission of act of domestic violence constitutes aggravated assault.
Provides tuition benefits at public institutions of higher education for dependents of certain veterans.
Makes Fiscal Year 2015 General Fund appropriation of $500,000 for restoration and maintenance of A.J. Meerwald.
Establishes school breakfast kiosk pilot program.
Repeals N.J.S.3B:23-18, concerning intestate property distribution under certain circumstances.
Increases judicial salaries by set amount over multiple years, and thereafter provides for annual salary cost of living adjustment.
Requires MVC to accept Transportation Worker Identification Credential as proof of identity for issuance of driver's licenses, certain permits, and nondriver identification cards.
Requires public utility to remove utility pole no longer in use within a right of way within 14 days of replacement of utility pole.

Disallows tax deduction under corporation business tax and gross income tax for punitive damages paid in connection with legal action; includes amount paid as punitive damages on behalf of taxpayer in income for tax purposes.
Provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes for qualified farmers that develop housing for their agricultural workforce.
Mandates health benefits coverage for opioid analgesics with abuse-deterrent properties.
Establishes Licensed Prevailing Wage Inspection Professional Program.
Establishes task force to study issues and make recommendations related to use of educational technology in public school classrooms.
Establishes "The Democracy Act" to change various voter registration and voting procedures.
Designates State Highway 184 in Woodbridge Township as "Bruce Turcotte Memorial Highway."

Permits candidates for school board to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot; permits short nonpolitical designation of principles on petitions and ballots; provides for study of impact of changes.
"Healthy Small Food Retailer Act"; provides funding to small food retailers to sell fresh and nutritious food.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies that boycott Israel or Israeli businesses.
Requires combined reporting of corporation business tax by certain members of unitary business groups.

Prohibits utility from billing customer for costs incurred for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure; allows costs for certain upgrades to utility infrastructure be recovered in utility's rate base.
Reduces ambulatory care facility assessment.
Provides governance, transparency, and accountability reforms at PANYNJ.
Requires facilities providing services to persons with developmental disabilities and schools to adopt policies permitting administration of medical marijuana to qualifying patients.
"New Jersey International Arbitration, Mediation, and Conciliation Act."
Strengthens requirements for accreditation, inspection, and general oversight of "surgical practices."

Clarifies DHS authority to regulate sober living homes and halfway houses as residential substance abuse aftercare facilities; requires background checks and other protections for residents of residential substance abuse facilities.
Establishes the "New Jersey Electronic Plan Review System."
Requires DEP to offer to purchase and demolish certain contaminated residential property.
Increases number of arbitrators on panel determining contested cases involving tenured employees in school districts and gives Commissioner of Education discretion on setting fees.
Requires certain notifications for termination of services to persons with developmental disabilities and providers.
Establishes "Superstorm Sandy Homeowners Protection Act."
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to solicit proposals from school districts willing to be certified as district of residence for students who reside on certain federal property.
Requires MVC to issue motor vehicle placard to certain veterans and waives meter fees.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; upgrades crimes against individuals with developmental disabilities.
Regulates tethering of, and outdoor shelter for, dogs.
Gives priority to applicants for firearms purchaser identification card and permits to purchase handguns when domestic violence restraining order is in effect.
Prohibits certain reductions in reimbursement rates under network services management agreements.

Establishes "Small Business Bonding Readiness Assistance Program" in EDA to assist certain small businesses meet State or federal contract surety bond requirements; transfers $250,000 annually from enterprise zone assistance fund to program.
Requires Public Health Counsel to promulgate rules and regulations for use of quality control programs in bio-analytical and clinical laboratories.*
Provides transparency and accountability reforms at PANYNJ; modifies governance structure; provides legislative oversight of PANYNJ.
Requires teachers of health and physical education in grades kindergarten through six in public schools to possess appropriate endorsement to instructional certificate.
"The Child and Family Suicide Prevention Act;" requires training related to screening for suicide prevention for pediatricians, physician assistants, and advanced practice nurses.
Requires timeframe of standardbred mare residing in New Jersey breeding farm be inclusive of foaling instead of between foal's conception and birth.
Establishes award of attorney's fees to prevailing party in municipal services dispute.
Establishes Mike Adler Aphasia Task Force to assess needs of persons with aphasia, and their families, and ensure adequate provision of support services and information thereto.*
Prohibits victims from being charged certain costs and fees and clarifies victims' right to obtain certain interviews.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to include crime victims as protected status.
Expands rights of crime victims.
Revises definition of victim in "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights."
Increases maximum legal fee to represent victims from $1,000 to $3,000.
Removes age restriction on testifying via closed circuit television in certain sex crimes cases.
Concerns enterprise zone assistance fund project approval; dedicates certain revenues to UEZs or UEZ municipalities.
Requires State to pay its pension contributions on quarterly basis by August 1, November 1, February 1 and May 1 of each year.
Makes fiscal year 2015 State supplemental appropriations, reduces State appropriations and amends language provisions.
Imposes a one-year surcharge on Corporation Business Tax liabilities.
Makes FY 2015 supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,453,000 for family planning services.
Provides Medicaid coverage for family planning services to individuals with incomes up to 200 percent of the federal poverty level.
Makes FY 2016 supplemental appropriations of $6,500,000 and adds language provision.

Makes FY 2015 supplemental State appropriations totaling $300,000,000 for prepayment of portion of FY 2016 employer contributions to State-administered public employee defined benefit retirement systems.
Permits construction of natural gas transmission lines on areas of preserved farmland already subject to existing utility easements under certain circumstances.
Increases State earned income tax credit from 20 percent to 30 percent of federal earned income tax credit for taxable years 2015 and thereafter.
Permits certain health clubs to offer swimming lessons and otherwise remain exempt from first aid personnel and lifeguarding requirements.*
Requires health benefits coverage for synchronization of prescribed medications under certain circumstances.
Refines five-month window established by Supreme Court begins after trial court establishes standards.
